text: I got this for my nephew after he hurt his tailbone while riding his bike on a course near our home. These bicycle shorts are great; he tells me that they are very comfortable and that they keep him very cool while also giving him great protection. They seem to fit true to size too; he wears medium sized clothes so I got the medium and he tells me they fit perfectly. Overall, I'm very pleased with this find and highly recommend this product.I received this product free to review. Opinions are 100% my own.

This is a cool product that my hubby really likes. Since he switched to a job in the city, he has been using his phone more on his commute. He plays games, reads books and watches HD movies. He uses this very slim and compact case to carry an extra micro SD card with more video files. It also lets you carry extra Sim cards and includes a very handy USB micro SD card reader. Overall, he really likes this product. The quality is good, the price is affordable and I would highly recommend it.I received this product free to review. Opinions are 100% my own.

Ever since I was a kid, I have really enjoyed reading in the shower or bath. I used to cover my books in plastic so that I could do this, but now that all of my books are on my phone, I pop my cell in a waterproof cell phone case and use that to read in the shower. My mom recently mentioned that she wanted a waterproof case too so that she could take her phone to the pool when she goes for her swimming classes. I decided on this product as it is exactly what I was looking for. It‚Äôs super easy to use; you just drop your phone inside the case and fasten the clasps at the top to seal the case shut. This case is super slim and doesn‚Äôt affect the touch screen function at all. The blue color is very pretty and it has a nice strap that you can use to securely hold your phone. Overall, I really like this product. The quality is good and I would highly recommend it.I received this product free to review. Opinions are 100% my own.

With four kids, you never know when you are going to need to mend something and I love compact sewing kits like this one since I can carry with me everywhere. I have one in my handbag at all times and plan to keep another one in the car. I have larger sewing kits, but they are rather bulky and heavy and are a pain to get out of my crafts closet. This kit is great because it has everything you need and is super light and compact. I added a few more safety pins as I know that one will never be enough, but it has plenty of everything else. There are eight spools of thread in a variety of useful colors as well as a thimble, scissors, measuring tape, needles, etc. all in a nice case. Overall, I am very pleased with this product and think that it‚Äôs an excellent value. I highly recommend it!I received this product free to review. Opinions are 100% my own.

I was very excited when I was found this particular product because we found that the carpet in a corner of our basement is mildewing. I am using baking soda, vinegar and some other solutions to try to clean this area, but it still smells weird, so I hung this on the wall just above this corner. I was very happy to learn about this product. We have a pretty big dehumidifier and an air purifier down there, but I wanted to find something small to put in our storage closets and in the boiler room. I also wanted to find something that was natural and non-toxic. This natural bamboo charcoal bag seemed like the ideal solution as it had everything I was looking for. It's very easy to use; I just hung it on an existing hook on the wall. After about a week, I went downstairs to check and it was noticeably dryer and less smelly. I am planning to purchase a few more so that I can put them in our closets and shoe cabinet. Overall, I think that this is a great product and I highly recommend it.I received this product free to review. Opinions are 100% my own.

One of the few things that I don't love about having a fur baby is the fact that he often pees in odd places, which can cause us to be rather unpleasantly surprised at inconvenient times. Upon receiving this product, we were delighted. This is a well made UV LED flashlight that helps you find stains and UV-sensitive markings. This flashlight is very compact and has a nice weight to it, without being too big or heavy; it feels really good in your hand. I also like that it takes AAA batteries (not C or D batteries, which I rarely have in the house), which are included as a nice touch. It works very well, but you should note that it really works in the dark. Overall, I‚Äôm very pleased with this product and know that we will continue using it!I received this product free to review. Opinions are 100% my own.

This aLLreLi HD 4K(3840x2160) Mini Displayport to HDMI Cable is 1.8 m long and 4K compatible. We were really happy to see that this cable is extremely well made. The connectors are gold-plated and the cables look quite durable. We tested this cable to connect my laptop to both our television and our projector. The picture quality improved significantly after we switched to this cable. We are changing to Macbooks at work, so I will update after I test it with my new Macbook as well. So far, I am quite happy to say that I really like this product. The quality is very impressive, the price is super competitive, and I would highly recommend it.I received this product free to review. Opinions are 100% my own.

I love lighting candles in my home office or in our bedroom at night; I love the way they smell and they help me relax and get a good night‚Äôs sleep. I really like this set of party votives as it has a lot of really delicious-smelling green tea scented candles. I absolutely love matcha/green tea and the fragrance of it, so this was pefect for me. The candles smell great and help me relax when I am in the bath or before I go to bed. They burn very evenly and for a pretty long time. I also love that they are made right here in the U.S. because this always makes me feel more confident about a product. Overall, I think that this is a great product that would make a great gift for yourself or for anyone else!I received this product free to review. Opinions are 100% my own.

I went on a trip to Asia a few years ago and was pleasantly surprised to learn that they use bidets everywhere in Korea. Seriously, every public and private bathroom we stepped into had a bidet. While it was a little daunting for me because I had never used one before, I soon found that they are fantastic. They make your rear end feel so clean and you can use them in conjunction with or in lieu of toilet paper. I really wanted to get one for our bathroom at home, but everything I  saw very expensive and/or they would require us to hire a plumber to help install them, so I was very pleased to find this one. It is very affordable and super easy to install. It is so easy to use too; even the labels on the control are upside down so that you can easily read them while you are on the toilet. Overall, I‚Äôm very pleased with this bidet and will continue using it!I received this product free to review. Opinions are 100% my own.

This micro USB charging cable is so cool. I am constantly losing or breaking my cables because I carry them to and from work in a ginormous handbag with tons of other things. This cable is super well made and sturdy. It lights up to look like the power is flowing into your cell phone and the speed of the lights slows down when it is almost done charging. The lights even turn off when it is finished charging. I think it charges relatively quickly; I am just really happy with the quality of the cable and how nice it looks while it is charging. It looks very expensive and durable. Overall, I‚Äôm very pleased with this cable and will continue using it!I received this product free to review. Opinions are 100% my own.
Sneaky Pete is a lot sneaker then one thinks. The end promises a bright future for this series. Good job a Amazon!!

individual portions of soups and casseroles. Will also use for freezing chopped vegetables. Actually, there are endless uses for them. I used a Sharpie to label them. The marker comes right off with Dawn and the scour side of a sponge. No deep rubbing required. Very happy. Equal to Rubbermaid, but cheaper.
I found the filter and pump area very easy to access, set up and maintain. No scratches on glass. Beautiful small aquarium for my few fish. Absolutely silent too!! Very happy and so is my betta.

Nicest v-neck tee shirt I've found in ages!! I'm going to stop looking because I found nice quality material, comfortable fit and made well. Thanks for Amazon's rating system, I may have hesitated in tying these.

Oatmeal Bread with the top on and off.  Tonight, Zucchini quick bread (top off).It's not a specialty pan, it's an everyday pan.  I ordered the smaller one after using this one.PS: High quality metal and construction. Cleaning it is a breeze.

With this product.  As per reviews, I did purchase extra 3M command tabs to secure it to a mirror.  It gets 5 stars because unlike most soap dispensers, it cuts off the soap quickly and doesn't drip. I assumed I would always be cleaning up the counter of dots of soap under the dispenser. I have yet to find any messes..It's also easy to control the amount of soap needed.It holds a lot of soap and a funnel is not needed to fill this soap dispenser.I was guided to this product by reviews.
this was a quick read and well written to keep your attention. Would make a good addition to ID's channel "Imposters" series...

What can one say to add to the joys of this show? It's always nice to be able to catch a rerun now and again.  Reminds when when I faked being sick to stay home from school and load up on these reruns.

Didn't like the back because it fell away from the back of the kindle.  When I used the strap to hold it in place, it covered the screen. Ended up with the $15 SUPCASE, which to me is just about perfect in fit and quality.. PLUS the Supcase turns the kindle on and off just by opening and closing it.The kindle did fit securely snapping in the Belkin though, but in my new one, I will never have to worry about the kindle snapping out.

Super happy with this cover. I returned the Belkin $40 cover because I didn't like how the back didn't lay flat against the back of the kindle and when I used the strap to hold it in place, it cover the screen. Plus, it didn't turn the kindle on or off when opening and closing the cover, like this one does.  The kindle fits like a "bug in a rug" in this cover and I can access all the controls.  Decent enough quality to for $15.
Not much difference in the purples and golds, so basically you get eight colors. The price was right... my granddaughter will have fun with them.

well with my Tidy Cat BREEZE box. I purchased because I keep this box in an extra sliding door closet.  I could notice a slight odor in the closet.  I took out some of the product from the original jar and put in a smaller jar, placed tin foil on the top of the small jar with holes in the top and placed near the box. Then I sprinkled a few 'Crystal', don't know what else to call them, onto the breeze pad.  It seems to help. At this rate, the original jar will last  a long time.  I placed plastic and tin foil on the original jar so it wouldn't dry up, because the original jars lid has holes in it. I live in AZ and the dry air doesn't seem to be big problem.

Sliced tomato really nice... but making fries out of a potato almost crushed the cheap plastic as I tried to get it through the slicer.  Even with the guard it was horrid trying too pass the potato through.  I felt I needed a whack with a hammer to push it through and I was afraid my hand would slip off the guard into the blades... Very disappointedEnded up with the one made by OXO, because it was America's Test Kitchen number one recommendation. I love it. It has four thickness levels to choice from... more blades and it works. The blades are also super SHARP. It has rubber feet that hold it in place better. You can elevate it at one end. Most important, the plastic housing doesn't feel like it will break, when pressure is applied while slicing fries. As for the one made in Germany, I had hoped it would be better, but it's not. For a few dollars more, go with OXO. Hope this was helpful.

But with real talented... kids. Wish Amazon had all seasons on Prime, because the Lifetime App is full of commercials we are forced to sit through.  Goes to show you I like it, cause I put up with the ads. Plus, the app's video is not as nice as Amazon Prime Streaming..

Debate for a few months regarding this product, but the other day I did my nails and bemoaned the shininess and decided to spend the $$... Tried it on teal and LOVE it!  This will be fun to try with other colors.  Didn't like it on a 'barely there color', that needed shine. I would never had tried it with out the Amazon reviewers.  Thank you

so far.. had a little trouble with indigestion, until I learned to take after lunch (normally my biggest meal). I have read by this author.  As stated in previous reviews of his writing, I am hooked and will finish every book he has and will write. Professional written and written with passion, but not filled with wasted words that may bore a reader... I would also like to thank Amazon and  the Amazon reviewers that introduced me to this man's touching books.

everytime I used salad dressing, I curse the bottle they came in. I would have to be really careful not to flood the salad if the opening didn't come with a cap with a smaller hole, then the actual diameter of the bottle. Even With the smaller hole, the opening and cap soon built up with goop.  These are great, squirt, squirt.. I control the amount needed, and the top doesn't goop up.  Some dressing has particles that will plug the tip, but I cut down the tip to allow the chunks to pass through.  I knew they didn't come with caps.  Wire connectors work, but I use the little tiny rubber caps that come with my e-cigs cartridges.  They for perfectly.  I also love then for my oils and catsup.  Con: be careful screwing on the top.  I noticed one top was 'stripping'.

Book I've read by this author, wait I should say devoured by this author. It's been awhile since I have come across a true crime book that reads like a well written suspense novel that keeps you glued to the story from beginning  to end.  It's an equal to THE ONION FIELD, SMALL SACRIFICES, IN COLD BLOOD and THE TWELVE OF NEVER.  I have a feeling I will have finished all of Carlton Stowers books before the end of this month.

Reading this after watching a condensed version on tv. There is so much more to this story then an hour televised recreation could possibly cover.  I am also excited to find new crime author that knows how to tell a riveting story, even though I knew how it  ended.  Ann Rule is correct in her praise of Carlton Stowers. Excuse me, I have to find another one of his books...
Cat loves these, but there is no difference in the amount of vomit that I am cleaning up so I quit...

Another book on Jodi by a so called news anchor... this book is filled with dribble, nothing new here because CNN already over saturated the air waves with this money making trial... and the author is desperate to cash in... glad I didn't buy it, but tried to read my friends copy... told her she was a sucker...

I've had five of these Magnavox HDD / DVD recorders and normally I love them.  I have two 533s in use, and a newer model in reserve.  Another 533 died after a storm -- probably an electrical surge killed it -- but was otherwise great.  This older model H2080, though, has given me lots of trouble.This recorder kept resetting to factory settings at least every 48 hours.  I noticed that at 11:58 each morning the machine would automatically start whirring -- perhaps it confirms its clock setting at 12 noon? -- and often this would lead to everything resetting.  I never had anything scheduled to record at 12 o'clock, so I can only guess that this was some sort of maintenance function in action.  At any rate, I got tired of rerunning the antenna setup and re-entering my timer list every other day.  After almost a dozen times, I'd had enough.My particular machine might just be a misfit, or it may have exceeded its useful life.  I'm keeping it as a back-up, for dubbing recording, and for parts if necessary.  Again, the newer Magnavox HDD/DVDs are great (I especially like the 1.3X playback).

I'm frankly puzzled by the enthusiastic reviews for this movie.  The film is clearly aimed at very small children and will likely frustrate adults and intelligent children with its clich√© humor and poor plotting.  The motivations of the characters (albeit LEGO toys) are missing and there is a moralistic message of co√∂peration that is undermined by the success of Clutch Powers as an individual and by the lack of character development in the other LEGO figures who are having difficulty getting along until they aren't.  This message is much more effectively delivered in "The LEGO Movie".  That film, along with the LEGO Batman movie, is eminently preferable to this boring and puerile effort.

It like these Eneloop batteries and the D spacers.  I only wish the screw-bottom on the spacers were better designed as one of mine has trouble staying on.  Still, these are superior to the D spacers that don't have "lids".  I use batteries and spacers in a radio and in little fans and they work great.

I'm disappointed with this correction fluid.  The color is more yellow than I expected -- I'd hoped it would match the standard beige tone of old book paper.  The foam "paint brush" sort of sucks.  It doesn't spread evenly and the fluid quickly clumps on the end.  The old type of brush with little strands of "hair" works much better, and the correction tape is much better still.

Wow, what a thrilling piece is Handel's "Dixit Dominus" and what a fine recording is this 1978 John Eliot Gardiner recording.  The music is worthy of J.S. Bach -- what higher compliment can be offered?  The recording is delightful, as expected from Mr. Gardiner.  I've yet to be disappointed with his CDs.

It's nice to have this "Raffles" double film set.  I like the books and both films stick to the initial Raffles story pretty well, except for offering Hollywood endings.  The 1939 David Niven film is a fairly-close remake of the 1929 Ronald Colman "Raffles", but the 1939 is much better paced and, apart from its crime-does-not-pay required ending, is a superior film.  I say this, despite the fact that I prefer Ronald Colman to David Niven.  If you like 1930s and '40s crime film series like "The Thin Man", "Boston Blackie", "The Lone Wolf", and company, you'll probably enjoy these two Raffles movies.
These are nifty pens.  I've used them to fill-in the faded titles on the covers and spines of old books.  They work like a charm!

"Tropic Thunder" is exciting and very funny.  I wish a curse-free version were available, since I don't enjoy swearing.  Still, it's a fun parody of action movies like "Rambo" and Hollywood in general.

I like my solar battery charger.  I place it on my window ledge on sunny days and recharge my AA and AAA batteries in a matter of hours.  It only works on bright sunny days, not on cloudy days or with lamp light, but it does work -- especially if the solar panel is angled directly toward the sun, which my study window allows at various times during the day.I wish it had more slots for AA and AAA batteries, since I don't have rechargeable Cs and Ds and such.  I also wish the solar panel detached from the charger and had an extension cord, to more easily place it.  Yet, all things considered, I'm happy with this charger because it successfully recharges my AA and AAA rechargeable batteries of every kind.

This tester has worked wonderfully for my husband and me.  We checked all our outlets with it and learned, much to our delight, that most of them were grounded (we had thought very few actually were).  We discovered which outlets were not grounded and found one outlet had been wired backwards.  I was able to fix that by reversing the outlet, which had been install upside down.  Now all our outlets are happy, and so are we!

"Zorro Rides Again" is okay, but certainly undeserving of the over-the-top reviews I've read at Amazon.  The story is so-so, with Zorro coming out of retirement after someone starts impersonating him maliciously.  The acting, apart from the leads, is pretty bad -- like mediocre community theater -- and the Castilian lisps are overdone.  Preteens may enjoy the play, but I think most older children, and all but a few adults, will find it far less engaging.  You can do much better with the Marius Goring "Adventures of the Scarlet Pimpernel" recordings available on Amazon from One's Media.

I was very disappointed with this radio drama.  The story is overlong -- 3 hours! -- and hasn't nearly enough Zorro, just lots of pirate mischief.  The acting, apart from a couple of the leads, is pretty bad -- like mediocre community theater -- and the Castilian lisps are WAY overdone.  Preteen boys may enjoy the play, but I think most older children, and all but a few adults, will find it a chore to sit through.

This was a gift for my husband, who reviews:"The book is wonderfully well-written, full of surprises, and among the most heartening and heartwarming I have ever read.  The central subject is friendship between men -- heterosexual men in every case -- and how that can be sustained in a world that works very hard, in so many ways, to keep men apart.  I can't recommend it highly enough."
My husband is very pleased with these socks.  They're comfortable and fit well, and the price was excellent: about $1 a pair!

I'd remembered these films fondly from my childhood, but alas, they didn't live up to my memories.  They're okay, and reasonably-amusing, but somewhat cheesy and dated.  I like all the actors, but the plots are pretty thin.
I'm pleased with this electric shaver for its very low price and its clean, painless shaving on my underarms.
I'm using this to secure a garden shed and am happy with the low-price and the results.

These are inexpensive and attractive target arrows, but you get what you pay for: one cracked the first time I used it.  I wish the tips were not screw-in points -- One came off inside the target and I had to fish it out with pliers.  I used some super glue to stick the the tips on good-and-proper, and to fix the cracks.  So, I'm happy with these arrows for the low price.  Plus, they came in just two weeks, all the way from China.
We use this padlocks on a garden shed.  So far, so good!
This is a nice, very-tiny flash drive.  I use it for a portable speaker, filling the flash drive with MP3s.

I purchased this to use behind an Arrow Mat 1 Spot Target for archery, along with a roll of sponge neoprene -- both pretty inexpensive. Laying all upon a piece of plywood makes a low-priced, but durable and attractive archery target.  The extra tiles I'll use in the basement for an anti-fatigue mat.

I purchased this to use behind an Arrow Mat 1 Spot Target for archery, along with squares of anti-fatigue matting -- both pretty inexpensive. Laying all upon a piece of plywood makes a low-priced, but durable and attractive archery target.  However, this mouse pad proved to be much thinner than advertised, and I had to return it and purchase a roll of sponge neoprene instead.  So, this would make an okay mouse pad -- but again it's very thin, so it might not last long -- but it is mis-advertised and didn't work for my purposes.

I purchased this to use behind an Arrowmat Arrow Mat 1 Spot Target for archery, along with squares of anti-fatigue matting -- both pretty inexpensive. Laying all upon a piece of plywood makes a low-priced, but durable and attractive archery target.

I purchased this to use behind an Arrowmat Arrow Mat 1 Spot Target for archery, along with squares of anti-fatigue matting -- both pretty inexpensive. Laying all upon a piece of plywood makes a low-priced, but durable and attractive archery target.

I've enjoyed all the Lloyd Nolan "Michael Shayne" mysteries, but this one is my favorite.  It has the most engaging plot, and all the characteristic humor.  If you like Boston Blackie, The Lone Wolf, Nick Carter, and the like, I really think you'll enjoy "Dressed to Kill" and the other Michael Shayne films.

This is, essentially, a huge mouse pad, with grommets and a target design.  Still, it's great-looking and it does the trick.  I use it atop some layers of sponge neoprene and squares of anti-fatigue matting -- both pretty inexpensive.  Laying all upon a piece of plywood makes a low-priced, but durable and attractive archery target.

This Arrow Shed is a LOT of work to assemble: my husband and I spent an entire day 9-to-5 (with a short breakfast break and a longer lunch) and another hour or so the next day putting this together.  It has hundreds of screws and bolts, and while not particularly difficult to assemble, it's certainly time-consuming.  The result is pretty nice.  We're caulking the seams to help water-proof it, but we expect that it will do a good job storing our rakes and broom and garbage cans.  It's very reasonably-priced in comparison with other garden sheds, and if you're comfortable with Ikea-like assembly -- and patient, and have a partner -- then I recommend it.

These are very entertaining short stories in the vein of "Fortunes of Captain Blood" and "Captain Blood Returns", if not as wonderfully-written as those Rafael Sabatini books.  H. Bedford-Jones knew how to tell a tale and I was never less-than-engaged by these swashbuckler shorts.  Recommended for fans of Sabatini, Justin Huntly-McCarthy, and the like.

I purchased this solely on the recommendation of other reviewers who asserted that this Marengo Films edition of "The Son of Monte Cristo" is the best.  I'm disappointed.  The picture and sound is slightly better than the Alpha Video release, but nothing great.  As for Cyrano, the Olive Films blu-ray is the way to go for picture and sound.Moreover, Marengo Films has an annoying advertisement at the beginning of the disc that cannot be skipped.  One has to wait through the entire advertisement (fast-forward, skip, and menu buttons don't work) to get to the main menu to select the film one wishes to see.  Very lame!As for the films themselves, "Cyrano de Bergerac" is 5-stars, and "The Son of Monte Cristo" is 4 or 4.5.  Both are top-drawer examples of swashbucklers and very entertaining.

The cover design is deceptive: Alexander Gauge plays a subordinate r√¥le in "The Pickwick Papers", but, myself, I'm glad for the deception because as a fan of Gauge's work I might not have purchased this else.  James Hayter plays Mr. Pickwick to a "P" -- the casting is spot-on without exception in fact -- and is the heart of this endearing, amusing, and moving set of episodic adventures.  The picture-quality and sound are excellent.  This is by-far my favorite Dickens realization.  It's rather akin in tone to the Greer Garson / Laurence Olivier "Price and Prejudice".  Highly recommended.
This is THE essential modern rendition of the traditional Robin Hood ballads.  Howard Pyle's prose is elegant and engaging and his lavish illustrations are simply superb.  Highly recommended.

These Michael Shayne Mysteries are vastly-enjoyable b-pictures, with fun mystery plots and lots of humor.  Lloyd Nolan is great as gumshoe Michael Shayne.  This collection includes sparkling prints and some entertaining special features.  It's just a pity that they never issued Volume 2 with the other three Shayne films.  Still, this is very-reasonably-priced and worth every penny.  Highly recommended, especially for fans of the "Lone Wolf", "Boston Blackie", "Falcon", "Saint", and "Nick Carter" series.

One of the cartoons on "Best Pals: Mickey & Minnie" is excellent, "Mickey's Rival" (which is one of only three that includes both Minnie and Mickey), the rest range from mediocre to annoying.  Disney cartoon collections are over-priced and niggardly-supplied as is -- just eight cartoons of varying quality -- but this volume is especially-poor with just one that's worthwhile.  The remaining seven just aren't worth watching, and mostly consist of housewife Minnie being annoyed by Pluto or Figaro.  Disney makes these expensive, ungenerous collections all the less-enjoyable with its annoying advertisements and menus. A simple, music-free menu allowing quick access to any of the cartoons would be so-preferable. Sigh....

These "Road" pictures are amusing, feather-light entertainments, and this collection of the first four in the series is worth the price, if one is a fan of Bob and Bing. The quality of the pictures and sound is excellent.

These "Road" pictures are amusing, feather-light entertainments, and this collection of the last two in the series is worth the modest coin requested, if one is a fan of Bob and Bing.  The quality of the pictures and sound is excellent.

About half of these cartoons are good, the rest are rather mediocre.  These Disney cartoon collections are over-priced and niggardly-supplied -- just eight cartoons of varying quality.  The good ones on "Funny Factory with Mickey" (Vol. 1) are "M.M. Takes a Trip", "Moose Hunters", "The Pointer", and "Magician Mickey".  Those are clever, entertaining shorts.  The other four aren't worth watching, sadly.  Disney makes this expensive, ungenerous collection all the less-enjoyable with its annoying advertisements and menus.  A simple, music-free menu allowing quick access to any of the cartoons would be so-preferable.  Sigh....

This is a fine guide to Central Park, if a little big for the pocket.  It's informative and lavishly-illustrated, with lots of photos and maps and history bits.  Recommended for touring that unique and wonderful public park.  (By the way, the best map of the park is "Central Park Entire: The Definitive Illustrated Folding Map", available from www.centralparknature.com.)

As another reviewer mentioned, the picture is worth a thousand deceptive words, because what you're getting here is a big piece of burlap with two sets of black concentric circles printed on it.  Pretty simple.  Burlap is hardly self-healing, as the advertisement claims.  Sure, the arrow goes in and you can pull it out and the burlap thread has largely been thrust-aside, but it pretty-much stays that way, so you'll quickly end-up with lots of little holes.  Still, it's not terrible and lasts long-enough, I suppose.  Yet for this price a piece of burlap seems kind of a rip-off....  If you're willing to spend $25 for a true self-healing target, I recommend the Arrowmat Arrow Mat 1 Spot Target 17"x17".  Mounted atop a few layers of neoprene and you've got a nifty long-last self-healing target for about $50 -- much less than a standard brand-name self-healing archery target.

"Don Ricardo Returns" is a B-picture, and a rather-poor swashbuckler at that.  Isabelita is fairly-bad and the fellow who plays the friar kind of stinks and Fred Coby is just okay.  In other words, the acting isn't going to win any awards.  Neither is the editing.  The direction is pretty poor too.  So what does "Don Ricardo" have going for it?  It has some fine fencing, a serviceable story, and humor.  Just the same, if you haven't the means or willingness to do some home-editing, I don't recommend "Don Ricardo Returns" unless you're a completest swashbuckler-collector.  As for me, I've put "Don Ricardo" through the Corel Video Studio Pro treatment, removing stupid bits, paring-down overlong scenes, and trimming the entire film by almost ten-minutes.  This effort has taken a D+ movie and made it a C+, and I've had lots of fun in the process!

This arrow-rest is okay, as far as it goes, but I've found a better, much longer-lasting, and less-expensive alternative.  The Bear weather arrow-rest is initially accurate, but quickly wears away and that can lead to inaccurate shooting.  Tired of these disintegrating arrow-rests, I drilled a small hole through the side of the riser (on my recurve bow) opposite to where one places an adhesive arrow-rest like the Bear.  I then screwed-in an inch-long wood screw, bent-up the protruding part slightly and screwed-on a standard plastic drywall anchor.  I've found that arrows fly more accurately now, and the drywall-anchor arrow-rest lasts longer and can be inexpensively replaced.  The wood screw lasts as long as the bow, of course.  In brief, this Bear weather arrow-rest is as good as the other brand-name arrow-rests, but a 5-cent wood screw and plastic anchor provide a far-better solution.

Volume 3 has the best artwork in the series to date, and the most consistent, and these were my favorite chapters of the story so far (other than the fine Jimmy Olsen prologue in Volume 1), so things are moving in the right direction as I'm concerned.  Some have criticized this volume for not having enough action, but I think the story-telling is quite exciting.  I really enjoyed Superman / Kal-El adjusting to life on New Krypton, training the Kandorians in their yellow sun powers, keeping an eye on General Zod, and gently trying to show everyone a better way.  Perhaps my favorite story is "World of New Krypton" Part Two, where Commander El (Superman) is ordered by General Zod to stop a herd of rampaging though-beasts "by whatever means necessary."  His solution is so essentially Clark / Superman: clever, compassionate, efficient, and as non-violent as possible.  I'm liking "New Krypton" more and more with each volume.

I'm enjoying this New Krypton story arc.  Volume two has somewhat better artwork than volume one.  The six chapters in volume two lead up to the creation of New Krypton in synchronous orbit with Earth, and Superman departing for his new home.  There are lots of confrontations and fisticuffs, General Lane and Luthor continue to scheme and attack Kryptonians, Aunt Alura needs a hug, and Superman just wants everyone to get along.  The many story threads are still dangling at the end of the volume, so I was left feeling a bit at sea, but I'm having a pretty good time reading and looking forward to the rest of the tale, so I consider this $10 well spent.

I read about this blu ray player in "Sound and Vision" magazine several months ago and was excited by the possibility of owning a 4K blu ray player with Technicolor certification -- for just $100!  After checking at Amazon from time to time over the succeeding months, I finally found the player available in January 2015 -- though selling for $130.  I checked around and purchased it from Sears.com for $90.The set-up was very easy.  I simply unplugged the coaxial digital audio cable and the HDMI cable from the back of my old Samsung blu-ray and plugged them into the Seiki player.  The full list of inputs is: HDMI, LAN, USB, Coaxial Digital Audio, a stereo pair of RCA audio inputs, and CVBS (yellow RCA video -- why would anyone buy a blu-ray player and use this feeble connection?  I wish it had S-Video instead).I've tried four different blu-ray discs, a DVD-RW, two DVD-Rs, and a DVD and they all played without a hitch and look fabulous.  (The manual lists BD, DVD, DVD-R/+R, DVD-RW/+RW, VCD, CD-R, and CD-RW as all compatible, by the way.)  I haven't fiddled much with the settings on the Seiki yet -- the user can adjust resolution, t.v. system (NTSC / PAL / Multi), color space, sharpness, video mode, and video noise reduction, among various other things.The remote control is so-so.  There are a lot of buttons and they are pretty small (and I have small hands).  It took me a few seconds to find the play/pause button!  Still, it's a serviceable remote and I hope to incorporate its functions into my universal remote.The player itself is attractively sleek and modern looking, with its gently curved surface and its three large buttons (open/close, play/pause, and power).  This elegant design does make stacking other components on the Seiki a bit tricky.  I have a small DVD player and a small all-region DVD player on top of the Seiki and they're stable enough, but it wouldn't handle anything bigger on its roof.  I also trimmed and kept the manufacturer's cellophane over the three big buttons, since as these face upward they are likely to be dust catchers.The bottom line is, I'm very happy with my $90 purchase and couldn't be more pleased with the ease of setup and the quality of the picture from this Seiki blu-ray player.

I'd never seen this version of "The Man in the Iron Mask" before purchasing these discs, though I'm a swashbuckler collector and a fan of Richard Chamberlain from "The Three Musketeers" and "The Four Musketeers" films.This is an excellent, if somewhat altered, rendition of the Dumas story.  The first hour is rather leisurely paced, though entertaining, but the second half really hums.  The story has action, intrigue, betrayal, romance, and lots of gorgeous costumes and locations.  If you like Richard Chamberlain's work (very fine here, especially in his distinction between Louis and Philippe), swashbucklers, or the Richard Lester "Three / Four Musketeers", you'll probably enjoy this too.

I'm enjoying this New Krypton story arc more than I thought I might, though the Jimmy Olsen prologue is even better.  This first volume of "New Krypton" begins after the "Superman: Brainiac" book, following Superman's defeat and capture of that Coluan scoundrel.  The best story and artwork in Volume 1 is the first, "From a Cub to a Wolf", from "Superman's Pal Jimmy Olsen Special 1".  Jimmy is investigating a shadowy figure, and his investigation leads him to Cadmus and to the strange desert town of Warpath.  The Jimmy Olsen story concludes in the next chapter, "The Worst Night of His Life", but the artwork is far inferior.  In fact, apart from the first story / chapter, the artwork in this volume ranges from mediocre to juvenile.  Really, I'm surprised that DC allowed such poor penciling -- the sort you'd expect from a high-schooler who might, one day, be pretty good.  People look past one another, poses are awkward, and figures frequently look unnatural.  However, the storytelling remains good throughout, but the first two chapters of Jimmy Olsen are the real treat, and worth getting this volume for.  The New Krypton storyline starts with the third of five chapters, and begins with the tale of what happens after the bottle city of Kandor is restored to full-size (next door to Superman's Fortress of Solitude) and the Kandorians are free to roam Earth with the same powers as Superman.  Hijinks and tomfoolery are the results.

"Superman for All Seasons" is a marvelous book.  In four season chapters it offers a fresh and very moving version of the Superman origin story (Smallville and Metropolis parts, no Krypton).  The artwork is lovely and personal and unlike most other comic book illustration, and the story is just sublime.  We already had the paperback edition, and this hardcover "Deluxe" edition doesn't add any annotation, but just a larger-size version plus three short stories from other publications (including a Superman/Batman book) that feature the same artists.  Still, I'm very happy to have it in larger format, and hardcover!
This is a very handy gizmo and it only cost me several dollars, so I'm quite pleased.  If you need to convert from Toslink optical to coaxial digital, this is the tool.

We purchased this to help burglar-proof our home.  It wasn't too expensive, and not too hard to apply, and it does frustrate prying eyes, so we're happy!February 2015 Update:My husband and I applied some of this film to both sides of the glass on two cabinets.  It took several hours for seven panes, but wasn't difficult and we couldn't be more pleased with the results.  The effect is that of an antique mirror, and only with low indirect light can one see the inside at all, and then only indistinctly.By the way, the key to separating the adhesive backing from the film is a piece of Scotch or packing tape at a corner -- one piece on each side, with half the length of the tape on the film and the other half held between your thumb and forefinger on each hand. A firm (but not violent) pull will separate the layers.  Without the tape, it's almost impossible to pull the two layers apart, but with tape, and a little practice, it isn't difficult.

I got this through Amazon Warehouse Deals for only $15 and I'm happier with it than I expected.  It's very lightweight, easy to separate for emptying, and it has a small footprint, which means I can get it in all the tight spots that frustrated my standard vacuum cleaner.  I only wish this had a longer cord, as I need to move to several different sockets in order to vacuum my kitchen, bedroom, bathroom, and living room (all on one floor).  Still, for $15, I'm very pleased with this vacuum.  It does as good a job as my Eureka "wind-tunnel" vacuum, with less hassle.

My sister-in-law enthusiastically recommended these, but I was disappointed.  They are more comfortable than some mouth guards -- and smaller -- but they still bugged me.  I hate grinding my teeth, but I also hate having a mouth full of rubber that I can't stop sucking and chewing on.  Sigh.

~BACKGROUND~My 2-year old son is hit or miss with his diet and I felt he needed some supplements to round out his nutrition.  After a lot of research I decided to go with the Yummi Bears.~PROS~- Most importantly - no artificial colors or flavors!  All natural colors and flavors.- Allergen, gluten, and dairy free- No preservatives- Made in the USA- Soft gummies with good flavor that my son enjoys eating~CONS~- More expensive than traditional chewable daily vitamins~CONCLUSION~The early years are critical for children so for me it's worthwhile to spend the money to give my son a better overall diet without having the artificial colors, flavors and preservatives that are unhealthy.

~BACKGROUND~My 2-year old son is hit or miss with his diet and I felt he needed some supplements to round out his nutrition.  After a lot of research I decided to go with the Yummi Bears.~PROS~- Most importantly - no artificial colors or flavors!  All natural colors and flavors.- Allergen, gluten and casein free- DHA and Omega-3 for brain development, heart health and vision- Soft gummies with good flavor that my son enjoys eating~CONS~- Pricey~CONCLUSION~The early years are critical for children so for me it's worthwhile to spend the money to give my son a better overall diet.

~BACKGROUND~I have a half sleeve on each arm and working as a manager in a corporate business casual environment I wanted to have the flexibility of being able to wear short sleeve shirts (polos) without revealing my tattoos. I've been wearing the sleeves for several years now.~PROS~- made of solid, durable material- rubber "no-slip" elastic grip band on the upper seam to prevent slipping- blocks 98% of UV rays which are harmful to tattoos- logo free- tag free- breathable material (80% nylon-20% spandex)- comfortable- made in the USA~CONS~- I used my white ones daily from spring to fall for two seasons and the sleeves have stretched out and are now loose- the sleeve does not blend in as well as I would like. They look like you are wearing a compression shirt (Under Armour, Nike, etc.)~TIPS~- wash them in a gentle cycle with clothing that will not snag the sleeves (velcro, zippers, etc.)~CONCLUSION~The white sleeve does not cover 100% as the heavy black areas on my tattoos are slightly visible in bright light, but they do enough to satisfy my needs.

~BACKGROUND~I purchased these for my 1 year old son.~PROS~- Pouches are BPA free.- Real fruit.- All natural.- Convenient for lunches, snacks, on the go.- Resealable.- Gluten free, dairy free, nut free and Kosher certified.- Nice flavor blend.- Don't have to worry about an open jar/bottle of applesauce in the refrigerator that might go bad.- Made in the USA.~CONS~None so far!~TIPS~- I like to put these in the refrigerator and serve them to my son chilled - he loves them!- I squeeze the sauce out into a bowl and add in diced strawberries for a change.~CONCLUSION~My son absolutely loves the Fruit Me Up pouches.

~BACKGROUND~My wife is on a low sugar, low carb, moderated protein diet and was paying $4 a bar from the "program".  After doing some label research she wanted to give these a try.  She eats one a day as a snack/treat in place of traditional junk foods.~PROS~- Taste good for what they are- Better quality than other protein bars - not as dry and chalky.- Convenient.- Not overly sweet.- Best balance of flavor vs sugars/carbs.- Nice price at ~$1 per bar.~CONS~- None so far - especially in comparison to other protein bars.~NUTRITION LABELS~Since they are not listed on here. (I believe these are correct)Chocolate Peanut ButterProtein 20g - Sugar 2g - Calories 200Chewy Chocolate ChipProtein 20g - Sugar 3g - Calories 200Chocolate DeluxeProtein 21g - Sugar 3g - Calories 180~CONCLUSION~Best bar for not only the money, but for protein content, low sugar, low carb, high protein value.  My wife strongly recommends these protein bars.  Great for not just dieters and healthy eaters, but for every day use to replace high sugar junk foods!

~BACKGROUND~My wife is on a low sugar and carb diet and eats salads for lunch every day.~PROS~- Nice balance of oil and vinegar.- Great price on Amazon!  Sells for almost $5 a bottle in the local grocery stores.- Newman's Own brand profits go to charity!~CONS~- None!~DETAILS~Olive Oil Blend (Olive Oil, Extra Virgin Olive Oil), Vegetable Oil (Soybean Oil and/or Canola Oil), Water, Red Wine Vinegar, Onion, Spices, Salt, Garlic, Lemon Juice and Distilled Vinegar.  Not Kosher.Serving Size - 2 TBCalories - 150Calories from fat - 150Total Fat - 16g (25%DV)Saturated fat - 2.5g (13% DV)Trans fat - 0gCholesterol - 0mg (0% DV)Sodium - 150mg (6% DV)Total Carbohydrate - 1g (0% DV)Dietary Fiber - 0g (0% DV)Sugars - 1gProtein - 0gVitamin A - (0% DV)Vitamin C - (0% DV)Calcium - (0% DV)Iron - (0% DV)Percent Daily Values (DV) are based on a 2,000 calorie diet.~CONCLUSION~My wife and I really like Newman's Own products.  Not only for their flavor, but also in their healthy product line (compared to others) and their charity driven business ($400+ million to charity in 30 years).

~BACKGROUND~Misplaced the gas cap for my MTD riding mower and needed a replacement.~PROS~- Looks just like the original.- Fits well with no issues.~CONS~- None!~CONCLUSION~The gas cap is what it is - a direct replacement for your old one.

~BACKGROUND~I purchased this throwing brace for my 10 year-old son who has had a history of inconsistent throwing motions which effects his accuracy and his velocity due to his fear of making a poor throw.  My son is 4'5" tall and scrawny.  ThrowMax recommends an Extra Small (up to 4'7"), but I went a Small (4'8" - 5'2").I have been coaching little league for the past 6 years.~PROS~- Appears to be well made with quality materials- When properly placed on the arm it works as described:  > keeping the elbow up  > preventing the elbow from from going too far ahead of the rest of the arm  > preventing side arm motion  > preventing arm only throws- Includes a paper with various drills to help improve throwing motion~CONS~- The instructions leave a lot to be desired:  > The instructions nor the brace itself does not indicate which end of the brace is the top and which is the bottom.  I had to search the web to find pictures of people wearing them.  > There are 3 flexible bars in 3 widths on the brace that run from top to bottom. The instructions are not very clear on where the bars should be on the arm.- As others have stated, the straps irritate the skin causing discomfort..  The design/material could be improved.- Most kids' arms are thin and taper down in size from their shoulder to their wrists.  The brace therefore slips down unless it is strapped in fairly tightly - which causes discomfort as stated above.~TIPS~The listing on Amazon does not show the sizing recommendations, so I've typed them here for reference from ThrowMax.Extra Small - up to 4'8" heightSmall - 4'8" - 5'2" heightMedium - 5'3" - 5'8" heightLarge - 5'9" height~CONCLUSION~The Small fits my son just fine.  Since the instructions were lacking and to understand how it worked I tried it on myself to figure out strap tightness and proper placement.  I'm 6'2" and 175 pounds and the brace fit me and worked just fine.  There was only the discomfort from the strap.  I did not have any issues with the brace sliding down since I have some muscle definition which prevented the sliding.Overall a nice product and I recommend it to correct throwing motions.  Just be mindful of the potential for skin irritation and discomfort that others have stated in their reviews.

~BACKGROUND~I have been playing disc golf on and off for around 10 years and much more in the last year.  I am a RHBH (Right Hand Back Hand) thrower.~PROS / REVIEW~- Tournament Plastic (TP) is advanced polymers than VIP plastic with the same durability, and Westside claims the grip is slightly better- overstable disc ideal for advanced and power throwers- the Viking sword on the disc is a cool design that stands out over other discs- Speed-Glide-Turn-Fade all printed on the front of the disc- PDGA approvedSpeed 12Glide 5Turn 0Fade 2Type - distance driverStability - overstableFlight - hookRecommended skill level - advancedStyle - backhand, forehandDiameter: 21.2 cmHeight: 1.8 cmRim Depth: 1.2 cmRim Width: 2.2 cm~CONS~- None that I can speak of~TIPS~- Purchase a moisture towel like Dga Disc Dri Golf Towel (Blue) to dry off discs.- Driving is not about strength as much as it is about technique!- Write your name and phone # on the inside RIM of the disc to keep a clean look - most disc golf players are very nice and will call you if you lose it- Beginners and intermediate players should use lighter weight discs.  I recommend ~167g for beginners and ~169g for intermediate.  The lighter discs are more forgiving to errors and easier for less experienced players to throw.~CONCLUSION~I'm a big fan of the Westside/Latitude 64/Dynamic Discs lineups.  I think Westside produces some of the best quality and aesthetically pleasing discs on the market.

**Update 09/2014**Since my review I have smoked many pork shoulders/butts, chicken breasts, turkey breasts, whole chicken and fish with NO ISSUES.  I will reiterate the need for proper maintenance and technique to use not just this unit, but ANY smoker.  Disregard the bad reviews - if you learn to properly smoke then this unit is a great bang for the buck.~Background~This is the first smoker I have ever owned or used.  To this point I have smoked numerous pork butts, pork shoulders, briskets, chicken and fish.I have uploaded a picture of 16 pounds of Boston Butt.  After an overnight brine of apple cinder vinegar base and 6 hour rub, I used apple chips and smoked for 18 hours at 225 degrees.  The end result was a nice dark and crispy bark, great smoke ring - (which some raters stated is not possible with an electric smoker), and juicy, tender meat that fell off the bones.~Pros~- Food quality is on par/better than other methods such as charcoal and propane.- Easy assembly.- Easy to use - plug and start.- Easy to maintain temperature since it's electric.  Trust me, I know charcoal using smokers who are constantly checking temperature, adjusting air flow/temperature.- No need to purchase or worry about charcoal or propane. My brother-in-law owns a charcoal smoker and he spends far more time maintaining the meat, charcoal and chips and prepping and cleaning up.- Two racks that can easily hold 10-14 pounds each.- Lid has a "hook" that allows you to hang it from the smoker itself.- Great bang for the buck.~Cons~- The screws inside!  These are a hazard as you can scratch your hands and arms, snag clothing, etc.  This can be a pain if you are pulling the top rack to mop the lower rack and reaching inside to mop.- No side door.  This would be extremely beneficial in being able to add more chips and empty the drip tray.  I'm pretty handy and plan on modifying my smoker and installing a side door.- No thermometer - only low/medium/high temperature settings- Too airtight, but easily solved by not sealing the lid as tight as possible.  Others have suggested drilling holes in the lid and/or sides.- Not the most durable handles, but as long as you don't beat on it it should last.~Tips~- Buy Old Smokey Replacement Grease Absorbents to replace as needed.  It can be found here on Amazon.- Leave the lid slightly ajar to allow some air to escape.  This will prevent the condensation buildup inside the smoker.- To clean: Use a pressure washer.  If you don't have access to one, put some water and vinegar/lemon into the drip pan and crank the smoker up.  Let the condensation build up.  Turn off, and wearing thick gloves, use a grill or wire brush to scrub the inside.- Purchase a thermometer to monitor and maintain appropriate temps: 2" Thermometer- Purchase a heavy duty outdoor extension cord Fellowes 99597 25-Feet 1-Outlet 3-Prong Indoor/Out Heavy Duty Extension Cord~Conclusion~Traditionalists will say "charcoal tastes better", but a blind taste test would strongly beg to differ as I have made pork that bbq loving people have said is "the best" they've ever had.I'm sorry, but those that are giving this smoker 1 star clearly have no clue or idea of how to properly smoke meat.  The end result is how YOU use the smoker - it is not a magical cylinder that transforms meat into juicy, tender goodness.  Proper technique in prepping and maintaining the meat, choice of chips, maintaining the proper temperature for the appropriate duration all add up to a great final product.If you have any questions or need guidance I'd be more than happy to answer them - just leave me a comment!

~BACKGROUND~I have been playing disc golf on and off for around 10 years and much more in the last year.  I am a RHBH (Right Hand Back Hand) thrower.~PROS / REVIEW~- VIP plastic is transparent and over time maintains most of it's flight characteristics- overstable to stable disc best suited for intermediate to advanced players- the metalworker on the disc is a cool design that stands out over other discs- Speed-Glide-Turn-Fade all printed on the front of the disc- PDGA approvedSpeed 10Glide 5Turn -1Fade 2Type - distance driverStability - overstableFlight - s-curveRecommended skill level - intermediateStyle - backhandDiameter: 21.5 cmHeight: 1.7 cmRim Depth: 1.1 cmRim Width: 2.0 cm~CONS~- None that I can speak of~TIPS~- Purchase a moisture towel like Dga Disc Dri Golf Towel (Blue) to dry off discs.- Driving is not about strength as much as it is about technique!- Write your name and phone # on the inside RIM of the disc to keep a clean look - most disc golf players are very nice and will call you if you lose it- Beginners and intermediate players should use lighter weight discs.  I recommend ~167g for beginners and ~169g for intermediate.  The lighter discs are more forgiving to errors and easier for less experienced players to throw.~CONCLUSION~I'm a big fan of the Westside/Latitude 64/Dynamic Discs lineups.  I think Westside produces some of the best quality and aesthetically pleasing discs on the market.

~BACKGROUND~I purchased this board for my 10 year old son's birthday.  It is his first longboard.~PROS~- Great length for cruising- Good starter/beginner board- Trucks, wheels, bushings, and bearings are entry level - not too fast nor requires a lot of skill- Good looking classic-look longboard~CONS~- Poor quality control.  There are 4 screws on the top of the deck that connect the trucks to the deck.  6 of the screws are black to match the deck, but 2 screws are silver.~CONCLUSION~Experienced riders should look elsewhere - this is definitely an entry level / beginner setup.

~BACKGROUND~My wife and I own over a dozen Tervis Tumblers and are huge fans! My kids are using the 16 ounce size around the house and on the go. We have been using them for over 10 years now.~PROS~- Huge variety of attractive designs- Insulating qualities prevent "sweating"- Accessories like the lid, straws and straw tops really make this an anywhere tumbler- Lifetime manufacturer's guarantee. I've never used it nor do I know what it covers, but that kind of backing is impressive for a "cup".- Lid snaps on and stays on very well- The "spout" opens and closes to allow drinking and prevent spills.~CONS~- Although listed as dishwasher safe, I have found the heated dry caused my tumbler to start sweating- Cost. A bit on the pricey side for a tumbler.- Size. Due to it's size (girth) it does not fit well or at all in some vehicle cupholders.~TIPS~- Do not let colored drinks to sit in the tumbler for too long. One of my tumbler's is slightly stained from letting ice tea sit in it overnight too many times.- Try some of the accessories available:Tervis Tumbler HandleTervisTumbler 6 STRAWS 24OZ (BIG-T) - TERVIS TUMBLERS * - (I could not find the straw lid on Amazon)~CONCLUSION~Overall an excellent tumbler. It's all we use at home now!

Sure, there‚Äôs a lot going on in this book. Covert ops, a wanna be paranormal detective. Supernatural shenanigans. But that‚Äôs only part of it.I‚Äôm huge on character driven stories and Get Real has some fun ones.I fell for Francesca immediately. She‚Äôs snarky, sexy, and so ready to become a paranormal detective and kick some supernatural butt.Enter bad boy Rafael. Ooh, he‚Äôs swoon worthy to look at, has the under the lashes come hither look down pat, and a mouth begging to be kissed.When Francesca and Rafa catch each others eye at a party, the heat goes up in the room. When they end up together in the bathroom, their kiss is steamy.If you‚Äôre thinking, oh no, another love at first story, you‚Äôd be right, for a few minutes. Then Rafa drops an ice cube on the passion and walks away, leaving Francesca gasping for air. You can bet she‚Äôs not happy. She knew better than to go with a bad guy like Rafa. See if he ever kisses her again.There are some other fun characters, but these two really had me going. The snarky dialogue, their inner thoughts, all of it cracked me up.What happens next, you ask? You guessed it. Francesca and Rafa wind up having to work together as the world around them starts going wiggy. And that‚Äôs just as fun. The two of them are as busy trying to ignore their attraction for each other, as they are for trying to stay alive.Nothing but fun here. Looking for a little mystery and danger, some witty dialogue, and steamy romance? You should read this book. I promise you‚Äôll laugh.I received this book for my honest review.

I couldn‚Äôt help but feel something familiar when I started this story. Reminded me of certain other books I‚Äôd read. That‚Äôs not uncommon when there are so many stories out there.  So if this happens to you, don‚Äôt stop reading. It‚Äôs the author‚Äôs job to spin their own tale, to move from familiar to fresh, to new. And that happens soon in this book.With so many characters, it‚Äôs hard to discuss all of them. I do have some favorites though. There‚Äôs Ember, or course.  Her powers are out of control. She‚Äôs a danger to herself and all those around her.Then there‚Äôs Mace. He‚Äôs a grim, a reaper of sorts. He has to consume souls to survive. He‚Äôs what you‚Äôd call a good bad guy. Sexy, snarky, and as spicy as his name implies. Like the chemical spray, he‚Äôll burn ya.Ember‚Äôs first encounter with Mace ends with a shovel to the back of his head. Their next encounter is electric. They‚Äôre like magnets. Each one‚Äôs power is drawn to the others, whether they like each other or not. The humorous dialogue and situations lighten the mood.A couple more I want to mention are Kai and Rhys. One human. One werewolf. Both are a mess of anxiety and unrequited love. Puppy love.After Ember‚Äôs father dies, she‚Äôs lost and alone. But not for long. She‚Äôs soon whisked away to a new life. One filled with supernatural beings from werewolves, to witches, to reapers, and more. And, she‚Äôs one of them. Except, no one seems to know just what she is.Living with a wolf pack isn‚Äôt easy. They are all touchy feely and Ember abhors being touched. She adjusts and soon becomes a part of the rambunctious family.It was a lot of fun getting to know the pack. It doesn‚Äôt take long to recognize who‚Äôs who. They really do have two natures, and they seem to blend together.Lots of questions to be answered. What happened twelve years ago? Why can‚Äôt anyone remember? What does the Grove know? And why is Ember alive when she‚Äôs supposed to be dead?I usually fly through books, especially those I loved as much as this one. Yet, at just over 500 pages, it took me several days. I did have to sleep and show up for work. But, the book stayed with me. I thought about it while at work, wondering about the answers I‚Äôd get. I‚Äôd crawl into bed at night, determined to stay awake and finish it, falling asleep and startling awake when the book fell out of my hands.What‚Äôs funny is, as anxious as I was to get to the end, once I got there, I didn‚Äôt want it to end. I was that into it. That connected to the characters. And I loved the world the author created.The good news is there‚Äôs another book in the series coming out in 2016. I‚Äôll be waiting for it.One for all fantasy fans, no matter your age.I received this book for my honest review.

Jack McBride has a past. A wife who‚Äôs AWOL and a defunct career with the FBI. He leaves all the rumors behind and takes a job as chief of police in the small town of Stillwater, hoping for less crime and more time to devote to his son, Ethan.What Jack doesn‚Äôt expect is a staged crime scene of murder/suicide, and a cold case rising from the grave when skeletal remains are uncovered in the woods. No coasting along in this town. He‚Äôs neck deep in rumors, gossip, conspiracy, and suspicions.Ethan may be only thirteen years old and labeled a troublemaker, but what I see is a chip off the old block. He has his father‚Äôs curiosity, penchant for seeing through the lies, and a natural talent at observing people and scenes. He‚Äôs confused about his mother‚Äôs disappearance, and angry at his father, always testing him, but he knowsJack loves him and begins to see that as they adjust to their new life.I don‚Äôt want to forget Ellie Martin. She grew up in Stillwater and knows everybody and pretty much everything that‚Äôs happened there. She‚Äôs had a rough life, but she‚Äôs moving on, starting her own business and leaving all the bad behind. She hopes.Jack turns to Ellie for help with the towns history and denizens, and is surprised to feel a growing attracting towards her. He can‚Äôt seem to stop thinking about herEllie isn‚Äôt wanting anything to do with Jack. He‚Äôs big city, she‚Äôs small town. He‚Äôs got a questionable marriage status and she‚Äôs recovering from a really bad one. But, she can‚Äôt seem to stop thinking about him either.Hmm, me thinks a romance is happening whether either of them wants it or not. I love those kind. Leads to all kinds of humorous dialogue and situations. Lightens the mood and gives you something more to hope for.I wish I was good at explaining. This book doesn‚Äôt have many big action scenes all through it. There‚Äôs a lot of meet and greet and following the main characters. getting to know them, learning what makes them tick. It‚Äôs compelling. That‚Äôs the word. The writing is so good you‚Äôre compelled to keep reading. It doesn‚Äôt feel slow or boring. It keeps you reading, seeking answers, hoping for what you want to happen to really happen.A solid mystery. Genuine characters. Compelling writing. It all works to give you a great read.I received this book for my honest review.

A Sasquatch! Yancy Lazarus meets Big Foot. How could I not love this book.Yancy has charmed me from the very beginning. Not by his looks, he‚Äôs okay. Not by his smoking and drinking, does way too much of that. And definitely not because of his behavior. But, in spite of it.Now, he‚Äôs teamed up with a sasquatch who needs his help. Seems one of his kind has gone off the rails, munching on flesh, cannibalizing his own species, and liking it too much.Now, these beings like their privacy. They‚Äôve managed to stay secluded, with everyone believing they don‚Äôt exist. One rogue sasquatch could put them on the front page and here comes the hunters. Not good at all.In comes the big bad Wendigo. If it isn‚Äôt one thing, it‚Äôs another, and the state of Montana may be one big ghost town if Yancy doesn‚Äôt take care of it.If that isn‚Äôt enough, Yancy‚Äôs still trying to stop the supernatural beings and their plans for armageddon.When I wasn‚Äôt snortin with laughter, I was talking out loud. Cheering Yancy on. The poor guy just wants a break. Some time off to smoke, drink, and jam some blues. Not today, YancyAs with the first two books, I ate this up. The author kept the suspense ramped up, threw in some new supernatural beings, put Yancy through the wringer, and continued to make me laugh.I‚Äôve been thinking about who should play the part of Yancy if there were a movie. I‚Äôm going with Russell Crow or Gerard Butler. Picture them in Gladiator and The 300.Still lovin Yancy Lazarus, and still wanting more.I received this book for my honest review.

Once again, Yancy Lazarus is on the job.He‚Äôd like nothing better than to enjoy some good blues music, chain smoke some cigarettes, and throw back some shots, chasing them with a few beers. But nope. Instead he has to rescue some kid who‚Äôs been kidnapped and dragged below to the Winter regions.It‚Äôs no pick-nick there. lots of tunnels, bitter cold, and some really nasty Fae that want to eat him for dinner.Known as the Fix-It man, it‚Äôs just another case and with a few bumps and bruises, and spilled blood, Yancy takes care of business. Except, it doesn‚Äôt stop there.Things are hinky. Others are scheming to open the supernatural gates, inviting in all manner of beasts. Can‚Äôt be good for mankind, or Yancy. It‚Äôs gonna get tricky without his VIS, his powers.Aah, Yancy. You can‚Äôt help but love him. He‚Äôs not a good catch. Smokes too much. Drinks too much. And kind of lazy. And he‚Äôs a lot older than he looks. But there‚Äôs something about him. Once you get past his smart mouth, you find he has a large heart, even though he tries to hide it behind a cavalier attitude. I‚Äôm thinking a lot of you men can relate with Yancy.Like the first book, the action is wild, the beings are out of this world, in more ways than one, and Yancy charms you yet again.Sorry Mom. I know you warned me about the bad boys. But, I just love Yancy.And I love this series. I sure you hope you give it a try. It‚Äôs all good.I received this book for my honest review.

The blurb ends with this question, ‚ÄúWhat could possibly go wrong?‚Äù Well, plenty can and does.The zombie apocalypse has come and gone, for the most part. People now know vampires and werewolves exist.Zombies are in camps, kept contained for our and their protection.The vampires live in poverty, struggling just to exist as their numbers dwindle towards extinction.And the werewolves live deep in the swamps and jungles, trying to avoid man at all costs.When one man‚Äôs vision offers all of these beings a safe place to live and improve their station, they take his offer, one way or the other.Imagine Jurassic Park, but not dinosaurs. Instead you get zombies, werewolves, and vampires. I don‚Äôt know about you, but I‚Äôd probably buy a ticket.When you add important people and a bunch of kids to opening night, your mind should buzz with what could happen. With what could go wrong. That‚Äôs where it gets wild.Take a walk with the zombies in Zombieville. Meet real vampires in Vampire Village. And run with the werewolves in River Run.But beware, ye who enter. The monsters aren‚Äôt happy and you don‚Äôt ever want that.I ate this story up in one sitting. The minute it was available to purchase I grabbed my copy and opened it immediately. I knew it was going to be great, and it was. I loved every bit of it. Michael gave me everything I was hoping for and expecting.

Poor Wes. He‚Äôs failed again and now he‚Äôs been given one last chance to prove himself qualified to be in law enforcement. He‚Äôs sure it‚Äôs a prank when he‚Äôs assigned to the Witches Protection Program.It‚Äôs no hoax. But it takes some convincing for Wes to believe in witches. He gets it in spades.His first assignment, protect a witch, heiress Morgan Pendragon, from her evil aunt. Her aunt is cooking up a diabolical scheme to rule the world.Wes will have to catch on quick if he‚Äôs to save Morgan and himself from a witches brew of trouble.This was a fun story with some likable and not so likable characters. Got to take the good with the bad.Wes is a pain in the beginning. Then he finds his place and becomes someone to cheer for.Morgan is a reluctant witch, wanting nothing to do with her aunt or the other witches and their schemes. They‚Äôre not going to give her a choice though.There‚Äôs some cool weapons, compelling characters, and a showdown at the end that I wish I could see for myself. Just imagine the pile-up when drivers look up and see witches flying in the sky.I like a good witch, but I have a thing for the bad ones too. There‚Äôs one, Morgan‚Äôs aunt, who will chill you to the bone. Too powerful for anyone‚Äôs good.Grab a broomstick and hang on tight. It‚Äôs a bumpy ride.I received this book as a gift.

I‚Äôve become fascinated by zombies and apocalyptic stories. I love The Walking Dead and the show has helped me to visualize lots of scenes. From funny to gruesome. .The author yanks you right into the apocalypse. Barely time to breath before they are everywhere. .While I love the zombies, what really grabbed me in this story was the group dynamics. Ever seen the movie The Postman with Kevin Costner?.Similar to the movie, you have opposite sides on the apocalypse. Those who want to help others and those who want to use others to save themselves. It comes as no surprise that some people choose to force their will on others, even to the point of killing..Krista lost her parents to the zombies and was out there alone. When she does find a safe haven, she feels lucky, even though she‚Äôs assigned a job as a maid to one of the top governing families. Anything is better than being out there, right? And the zombies don‚Äôt like the humidity and heat of the south, so there aren‚Äôt many around..She can‚Äôt believe her luck when she finds she has a living relative. He‚Äôs an officer in the military, if you can call it that anymore, and she jumps at a chance to go with him and fight for her new world..This is where the dynamics come in. Either place might have been safe for a while. But with leaders who are looking out for themselves first, trying to lord it over everyone else, and practically relegating them to slaves, there‚Äôs bound to be some discontent. And sooner or later something has to give..There‚Äôs plenty of zombie action and intrigue to keep the story moving quickly. Genuine characters that you‚Äôll like or loath. And a satisfying ending. Not that it‚Äôs really the end. The author wraps up this chapter, but from the conclusion, I figure there will be more stories to come. I sure hope so.I received this book for my honest review.

This book was such a delightful read.Each message is displayed through wonderful illustrations on glossy pages along with thought provoking insight into how to be true to yourself and reminding you to treat others as you would want to be treated.Not just for young children, these lessons are ones we should all heed and live by. We are reminded that everyone is important, has feelings, hopes, and dreams. There‚Äôs more to life than just another day.My mother read this book and had this to say, ‚ÄúA gorgeous book. Just what life is. Loved it.‚ÄùMy son read this book and had this to share, ‚ÄúSimple yet interesting story about not straying from your course and staying true to yourself.  Regardless of how you‚Äôre born, you‚Äôre somebody.‚ÄùThree generations loved this book and I‚Äôm sure you will too. A great book to read to kids from the time they can understand. One you‚Äôll want to read to them often.I received this book for my honest review.

This is tagged as a suspense. thriller and that‚Äôs exactly what it is.Josephine Back, a reporter who‚Äôs focus is on science and climate change, comes under attack by some very powerful corporations.Global warming is a touchy subject and many in the fossil fuel business don‚Äôt want it to be legitimized. Big brother at work again.She finds an unlikely ally in Bennett Mills. As they probe behind the red tape, they stumble into dangerous waters. Soon, they are in a race to expose those behind horrific events before they are silenced, permanently.Right from the beginning, the story intrigues you. The suspense builds slowly, leading you into the many pots and subplots. As the action builds, so does the thrills.I was particularly drawn to this story because of the topic of climate change. It‚Äôs being argued that mere humans can‚Äôt affect the globe. That global warming is a scare tactic by radical and those with their own agendas.I feel differently. Do the research. Explore the information that‚Äôs out there. I can‚Äôt see how we‚Äôre not affecting this planet.While the plot was serious, it did have some humorous scenes. I guess I‚Äôm a bit macabre. There were two scenes where what started as scare tactics turned into tragedy. The two interrogators made me think of the movie Fargo. If anything could go wrong, it did.You‚Äôll feel this author‚Äôs passion about climate change, experience reporting from the inside with Jo, enjoy the dialogue between Bennett and Jo and there burgeoning romance, and cross your fingers that they emerge safely and all of the bad guys get their just desserts.I received this book for my honest review.

I‚Äôm sure you‚Äôve read the thrilling excerpt for this book already. There‚Äôs no way I can describe this book any better.I can say that, while this isn‚Äôt the first book in this series, I jumped right in and had no problems following it.Being a fan of character driven stories, I found some strong ones here.The main protagonist, Lance Underphal, isn‚Äôt your typical one. He‚Äôs no longer in his fifties, has a bad heart, and is still grieving over the loss of his beloved wife, who visits him from time to time..He has met a new woman, one who might help fill that gaping hole, give him another chance at love. But first he has to solve a case. One that‚Äôs rife with unsavory characters. From deadly bikers, to corrupt police, Lance will need some friends if he‚Äôs to catch a killer and survive despite the bad odds.The paranormal elements had me fascinated. There‚Äôs more than one ghost haunting Lance. He‚Äôs a psychic and not surprised by that. If only some of them didn‚Äôt scare the crap out of him. They aren‚Äôt all pretty and glowing when they appear, and some have their own agendas, dark ones.The writing is excellent. I came really close to seeing the movie as I read it. Vivid detail and imagination put me in the thick of it. I got creeped out in several places. Especially at a nasty, run down house.  The author didn‚Äôt hold my hand. He made me smell the awful stench of the place. Hear the scurrying of thousands of roaches. Feel the evil presence fouling it.There‚Äôs such a great bunch of characters too. Aside from Lance and his ghostly wife, Sonja, there‚Äôs his new love interest, Callie. She‚Äôs no shrinking violet and has her own little paranormal talents.Then there‚Äôs Lance‚Äôs friend, Detective Frank Salmon. He‚Äôs stoic yet fierce when his friends are threatened. Reminds me Hodges from Criminal Minds. Doesn‚Äôt say much and rarely smiles unless he‚Äôs around his wife, Lacey. She‚Äôs a nurturer with lots of patience.Can‚Äôt forget Jake Jacobs, a federal private investigator. He‚Äôs a huge bear of a man and I could just picture him and his lady friend, Laura. She‚Äôs a bit older, sassy, and such a tiny thing. I had such fun with these two.Things get so much worse for Lance. It appears he‚Äôs being accused of the negligent death of his wife by her sister and she‚Äôs also suing him.The bad things keep on coming and Lance just hopes his heart can take it.I got thrills and chills, plenty of mystery, and more than one plot to follow. All made for an excellent read. You can bet I‚Äôll be going back to the beginning of this series now.I received this book for my honest review.

I loved everything about this book. From the different points of view to the different dates in time to the fantastic illustrations and the hair raising creepiness.When I reached the end of this book, Onyx Webb was still an enigma to me. I know there are many more episodes to come and I‚Äôm sure I‚Äôll figure her out. The jury is still out about her right now.Ever wanted to know how it felt to be a ghost? From what I learned in this book, it‚Äôs no fun. Can‚Äôt taste, can‚Äôt feel, and can‚Äôt love. Why stick around? This story will tell you why.Taking place in different time periods, all of the characters start their stories here and it‚Äôs promised by the authors that following episodes will reveal their full stories and bring all of the characters together.For now, I‚Äôm just getting to know Onyx and her father Catfish, rich boy Koda Mulvaney and his best friend Dane, Quinn Cole and his missing sister Juniper, and a slew of secondary characters.I‚Äôve read other books written in episodes but not quite like this. The characters stories span many centuries but it‚Äôs easy to follow them as their voices speak clearly. And there are several mysteries happening at different times and I have no clue how they‚Äôll all come together.I also knew there wouldn‚Äôt be an ending in this book, so no surprise there. And that‚Äôs the ‚Äòhook.‚Äô I was hooked from the first chapter, compelled to keep reading, and in no hurry to finish.The illustrations are spectacular and the writing is easy to follow. Not what you‚Äôd expect at all with the story occurring in several different time periods and told from many points of view.Trying to label this, I‚Äôd call this a ghost story and a mystery. Maybe adding a dash of historical too. With lots of showing and some telling. Short chapters that make the read fly. And I believe I already mentioned the illustrations. They are all through the book and ‚Äòtell‚Äô a story too.There are several more books to come, each containing three episodes. You can bet I‚Äôm off to grab the second book now and will be watching for others as they are released.I received this book for my honest review.

This has all the makings for a good mystery.A family torn apart by tragedy, isolation on a private island, toxic spills, murder, stalkers, and all of this might possibly be connected to a mysterious history. I was hooked already!Being a fan of character driven stories, this didn‚Äôt disappoint.There‚Äôs Faye Longchamp ‚Äì Mantooth. She‚Äôs coping the only way she knows how after a terrible loss. She spends every waking minute and most nights prowling the island and doing random digs. Not herself at all. Being a professional archaeologist, she knows better. You need to investigate, do the math, before digging. I think she‚Äôs just trying to stay numb.Her husband, Joe Wolf Mantooth, is such a gentle soul. He loves his wife and patiently waits for her to come around, knowing she needs time to grieve and heal.
