The inside of the calendar looks very old fashioned, with beige pages and lots of curlicues around the dates and other areas of the pages.  There are really pretty old fashioned lettering and illustrations around the calendar pages, all lightly done to look old.  Each page has a nice inspirational quote at the top.As for the calendar, it's perfect.  There are tabs for each month, and each month starts out with the whole calendar for that month.  Then the rest of the month is each week with 5 very nice sized lines on each day for writing down appointments, etc.  Each month's pages are a different color, but they all blend into the same theme.  I always rely on my yearly appointment book for everything in our house and this is going to work just perfectly.

At first I thought this would be too uncomfortable because it is very hard, but I am using it to stretch my upper back and neck and it really is working.  There are many other stretches you can do with this relaxer and you can download a chart from the Gaiam website.  I haven't tried all the stretches because my tension is always in my upper back, but it works for my purposes.  It's not something that I can say I feel relaxed while using, but afterwards I definitely feel much better.

This band is perfect for my iPhone 6, even with my Case-Mate clear case on it.  I did not want to have to take my case off and on to be able to use this and while it's a really tight fit, I'm able to get the phone with case in and out with only a few minutes of wiggling it back and forth.  The band comes with an extension, which I would imagine would be good for men, but for me as an average sized woman it fits just fine without it.  The little slot for a key is a nice touch too.I would highly recommend this case.  Once it's on you can use your phone just like it's not even in a case.  The only issue is with the phone itself - since the iPhone 6 is larger than the older iPhones, you will notice it more than the smaller phone.  But, that has nothing to do with the band.  The only reason I put that comment in this review is that if you think having the large phone on your arm would annoy you, you might want to look for another type of holder for your phone while working out.

I bought these pens to use with Johanna Basford's coloring books.  I read on her blog that these pens were some of her favorites, so I thought I couldn't go wrong.  The pens themselves are great.  There is every color I'd need in this package, and I'm able to blend with them.  The tips are super fine, which makes them perfect for all the tiny places to color in her books.  I can color the tiniest dot with no problem at all.  The only issue I have with using the pens with the books is that some of the colors bleed on to the design on the back of the page you're working on.  That's a little disappointing, but I think I'll be able to color over the spots just fine.  The problem only seems to be with the paper used in her books, though.  I'm testing out each color on cardstock before I use it and there is no bleeding at all on the back of the sheet.  So, if you can live with a little bit of color on the pages you haven't started coloring yet, I'm sure you'll be very happy with these pens.I almost forgot to mention that the barrels of the pens are triangular shaped and that really makes it very comfortable for coloring for long periods of time.  Very nice touch.

This is a very nice hand lotion.  The scent is just perfect - it's light, but very pretty.  It lingers slightly after you put it on, but not enough to be annoying.  He lotion goes on really smoothly and absorbs pretty quickly.  Not as quickly as some hand lotions I've used, but after a few minutes I can use my hands as usual.  I really think this lotion might be best used at night.  There is a bit of a residue even after washing my hands, but I don't feel like my hands are suffocating.  I just think this might work best if used before bed.  The scent is nice enough to be relaxing for sleep and the lotion will have time to really work on your hands.

I went through the Quick Guide to set this up and then decided to read the full instruction manual before using it and I'm glad I did.  The first page has a list of conditions where you should not use this belt, such as if you have a pacemaker, etc.  I wasn't worried about any of it until I got a couple of lines down on the "Do Not Use if:" and it said "If you suffer from cancer.  The effects of electronic stimulation on cancerous tissue are unknown."  I don't know that I have cancer but just in case I have it in my body somewhere, I will not use this.  Also, under the Warnings section it says "The long-term effects of chronic electronic stimulation are unknown."  I'm not taking any chances on this and will continue to exercise the old fashioned way.  I'm very disappointed that something that could be this dangerous - according to their own literature - is on the market.

We used this to test my husband's ethnicity because his mother thought they might have a little French in their family but wasn't sure.  I saw a commercial that showed a man getting rid of his lederhosen because he found he wasn't German after all, and thought for sure this test would tell us what we wanted to know. But, all it told us is that he was 41% Western European, which could be several countries.  So, if you are looking to see if you are from a particular country you will not get that information - just what region you are from.  I guess if you want to know more you have to go through the list of people they give you who have the same DNA, but that's way too time consuming.  This would probably be nice for someone who is really into genealogy and wants to spend time researching your family, but if you are thinking you'll get a list saying you're a certain percentage French, another percentage German and so on, this is not what you'll get.

First of all, I've never had earbuds that have fit as well as these do.  They come with 3 different sized EarWings and EarGels, and once you find the ones that are just right for your ears, they are a perfect fit and don't feel like they are coming out at all.  I only plan on using these for walking, so I don't know how they'd work for a more rigorous workout, but I have a feeling they'd stay in just fine.  There is a volume switch for your music on the cord, yet the cord is pretty short and when you have it on you hardly notice it.As for the coaching part of these earbuds, it took me a little while to figure it all out, but once I did I found that it's exactly what I was hoping for.  There are two apps, a Sound app and a Sport Life app.  I didn't find the Sound app helpful at all and will probably not use it.  With the Sport Life app, all you have to do is select the Current Active choice for your music and you can listen to anything on your phone.  I mostly like to listen to books while I walk and it works perfectly with my Audible app.  I also tested it with the Apple Podcast app, Apple Music and Amazon Music and was able to listen to all of them.  While you are walking, you will get a voice message every 10 minutes (or however often you'd like) telling you how far and how long you've walked.  You can also set the app to tell you more information, such as your stride, etc. but I just want to know how far I've walked and for how long.  It's very easy to set the app to do just what you want.If you are not into just walking, there are many other activities to choose from.  You can also set the app to play several complete workouts for you.  You will hear the ear buds telling you to do 20 pushups, then rest for 10 seconds, 10 squats, rest for 10 seconds, etc.  Music will be playing in the backround while you do the exercises.The earbuds come with a very small hardshell case that will easily fit into your purse or pocket.  I have my earbuds and the charging cord in it and they fit just fine.All in all, I think these are just great for making your workouts more enjoyable and for giving you motivation by keeping you informed on how you're doing.  At the end of the day you can look at the history of how often you worked out and that will be very inspiring.

These pencils are very comfortable to hold.  I'm trying them out on adult coloring books, and while the color isn't the best for that purpose - and they are not advertised for coloring - I'm really enjoying using them.  You get a much more even color if you apply a light touch and so your colors will be more on the pastel side.  I would really recommend these for someone who is older and has trouble holding on to round pencils.  With these pencils you will be able to get the relaxing benefits of coloring without some of hand discomfort that goes with it.

I've tried a few adult coloring books and while it's relaxing, I find that my hands get really tired after awhile.  With this app, all you do is tap the area you want to color and it fills in the section for you.  The designs are all very intricate with lots of small areas to color, but I have no problem at all with a regular sized stylus and my 6" Fire.  You can zoom in to enlarge the area you want to work on. There are about 5-6 different books in the app (floral,mandalas,etc) and a few designs in each book.  There are several colors to use also.  There's a basic palette of about 20 colors and a few special palettes.

First of all, this is probably the prettiest blow drier I've ever had.  In the photo it looks like it's kind of shiny, but it's not.  It's kind of a rubberized material and the color is a dark, matte magenta.  It's really pretty.As for the drying power - it's just great.  Where I live it's very humid right now and sometimes it feels like it's not even worth trying to dry my hair.  But this is super powerful and gets my hair dry very quickly.  I have shoulder length, straight hair.  I don't use any attachments when I do my hair because I just want it dried and dried quickly and then I use my flat iron.  This drier does exactly what I want it to do.  It has settings for high and low, and cold, warm and hot.  I use the highest setting and the hottest temperature and it's dry in no time.  I love it.

I'm really happy with this clock radio. It was super easy to set up and pair with my iPod and my iPhone.  I'm able to play all kinds of apps though the speaker and the sound is very rich and nice.  The FM radio sounds just as good.  The display is very large and easy to see the time along with the day of the week and the date.  The default setting of the display is pretty bright but you can easily dim the setting to a level you are comfortable with, which is a real plus for me.  I have to have a very dark room for sleeping.  The brighter setting would probably work very nicely if you are looking for something to give you a little bit of light in the bedroom.I also really love being able to use the USB charging for my devices.  You just plus the cord you already use for charging into the port on the back of the radio and charge your device as usual.  Very handy.

In my opinion, there couldn't be an easier way to clean the toilet.  You just attach one of the scrubbers to the wand that you get with your original kit, scrub the toilet and then push the button on the wand to drop the scrubber in the trash.  You never have to touch anything yucky at all.  As for the scrubbing - it's great.  The scrubbers have lots of cleaning solution on them and the scrubbing part is roughly textured enough to be able to really clean.The only thing I would say to be careful about it that the cleaning solution is blue and it will stay on your toilet rim if you do not rinse it of.  I just use a disposable cleaning cloth to go around all the areas where I can see blue.  If you happen to miss a spot it will be harder to get off later, but it doesn't leave a permanent stain.  Other than that little issue, I don't think you can go wrong with these.

This candle is just beautiful.  The paper around the jar holding the candle is slightly textured and is printed with the most gorgeous floral print.  The back of the candle tells a little bit about the New York Botanical Garden and has a link so you can learn more about it.  The lid is printed on the inside with a complete description of the scent of the candle, including the top notes, middle notes, base notes and essential oils.  I have the Peony Bouquet scent and it is just the nicest scent.  It's definitely a floral scent, but in no way annoying or fake smelling at all.  It truly smells like being in a garden.  When the lid is off the candle you can smell the scent throughout the whole room.I wouldn't hesitate to buy this as a gift for someone or just for your own home.  It's one of the nicest candles I've had.

This towel is so cute and extremely soft.  It's the size of a regular bath towel, which is great.  I'm using mine on the back of a chair that one of my beagles always lays on.  It's starting to look a little worn from her being on it all the time and this will help protect the chair.  It just happens to match the color of our furniture and I have lots of paw print and dog things around our house, so it goes with what we have.  And, the towel is so soft that she loves laying on it.

I couldn't be happier with this tracker.  I've never used one before but even though I am new to this, I've had no trouble at all understanding it or getting it to work.  When I opened the box I was a little worried when I didn't see any instructions and just a website to go to, but the website information was excellent.  There were enough step by step written instructions and videos for me to be able to set it up and pair it with my iPhone 6 with no problems at all.  Having the band paired with my iPhone has not shown any decrease in my phone battery usage, which was a big relief.Wearing the band is great.  Most of the time I don't even remember I have it on.  I have had no problems at all with the clasp and even though it's a little bit of a different type of clasp that I've ever used, the instructions and videos showed me exactly how to clasp it and it's super easy now.  I leave it on all day except when I'm in the shower.  The instructions say it's OK to wear in the shower, but I take it off anyway.  The only issue I've had with the band is that sometimes it will change itself from active mode to sleep mode and I can't figure out why.  But, when the band changes modes, the vibration and flash of the icons are so obvious that I can put it right back into the mode I want.  It would be nice if this didn't happen at all, and hopefully it's something that will be fixed in a software update.The best part of the band to me, is the app.  Wearing the band is completely effortless and there is nothing to look at on the band except when modes change, so you track your progress on your phone.  The app itself keeps track of your steps, resting heart rate and monitors your sleep.  I have found the sleep monitoring very accurate and extremely helpful.  You can also add other apps that you already use and they will work together.  I've used My Fitness Pal for years and it was super easy to sync the two apps and now my exercise data goes right from my UP software to My Fitness Pal, and my nutrition data goes right from My Fitness Pal to my UP software.  You can also add your food through the UP app, but since I already use My Fitness Pal I just synced the two.  When you set up the tracker you enter your weight and goals and can easily update those in the UP app.  The UP app shows you your daily progress on sleep, steps and food, and then you can click on each category to get more detailed information.  There is a Coach that keeps track of what you've done in previous days and will challenge you to try to do more steps the next day, which is really nice.  There is also a section where you can keep track of how you are feeling during the day.  It gives you some generic feelings, such as "good", "exhausted", etc. but you can edit those and put in your own feelings along with comments.  You can also set reminders in the app and your band will vibrate to remind you.  I have a reminder set to tell me to get up and walk every half hour since I work at a desk all day.I really could go on and on because I love it so much, but I'll just end this review by saying that I highly recommend this band.  Especially if you are like me and are not really athletic, but just want to keep track of the basics of your health lifestyle and have an easy and carefree way of trying to do better each day.

These are outstanding!  They have lots of whole nuts and lots of chocolate which alone would be delicious, but then there is the chili flavor in the bars.  The chili is not overly hot, but it definitely stands out in every bite.  I've had chocolate with chili in it before, but with the nuts and the sweetness of the mixture that holds the bars together, it was an absolutely delicious combination.  And, one bar was enough.  I've purchased many bars where I will eat at least two or maybe more, but just one of these is perfectly satisfying.

I had used Hope in a Jar for years but decided to look around for something less expensive and tried this.  I could not be happier with it.  The cream is pretty thick yet goes on easily and really, just a small amount on my fingertip is plenty for my whole face.  I was a little worried at first because the cream has kind of a tropical scent, but the scent goes away right away and you smell nothing at all during the day.  The cream goes right into my skin and leaves no residue at all.  I just feel nice and soft and my skin feels like nothing at all is on it.  This is a great skin cream, just like all of the other Alba products I use.

I'm rating this only on the scent, which I found unbearable.  I can't quite describe it, only that it smells like a lemon scented cleaner for the house.  And, the scent stays on my hands even after washing them a couple of times.  I would really encourage people to check this out at a store before ordering it if you haven't used it before to see if you like the scent.  Other than that, it's an OK hand lotion - a little thick and hard to rub in, but I could have lived with that.  It was just the Aloe and Green Tea scent that I just couldn't handle.

This package of scissors is perfect for keeping around the house for all kinds of things.  We put a pair in each of our cars for clipping coupons and things like that, I always have several sewing and knitting projects going at the same time and they are perfect to keep with my supplies for snipping threads, and we keep a few other pairs around for various little things.  They look great and the handle is large enough for both my husband and I to be able to use.  The point is not sharp enough to really stab you, but it is pointy enough to get a nice close cut.  Very handy to have around.

I'm using this with my 6" Kindle Fire and it couldn't be more perfect.  At first I was a little confused about which disk to attach to my Kindle since it comes with 3 - 1 large "sticky pad" and 2 very thin stick on disks. The directions were a little unclear to me, so I just went ahead and attached the sticky pad since it is reusable.  It worked great but since I put it directly on my Fire, I was not able to put it back in the case I have.  So, I removed it and used one of the thin disks and was much happier.  The small disks are so thin that I can still put it in my case when I want to, but it works just great with the Tab-Legs.  So, you actually can use this with 3 devices - one with the big sticky pad and two with the thin disks.The magnet is in the top of the Tab-Legs and the disks are metal, so that's how it works.  Another bonus of having the magnet in the top of the Tab-Legs is that I can store it by just sticking it onto a metal surface.  I just happen to have lamps with a metal bases next to my side of the bed and my spot on the couch, so I can just stick it there when I'm not using it and I hardly notice it when the legs are straightened out.The Tab-Legs themselves are just a dream come true.  I'm able to position them so that I can read hands free and do needlework at the same time because the legs are the perfect height to make them just about eye level when I'm sitting on the couch.  I've also tried wrapping the legs around my neck and was so happy to find that the legs are long enough that I can see my Fire perfectly while walking around.  I need to have things a little farther away from me than I used to in order to see anymore, and the length of the Tab-Legs is just right.  It's also great while laying in bed watching videos because I can bend the legs into any position, making it perfectly comfortable to lay in any position - even on my side.  I'm very glad that I bought this.

This is exactly what I want in a caramel.  A nice buttery, creamy taste with no harsh burned taste to it and a perfect texture.  It's nice and chewy, but not so much that it feels like it sticks to my teeth too much.  I have kind of sensitive teeth and sometimes chewy candy is a little painful, but this is just right.  Couldn't be better.

I'm usually such a fan of Dummies books, but this one fell short for me.  To me, Social Security is such a complicated thing and this book really didn't tell me anything I didn't already know just from watching financial segments on the news, information I've read online, etc.  Truly, the most helpful thing in this book is the list of resources in the back.  I'm sure when the time comes, my husband and I will need to get some help and this list will give us some places to contact.  I suppose it might be worth purchasing the book for that, but unless you really don't know anything at all about Social Security, you might want to pass on this book.  If you don't know anything at all about it, this book will help - it covers just about all the questions I've had in the past.  For me though, I've already gotten the answers to my basic questions and this book didn't offer anything new.

This book was very informative, but in an easy to read way.  I hate diet/health books that go into way too much scientific information before you even get into the parts about what to eat and do.  The layout of the book is kind of magazine style, with lots of blocks of information and lists, which I always like because it's easy to find what you are looking for.  There are quite a few recipes that sound good and look very easy to make.  There are lots of exercises and really good photos of how to do them.  The book not only gives you information on dieting, but lots of information on sleep, depression and anxiety and the dangers of taking pills to help you.  It seems to be focusing more on helping people feel better rather than just look better.Honestly, the information was really nothing I haven't seen online or in magazines, but it is so nicely assembled in this book that I think it would be worth purchasing.

This conditioner made my fine, shoulder length straight hair look really good, I have to say.  After washing my hair and using the conditioner, it was pretty easy to comb out, but not as easy as with some other conditioners I've tried.  But, it wasn't terribly hard, so I'm OK with that part of it.  The only issue I have is the scent.  It's a really sharp, flowery scent that really kind of annoys me all day long.  I can still smell it after about 12 hours.  So, you may want to check this out at a store before you buy it, just to see if you'll be OK with the scent.  Other than that, I think it's great.

I don't have overly dry skin except on my hands, so I prefer using this as a hand lotion.  When I use it as a body lotion, I kind of feel a bit of a residue on my skin.  But, as a hand lotion, it's perfect.  You only need a tiny bit - maybe the size of a pea - for both of your hands and it absorbs right away.  My hands feel great for much longer than other hand lotions I've tried and there is no scent at all that I can detect.

I really had a good time reading this book.  I love reading about the rich and famous and all the things they have and do.  The author has a really good sense of humor and actually made their lifestyles sound kind of funny, which was fun.  I have to say I was a little disappointed because I thought I'd find out some things about the 1% that I had never heard of outside of reality shows and entertainment magazines and I really didn't read about anything I hadn't heard of before.  The book even has a conversation between a couple of wealthy people saying how it used to be so much more fun being rich when it was real (or something like that). They were saying how now anyone can give the appearance of having money when it just might mean they are in quite a bit of debt.  Another thing I was hoping for was some name dropping, but the author only describes people, such as "Wife of Famous Rock Star", etc.  So, we really have no idea who the people in the book are, unfortunately.  The essays were all very short and the whole book was a lot of fun to read.

I'm pretty impressed with these bars.  Like V8 Juice, they pack a lot of nutritional value into something you can consume pretty quickly.  The taste of the bars is good, but not so good that I'd want to eat them like candy bars.  I've had some bars that are so good that I eat too many.  A bar is the perfect size to have as a meal replacement, along with something to drink and one is more than enough.  The texture is nice and chewy but it still has a little crunch to it.  I'd for sure buy these on a regular basis.

I find these pills very inconvenient to take.  First of all, the pills are very large and when I take them with water I can feel them almost stuck in my throat.  They are easier to take with something like Slim Fast, but I'm not about to add extra calories to my diet two more times a day just to take these pills.The second problem is that the magnesium in this supplement is not supposed to be taken with two of the prescriptions I take.  I've had to readjust my whole schedule to take them at different times of the day.  You may want to look at any prescriptions you take and see if there are any interactions with Magnesium Oxide before you decide on this brand.All that said, I have found that I'm getting all of the benefits from the magnesium drink that I was taking before these.  I still have reduced muscle cramping and I do sleep better when I take magnesium.  It's just the size of the pills and that I've had to change my schedule around to be able to take these three times a day that makes it hard for me to recommend these.

I've had so many reading glasses where the frames are so small that I have to move either the glasses or my head to be able to read a whole page.  These frames measure 1 1/4 inches and are just the perfect size for being able to see everything I want to read without having to do any adjusting.The lenses themselves are in perfect shape with no scratches at all.  Each of the 3 pairs were individually wrapped in plastic.  All of the different colors of metal are very nice looking as well.  They fit my average sized head perfectly and don't feel like they are too tight or about to slip off.  I'm super happy with this purchase.

I couldn't live without these.  We have two dogs who are always knocking the vertical blinds off our windows and I can repair and rehang the broken blind in just a matter of minutes with these.  We've tried tape, but this material is much stronger and fits just right over the top of the blind.  I've been using them for years and always have a package on hand.

This really doesn't have a good taste and the texture is very grainy and chalky.  The nutritional value looks good, so if that's all you are interested in, this product might work for you.  But, you may want to add some fruit to it or something to help mask the taste and texture.

I'm really impressed with this loom.  It came completely assembled except for the legs and they only took a minute to attach.  All the hardware you need is included.  The wood the loom is made of is really beautiful - nice and smooth and is engraved with the Melissa & Doug logo.There are several formations you can easily adjust this loom into.  You can leave it as is for large projects, the top bar moves down to the middle of the loom for a weaving half the size, and then there are two wooden dowels on the sides that can be moved to make the loom narrower.  It is really versatile.The weaving itself could not be simpler.  The only minor complaint I have is that the instruction book is in black and white and I had just a little bit of trouble figuring out where to get started and how to attach the yarn, but really it's very simple and not much instruction was needed after all.  You just tie the yarn onto the dowel and start weaving.The box contains two large balls of really pretty brightly colored bulky weight yarn, a ball of string and three sets of paper strips you can use for paper weavings. A really nice wooden needle for the weaving is also included.  There is close to a half inch space between each section on the top and bottom of the loom, so you would probably always want to use a thicker yarn.  I'm also thinking about trying to weave with fabric strips and see what kind of projects I can do with fabric.  I'm kind of excited to go online and look at what kinds of projects I can do with this loom.All in all, this is a really nice loom for adults or children.

My husband had eye surgery recently and as a result, his eye feels irritated by the end of the work day.  His doctor told him it was fine to use over the counter eye drops when he needs to and these have really made a difference.  He said his eye feels much more refreshed when he uses these drops than other drops he's tried and the relief lasts for several hours. The consistency of the eye drops seems a little thicker than regular drops.  He will definitely keep using this.

This fits perfectly inside my medicine cabinet and I'm able to get my toothbrush and toothpaste out of it without taking it out of the cabinet.  I can't imagine wanting anything else in a toothbrush and toothpaste holder.  Very practical and useful.

The writing in this book is so funny, but I have to say the answers to most of the questions went way over my head.  The questions were good and some of them were things I've really wondered about, like what if everyone on earth jumped at the same time.  The answers to the questions start out funny,  but the next thing you know you are reading complicated formulas, distances and things like that.  I would imagine someone who is really into math or science would understand this book and really have fun with it, but the average reader might be like me and have fun reading the questions and then end up feeling kind of dumb when they try to understand the answers.

l had no idea how nice the stainless steel on the top of the lid would look with my kitchen sink.  I really like little matching details and so to me this is a real plus for this soap dispenser.  The container holds a large amount of hand soap and it's super easy to press the top and get just the right amount for washing your hands at the sink.  The dispenser stays right in place when you press the top.  I love it.

This book is so nicely done.  It's just a small book and would be a perfect little gift for someone who is interested in nature and the spiritual life.  The book is written by a nun but I did not find it overly religious, so it would probably be good for just about anyone.  The book is adorably illustrated throughout.  The book is made up mostly of text, but there are quite a few pages that have illustrations along with quotes that compare growing grapes to growing our spiritual lives.  The grape theme is consistent throughout the book, and it all ties in really nicely with some really valuable life lessons.

Maeve started writing for The Irish Times in the 1960's, so this book is like looking back in time with someone many of us who have loved her books for years almost feel like we know.  The writings in this book cover all of the decades until the last entry in 2012.  She writes about noteworthy subjects, such as the royal family, as well as everyday things that all woman can identify with.  The entries are only a couple of pages and it's nice to pick up and read here and there.

This bottle is so much better than the old shaker bottles we've had.  It's much taller and thinner than the old kind and it fits perfectly in the cup holder of our car which is a real plus.  The ball is a nice solid plastic and it does a much better job of mixing than the wire type.  The rounded bottom is the best part because if you make a drink out of powder, none of it gets stuck in the edges like it used to.  With the taller shape, it would also be much easier to add ice to a drink if you want to do that.  I really recommend this bottle.

I've read all of the Cedar Cove books, and at first had a really hard time seeing all the characters differently from the way I've been imagining them for years.  This series is so well done and the scenery is so beautiful that within a couple episodes I couldn't imagine any of the characters any other way.  All of the actors are perfectly cast as the characters I've loved for years and I hope the show goes on as long as the books did.

This product works very well.  It smells a little less strong than WD-40, but it still has quite an industrial smell.  But, if you have a lock that doesn't work as well as it used to or a door that's a little squeaky, this will take care of it for you.

My husband had to have surgery on his eye that required him to stay in a face-down position for a week after the surgery.  We rented the special chair, etc. that is used for recovery after this surgery, but I had also read somewhere that a massage table would be helpful too.  It was extremely helpful.  His back and neck would get tired from being in the chair, but then he could stretch out on this table and be completely comfortable again.  We'd just put his iPad on a low table below him and he could keep his face down and watch TV for hours.The table is very sturdy and super easy to assemble. You can remove the face pillow if you'd rather use something else to rest your head on, which is what my husband did.  He pretty much just rested his chin on the edge of the bed and he was in the perfect position.  My husband is 6'1' and weighs 250 pounds and the table never wobbled or felt like to was going to fall over.  The legs adjust easily and we adjusted it to the lowest position to make it easy for him to get on and off.  I highly recommend having this table on hand if you or someone in your house has to have this type of surgery.  My husband's surgery was a complete success and I understand that keeping your face down is almost as important as the surgery.  This made it very easy for him.

This is perfect if you like to read on your Kindle Fire.  I've always found it too heavy to hold for a long period of time, but this makes it really comfortable.  I especially like that I'm able to hold on to it in a way that I'm able to reach my hand around the Fire and turn the pages by tapping with my middle finger instead of always having to use my thumbs.  There are many ways to hold the strap and you can put it on either corner to make it most comfortable for you.  I have the Amazon Origami Case on my Fire and the Padlette fits perfectly without having to take the case off.  I just slip the Padlette on when I want to read and take it off when I'm done.

If you need something to keep your hair out of your eyes, these bands will do the job.  They are very tight, but not uncomfortable.  Unless you kind of move them around to look a little nicer, they look like the caps that people wear under wigs to hide their hair.  The fabric they are made of is very nice and soft and you can wear them without even feeling them.  I've even worn them to bed to keep my bangs out of my eyes while I'm sleeping and they stay nice and secure.

Nella's husband marries her without knowing her very well, gives her a beautiful home with servants and then doesn't have much to do with her.  Her sister-in-law also lives in the house and she is really unfriendly and isn't too happy about Nella being there.The story gets really good when Nella starts wanting to get involved with things in the house, and to keep her out of everyone's business, her husband gives her a miniature house exactly like the one they are living in.  Her sister-in-law gives her some money and tells her to keep herself busy furnishing her house.  Nella finds an ad for a miniaturist and requests a few things.  Then, the miniaturist starts sending her things on her own and they all seem to show that she knows things about about the people and things in the house.Throughout the book, Nella tries to find out who the miniaturist is and how she knows what she knows.  It's a great story and if you like miniatures, you will really love reading about the tiny and beautiful things the miniaturist creates.

This book is almost like a directory of websites for different resources we'll all need as we age.  As with all Dummies books, it briefly explains things like Medicare, Assisted Living, Long Term Care Insurance, etc., but it gives you lists of websites to go to for more information.  I like this because I want to know which sites are reputable and not something that will give me bad information.  For this alone, I find this book very helpful.  The book is only 341 pages and it covers just about every area of aging from staying in your own home to tables of the cost of assisted living facilities, transportation alternatives (which I really found helpful) and basic health information for aging people.  There is a small section on finances and estate planning, but not that much - it's mostly on how to live as an elder, not a financial guide.  The amount of information covered in the book is everything I've thought of, plus several things I didn't even know about.  I would highly recommend this book to have on hand to give you a start on where to look when you need help.  It's easy enough for an elder to read or for someone who is caring for an elder - just make sure if you are an elder yourself, you are comfortable with the computer because you will be looking at a lot of websites.  But, with AARP behind the book, I feel confident that they are sending us to the right places online to look and that's very important.

Even though this is a super cute way to store rubber bands, I was really happy to find that the quality of the bands is excellent.  They measure 3 1/4" by 1/8"' which to me is the perfect size rubber band.  They come in a variety of colors, as you can see in the photo.  A great way to store rubber bands so they are always all in one place.

I find the glare and dust accumulation on the screen of my Fire almost unbearable, so even though I've never had good luck with screen protectors in the past, I tried yet another one.  There are two in the package and as of right now they are both in the trash can.  No matter how hard I tried to remove all the dust from my screen before applying them, I'd find specks of dust that could not be smoothed out.  I was able to get rid of all the air bubbles, but not the dust. It did cut out all of the glare, but rather than looking at my reflection in the screen, I was zeroed in on the specks of dust under the protector.  I can't say this brand is any worse that any other screen protector, but it certainly is not any better for the price.

This case is really nice, especially the material that it's made of.  It feels kind of like felt, and if you are looking for something besides leather for a change, this is a nice option.  I have the grey and absolutely love the look of it.The case is very simple.  You snap the Kindle into a hard plastic back and then just stand it to whatever angle is comfortable for you.  I guess because of the slightly rough surface (it's very soft to hold, but it's not slippery like leather or plastic), it will stay where you stand it on it's own.  I think it's meant to lean against the edge, like you see in the photo, but you can also stand it anywhere and it will stay.If you want to hold the Kindle in you hand, you can flip the flat part back and there is a magnet to hold the front and back together.  To close it, you fasten the tab that you see in the photo that the Kindle is leaning on.  It straightens out to a tab that you secure the case with.If you are looking for a very thin, lightweight case, you can't go wrong with this.  It's attractive and functional.

My favorite thing about this cover is the look.  It's made of fabric and looks and feels like soft, faded denim.  I think it would be perfect for a man or a woman.The case fits the Fire perfectly and leaves all of the buttons completely exposed to you can get to them. The speakers are exposed too and the sound is as good as without a case.  It works well horizontally for watching videos and vertically for reading.  The plastic part of the case that you put the Fire in has two little tabs on it that fit in grooves on the bottom of the case to hold it still.  It is very secure.  I find that the slant at even the level closest to the back of the case is too much of an angle for when I'm laying in bed watching videos, so I set put the back of the case that has the grooves on it out flat facing the back (like a train on a dress) and that holds the Fire up perfectly straight and it doesn't fall over at all.  If you are sitting and looking down on the Fire, all of the angles that the Fire can go to are just right - from almost upright, like you see in the photo to leaning back quite a bit for typing.As for reading in a vertical position, the case works very well too.  There is an elastic band on the bottom part (with the grooves) and if you wrap it around the part of the case with the Fire in it, it will stay perfectly flat.  I leave my thumb on the outside to turn pages, put my index finger in between the front and back of the cover and hold the rest of my fingers on the back of the case and am able to read perfectly comfortably with one hand.This is a very attractive case and is very comfortable to use.

If you were to give me one of these without me knowing it was supposed to be chocolate, I'd never guess that was the flavor.  But, they do taste nice and they are sufficiently minty.  They are no where near the strength of Hall's or Luden's, so don't expect these to open your sinuses like those do, but this would definitely soothe a scratchy throat and would even be nice as a breath mint.

This book gives you tips on relaxing and reducing stress by giving you examples of things done in different parts of the world.  Each situation is on two pages. One page is a photo or illustration and the next page is the title of the stressful situation.  After that, the page goes on to tell you the tradition that is practiced, what time of year and the country it was originated in.  The text is only a few paragraphs, but it is so well written that you get a lot out of it in a short time. My favorite part of the book is that the practices were things I really hadn't thought about before.  In fact, in the introduction they tell you the don't go into the obvious such as yoga or tai chi.  Not that there is anything wrong with those, but there is a lot of information on these topics already.  This book covers things such a "Laugh in the Face of Danger" which tells about Greek philosophers who imagine worst case scenarios and then write down how they would handle them.  Or "Aim for Excellence" which talks about how some Japanese Sushi chefs master just one dish.  This is to show us an example of trying to focus on one thing rather than stressing ourselves out by trying to do everything.  We learn about patience from stilt fishers in Sri Lanka and staying in the present from the Piraha Language in Brazil that has no words to describe the past or the future.  The book is 125 pages, so there are many more practices you might find helpful or just enjoy reading about them.

Dreamz are really the only needles I'll knit with anymore, I love them so much.  The wood is slick enough for your knitting to move right along, yet they are not so slippery that you have to constantly worry about your stitches falling off.  The cords are an absolute dream to work with and are not stiff at all. The point is just right - pretty pointy, but not so pointy that it splits the yarn you are working with. The best part is that you don't notice the difference between the cord and the needle at all - the join is perfectly smooth.  The fun part of the needles is that the sizes are all different colors.  I have several Dreamz in both circular and dpn's and the color does not come off at all.  I truly love these needles.

These are actually shaped like macaroni - hole in the center and all!  The taste is really close to mac and cheese too.  It has a mild cheddar flavor with a really nice creaminess to it. They are nothing like any other cheese puff I've had.  The texture is crunchy and almost a little chewy at the same time.  We loved them!

I've had bad luck with putting on screen protectors in the past, so when I tried to apply this one I really tried to do everything right.  I followed the instruction to the letter and made sure I had a nice quiet place to work.  I thought I had my screen perfectly clean, but still when I applied the protector I found  one little bit of dust. I was able to remove the protector easily, but it just went downhill from there. Once I removed the protector, dust started collecting on the adhesive backing and I could not get it all off. Every time I put it back on my Kindle, I noticed more dust. The protector is very forgiving, in that it's a thickish piece of plastic, but after removing it several times to try to remove dust, I bent the corner slightly and I would not be able to live with that.  So, I've had another failed attempt at applying a screen protector.  If the one bit of dust wouldn't bother you like it did me, you may be happy with this.  Before I noticed the speck of dust, I checked it out and my Kindle worked just like it did before it had the protector on it.  I was able to get all of the air bubbles out and I had it perfectly aligned so that it was barely noticeable on the Kindle.

We've had these steps for years and recently one of our beagles started having trouble jumping onto our furniture due to a back problem, so we got them out of our garage to see if she'd use them.  We purchased these steps years ago for one of our cats, but she refused to use them.  Our beagle just walked right up them like she's always used stairs to get on the couch!  I wanted to get another set of steps to help her onto the window seat and was really glad to see that the exact same product was still available.  So, we now have two, plus I just ordered another set to put by our bed.  Now that our beagle who needs the steps is using them, our other beagle is using them too just because!They come unassembled, but it only takes a couple of minutes to snap them together.  They are definitely sturdy enough for our approx. 30 pound beagles and the size of the steps is just right for their height. I would definitely check into a different type of steps of you have a dog taller than a beagle because each step is only about 4-5" high,  but any dog that size or smaller should be just fine.

Sheesh, Amazon has a picture of a t-shirt instead of the hoodie. It's a hoodie, ignore their picture.Just what I needed. I tried a few other brands here on Amazon, but couldn't find a full-zip hoodie that was movable and functional for me to wear to work in. I decided to try this Champion in a 4X and love it. A 4X is typically too big on me, but at 6'3" 275, too big on me doesn't happen that often. This hoodie has nice full cut shoulders and arms. It probably is a little big on me, but that's perfect for moving around.A few important parts:If you get cold easy this hoodie might not be thick enough for you. It's a thin, but high quality polyester material. I rarely get cold, so it works well for me.The most flexible (physically) hoodie I own.Short/small waistband keeps it from feeling like you need to pull it down.Full pockets on the front. Also are fairly snug so you can hold most things in them without worrying about them falling out.Good quality zipper, most of the others I've tried had plastic zippers. This one is metal.Would even recommend the non-tall versions for tall-big guys. I ordered the regular 4X and the sleeves come down to my wrists, the length of the jacket goes below my waist.I would like to thank whomever the person was, no doubt a big man, who invented "generous cut". I can finally stop trying to wear flannel shirts when I'm working outdoors in the cold weather. And most importantly, I don't have to spend the next month fighting holiday crowds, trying on hoodies/jackets trying to find one that doesn't make me feel like a mummy.

Very underrated album. I found these guys years ago. Which is how I will describe them. I've been a huge Glenn Danzig fan for years. Also Wino of The Obsessed, St. Vitus, Spirit Caravan, etc...The first time I heard these guys they reminded me of early Danzig (the band not Glenn) mixed with "The Church Within" era The Obsessed. Those are two of my favorite bands so I gave Goatsnake a try and loved it. This new album sticks to the formula. It's good, heavy bluesy rock, crooning and screaming vocals. I'm sure some people will classify it as stoner rock or whatever sub-genre, but it's really just good bluesy hard rock. I've had this album for nearly 5 months and still have it in my regular rotation. I would recommend it to any fan of hard rock, especially if you like nice, cleanly-sung vocals. I especially like the song House of the Moon, has some female vocal accompaniment that is reminiscent of an old church choir.

Hopefully this will be helpful for parents and friends/family who are trying to pick a console to buy someone. If you'll look in my review history, I have a verified purchase review of a higher end gaming PC I bought back in spring (2015). I was swearing off console games after 30+ years of console gaming. Then ... I started missing my consoles. We were already planning on buying two consoles this Christmas. One for our 13 year old daughter and one for our 11 year old son. Their choices were easy ... mine, not so much.Our 11 year old son made his choice loud and clear, "Why can't I play online games with my friends anymore?" He was playing on an Xbox 360. They were playing on Xbox One. That, not the exclusives, not the negligible difference in graphics, should be a deciding factor if your child or big child likes playing online games. I would guess it's something us gamers take for granted in knowing, but for those who are shopping for a console for someone else you need to know this:If you buy a PS4 for someone and their friends play games online on the Xbox One, they will not be able to play together and vice versa. Our son loves the online multiplayer games and that was the only factor for him. It's the one his friends have and play online.Our 13 year old daughter is a very casual gamer. My wife is as well. They love Nintendo though. Mario and Zelda are their favorites. So buying a Wii U for our daughter makes perfect sense. See how easy this is?Buying one for me? I'm an ol' grouchy anti-social gamer. I don't like online games. I prefer immersive one player games. The difference between the PS4 and Xbox One for me is almost non-existent. Either one would work fine. I don't care for exclusive games. There's only a couple out right now that I have any interest in. Bloodborne on PS4 and State of Decay on Xbox One. My first step to deciding was to buy an Xbox One last month at Target. I liked it, but returned it for a PS4. I liked it, but returned it for a refund. I knew better holiday bundles were coming out. The difference between the two systems is one of the smallest gaps I've seen in my 30+ years of console gaming. I would compare it to the difference between the Super Nintendo and Sega Genesis back in the early 90s. Both systems seem to be equally as strong and capable as the other. These were my deciding factors:I prefer the look of the Xbox One.I preferred the PS4s user-interface before the November 12th Windows 10 update on the Xbox One, but I now prefer the Xbox One's user-interface and compatibility with my PC.I'm a different one. I prefer the exterior power block of the Xbox One.Controllers are becoming closer to equal. In all fairness to Sony, I think the PS4's controller is a bigger, better change than the Xbox One's, which I had already gotten used to since I use one for my PC games. The PS4 controller is still smaller than I would like, but the Xbox One's has gotten smaller too.I generally like the free games Xbox Live gives away each month better than the Playstation Network's.I originally leaned towards Sony because I bought into the numbers arguments. Sony sells more consoles. Sony has more games. Both of which are true, but Sony has a bigger market than Microsoft. Anyway, Justin Beiber sold more albums than my favorite band, but it doesn't make him better. After scanning through both consoles lists on wiki of games, I realized the Sony number is quite a big higher, but a lot of the games are Japanese games. I grew up with some of those classic JRPG's, but really don't have much interest in them anymore.But my big deciding factor was simple:The recent bundle specials. I originally bought a PS4 Last of Us bundle that I returned. I haven't been able to find any PS4 bundles that stand out to me. I did the promo through Amazon and received the 1TB Madden 16 bundle with another free game and a fifty dollar store credit. I used the free game to get Far Cry 4 Complete and used the store credit to pre-order Fallout 4. That means I got 3 of my favorite game series, a year subscription to EA Access, a 1TB console and controller for four hundred dollars. Also did the same promo for our son's at another store and got him the Forza 6 bundle, got Call of Duty Black Ops 3 and Assassin's Creed Syndicate for his free game and fifty dollar credit.Take that how you will. If Sony had been offering a similar deal then I would have been stuck again on deciding on which one, but good marketing by Microsoft made me decide to get the Xbox One. The other small factor is the large collection of Xbox 360 games I have. With the Windows 10 update backwards compatibility was added for over 100 games from the 360 and more are coming. Sony's "backward compatibility" plan sounds more like a money grab to me.Having said all of this, I think the only way you can truly go wrong on the PS4 or Xbox One is if you buy the one your friends, or your child's friends don't have. Unless you're an anti-social gamer like me. Then I would say just shop around until you find a bundle you like. Getting 3 games with a new console is pretty nice and whatever you do, ignore the numbers arguments. My dad used to always tell me, "You can only play one game at a time" and as hard as it to believe these days, that still holds true.Edit: I forgot to mention if you're buying a console for a casual gamer it wouldn't hurt to look at the Wii U by Nintendo. It seems like every game coming out for the Xbox One and PS4 has a season pass, DLC, and these games are starting to become expensive. The vanilla price has stayed the same for new games, but when you have to then buy a season pass for twenty to fifty dollars, these games can be expensive.

We have five people in our household. It seems like each one of them add something to their lives that take AA batteries, every week. I started out ordering the Duracell coppertops in bulk from Amazon, but they were temporarily sold out of them last year. I then turned to the Maxell bulk package from Amazon. I really didn't see a huge difference between the Duracell and Maxell. I've been waiting to run out of Maxell's so I could try the AmazonBasics AAs. I've put 8 to use so far, Xbox 360 controller x 2, MS wireless mouse x 2, flashlight x 4. The only one that I can compare to the others is the Xbox 360 controller. I usually get about 2 months on 2 AAs in it. I've had these AmazonBasics in it for 7 weeks and they're still going with the on-screen display saying I have 2 bars out of 4 left in the battery. As long as they keep a similar to the pace the other two I'll be happy with them. Works well in the flashlight too, no dimming, no fading of light. One thing I will mention is that I always preferred the Duracell packing method of 16 per tray. The Maxell packing was easy to accidentally spill the entire package. These AmazonBasics are even better than both of those. They come in a plain brown box. The batteries are then separated in blister packs of 4. So when your kids need 2 or 4, you can just hand them a blister pack without worrying about them losing the whole box.

I've had the Amazon store card for roughly 3 years now. Admittedly, I only use it when I'm going to be spending enough to receive the 0% financing for 6 months or more, but it's easily one of my favorite cards to use. Why? It's easy to pay, at least easier than some cards I have and I like the flexibility of being able to pay it off over 6 months. I don't typically like to keep balances on my credit cards, but when I pay them all off it seems to negatively hurt my credit score. I can buy something over $300 with this card, set the auto-pay to pay it off in 5 months and know my credit score is receiving at least proof of one monthly, on-time payment. I have other cards from Synchrony Bank and haven't had a single problem with any of them. All of the ones I have also have the special financing rates for purchases over $300.Best thing about the Amazon one? It's partially linked to my Amazon account. I really preferred the old sign-in method, but I'm getting used to the new one. Amazon is generous with the credit line increases as well. Mine has increased by nearly 400% over the three years. Others might not agree, but I prefer it over the Amazon Visa. The Visa adds the flexibility of being able to use it anywhere that accepts Visa, but they gave me it with a fairly high credit line ($7200). but I really wanted the store card instead for the special financing, which the Visa doesn't offer. If you apply and they give you the Visa instead, give their customer service a call and they'll get you the store card. I know that everyone prefers the more prestigious cards, but trust me, this Amazon store card, when used in moderation and paid off during the promotion months is as good as any card I have. It's also an advantage if you have anyone in your family who "borrows" your wallet. The Amazon store card can only be used on Amazon and if you're like me you require all family members to wait before ordering on Amazon since you might need to add something to the order. I would also recommend Synchrony's Best Buy store card if you buy electronics there since it too has the special financing on purchases over $300. I'm overall impressed with Synchrony.

I bought this with one main use in mind ... to work in.I work as a construction engineer. My daily work varies from planning, drawing blueprints inside our house to surveying, grading land, all the way down to helping with the manual labor. We build, remodel houses and small businesses. That's important because I need my clothes to be movable and non-binding.I'm originally from California, but now live in the Southern Appalachian region. We have very inconsistent weather. I'm not the type of person who gets cold unless in bitterly cold windchill. That's why I wanted a midweight zip-up hoodie. It will serve pretty much as my late fall, winter jacket/coat while at work.The make of this hoodie is very good quality. I especially liked the mesh hood. There's a common problem for me with Under Armour products. It is really small. I know a few reviewers have said it runs big and I'm going to explain what the sizing problem is. If you have large shoulders you're going to think these run very small. I would go as far as saying it feels like a unisex. My shoulders have long been a problem when buying shirts, jackets, coats, but I read the reviews here and saw several say they run big. That's always a good sign for me.I'm on average 6'3" 275. I ordered the 3XL.As soon as I put it on I noticed one big problem. The sleeves didn't even cover my forearms. Probably 2-3 inches from my wrist. This means my shoulders are too broad for the material. It causes the sleeves to have to make up for the lack of width in the shoulders. It's a common problem and I know I'm not the only one with this problem.I've always been confused by UA's sizing since their pants seem to be made for us large frame guys, but their shirts/tops are made for smaller to medium frame guys. No offense to anyone. I'm sure we all have our brands that just don't work with our builds.I really wish UA would make a big and tall line in their shirts. I'm able to wear their pants in XL, so I'm okay with the sizing on those, but I need their shirts to be a size bigger or cut more for a big frame. Good product. I can wear it fine. Even can zip it, but its skin-tight on my shoulders, upper arms and forearms. Would recommend it to anyone of the medium build or smaller.

I've been using the Dr. Tung tongue scrapers for quite a few years. That is until my most recent one started rusting and the rubber handles started getting what looked like mold spots.I bought this HealthAndYoga tongue scraper mainly because it has no rubber grips on it. This is a review of a tongue scraper so don't expect too much from me on this:I originally had more trouble cleaning my tongue with this scraper than I normally did with the Dr. Tung version, but it's a matter of tilting it a little downwards. Once I figured this out it works as good as the Dr. Tung.It has a good build quality feel to it.No rubber handles to mold, mildew, rot.Only negative is the quality. The quality is so good and strong feeling it makes it hard to put this in a cup. The sides want to pop back out, but that's not really a negative, it's just something you should know. I used to put my tongue scraper in two holes of a toothbrush holder. If you do that, it may take some time to get this one used to being bent. Otherwise, it's a great scraper. Will update if any problems come up.

This costume came the day before Halloween and all I can say about is it's not worth your money or time. Our 13 year old daughter wasn't going to dress up this year, but her school had a Halloween Day where all the students and teachers were invited to dress up. One of the boneheaded teachers offered 20 points bonus on their test that day for all who dressed up. Our daughter's first choice was Spider Gwen. I think that's her name. The only ones I found were from China, which wouldn't get here on time. So she decided this Spider Girl costume would work. She's athletic-build, even somewhat muscular for her age. Her mom ordered the large with the thinking that it would be loose on our daughter.She puts it on and it's skin-tight. I'm not worried too much about our daughter, but I used to be a 13 year old boy. My wife spent nearly two hours finding ways to cover up the "bad" parts of this costume. How is a large in women's sizing skin tight on a 5'2" 120 pound 13 year old? My wife is 5'7" 160, it wouldn't even go on her.Other problems: Like others have said there was a hole in the back of the costume. The costume we received was black not blue, which would have been fine if the red part was black and the spider was white, but instead it looks like a cheap knockoff of Spiderman. I wouldn't recommend it unless it's for an adult woman who unless of small frame, won't be able to fit into any of the sizes.

It's probably going to be hard to get me to give these costumes anything higher than 3 stars. The cape is decent quality. Lets put it this way. It's still in working condition after our 11 year old son wore it three times. The belt is decent quality, but was too long on him. He still wore it. Vest is decent quality and survived three wearings. And that's it. I would pay maybe ten dollars for this costume, but it instead costed over thirty.A few things to note:It doesn't come with anything else. The belt, cape and vest is all.No shirt to wear under it or pants or boots or makeup or fake blood.If my mood towards it sounds mediocre it's because the costume is mediocre as well.It's decent. Nothing more, nothing less.

I originally gave these loafers a 5 star review, but after wearing them some more, I'm not even going to be able to keep them. My biggest draw to these was to wear them as house shoes that I could wear outside when taking the dogs out, checking the mail, etc...They initially gave me a very good impression. The soles are plenty strong enough to wear outside and my guess is they are made for daily casual wear. The other draw and this would only apply when comparing them to other house shoes, is the lack of fur, fuzzy or hair inside the shoe. I will keep that explanation short. I have partial permanent nerve damage in my feet. Anything furry, fuzzy or hairy stimulates the damage. I really loved that these loafers didn't have any of those.I listed in my original review how these run small. It's now even more evident to me. Similar to another reviewer these loafers are snug on the front half of my foot and loose on the back/arch/heel part. It's not too big of a deal for me, but there's another problem that might just be a problem for me. I had never wore a pair of Crocs. The insoles have bumps and grooves in them. That's as irritating to my nerve damage as hair, fuzzy, furry insides of shoes. After wearing them for roughly 3 hours, sitting at my home office's desk, my feet started burning.Note: I am not in anyway saying it's the loafers fault. This is a problem I've had for nearly 15 years, but I did want to point out the insoles are bumpy and have grooves since I'm sure I'm not the only person with nerve damage in their feet. The thinking would be why not just change the insoles, but if I do that, the front half will be too tight. The front of the insoles that come in the loafers is a recessed groove. They are already snug in that area so other insoles would just make them tighter.Otherwise, these are still a four star product especially if you can catch them on sale like I did.

One of the most disappointing purchases I've made on Amazon. For one, the customer reviews convinced me to try this alarm clock. No offense to Amazon members, I hope others use my reviews to make purchases as well and this one bad experience won't stop me from using Amazon reviews, but there's no way this clock should be priced what it is or have the high reviews it has. Preferences are a definite factor as is just plain old subjective opinion, but the problems I had with this clock wouldn't seem to fall under subjective opinion. For two, I love Seiko. I have reviews in my review history of two Seiko watches I've owned for nearly 10 years. Wouldn't wear another brand of watch. Which is really the biggest disappointment for me.To start with, do a search on Google for "Equity Silver Silent Sweep clock". Just a week before buying this Seiko, I had that Equity clock and returned it. It's nearly identical to this Seiko for one-third the price. Even worse, some of my complaints with this Seiko were fixed by that Equity.Starting with:The alarm hand is silver. It's a white-faced clock, why not a black, red, green, blue, purple hand?It's an all-plastic clock.The alarm annoys our dachshund, but doesn't even wake me up.The backlight is terribly weak for a clock that uses 3 AA batteries.The luminous hands aren't even working for me.Alarm clocks are essential for me. I sleep 5 hours a night during the week. Forcing myself up five days a week after 5 hours of sleep is sometimes hard. On the other hand, it can also mean problems for the poor alarm clock. Not that I intentionally punch the clocks, but I sometimes hit my hand on them as I'm trying to turn them off. I had been using this clock Sharp SPC800 Quartz Analog Twin Bell Alarm Clock (Silver)  for the last year. Then one day two weeks ago, it went off and it met an untimely demise. I'm really not trying to be funny or meaning puns, but it happens. I've been this way for many years. That Sharp is metal with a plastic face. One wrong swing and it now doesn't even try to work. So you can imagine what this plastic Seiko would do if my hand hits it. Everyone tells me to use my phone, but it's a six hundred dollar phone. I'm not risking destroying it.Those problems listed above are also based on my living environment. If you don't have these same problems it might be a good clock for you.Our bedroom has two ceiling fan/lights that are fairly dim. My wife goes to bed before I do so turning on lights isn't an option. Since I change my alarm daily depending on what time I go to bed, I had to, in the dark, try to see the alarm hand while turning the nearly flat alarm button on the front. It didn't hit me to push the snooze button which does give a better backlight, but even so, this clock isn't cheap and it says always on backlight.The alarm doesn't have a good analog sounding alarm. It sounds more like an underpowered digital clock gone haywire.All-plastic means it will last me about 6 months.I turned the backlight off and left the clock sitting in the window to power the luminous hands, but there's no luminous hands. I see the strips, but it's not working at all.The two things it does well and it's why I give it two stars is keeps time and doesn't tick. I actually like a ticking clock, but my wife can't stand ticking. I expected much more from this clock. Maybe some people don't think the price is high, but I bought a replacement Sharp for seven dollars that I'm now using. And again, had just returned that Equity clock which is 80% similar to this Seiko at 33% the price. I'll try that other Seiko with the twin-bells maybe it will be what I need and restore my faith in Seiko.Don't let my review push you away from this clock. You might like it. Just be sure to read the problems I had with it and if those would be problems for you consider a different clock. This is the one I'm going to try Seiko QXK118KLH Classic Bedside Alarm Clock

I'll start by saying my only thing I use these trimmers for is trimming my beard. I did have some fun with them and our 11 year old son for reviewing purposes. Not to worry, he likes his hair buzzed short and hadn't had a haircut in nearly 2 months.I have these two pairs of trimmers:Panasonic ER224S All-in-One Hair Clipper & Beard Wet/Dry TrimmerWahl 9854-600 Lithium Ion All In One TrimmerThe Panasonic above are very good, but they don't have enough power for what I need.The Wahl's from above rusted on me. In Wahl's defense they offered a free replacement set (Review with comment from Wahl in my history).I had a specific problem. I don't like using guides when trimming my beard. I like to freehand trim my beard and to properly freehand you have to have pretty good power from your trimmer. Without good power all that happens is the hair pushes down before it's cut.My beard is roughly 4-5 inches in length when brushed out, but I like for it to look neat and even. Using the two above linked trimmers, I would get varying results. Most of the time with either I would go to bed with an even beard then wake up with a 99% even beard, with 1% of the beard sticking out, stray hairs and that defined the type of trimmer I needed. It needed to have the power to get those single stray hairs instead of pushing them down.My only knowledge of Philips products was with their televisions and older stereo systems. Everything I had bought from them had good quality, but it just didn't seem right to buy trimmers from what I knew as an electronics company. These Philips trimmers happened to have a coupon on them here on Amazon so I took a shot and have to say I'm impressed. The power is good enough to cut those stray hairs despite being quieter than the Wahl, similar sound as the Panasonic. Pushing the turbo button on these Philips trimmers boosts power even more, but I've only had to do it to test it out.Since I'm bald, I really didn't have any other way to test these out, so I talked our 11 year old son into letting me try them on his hair with the guides. Keeping in mind, I do not like using guides and have never had any success with guided shaves. That didn't change. I just think I don't know how to use guides. These guides are solid, stay in place, but our son's hair still had uneven spots.There are 3 guides included. One has a 2-12 range. One has a 2-16 range. One has a 2-20 range. I'm guessing that's millimeters and the different guides are for varying thickness of hair based on their designs. If you're good with guides then you'll like these. The Panasonic listed above comes with the one-piece guide that adjusts by dialing it which is pretty handy, but it pops off when you go to the longer lengths. That doesn't happen with these Philips guides.It also comes with 4 different blade types for detailing/preference/nose etc...I'll mention here in case anyone has the problem I had. The blade can be washed off as can the top part of the inner trimmer. There are hex type screws in the default blade, which I spent 20 minutes trying to remove. If there's any fault with these it's the lack of instructions. All mine had with it was a leaflet that showed the features. I tried pulling the blade which would be similar to the Panasonic trimmers, but that didn't work either. I finally entered a youtube search and found a video review that showed how to remove the blade/head. It's this easy ... you give it a 1/4 twist and it pops right off. Figures, I was thinking it was going to be something complicated. The blade/head goes back on the same way in opposite order.This set of trimmers are travel-friendly as well. All of the guides, the charger, the trimmer itself fits nicely in the provided pouch. The battery life is about the same as the other trimmers I've tried. If they are fully charged I can go a full week without charging them. I use them 2-3 times a week. I'm very happy with them.

Edit: 10/22Below is my glowing review of the graphite colored Under Armour Blitzing II Cap. I've had sizing issues with caps for the last several years, but the graphite XL/XXL finally fit and fit comfortably. I really liked it enough to order the black color and was planning on ordering the navy as well. The black one came yesterday and it's made differently. I studied over it trying to figure it out. I wear my caps in a fairly straight line style on the side of my head so they come just above my eyebrows. The black XL/XXL is too tight and my regular hat size is 7 3/4 which is the lower end of the XL/XXL size range. From looking at the hats side by side it looks like the graphite color has a slightly higher crown and that would agree with the fit since the black feels too tight on the front side of my head back through the crown area. As someone who spends way too much time looking for clothes/caps/shoes that fit me properly, I have to wonder if the black and navy colors in this hat are just direct copies of the Blitzing I Cap which ran small?  I'll give one of the other newer colors a try and post another edit. Don't let this push anyone away from this hat as it really is one of the best caps I've ever worn, but there's definitely something going on with the sizing.Original review: It may or may not be hard to believe, but I had all but gave up on baseball caps. The last cap I had that fit just right was a New Era 5950 from years ago. It was before the flatbill design become popular. Ever since then it seems like no one makes hats like they used to including New Era. I have a handful of New Era reviews here on Amazon of the 3930 which was supposed to be a lower crown, better fitting, curved bill hat, but I went through 4 different sizes without finding a single one that fit right. I've never had much success with stretch hats because I wear a 7 3/4. Most stretch fit hats I've tried in the L/XL size or too tight even though the size range goes up to 7 3/4. That's the problem though, right? My size is the highest size available in stretch fit. I've seen a few stretch fit hats that have the XL/XXL size, but think my own frustration with caps just pushed me away. I have looked for Under Armour's XL/XXL size for over a year. This includes going in every sporting goods store I can find, but never see this big size. Even Under Armour's website sporadically gets the XL/XXL size in, but it's usually in red or baby blue. I prefer a dark gray, black or navy hat.So with my birthday nearing my wife was looking for something to get me from the kids and saw where Amazon had the XL/XXL in stock. She ordered me the Graphite color. It came last night. I cringed as I started to put it on figuring it would either be way too big or too tight. It fits perfect. Comfortably. I no longer have to push the bill up a little to relieve the tight hat band. I wore it for four hours last night. No red line across the forehead when I took it off. I kind of feel bad since the size range for this hat is 7 3/4 - 8 1/8, meaning it fits me perfect and I'm a 7 3/4, so anyone wearing bigger than 7 3/4 may have trouble with the sizing, but at least it fits 7 3/4. I would think the next two sizes above 7 3/4 would fit pretty well too. Still, be warned ahead of time, if you're much over a 7 3/4 it might be too tight.Otherwise, the quality of this hat is excellent. I was only interested in the Blitzing line as I like the logo better than the sticker logo I've seen on some UA hats. I love it so much that I have already placed an order for the black one as well and most likely will get the navy one.

I was a teenager back when the original Nike Air Max 95s came out and loved them back then. I originally was a Jordan-lover back when the first pairs of Air Jordans came out and that carried on every year up until the Nike Air Max Bo Jackson crosstrainer came out in 1989 (I think). From then through the late 90s, you wouldn't catch me out in anything except Air Max or Jordans. Moving on to current times, I've of course aged and while I don't consider my sense of style to be that much different than it was back then, I mostly have been wearing running shoes from New Balance and Brooks. My review history is littered with reviews of different shoes I've bought here on Amazon only to have to return them due to them not fitting me right. I've also accumulated a long list of over 10 breaks/serious sprains to my legs and ankles since the 90s.My mom lives with my wife and I and our kids. She watched a few months ago as I tried on another pair of running shoes, believe it was Asics, and saw me again shaking my head no while saying, "Doesn't feel right". She out of nowhere says, "Why did you stop wearing Jordans?" I'm guessing she's noticed that our 11 year old son loves Jordans just like I did. I shrugged my shoulders, "Not for sure". So while I was looking for a pair of Jordans that didn't look like a neon Christmas tree, I found these Air Max 95s. I really wanted the Obsidian color, but couldn't find them anywhere in my size. I went with these nice wolf grey ones. For well over a decade, I wore a 10.5 in all Nike shoes. I knew I needed bigger than that, but didn't know what size to try.
