I ordered an 11 and 12 in them with the intention of returning whichever pair didn't fit. There's the bad news. Neither pair fit. No matter how hard I tried to relace them, to loosen them, the width just wasn't working with my foot. I think it's because of the thick sides on the shoe.Needless to say, I finally found a Jordan shoe I liked and ordered them in an 11.5. Those fit perfect. It was the Jordan Retro 6 Chrome if you're wondering. These Air Maxs are still really nice and even comfortable even when too tight. I don't think you could roll your ankles in these shoes if you tried. Which is the same thing that I think stops them from fitting my foot width. They are very sturdy. I would compare the build quality to the best work boots I've wore and those run in the three hundred dollar range. Very nice looking too. They grey has a sleek look to it. Arch support is excellent so if you can fit these then I would recommend them. If you're having trouble fitting them in width give the Jordan Retro line a try. They're a little more expensive, but not much more. Oh and I'm not too old to wear either one. I saw my old basketball coach from high school wearing some Retro Jordans just a few days ago. I'm back to believing if you want durable, well-made shoes you're going to have to pay more and then you can expect more. This Air Max would have easily lived up to my expectations if not for the width issue.

I rarely if ever write 1 star reviews, but it's mostly because I don't review movies we watch. I'll admit ahead of time, I'm no movie expert or even a qualified critic of movies, but I felt like my wife and I wasted night one of our "scary movie month" on this movie. A few years ago, my wife gave in and agreed to watch some horror movies. She had made it 30 or so years without ever seeing a single horror movie. My experience with horror movies were the classics like Halloween, Night of the Living Dead, Texas Chainsaw Massacre and so on. She really liked the original versions of the Halloween movies, but didn't care for the gore in most of the ones we watched. We missed out on scary movie month last year due to us moving during October. I decided to let her pick out some this year. Even though this was officially night one's movie, we also watched "A Cabin in the Woods" recommended by Amazon a few nights ago.Like most people I figured this Annabelle was some sort of Child's Play knockoff, but it's not. I also noticed that the doll is somewhat reminiscent of Linda Blair in The Exorcist and sure enough this movie is about demonic possession. I really struggle with these types of movies. I also have trouble with most Science-Fiction movies as well. I've spent most of my life working in logic and reality (Engineering). It's hard for me to tap into a "I believe that" feeling with most movies. Like Child's Play. I never really got the scare of it.So, the story of this movie isn't too bad, but it's one of those that you'll feel like you already know what is going to happen. The acting is poor. The mother in it isn't the least bit believable. I'm guessing that's a case of overacting. More importantly, the movie really is very slow. I told my wife, "I feel like I'm watching Leave it to Beaver". As the movie panned around the setting city. It has maybe 2-3 "jump scare" moments in it, but those are even tame. I didn't see anything in this movie that warranted the "horror" label. It's a drama movie with a "creepy" doll in it. It's Poltergeist without the true feeling of helplessness of Poltergeist. I also don't know why it's rated R. I honestly think you could play this movie uncut on network television. Not that I was looking for rated R moments, but it's almost as if that rating was put in place to make it more scary than it actually is. My wife chose this movie based on the doll. I've tried to get her to watch Puppet Master, but she's always saying the puppets freak her out. Which is what I always thought the point of a horror movie was. This one will just make you wish you could move time back 99 minutes and not push play.

Awhile back, I decided to convert from a console gamer to a PC gamer. I had a few exceptions. Sports games aren't released on the PC as often as the console, so I kept my Xbox 360 just for sports games. I wasn't impressed with what I saw of Madden 16, so I instead bought Madden 15. My last Madden was Madden 13.My main gripe with football games is the difficulty or lack of. From the earliest days of sports licensed games (late 80s - early 90s), I've rarely found a sports game that is challenging, unless you set the difficulty very high. Then as most know, it becomes a game of frustration and patience as you watch computer AI opponents become with 12 foot jumping interceptions, being blocked by two players only to squeeze between them and get a sack ... two, three times a game. Madden was never my favorite as I preferred the NCAA football game. With no new NCAA games, Madden 15 would have to be my football gaming fix this year.Sadly, any thought of a challenge disappeared during my first exhibition game. I'll never understand the "realism" other people find in these football games. In my first exhibition game, I used the Chicago Bears against the Detroit Lions. I didn't touch any of the sliders or settings (penalties, stamina, quarter length). It's my belief that the default settings and sliders should give the most realistic result. Sliders, to me, were there for when you had played 3-4 seasons and had gotten too good at the game to have realistic results. Settings, especially quarter length, was for stat lovers who wanted a little extra time to pick up their players stats. My first game result with default sliders and settings:Chicago Bears 45 - Detroit Lions 10Notable players stats:Jay Cutler 14-16 passing, 286 yards, 2 TDs, 0 INTsMatt Stafford 6-22 passing, 57 yards, 1 TD, 3 INTsMatt Forte 13 rushes, 178 yards, 2 TDsJacquizz Rodgers 6 rushes, 84 yards, 2 TDsJoique Bell 15 rushes, 12 yardsBears defense 11 sacks, 6 turnovers (3 INTs, 3 fumbles recovered)Total yards:Bears 568Lions 115I don't think I need to explain how unrealistic these stats are. The worst part for me is the quarter length setting. If you look at the Bears QB and RB combined with the Lions QB and RB, there was only 38 passes between the two teams and 28 rushes between the two teams top RBs. To put some perspective on that, when these two teams played last year with the near exact rosters as I'm using in this game, those two QBs combined for 93 passes attempted and the two teams combined for 31 rushing attempts. That means in the real game the two teams ran right at double the plays as the same two teams ran on Madden 15. I'll agree that video game football is supposed to be a little more geared towards big, exciting plays than long drawn out drives, but to get the stats to match or even be close between Madden and real-life results, one would need to play 12 minute quarters. Just prorating the stats I had in the 6 minute quarters, that would have made the score Bears 90 Lions 20. Cutler would have had nearly 600 yards passing, Forte would have been over 300 yards. The teams would have nearly 1,500 total yards combined.I adjusted the sliders making the game "harder". The only big difference I saw was the number of interceptions I was throwing. I was still rushing at will with any team and with any running back. Outside of turning the difficulty up to Madden level and adjusting all sliders to make the computer AI defense as good as possible, I was still carrying the ball at a 10+ yards average per rush. It's pretty sad when you have to spend the second half of the game making negative rushes just to lower your RBs yards per carry to a believable level. The pass defense AI isn't much better. I even tried making the game feel a little more challenging by intentionally throwing the ball out of bounds for an incomplete pass for my QBs stats and so my offense would have only two plays to get a first down.It's frustrating when you have to play a game the opposite of how it should be played just so you won't feel like you're just wasting your time. If all this is a little confusing or hard to understand, I decided to play a full season with 8 minute quarters, All-Pro difficulty, all sliders adjusted to favor the computer AI opponent. This was the result:Bears 16-0 in regular season. Won the Super Bowl.Jay Cutler 6,008 yards - Broke all-time single season record by 600 yards.Cutler 58 TDs passing, 7 INTs - Broke all-time single season passing TDs record.Forte 2,673 yards rushing - Broke all-time single season rushing yards record by 500 yards.Forte 31 rushing TDs - Broke all-time single season rushing TD record.Jeffrey 2,217 receiving yards - Broke all-time single season receiving yards record.To make all this even worse, the Bears also had these stats:Rodgers the second string RB had 1,426 yards with 14 TDs, the yards ranked 3rd in the NFL and the rushing TDs also ranked 3rd.Bennett the Bears Tight End had 1,729 yardsRoyal the Bears #2 WR had 1,256 yardsAs a lifelong Bears fan I can tell you those stats aren't even close to being accurate. It's more believable for me to say those are the least accurate stats possible. Needless to say, I put the game back in its case and it's not likely that I'll play it again. I would like to think it's just my general football knowledge that allows me to post these type of stats, but I do the same on all of EA's sports games including FIFA, and I've never even played soccer nor do I even understand the majority of soccer's penalties. I really believe these EA sports games aren't being tested enough.

I bought both WWE 2K14 and 2K15. My review of 2K14 can be found in my history.I rate this one higher even though I don't think most gamers do. I'm going to explain the differences.The Create a Finisher is gone. The Create a Story is gone.The roster is much better in 2K15. The NXT and Showcase modes are relatively fun.Most of what I had read must have been based around WWE 2K15 on the XBone and PS4. This is a near carbon copy of 2K14 on the Xbox 360. You can still Create Divas in the 360 version. No match options were removed, it's exactly the same as 2K14 match options.One negative is the Community Creations community isn't near as active on 2K15. You can download pretty much any wrestler you can name on 2K14's Community Creations, not so on 2K15, but there's still some good created wrestlers, especially if you like Indy wrestling. If you're into International wrestling, then you would probably prefer 2K14's Community Creations. 2K15 has 1-2 created versions of the biggest name international wrestlers like Great Muta, Cibernetico, Liger, and you're as likely to find 1 bad one for every 1 good one.I had read "limited creation functions", but that doesn't apply as much on the 360. It hasn't changed since 2K14. What has changed is how Community Creations works. On 2K14, you can download the max 100 wrestlers if you want to in one night. On 2K15 it limits you to 10 downloads per 24 hour period. There's a simple way around it, but the way around the limit doesn't work if you're downloading logos, arenas, move-sets. It's a little annoying, but the default roster had at least 20 wrestlers in it that I had to download on 2K14.The game plays smoothly, character models are a little crisper than in 2K14 and I don't feel as distracted when playing it as I did in 2K14. I kept wanting to create a story, create a finisher, I just knew I would figure out how to make a finisher that didn't look herky jerky, but it didn't work. This 2K15 has more moves since it retains all the moves from 2K14 and adds all the moves for the new wrestlers who weren't in last year's game. Since I don't watch wrestling much, most of the moves are new to me so I didn't miss the create a finisher option.Other complaints I've seen on 2K15 is the removal of custom entrance music and the custom entrances only include one generic motion. Those are both right. I usually play wrestling or even fighting games for an hour or so and it's just to relax. I turn the entrances to off. So those removed features aren't noticeable to the way I play the game. But they are gone for those who do like custom music and custom entrances. Both features were in 2K14.It just came down to me preferring this roster over 2K14's. It's a good wrestling game. I will say it's not as good as those old wrestling games on the N64. But I've been saying that about every wrestling game I've played since Wrestlemania 2000, No Mercy and the WCW vs games on the N64. This 2K15 is the better buy of the two as I ended up sinking fifty dollars in a used version of 2K14, whereas I only spent the price for 2K15 plus 2 DLCs that were only seven dollars.

I hadn't played a wrestling game since SD vs. Raw 2010. I also haven't followed wrestling for awhile. My son watches a few of the programs each week, but most of what I saw wasn't very interesting. I grew up with the 80s Saturday night wrestling shows with Gordon Solie as announcer, Sunday was WWF/E and even rented the VHS of Wrestlemania I just a few months after it originally happened. I really loved wrestling. Our son is back and forth with it. So there's really not been a reason to buy the games. I hadn't realized 2K had taken over the WWE series until a few weeks ago. That, if nothing else, made me interested in the game since I believe 2K still has developed the best NFL game ever ... in NFL 2K5. And I've enjoyed several of the more current NBA 2K games.The roster had very little impact on my choice of which WWE game to get. Despite being a fan during the 80s and through the Attitude Era, I'm not really into using the wrestlers from those eras, especially those who've passed away. I was more interested in having a fun game. Everything I read on wrestling games forums said 2K14 is better than 2K15, so I ordered a used version, not knowing I would need to buy an online pass since the one included was used by the previous owner.So, I ended up paying ten more dollars for an online pass. Then ended up buying the Season Pass which was another twenty dollars. I really didn't mind the price since I figured it would be enough to last my wrestling game interest for a few years. The game is good, but it's really not that different than I remember the THQ WWE games being. It's a reversal-fest. I ended up lowering the reversal slider all the way down to just one level of it. It was pretty annoying to hit a finisher, pick the guy up and have him reverse your next move. There's plenty of match types to play. And though the roster didn't matter much to me in the beginning, it started to matter once I played the game. I ended up going to the community creations and downloading roughly 90 created wrestlers since there's a lot of active wrestlers not in this game. I would think most notably for current WWE fans, The Wyatt Family. There's some really great created wrestlers in the community creations.We played it off and on for a week or so, but the roster, even with added created wrestlers, just isn't very good. The best created wrestlers don't look much better than the worst default characters. I would rate this higher, but I turned around and bought a new copy of WWE 2K15 for the 360 and liked it quite a bit better. I wouldn't rate either one a five star. There's problems in these games that were around back in 2010. From collision detection, floating wrestlers, a very ambitious "create a finisher" that ends up making you think they really don't put much time into it. Create a Story isn't any better than I remember it being. It more or less reminds me of most sports video games. They update the roster, throw a few new animations in and say it's a new game. I'm also going to review 2K15 as well. A quick ending piece of advice. Only buy used if you're willing to pay the money for the online access which you have to have to download created wrestlers. You also have to have Xbox Gold. I tried a free trial week to the online access only to find out it wouldn't let me download any created wrestlers during the trial. If you buy a new copy it will come with the online access code. One last warning on this one. The server has been having problems for the last 2 weeks. I spent a week trying to download a Great Muta created wrestler only to receive this message, "The WWE 2K14 service is not available. Try again later." From what I've read they'll most likely shut the server down in the next few months anyway.

One of the easiest, cheapest and no-fuss ways to help rid your house of household odors. Our daughter's closet is in the most humid area of our house. With summer temperatures hitting at least 90 for 35 straight days this year she was starting to complain about how her closet smelled. It doesn't help that we've been making her and her brother wash their own clothes. She had an entire mesh laundry bag in her closet filled with wet towels and dirty sheets. She forgot them before going on vacation with my wife's family. Since neither sheets or towels are something she had to take on vacation with her, she left them there for two weeks. We ordered this Moso bag and put it in there. Washed the dirty sheets and towels, now the closet is back to smelling neutral. And here's another tip for these. My first experience with these bags was in my job. We had remodeled a house that was over 100 years old. This required cutting some of the walls out. A few days after opening those old walls up we noticed a musty smell and bought some of these 200g bags, mounted them to the bottom of the walls we left in place. It removed the smell and because of the hole in the 200g bag, the new owners can replace them in the future if they want.

These have been great for my mom. She's in her late 60s and bruises easily on her hands, wrists and forearms. Recently she had a fairly bad slip that caused a light globe to break on her hand. It caused a lot of bleeding due to the number of bruises on her hand busting when the glass hit her hand. She's hit her hand on a few things since getting these, but no bruising. Here's hoping they keep working. She's tried just about everything from a similar pair of hand/forearm protectors made by Under Armour for use by football players to the various different bruises creams. I'll update in a few months to see how well they hold up. So far it's a 5 star product.

I said I wouldn't have buyer's remorse after buying this. Like most FNM fans I've been around since the late 80s when they had their smash hit with "Epic". I've since became a follower of Mike Patton's musical adventures, all the way from FNM through Mr. Bungle to Tomahawk and back around by Fantomas. I've enjoyed every step despite some of them making me wonder if I just like to see what crazy thing Mike is going to do with his voice. With FNM you're getting mostly great music on all albums with a few of those more experimental songs thrown in.This deluxe edition really offers very little to any FNM collector. The Angel Dust album is one of the finest mastered albums I've heard and they didn't mess with the sound much if at all. The bonus disc is good, but there's also a chance you've already heard everything on it. It's surprising they left out, "The Perfect Crime" from Bill and Ted, but most of us have it already.If you don't have Angel Dust already then I'll recommend this deluxe edition wholeheartedly, but if you already have it then you might want to look at disc two to see if it's worth purchasing. I'm not regretting it.

I got this for my 13 year old daughter's iPhone 5c. She prefers a more colorful case, but her school now requires student ID cards so this fits the bill perfectly. She is happier with it than I expected. It seems pretty good at offering protection as well. If for no other reason it's like adding a thin cushion around the phone when closed. Good buy for anyone who has an ID they have to use everyday, but don't want to carry a purse or wallet.

So, I had bought another product by this company that wasn't for cool-mist humidifiers. This one says it is. I used it for a week and noticed no difference in the humidifier staying cleaner longer. From the way it reads it's supposed to stop the white dust. I already fixed that problem by using water from a filter. So I can't really say if it stops white dust, but can say it doesn't stop pink gunk from forming in the humidifier. As another warning like on the other product, this product also has multiple warnings on it about not letting it touch your skin. No doubt, the dilution of it would lower those risks, but it still seems crazy to put something in a cool mist humidifier that can hurt you by touching you. I found the combination of the Protec cartridges and filtered water from the faucet filter has slowed the pink gunk and white dust better than anything else.

My daughter recently turned 13. She's at that age where she's told me she no longer wants to play sports because "boys don't like girls who play sports". So when she asked for a designer perfume, I bought her this instead. It has a really nice subtle, fresh scent to it and Amazon always has it at a great price. My wife also uses it and sometimes my elderly mom will as well. It's very versatile.

Years ago I used these in a Vicks humidifier I had. They did seem to make the filter last longer, but I was curious to see how they would work in an ultrasonic cool mist humidifier. We've bought at least 5 humidifiers this year from Amazon (reviews in my history). The main problem I have with humidifiers is the pink gunk that builds up in them. I bought this pack that includes 2 of the cartridges. Cleaned my mom's humidifier and dropped one into the tank. Cleaned my purifier and dropped the other into it.I can say it's working. I'm only giving four stars because I think this is a long-term experiment. I kept a note on how long the clean humidifiers lasted before starting to show pink gunk with and without the cartridge.Without this cartridge, the Optimus humidifier my mom is using, had pink gunk in it 4 days after cleaning. It was needing cleaned by the 6th day without the cartridge. With the cartridge, the Optimus humidifier hasn't shown much pink gunk in 10 days after cleaning, but there is a little. Still, that's a big improvement.Without this cartridge my Pure Guardian humidifier showed pink gunk in it 5 days after cleaning and needed cleaned in 6 days after cleaning without the cartridge. With the cartridge, the Pure Guardian is showing no pink gunk at all in 10 days after cleaning.I should mention, I'm like most of you all. The idea of buying gallons of distilled water just for my humidifier wasn't a good option. I bought one of the faucet water filters (PUR, Culligan, etc) and have been filling them with the filtered water which I'm sure is also helping. I'll update this review a few more times over the next few months to see if the cartridge keeps working, how long it lasts, etc..

I have this really great story about this bag, but won't go too overboard with it. Our daughter bought this for her best friend. I checked it before giving it to her to make sure the smell wasn't bad. It wasn't, I was going to put a Odoban odor remover in the plastic bag if it was. Her best friend has a lot of serious medical problems, but she's completely positive. This bag became a new part of her "support system" she created. She wears it on her back when she has to stay overnight in a hospital or when she's having surgery. She says the bag helps her because she feels better knowing, "the turtles have my back". I'm afraid if I told the full story it would make some people cry. Just take it for it's worth. It's a good quality bag for the price. Hopefully I can find her an even higher quality one for her birthday.

I can't really rate this lower than five stars. We bought the Culligan faucet filter with the belief that we would use it a whole lot. There's one problem. The water is room temperature. I've mainly been using the faucet filter for ice, coffee for mom, iced tea for everyone, water for the dogs and for filling our humidifiers. We didn't have any trouble changing them and the water quality is very good. We are averaging 3 months of use out of ours between changes. I can't buy distilled or purified water any cheaper.

I take my lunch to work with me everyday. I'm a bit too much East Coast for someone born on the West Coast. I love my sandwiches for lunch. I can remember every man in my family using these and they're even better now. Well worth a purchase, especially if you use Prime Pantry. Hopefully Amazon will get them back in stock.

Excellent quality. I bought this for my mom. She's in her 60s and was talking to me one day about her hair thinning. She asked me if I remembered the hair brush she had when I was a little kid. I knew exactly what she was talking about and came here to Amazon to find one. It was a completely blind order since I wanted to surprise her with it. She loves it and says it doesn't pull her already thinning hair out. On the other side, our 13 year old daughter has very thick hair and tried it out. She too loved it so we bought her one too. I'm bald so I don't know much about brushes. I do know it seems like every few months my wife is buying our daughter a new brush because the old brush is either hurting her head to use or isn't working good anymore. Mom has been using this brush for about 6 months with no complaints and our daughter has been using hers for 3 months with no complaints. Can't beat that.

Sheesh, I tried buying myself one of these hats in the Detroit Tigers and couldn't get one to fit. Ended up returning it 3 times with no success on different sizes. I bought this one for my brother-in-law for his birthday. He said he knew it would fit him. It arrived, he put it on, didn't fit. He's got a big head like me. I really hope New Era gets this straightened out. We both love the designs and feel of these hats.

I'm going to keep this pretty simple (will explain why).This book doesn't live up to its title. There's very little new information in it about self-editing. There's a few tips based around using Scrivener which is advertised throughout the book. How often? There are 43 instances of the word "Scrivener" in this book. Author uses affiliate link to Scrivener to make money if you buy the software from his link. Lots of contradictions in the book. Example: Buy this book to learn about self-editing. Author becomes your "coach". Author then tells you to pay someone to edit your book after you edit it with your new knowledge learned in this book. After promoting self-editing, author tells you his first book failed because he didn't pay someone to edit it. I'm guessing author's writing book will tell me to write my book then hire a real author to write it for me. Wouldn't be so bad if Amazon stopped removing/rejecting my review.

I got this for my mom to use with her Chromebook. I have been a convert to the Bluetrack mice for several years now and this is one of the cheapest ways to get one. I think it's probably the cheapest way. I wouldn't be able to use it myself since it's rather small, but works perfect for mom. If anyone is wondering how well the bluetrack works, I'll tell you how I've used them. I sit in a recliner type chair at my computer so I can't depend on using the mouse on my desk or mouse pad. I use it daily on my shorts/pants made from denim, polyester, cotton, khaki. I've used it on the arm of my chair it's made of leather. My mom uses hers on her quilt on her bed. I've not tried it on glass mainly because outside of the windows, we don't have any glass furniture to test it on. Our daughter has used it on the floor which is laminate. In our experience these are the best and cheapest mice you can buy if you're not a traditional mouse on desk/mouse pad user of computers. And best of all it's plug and play.

I've become an almost exclusive user of TP-Link's products. This one won't hurt my opinion of them. We have the TL-PA4010KIT and the Archer C8 Router. My wife was wanting something to extend our WiFi into our kitchen, it's on the far end of the house away from the rooms we typically need internet in. She first ordered the TP-Link RE200, but all it really did was hurt the already poor WiFi reception in our kitchen. I built our current house and intended for the kitchen to be electronics/screens-free. My mom lives with us and is retired. She loves to take our kids into the kitchen, cook with them, have them test out her cookies or whatever she's in the mood to cook, but she despises computers/phones in the kitchen. She does like technology everywhere else though. My wife started taking online classes since we moved in and now needs internet in the kitchen so she can study in peace.With no RE200 or this WPA4220 we were getting 1-2 MB/sec at the kitchen table.The RE200 actually dropped us below 1 MB/sec at the kitchen table.I realized my wife had ordered the wrong product since it was giving what I call a "ghost" signal. Our phones, laptops were all saying they had full WiFi reception, but the speeds were just terrible. We can get upwards of 75 MB/sec in the bedrooms.Since I had experience with the 4010, I knew it should be better than what she was getting and finally found this WPA4220. I'll be completely honest and say it doesn't get as much speed in the kitchen as I would like, but it's still getting a consistent 25-30 MB/sec with the WPA4220 plugged in the hallway which is halfway between the router and kitchen.When I built this house I set out to make it WiFi friendly and ran most of the wiring, metal on the end with the kitchen with minimal shielded wiring throughout the bedrooms and bathrooms. It has worked good for what I intended. This WPA4220 does a good enough job. I knew expectations couldn't be too high since the hallway leads right into heavy wiring in the walls, so 25-30 MB/sec is probably lucky. I gave it 5 stars based on my knowledge of the house's wiring and my intentional attempt to lower WiFi accessibility in our kitchen to start with. It saved me a lot of time of going into the attic and rewiring everything.One tip: My wife is impatient. She plugged this in the kitchen and expected it to pair up with the router which is roughly 40 feet away. She was ready to send it back since it wouldn't even pair. I took it to our bedroom where the router is, pushed the WPS button on the router, plugged this in maybe 5 feet away and held the connect button for probably a minute. It paired up and has been working fine in the hallway ever since. I also think it's important to plug this into an outlet and not a surge protector. I originally had a problem with the 4010KIT since I tried plugging it into a surge protector.Very good product overall.

This is one of those reviews that I'm almost embarrassed to publish. Let me say I've been an RPG gamer for as long as I can remember. I still remember putting The Legend of Zelda on NES in layaway back in 1986. My dad wouldn't let me pay over twenty dollars for a video game back then and if I remember right, it was fifty. I was only eleven or twelve. I paid on it every other week until I had it in my hands and spent the entire summer playing it. A second major game came along in summer of 1990. Final Fantasy on the NES. I spent that summer playing it. So much in fact, I even loaded up the NES, the game, the maps and took them on vacation with us.The Elder Scrolls replaced both of those for me. Even as an overworked dad and husband, I've developed what I consider a healthy obsession with the Elder Scrolls and Fallout too. The Elder Scrolls games let me get away from the stress of daily life. I recently made the switch from console gamer to PC gamer and bought this set while Amazon had it on sale for twenty dollars. I figured I wouldn't use it since I do like Steam, but wanted this set anyway. I now own these versions of the Elder Scrolls games:Skyrim: (Xbox 360) Vanilla and Legendary, (PS3) Legendary, (PC) Steam LegendaryOblivion: (Xbox 360) Game of the Year with all downloaded add-ons like Vile Lair, (PC) Steam Deluxe Game of the Year Edition and this physical copy.Morrowind: (Xbox) Game of the Year played on Xbox 360For me, these three games become completely "new" on PC. This is the order of my favorites of these three and it's important to the review.Skyrim - On console it has been the best of the three for me. I don't care for the leveling up system in it, but the combination of graphics, realistic gore, story and atmosphere makes it my favorite.Morrowind - A game I had trouble liking at first on the console. It feels a little clunky, everything you "see" is outdated, but the leveling up is very fun, the atmosphere is good despite the lower-end graphics and the story is good.Oblivion - To me it's the most overrated on consoles. Skyrim's setting is near perfect. It's icy, it's cold, there are animals you would expect to see in cold areas. Morrowind is dark and moody which fits it well. Oblivion is set in Cyrodill and it's similar to North America in climate with the southern region being marshy, lots of water, the central region being green and flat, both coasts have water all along them and the northern parts get into mountainous, snowy conditions, but that's it. It's as if they created this beautiful lush continent for Oblivion, but forgot to add much to the outside parts of the game. You can run across half of Oblivion's map without being attacked once. There are wolves, the occasional Minotaur, but most of the outside area seems wasted.Having said that, Oblivion on the PC has the most potential since the modding community has added thousands of mods for it. More wildlife, even lusher graphics, it's kind of like taking Skyrim's outdoor adventures and adding it to Oblivion. I've already played the modded PC version for 114 hours. I barely had that much on the console version and I'm nowhere near finished with the PC version.Morrowind has the great graphics overhaul mod. Though I agree with other Elder Scrolls players who say you should play Morrowind without it at least for one playthrough. The mod makes it prettier, it takes away some of the dark atmosphere, but it makes it much nicer to look at it and easier on your eyes. There's also weapon and armor mods that improve those.Skyrim falls to the bottom on the PC since in my opinion, it was the best on console, there's some nice graphic mods for weapons and armor, but it was already near perfect for me, not counting the too easy leveling up system.I've been very happy with this anthology. As others have noted, the Skyrim that comes with this set is a Steam code. Also should be noted, the Oblivion that comes with this set is the Game of the Year edition. I had already bought the Deluxe GotY edition on Steam which includes those small add-ons like Vile Lair, Wizard's Tower, etc...I've read others say if you install Oblivion GotY from this set through Steam you'll get the Deluxe Edition, but I can't verify that since I already had it downloaded to my Steam account before buying this set. I also agree with the others who say you really don't "need" this anthology if you already have these games on Steam. I haven't tried Daggerfall or Arena, but will eventually. All in all, combining the console versions and PC versions, I've put in over 1,200 hours in these 3 games over the last 5-6 years. I probably still have another 1,200 hours to go with all these mods.

This is the fourth Bubba mug I've bought. There's not a lot of reason to review these except there can be some confusion.There are two different 34 oz Bubba mugs. There's one that is nearly uniform in size from top to bottom. Unless you have large cupholders it won't fit in them. Then there's the one picture above with the skinnier bottom which fits in all cupholders I've tried (loveseat console, truck's dashboard one, wife's car cupholder).You can see in my review history that I bought another 34 oz one that doesn't say "travel" in the title, but it was the travel one which is what I wanted. I then ordered a second one from the same page I ordered from, but instead received the uniform, thicker mug. I have ordered two from this travel mug page you're on and received the travel mug both times.It's a very good, sturdy mug that keeps drinks cold for several hours. I really can't say how long since I drink it all before 2 hours pass. It's still ice cold at the 2 hour mark.

I recently posted a review of an Oral-B S-200. I don't even think I was posting Amazon reviews back when I bought it on Amazon in 2007. It lasted up until a few weeks ago. So, I really didn't have any question about what brand electric toothbrush I was going to buy. Eight years of daily service is enough to make me forget my analytical ways.You'll have to understand that I was very happy to receive this. I used the S-200 for 8 years, 2 times a day, without skipping a day. That is until the S-200 stopped charging. I still only missed one day of using an electric toothbrush.The first thing I did when I received this toothbrush was replace the head. I have very sensitive gums. I bought the 3 pack of Oral-B's Power Sensitive Replacement Heads. My first use of the brush went better than expected. The motion of this model is much more along the lines of what I need from an electric toothbrush. The round head allows me to control the areas of my brushing. I do still brush my teeth with a regular brush 2-3 times a day. I use the electric toothbrush similar to how most people use floss. I want it to specifically hit along my gum line and this model's round head does that perfectly. Much better than the S-200's traditional style toothbrush head. While I can appreciate the timer "pulse" (the S-200 also had it), I've never really followed it. I cover my gum line all across the top and bottom teeth then go over my teeth once.A few problems I've learned to work with: We have three electric toothbrushes in our household. There's nothing that bothers me more than seeing gunk building up around the charging base. This can be simply avoided by wiping the toothbrush's handle down after every use. I know it sounds simple and you might be thinking "who doesn't do that?", but if you look at the reviews there's quite a few complaints about the charger base gunk.As much as I like the storage area that comes with this model, it's not staying hooked onto my charger's base. I keep it in the cabinet above the sink. It not only takes up more space on your sink with it attached, it also promotes water/bacteria around the base if you're switching heads frequently since the heads most likely won't be dried out when you switch them out.The only real choice I had to make was which model of the Oral-B I was going to buy. I started with a small list the toothbrush had to have or didn't need.Bluetooth - I don't even use bluetooth on my phone or computer. I didn't look into what the bluetooth function does, but did know I don't need it.More than one speed - As said above, I use this specifically for my gum line. All I really need though is the regular speed (for teeth) and the slower, sensitive speed for my gums.Doesn't come with a big charging base - My wife and I have separate sinks, but even so, I don't like sink clutter of any kind.The Pro 1000 model didn't have the separate speed settings so I removed it. The Pro 5000 model has bluetooth and the word "smart" in front of toothbrush. I'm all for technology as you can see in my review history, but technology has very little reason to be involved with my teeth cleaning. It made picking the 3000 model an easy choice and on top of that, there was a twenty dollar off coupon on it. Which was enough to cover the cost of the sensitive replacement heads.One thing I haven't mentioned is this model also comes with a "pulse" speed setting. I tried it. Didn't care for it. So it does have three speeds. This model is a good balance between the higher priced models and the lower priced models, though if you don't need a sensitive speed setting, I would recommend the Pro 1000. If you like the flexibility of 3 speeds and a charging base that can be easily taken apart so it's only a small, portable base, I would recommend this Pro 3000 model. Here's hoping for another 8 years of daily use.

It's never fun talking about grooming body hair. I started shaving off most of my body hair when I was in college. I played multiple sports in college and having less hair always made my body cooler and less likely to have hair pulling in my uniform.In college, I shaved all body hair except my chest. It was hell. That was in the 90s. I used to take a bottle of Nair and rub it all across my back, shoulders, legs and arms. Then would take a wet towel and rub the hair as hard as I could to remove the body hair. If it sounds painful, it was. Also, I would smell like Nair (which smells like rotten eggs to me) all day. I eventually found the Mangroomer product at one of the Bed, Bath stores and thought I had found the answer to my body hair problem. And I did ... sort of. It worked well on my back, but would cause major irritation. My back would look sunburned. And yes, it was also painful like a sunburn. Believe it or not, I still have that original Mangroomer and it still works.But, I've changed my body grooming since then. I no longer shave my legs or arms since my wife likes that hair. This leaves me with a smaller area to shave and I picked up a sample of these Body razors a few months ago. My wife used one on my back and I'm happy to say there was nearly no irritation. I did have another problem that I didn't have with the Mangroomer and that was a small skin tag I didn't know I had on my back. It bled pretty bad, but wasn't near as painful as the irritation the Mangroomer caused. I think it's a good product. It does look a lot like the razors my wife and daughter use, but that doesn't matter too much to me. I decided to order this two pack when I saw the special promo Amazon has on them. I'll put them up for future use since this Amazon price is nearly half off what I see them for in stores.

My wife bought these for her own use. She had a pair of Tweezerman tweezers that were lost. I really don't know what all women use tweezers for and honestly, don't really want to know. I use tweezers if I get a splinter. I was surprised when she ordered these. We have an Amazon system in our house. My wife, kids and mom all sign into my account when they are ordering something. They put the items in the cart then I check the next day. Look to see if there's anything else we need and place the order. The last time I looked there were two pairs of Tweezerman tweezers in the cart, but my wife had sent a text telling me not to order them yet. She had found these Bodyline tweezers and wanted to read up on them when she got time. She of course decided to buy these. She wasn't happy with them once they came. The main complaint she had was two of the pairs of tweezers don't close all the way. She said that made them useless on very fine thin hairs. The third pair she said were just okay. So she returned them and bought two different pairs of Tweezerman tweezers.As others have said, the seller can be a bit annoying asking for reviews of these tweezers. I received 5 emails asking for a review. The worst part, the first one came the day after I ordered them. Amazon Prime shipping is fast, but it's not that fast. On a side note, as annoying as those emails can be (especially since they came to my account and not my wife's, who was the one using them), I do respect the company for trying to get feedback on their products. Hopefully it's to use the feedback for improvement and not to try and get more people to buy them based on "good" reviews.I think I was fair in a 3 star rating. If it were me, the one working pair would have been enough, though that would make it overpriced for one pair. I thought the one pair (non-colored) looked more like a surgical tool than tweezers.

Let me start with a little bit of a warning: I'm bald. But I do have a little stubble on my head after a few days of not shaving and I also have a full beard. I haven't bought a bottle of shampoo in years, even decades. Just from memory, I would guess the last shampoo I bought was in 1993-1994. It was the regular Paul Mitchell in the white bottle. I always liked the pleasant smell of it. So my wife and I were on a weekend getaway. While there, the hotel room had several bottles of complimentary shampoo, conditioner and lotions. One of the shampoos was called Bumble and Bumble Surf Foam. I decided to try it on my beard and loved it. Then I found out how much it costs and decided to find a different shampoo.I typically use whatever shampoo is in our shower. My wife spends a lot of time making sure her best shampoo isn't left in the shower. I saw this Paul Mitchell here on Amazon and Lavender is one of my favorite scents. I had been sold on Paul Mitchell's brand back in the 90s. So I ordered the shampoo and conditioner. The plan was to wash my beard and head/hair every other day. I admit, I was pretty excited about having a lavender shampoo. Then I received it and started to use it. It's not the lavender I know of. As a kid, my grandfather used to have a bowl beside his clothing dresser. He kept warm water in it and dropped lavender in it. It kept his room smelling fresh and clean. He also would rub some on his hands and smack his hands on his face after shaving. He told me it's the only "perfume" a man ever needs. I was expecting this to smell something like his lavender water. It doesn't. There's a woodsy smell, a very slight mint smell and a dull lavender scent. It's okay, if it improves the feeling of my beard and stops dryness in the facial hair, it would still be worth the price. It didn't. I'm not saying it doesn't work. My beard and head felt very clean, but it didn't improve the feeling of my beard.My review is more or less based on the smell and how well it cleans/treats. It cleans well. The other two are below average. I'm still giving it a 3 star since I'll finish the bottles. There's nothing offensive or bad about it. It just doesn't live up to the expectations I have on the Paul Mitchell brand.

There's not much you can say about these cables. The one thing I will say is I've ordered them more than once. The main selling/return buying point is the snagless feature. My most recent order was of the 7 ft one. The one that came with our router popped loose the first three times I plugged it into our modem. I used that one until this one arrived then replaced it. These are also good for hooking up your Smart TV to a router instead of relying on wifi. Nice and flexible cable considering its thickness and durability.

I was surprised to see Dorco on Amazon. I'm a razor/shaving enthusiast. I've been shaving my head for roughly 25 years now. And up until this year (grew a beard), shaved my head and face at least 3 times a week. My wife initially found Harry's razors. I was on their site shopping for some cheaper razors when I noticed someone mentioned Dorco razors. My wife also spends way too much on razors and our daughter is almost 13, she's not shaving often, but does maybe once every two weeks. I signed up on Dorco and received a promo if bought from their website. The promo allowed you to pick multiple razors so it would be something like a sampler. I picked this Pace 6 Plus and a Pace 6. My wife picked the 6 blade women's razors.Wife used hers the first day the order arrived and went on and on about how much she liked it. Daughter used one and said it was as good as any she has used (keeping in mind she's just starting out).Since I have a beard, I've been shaving my head a little less often, maybe twice a week. My thinking was even if these cartridges weren't real good, just shaving my head, they should at least last a week or two with each cartridge. My first shave of my head with these cartridges wasn't bad. I did notice a few spots that hair could still be felt, but not seen, the real test would be how well they do on the second and hopefully third shave. Second shave was 3 days later and it was pretty frustrating. The cartridges kept clogging up. If my hair was very long or even very thick, I could understand, but most of my hair on the top of my head is gone whether I shave it or not. And it was only a 3 day growth on the sides and back of my head. I didn't get any cuts or nicks, but after finishing, there were multiple small patches of stubbly hair still on my head. I tried to get a third shave out of the cartridge, but quit after the first swipe. The cartridge wasn't shaving very well at all. I switched it for the second cartridge that came with the handle. It did okay on the first shave then started having problems on the second shave.I'm learning to just watch for when someone like Amazon has the Proglides at a very good price. I only rated the Proglides a 4 on here so it's not that I'm biased. I just can't deal with an uncomfortable shave. I do work outside, sometimes up in the mountains, which means wind burn, irritation are even more likely so I can't risk it. For a comparison, I bought some cartridges from Sam's called Simply Right Duraglide 6 blade razors. I didn't do well with those either, but would compare them as similar quality. I think the sixth blade is part of the problem. If you've used the Fusion (not Proglides), you know that 5 blades are almost too much since they don't allow for a freeflow of water through the blades. The Proglide version of the Fusion fixes that problem.To further show how much I want these Dorco to work for me, the next time my wife and daughter order cartridge refills, I'm going to order a Pace 4 and 3. I'm old enough to have grown up shaving with 2 and 3 blade razors. Maybe the less blades models will allow more water to get through the blades to wash the hair out. If not, I'll just watch Amazon's prices on the Proglides and order a dozen or so each time they put them on sale.To show a direct comparison: Since I've stopped using razors on my face, a Proglide will last me 6 comfortable shaves of my head. I can push that to 7-8 with a little irritation.The Dorco Pace 6 gets me one comfortable shave.Having said that, it's just my experience. As I said above, my wife and daughter love these cartridges. They just don't work very good for me. I would recommend people to try them. I'll eventually give Harry's a try, but I don't have much confidence in these value razors.

This won't be much of a review. I bought this on October 17, 2007 here on Amazon and must've skipped reviewing it. The good news is: It has been used at least twice a day since October 17, 2007. The bad news: It just stopped charging yesterday, June 24, 2015. I'm back to buy a replacement one and thought I would post this review. I consider myself a fairly simple man and will be trying to find a new model with the features this one has. I'm already leaning towards the Oral-B Pro-3000. Very impressive lifespan on this one and I'll have to just hope my next one lasts as long as this one. I remember when I bought this one. I couldn't believe an electric toothbrush would make that much difference, but it has. I'm planning on overnight shipping the next one just so I don't have to wait to have my electric toothbrush. I follow a pretty basic mouth cleaning process of: Full two minutes with the electric toothbrush as soon as I get out of bed. Two to three light brushings in the afternoon to evening. Then I used the electric toothbrush before going to bed, followed by a once over with my wife's water irrigation pick. I'll probably regret saying this, but I'm 40 now and haven't had a cavity since my mid-20s and while I gave up on the gleaming white smile, I'm still very happy to have made it this far without any dental problems. I credit this toothbrush for a lot of my oral health.

I've bought way too many charging cables over the years. Our household includes my elderly mom, my wife and two kids. When my wife upgraded to an iPhone 6 from a iPhone 4s, our son got her 4s to use just for iMessage and as a mp3 player. Mom was the last to upgrade from the 4s. Since there's hardly no value in selling or trading the 4s, I told her I would take it to use as a mp3 player. The standard charging cable that came with her 4s wasn't long enough to reach the back of my computer's USB ports so I needed a longer one to charge it and to register it to my iTunes. This charging cable was priced good and looked like good quality so I ordered it. It has a very good snug fit in the phone, also has the longer length I needed and has worked flawlessly for a few months now.

This is a handy in-wall surge protector. I bought one for our daughter's room. She loves to read and use her laptop. This small surge protector was all she needed for her personal reading space in her room. She uses it to plug her laptop into, the laptop speakers and a small desk fan. Then plugs her cellphone and Kindle into the USB ports to charge. It's a nice, inexpensive way to keep a small work/play space organized.

The best of the Latin Kindle books for those who already have at least some grasp of Latin. I think my second year Latin class in high school was the last year my high school offered Latin since so many people were taking Spanish or French. I remember more from my Latin classes than any other classes in high school. It's such a diverse language that helps you with other languages/vocabulary. I bought this book just to touch up on my past education in Latin and it served that purpose well.

If everyone read these books and absorbed their wisdom, practiced the wisdom, I really believe we would all be living in a much more peaceful and pleasant world. If you ever become frustrated with current society, give this book a read (or any of the Stoics) and you might be surprised to see you're more like them than the society you live in. The book is relaxing to read.

I'm always trying to work on my writing style, especially grammar, word usage and it's mostly because I'm a 40 year old dyslexic with a PhD. I generally avoided writing-based classes in my ten years of college. I've tried more than a dozen Kindle books about writing and this was the most educational. It reminds me somewhat of a book I had in college years ago. Had a spiral-bound backing and was required for Composition classes. I don't remember the name of it, but it was helpful back then. This also helps with the kids since they are getting into writing and are always asking me questions, for tips, and this book is filled with tips and answers questions about writing. That's what I like in a book that's supposed to "teach" me. I would recommend it to anyone who wants to improve their writing skills.

Our 12 year old daughter insisted on buying this for her friend's birthday. You know, kids these days, right? The day it arrived her friend was at our house and they took turns putting it on, running around the yard, dancing with it on and jumping on the trampoline with it on. I was guaranteed by my daughter that "it will be so funny!" Did I mention kids these days? I'll give it four stars since it's nicely made and they seemed to enjoy playing with it. Our daughter's friend looked at me and said, "Don't you know what the horse's head is?" I said, "An iconic tribute to the scene in the Godfather?" She said. "What's the Godfather? It's from Gangnam Style!" I said, "What's Gangnam Style?" So we all came away from the day a little more educated too.

There's not a lot that can be said about a bath mat set, but here goes...My wife and I have two sets of memory foam bath mat sets, two in the bathroom and two in half bathroom connected to our master bath. Our kids love using our bathroom to take a shower just because they love stepping on our memory foam bath mats. We paid quite a bit more for our sets. In the fifty dollar range. If you have kids you know you can't spend that kind of money for bath mats for their bathroom unless you want to buy a new set every few years. We just happened to catch these on sell, the brown color only, but it works well with their bathroom. It's themed partially with a beach theme with a couple of monkey accessories. We know, monkeys and beaches don't really mix, but it's shared by a 12 year old girl (beach) and 10 year old boy (monkeys). Anyway, the bath mats are nice-looking. They feel of good quality as well. You know there's a "but" coming. But, the ends roll up on them. This shouldn't be that big of a problem except the one in front the sink actually rolls up enough that their bathroom door won't close unless you move the rug or hold your foot on the end of it. My rating of 3 stars is maybe unfair since we did get them for under ten dollars, but seeing that their regular price is at least double that, I think the 3 stars is justified. It's not a bad product by any means and again, quality and looks are both very good. Seems to be a design flaw on the ends though. Would recommend the set if you're just putting them in the kids bathroom or even a guest bathroom.

This is my fifth humidifier review here on Amazon and it's maybe the funniest. Not the review, but the situation around using this humidifier. Lets get one thing out of the way, there's no way this humidifier can run for 100 hours on one tank of water. I've used it for 7 straight days/nights and had to refill each day. It will get roughly 24 hours on one full tank of water, running on medium for those 24 hours. It would be an understatement to say I've been frustrated with humidifiers. They're either too frustrating to clean or they don't put out enough mist or they have some kind of fan that blows the mist over my bed while I sleep. Believe it or not, I liked this one and wanted to try it based on the fact that the company has accessories for it. I don't like buying extra parts for anything, but with all my humidifier problems, it's nice to see a company making efforts to fix problem areas in their products.So, what was so funny? I either hook up a new humidifier in our kitchen or bathroom and let it run for a little while before trying it in our bedroom. I filled the tank up on this one, turned the one knob to "cool", turned the mist control knob up about halfway and nothing happened. I had just returned a Vornado that misted whenever it decided it wanted to or whenever I pushed it. So I pushed this one. No mist. I left the room and left it running. I go back 10 minutes later and it looks like someone is having a misting convention in our bathroom. There was lots of mist coming out. I immediately turned it off and back on to see if it was going to be one of those frustrating humidifiers that are inconsistent in their misting. It wasn't. The mist started right up. I then, for fun, turned the mist all the way up and I was surprised over how much mist came out.I rated this a 5 star, but it's not without its faults. I agree with everyone who says there isn't any warm mist coming out of the humidifier. I tried it three times, the unit acts like it's switching as it pauses when you turn the knob from cool to warm, but it doesn't feel any different. This doesn't bother me. I couldn't imagine using warm mist. I'm one of those people who sleeps with a ceiling fan on all year, only use one blanket all year, so the cool mist is the only feature I am interested in, but it should be mentioned that I also don't feel warm mist coming out of this humidifier.There's another part that should be mentioned. This humidifier is harder to fill than the others I've reviewed. The tank is awkward if you're used to any other type of humidifier. Filling it is easy and the valve to close it, closes very tight. Maybe it's the orientation of the tank though that causes a few problems. I fill ours in the bathroom. The bathroom is about 20 ft from our bedroom. I drip water taking the tank to the bathroom and back to the bedroom. I've added a hand towel near it to stop this problem. I wouldn't think this humidifier would be easy for say a kid, an elderly person to fill and refill.That's probably enough cons to question why I would rate it 5 stars. It works. The spout the mist comes out of has two spouts. You could send mist to the right of the humidifier and to the left. I personally turn both towards our bed. This is the first humidifier I have tried that sends mist to both my wife and I. She's always complained about me using the humidifier and blocking the mist from her. This one puts out enough mist that it reaches both of us. Cleaning is pretty standard, but they've made one part easier. The plunger that releases the water from the tank has a square plastic housing around it instead of round. This gives me enough room to get a toothbrush in there to clean it instead of trying to come up with a way to clean the smaller round housing on most humidifiers. The tube in the middle that the water goes into to create the mist is also easily accessible and can be cleaned with a dish-type brush or if you're in a bind, stick a washcloth in it and swab it back and forth.While I do use humidifiers to keep the air in our house moist, it's also relaxing for me to feel the cool mist blowing on my face while I sleep. This one does that better than any I've used. It also has a few features others may like. It has a light you can turn on. It's fairly bright too. I could see that being used in a kid's room or baby nursery as a night light. There's also a red light on it for when it runs out of water. Both are nice features that I see customers posting questions about.The best part, at least for my wife, it's the quietest humidifier I've used. You will hear a soft gurgle maybe two to three times an hour and it's only for a few seconds. I also rated an Optimus humidifier a 5 star and still think it is. It's just I believe this one is better overall. Most of these extra features won't be used by me, but my only real concerns are cleaning and how much mist is put out. This one is the best are those two of all the humidifiers I've reviewed. On a side note, I'm now curious about their smaller one that's half the price of this one. If those problems, the weight of the filled tank, the awkwardness of carrying the tank, the no warm mist problem are major problems for you then you might look at that smaller one by this company or check out the Honeywell or Optimus I reviewed. Both of those perform well and have similar strengths to this one they just don't put out as much mist as this one. If you try one of these be sure to give it time to get the mist going on the first use. I was ready to pack it up and ship it back until the mist started coming out.

So fun!These are mostly VERY simple tricks and tips to add some whimsy and charm to hairstyles, focusing ONLY on long straight "white" hair.The first section focuses on tips and basic things like hiding elastics when making a pony tail, tying your hair different ways, curling your hair with and without heat, caring for your hair (shampoos, conditioners, etc), and similar things.The second part has some cute crafty ideas like applying pearls or flowers, doing things with ribbon, decorating your brush, making a tiara, embellishing hair combs, doing headbands...This book is lots of fun IF you have the "right" hair for it.If you have ANY other type of hair (curly, kinky, medium or short), there is pretty much nothing for you here.

Here's what it needs: a guide on how to do many of the accents. It could be a booklet, an app with some videos or sounds, or even just a page of qr codes leading to a website with fun hints.Alone, expect a lot of "so...how do I do this?" Followed by a weak attempt and anything ranging from annoyance to frustration and pleas to skip cards.The accompanying phrases are often lackluster as well.This needs some work, but might be playable if done with theater people and actors. The fact I am both and didn't really like it doesn't so much help, but neither does the fact we were sober. I only see this being fun with some added ingredients like silly tutorials, or more likely, alcohol.This doesn't stand on its own very well.

Great, once they get hungry enough to eat it because they realize there is no other choice. My cat is fat. 18lbs fat. She eats emotionally because she hates my other cat, and from time to time, suffers random murder attempts from her.To top things off, she is now on a diet because the vet said things are out of hand, which means I have to separate them to feed them. This would be easier if I didn't have to wait for my lovely but fat kitty to Finally eat.Time will tell if she loses weight, but the hunger strike is (maybe) a start?As for the ingredients, the grain free thing is great, and while my vet generally prefers wet food, this one has some pretty decent ingredients.

Strangely enough, my favorite parts of the book are the various introductions.In school, we often are forced to read these plays, which is already the most abstract and distanced way to connect (or as is often the case, disconnect) from the intent of the writer. They are meant to be seen by performers. Add to this the florid language, and students often feel alienated. By adding prefaces that show how we relate in our modern lives to the beautiful masterpieces of the Greeks, we can change our perspectives and see the universal truths inside.The translations maintain a certain classical quality, still lofty and elegant, while simplifying and paring down wherever possible, trimming the excess and leaving behind mostly bone and sinew. This allows the listener/reader/audience to fill in the blanks and put a modern voice to something hundreds and hundreds of years old.More than ever, in our militarized society, these plays provide a timeless commentary on the brutality of war. Sublime!

It hurts so good.Anyone that uses a foam roller knows what I mean. You just beat those little knots and sore spots into submission, and yes, it hurts SO much, and if you're not used to it, you might initially think "I don't want to do this to myself. Why, oh god, why is this happening to me?", but when you stop after Really getting in there, you realize it was the cure.When it's time to buckle down and deal with the aftermath of a serious workout, this is a great supplement to the foam roller.YES. Bring the delicious pain of impending relief. You are the one, gaiam massager.:-D

This book is so sincere and so beautifully written. It's kind of amazing to find something like this in a time of cynicism, but there is so much hope and so many good intentions in each page; it is heartwarming. Aside from all that, this book is credible and relatable. It speaks DIRECTLY to victims of bullying FROM someone who was herself bullied. Her reassurances that things will be ok and that there are ways to overcome and survive these hard years mean so much more for all of the above. It's not coming from a grown-up, from someone generations away, out of touch or unable to understand; it is not by a psychologist or teacher, which while sympathetic, still feels far removed from the problem. It is by a teenager that just came out of it and is now basking in the silver linings she found.Then there's the format! It is very readable and organized, aesthetic and approachable, broken apart in chapters that work for skimming or reading in order, and introduced with rap poetry. It is beautifully-written and impactful, filled with power and triumph, poignant and captivating.This is a revolutionary book in the self-help genre for younger people. I recommend it to ANY kid, not just those being bullied. Great!

Get ready for a rough leg day! Offering three resistance levels and several options for use in the box, these are a great supplement to my pliometric based workouts. As-is, they offer plenty of benefits, but if you get creative, there are far more. For example, you can hook them to one foot (step on it), and then use them for bicep curls. You can put your hands through and use them like bands as well. These are great at what they're meant for and still versatile enough for other applications.

In an age of technology, video/online games, tablets, and tv, it is getting harder to get kids to connect with real life things, which is why toys like these are so important. This is messy, fun, creative, and most importantly, REAL. Kids use their hands to physically create something. They feel the materials and mold them into whatever their imagination decides (though truthfully, the molds have a better outcome, but who cares as long as they're having a good time and using their imaginations?)The only downside is that you will soon have to buy refills, and as of the date I am reviewing this, the item here retails for $21.55 Prime, but the refills are $17.03 (not Prime, but with free shipping). Even worse, this product says it makes up to 20 clings, while the refill says it only makes 10. Do the math, and you'll see why this is disappointing in the same way buying printer ink is.Aside from the expenses, mess, and potential additional problems from clings on a hot day on the window, this is a great concept and is lots of fun!

The issue with upgrading an amplifier for your car is much like getting fancy rims. If your car is a piece of garbage, the fanciest of rims are going to do much. The same is true with speakers. The problem with this was that my speakers weren't good enough for this to make much of a difference, so it wasn't really worth paying someone to install this to boost my limited speakers. It would have been a bit silly as well as a waste of money, so I am waiting until I find better speakers or find someone that will do it for cheap.  It's definitely not the sort of thing you install yourself unless you're already versed in modifying your car. Between the warning labels and enough self-awareness to know this isn't my specialty, I can tell you what the mechanic told me:This is a great way to get the most out of your existing speakers, especially if you don't have Bluetooth, which this would provide. The product is sturdy and pretty powerful, but the other side of the coin is that your car battery gets worn down faster if you plan to listen to music with these. In other words, leave the car on if you're using this for any length of time.

These towels are thick enough to not require using many of them, which is great for saving money. The thing to consider is the dispenser. If you have a business and are ok with the industrial look, then this is great. Otherwise, if you have other aesthetic plans or want a specific look for your bathroom, you might pass. It depends more on the context.

This nifty little gadget makes travel with a group or with a crazy person like myself with many gadgets easier. Allowing for FOUR USB ports, as well as an additional outlet, this charger fits into the cup holder of your car and creates a hub for tablets, phones, kindles....anything that works off USB, and it even has the additional port like the one it plugs into.Perfect size, lots of options, and ideal for groups or people with numerous devices!

We used this with our carpet deep cleaning vacuum to do a section on the house, and it performed very well and was comparable to other name brands. Since e had recently tested the wet vacuum, it was hard to see any contrast, but the house definitely smelled fresh and the minor scuffs and stains from the last month or two went away. Great!

The cream consistency as you apply it to your skin feels very smooth smooth and as you shave, creating a smooth lubrication for the razor to glide across your skin. The softness lasts beyond the shave as skin stays hydrated and smelling crisp and fresh. A lovely and luxurious feeling alternative to conventional aerosol shaving mousses and creams.

At a little under $2 per label, these are pretty expensive. Having said that, the concept is pretty cool. Write and re-write on the labels with chalk or chalk pens! It works as described, even though the surface feels nothing like chalk board (probably a good thing), but they're not exactly re-usable in the larger sense. The issue is the thinness of the stickers and the adhesive. They only stick so much the first time, and each subsequent time is a little weaker. If they had made them thicker and had some other options for the backing, it would have been better. Then, instead of being a disposable item, it could be more like a gift in itself by being able to be applied in various places. Pretty cool, and if you pick a surface you are keeping, these will probably last a while!
Everyone loves them, especially me. Aside from the edgy and sexy look, they're comfortable! I was scared to buy shoes online, but it really worked out.
What a cheap and useless product. Even when following the instructions, the results look bad and don't last long. Expect ruined clothing.

This thing is horribly proportioned to look more like a guy than a woman. She has no hips of bust and is just wide with a blocky profile. I have to add hips by crudely taping crumpled bags to the sides to make this thing look female and display my garments in a way that looks flattering. Are there some women shaped like this? Sure. But it's pretty uncommon. Most women, including plus size ones, have bigger hips and thighs. What happened here?!
It would have made more sense to have two slots for bills and fewer for coins. This is only useful for garage sales and similar things with LOW prices per transaction.

The hand painting is done with a sharpie.If that's not enough, the bowl doesn't play well. Of all the singing bowls I've bought (about 5), this is the worst in terms of sound as well as quality. Is it the cheapest? It's definitely in the lower end...and you get what you paid for.

This is a great concept! This soft and cuddly mat creates a comforting surface for baby with varied textures to explore. Mostly, it is Very soft, but there are slippery satin parts, some textured spots, and our favorite, crunchy bits that crinkle and make noise when touched! Lots of fun and a nice place to hang out on the floor.

I'm a huge spongebob fan and have always loved building blocks, so obviously, this has to get 5 stars from me. The models are very true to she show, and the mini figures are fun to play with...I mean...if you're a kid. (Whatever. It's fun!) I already have a replica of the Krusty Krab (I think it might be by Lego?), so I'm working my way through bikini bottom!

The gloves have a great fit, nice grip, and feel strong. They're great for cleaning, dying and bleaching hair, and other commercial and industrial applications, and the look is nicer than the white or gray ones. Excellent, and decent-priced!

Just from reading the introduction, it is immediately apparent that this book is written with lots of love and inspiration. It is truly a beautiful book for any family and is filled with not only budget-friendly, but creative and fun projects you and your child (of ANY gender!) will deeply enjoy. And I don't mean in the sense that you're happy they're happy but the activity kind of sucks for you. NO. I mean these are generally fun for ALL participants, and in many cases, will yield some really neat-looking goodies!The fun stuff inside includes art projects using commonplace and inexpensive components, repurposing things that might have been discarded (desiccated oranges, matchboxes, stuff from leftover candle wax from used candles, etc.), as well as some learning things, and a couple of cool tricks.The only note I have is the title. I don't really understand why the author chose to target this to girls, when these activities don't generally feel gendered. That, plus the fact it is likely to discourage boys because it appears to specifically be Not for them. I like to think we are moving pass that kind of thinking, so parents out there: This is for ALL your kids!

I know this is meant for your face, but I don't need it for that (female); what I DO need it for is my armpits. I tend to have horrible irritation and breakouts there from infected hairs, and this works great to prevent that.A couple things to note for facial use: this makes you photosensitive (meaning you shouldn't get sun) and can really dry things out.One issue: this bleached my wash towels which was a really nice color. KEEP AWAY FROM ANY FABRIC--it will bleach it.

This doll has a really neat mix of nostalgia and contemporary details that come together in a cool way. It reminds me a little of my Raggedy Anne doll I had growing up, and I loved her! She had similar yarn hair, a fabric face, the striped leggings and vibrant but "raggedy" look, yet the colors and styles are more updated with this doll.Her arms and legs come off, so you can mix or mismatch the leggings and sleeves, as well as change hairstyles and accessories. I will say, it would have been cooler if there had been more outfits to go with her, maybe with some shoe overlays so you don't have to change the whole leg.One last detail I saw another reviewer mention that I Really liked was the fact she could be modified to match a child's disability, like a missing limb, for example. That can be a really big deal for a kid wanting to identify with their toy!Modern and old-fashioned come together perfectly with this doll!

More than a toy, these have a quality of a collector's item. There is a great deal of detail and love put into the figure and accessories that gives this a sense of realism and warmth. Aside from the appearance and feel, it is great for any child that loves horses (and there are many!), and maybe even for adults that have kept the inner child alive. Beautiful, good quality, and very realistic!

This was easy and Quick to assemble, and once together, was super comfortable. This gets 5 stars from all of us!A few things to consider:*it doesn't roll while seated, which is good--this makes it safer, since it's a little different than being in a normal chair.*you can remove the ball inside and use it for fitness--this one is smaller, since it is for kids, but the smaller size works for them for fitness since it's proportional to their little framesThis is a Great option for a child's seating, especially to keep them entertained. Fidgeting is ok, and this is a great way to let them do it while still taking care of their schoolwork!

What an elegantly crafted set! I own a few Henckels knives and scissors and am familiar with the quality of their products. This is definitely in keeping with the precision and design the brand is known for. The scissors are very James Bond, and I hate to admit I had to read the instructions to figure them out. They're pretty clever and streamlined! The file is of excellent quality as well, and the precision with which everything lines up for the nose hair trimmer is pretty impressive. Having said that, the last item pinches a lot. Maybe I haven't figured out the rhythm of how to use it, but the nose hair trimmers really pull on those hairs, so I had to take a star off. It hurts! In good news, they are manual and do not require batteries. The case is leather, very elegant, and has room to add a few other toiletries like Q-tips or little manicure scissors, or something of comparable size.Excellent product with an upscale price tag. Nice if you can afford it!

The rules were sparse and vague, simple to a fault. Depending on the choices players make, the game can last as little as about 10 minutes. In the event of a tie, we chose to put all the pieces and did some Russian roulette.We ran out of berries after just a few turns.It was exciting to see where the fist would land, but for me, that wore off quickly.
