I just add about 3 or 4 drops of "Teliaoil's" oregano to an empty capsule, and fill the rest of the capsule up with "Amazing Herbs Black Seed Oil" (follow with a meal, or a large glass of water/liquid).  A must have for the cold & flu season!!

I absolutely love these fruit snacks!  In fact they are my favorite out of the other "natural" brands I've tried-- "Yummy Earth", and "Surf Sweets".Amazon for a time was selling the 2.75 oz. bags for about a dollar a piece (but now they're back up to $2.50+ per).I thought I was getting a similar deal through VitaCost, but to my dismay, it's only a box of five .08 oz. pouches, and therefore not worth the price (in my opinion)!Nowhere on the product page does it say how big the bags are. I should have checked VC's website to make sure; next time when it's not specific, I guess I will.

Wow, I can't believe how quick and easy this gluten free bread mix is!!  My family and I have tried making a gluten free mix or two in the past; then resorted to following a recipe (such as one by "Gluten Free Mama"), but none of them have ever been this simple!I ended up using a "quick rise" yeast packet (which is NOT provided), and following the ingredient suggestion exactly (the egg, AND yeast is optional).  The other two ingredients are 1 3/4 cups warm water, and 2 tablespoons oil (used grapeseed).  I poured the warm water in with the packet of yeast, then followed with the beaten egg, and oil mixture.  Then simply let rise atop preheated (gas) stove, which only took about 20-30 min.Actual baking time took 30 minutes (can go up to 40 if need be).  After baking, I turned out onto glass dish (directions say wire rack), and immediately sliced.  It is a bit moist (which was to be expected since I didn't let it rest); but sliced without crumbling.  The taste is great!  Nothing is overpowering or "off".I actually purchased this on the "Warehouse" side, and saved a few extra dollars (it was $15 something)-- so really, per box, it was cheaper than a loaf of GF frozen bread at the store!In conclusion my family and I are completely happy and satisfied with this particular mix, and will consider purchasing "Australis Foods" products in the future!______________Edit:  The second time I made it, the yeast didn't make the bread rise (even though it was fresh, and fast acting). I'm thinking that just as traditional bread recipes call for a bit of sugar to feed the yeast, that is what should be done for this. Also, instead of mixing all ingredients together right away, let the yeast/sugar/water sit for 5 min's or so (until frothy), then add the rest!

This is my first experience with "Tiptree", and I chose this particular kind to go with homemade gluten free scones, and "Devon Cream" (or as they call it in the UK-- "cream tea").  ..My family and I absolutely loved it!  The mini whole strawberries are really darling, and DELICIOUS!  I would say this is the BEST strawberry jam/jelly/preserve/conserve I've tried to date!  (FYI: Their 72, 1 ounce jars contain their regular strawberry, NOT "Scarlet" preserves.)In conclusion, I can't wait to order another product from this company!______EDIT:  I have since tried the "Damson" (plum) conserve/preserve, and "Tiptree Strawberry" conserve/preserve-- both with great success!  (And have yet to open their "Tiptree Orange" *medium cut* marmalade.)

First off, I don't own a microwave, so instead of nuking it for 3 1/2 minutes as directions say, I added boiling water to the line, stirred, and returned to the pan to cook (there is actually no printed "stove-top" method, I just used my noodle *pun intended*, and tried it anyway)...For those campers that don't have an RV style kitchen, and are considering this product, this is what you can do!Personally, the taste is neither rave worthy, nor disgusting enough to throw away.  Thankfully I received it at a great discount price (in the $4 range for 6), so I'm not upset about the cash spent.  The sodium count is a bit high though (670 mg. or 28% of  daily value).  I didn't exactly measure the cooked portion, but I would say it's about 1 cup or a tad over.  It DOES have corn (oil) in it, so for those with an allergy, be warned.  It is however "free from wheat, gluten, soy, eggs, and nuts".I can see how this would be very convenient for those who like to cook via  microwave, and need something gluten free in a hurry.  ..But for me, I much prefer Annie's brand (regular or "creamy deluxe"), if I want boxed GF mac & cheese.Another option would be to buy "Riega (Gluten Free) Cheese Sauce Mix"- there's different flavors: Alfredo, Yellow or White Cheddar, or Pepper Jack. Add your choice of gluten free noodle.Personally, if I'm craving cheese and noodles I usually make a 2 person serving of Fettuccine Alfredo (old "Taste of Home" recipe), with "A Taste of Thai" wide) noodles, to share with another family member.  Or if it's just myself- fast and simple version: grated parmesan cheese, TBSP of butter, splash of cream or half & half, a little ground nutmeg & black pepper/salt.

My household was out oats, so I made a search on Amazon, and decided to try a brand we've not yet tasted.  Since I gravitate toward food items from the UK/Ireland (ancestral roots); and because it had such great reviews, I decided to order this. I prepared it with 1 cup whole milk, and 1 1/2 cups water, and within a few minutes it was done! (I served mine up with a dash of cinnamon, and a sprinkling of coconut sugar- after tasting it alone).  ...This is hands down the best tasting oats my family and I have ever tasted!  It's not chewy or tough, and it doesn't require pre-soaking to get a smooth texture.  I don't recall having seen this brand in my local store, so when we run out, I'll be re-ordering!

I bought a package of this product at the store, being it was my first time trying it. Because the sodium content is high, I decided to thin it out by adding  a can of low sodium garbanzo beans (chick peas) that I rinsed/drained. I also sauteed an onion and about 6 smaller cloves of garlic, before adding the package, and extra beans.  I would think if a person eats it this way, the sodium content is not as bad; plus, it about doubles the serving size!Tomorrows left-overs will be combined with my favorite brown rice ("Mekong" by Lotus Foods) to make it a complete meal!Those that love curry, or are vegetarian should really enjoy this!

I just received these today.  This is my first experience with this brand, so I wasn't sure what to expect.  The color and nice silver sheen are very pleasing.  I did try them on, but have not worn them out yet.I will say this, that although I checked the sizing prior, and found that my height (5'2"-5'3") and weight are within the "A" range, I think the next time I order this brand, I will buy the "B".  They fit fine, but I'd like a little bit more length at the waist.  I was told by a friend, that to extend the life of your nylons, to wash prior to wearing.  I'm doing some research on the net, to see what people have to say on that.  In doing so, I came across a helpful page called "Protecting Pantyhose" at Stretcher (dot) com.  I'll update this review if I find they run fast; but so far so good!  I also plan on trying some of the other colors too.

The reason I purchased this was because it happened to be the cheapest organic whole bean coffee I could find that day (at least on Amazon).  The one good review it had made me hopeful.  I just received this today; and finished my 2nd cup just a few moments ago.  The only thing I added to it was some half & half.  I must say that this is probably the least flavorful organic coffee that I've ordered ("Camano Island", "Cameron's", "Jeremiah's Pick", & "Cafe Altura")!  Upon opening the bag there's no pungent coffee aroma-- you pretty much have to stick your nose in it to get a scent.  The bag itself is the thinnest I've received (compared to the above ones I mentioned); which will most likely not help in keeping it fresh.  It's about as thin as a chip bag found in the grocery store.  ...I do store my coffee in the freezer, hoping that it will lock in the freshness.The beans look okay; but I've had beans with a much more oily coat than these.  The taste itself is pretty bland.  There's nothing extremely discernable about it.  Maybe the SLIGHTEST hint of chocolate, but not much..  It's not terrible, but if you're expecting a dark rich flavor from this, be advised.Lastly, the number on the bag is untraceable.  If you go to GoodOrigin (dot) com , you can search to see which farm it came from.  However, upon choosing the right product, the pull down number tab does not yet contain the number on my bag (280720).  I'll give this 3 stars for the fact that it's Organic and "UTZ Certified"; but as for buying this again-- I'll pass!

I've been using different kinds of mud/clay mixtures for years to diminish blemishes, and cleanse pores.  However, none of the ingredients in those have ever compared to this!  This is totally natural, and there's so many wonderful Indian/Ayurvedic herbs in this!!  I was reading about the benefits of using Amalaki/Indian Gooseberry on your face; and after some research, I learned that it's a wonderful source of vitamin C (antioxident), that also comes in supplement form.  That's actually how I found this product (after searching Amalaki on VitaCost).  After reading some of the reviews, and going over the product list, I thought I'd give it a try.Well, tonight was my first application, which I applied to my face, and part of my neck.  The directions say to keep the mud wet, so I did.  It has a cooling feeling; very pleasant.  The fragrance is very interesting, but not offensive in the least!  I left it on for about a half hour, and rinsed off.  The end result, is that it didn't overly dry my face like some other mud/clay mixtures.  It gave me a nice light rosy glow (and a more even complexion), and my skin felt soft!!  I still had some left over, so after the initial rinse off, I used a little bit as spot application.  The previous carbon mask I was using will now be replaced with this (it's actually more economical too)!!!  I will be sure to make a note if anything changes; but my first impression is that I absolutely love it!!

First off, I don't claim to be a tea connoisseur, especially when it comes to black.  I've tried cheap store brands, as well as PG Tip's.  I have to say that out of them all, "Clipper" is by far the best!!  The taste is not overpowering, it's very mellow and pleasant (and it didn't make my tongue feel overly dry)!  It also didn't stuff my nose up (which could have been a possible chemical allergy to the other ones).  The price was fantastic as well (a little over $2 a box)-- especially considering it's organic AND fair trade!!In conclusion I'm extremely impressed; and anxious to try more teas from this company!

There's a new gelatin in town!!  I've made a concerted effort to watch what eat the past couple of years.  Because "Jell-O" contains dyes in their products, I decided to search for a healthier alternative.  Being that this was on sale, and had good reviews, I ordered this and the instant vanilla pudding.  Both are fantastic tasting; I'm extremely pleased!  I actually ended up ordering a second pack of the (regular) strawberry before it sold out.  It's great plain, but if you really want a decadent dessert, try adding a touch of whipping/whipped cream over top =>O  I hope to continue ordering from this company in the future-- so please keep selling it Amazon!!  Also, if anyone from "Better Bowls" happens to read this, please try and expand your gelatin line!!

I initially found these little gems under the "manager's special" section; and what a sweet deal they were!  Actually, this was my first experience with "golden berries".  I had previously thought of buying them plain- due to their health benefits, etc.  However, when I found these covered in dark chocolate, I just couldn't resist!!  If given a choice, I would pick these over chocolate covered raisins any day of the week- they're just that good!  I love the slight sour bite of the golden berries; and the (60%) dark chocolate compliments them perfectly!!  This is now my favorite chocolate covered item next to "Kopali Chocolate Covered Espresso Beans"!  I also love the fact that they're organic.  ...Now if only Amazon would start selling these again!!

First off, here are the nutrition facts, being that I haven't been able to find them online:Serving Size: 1/2 cup (57 g.), Servings per container: 1Amount Per Serving:Calories: 237Calories From Fat: 80Total Fat: 9 gSaturated Fat: 2 gTrans Fat: 0 gCholesterol: 0 mgSodium: 17 mgTotal Carbohydrate: 32 gDietary Fiber: 6 gSugars: 5 gProtein: 9 gVitamin A: 0% , Calcium: 3% , Vitamin C: 0% , Iron: 12% Ingredients: Certified Gluten Free Whole Grain Oats, Peanuts (peanuts, peanut oil, salt), Semi-Sweet Chocolate Chips (sugar, chocolate liquor, cocoa butter, dextrose, soya lecithin), Agave Nectar, Grapeseed Oil, and Cinnamon__________  My review is short and simple.  I will not be purchasing this particular flavor again!  Either the cinnamon was overpowering (and I like cinnamon), or the flavors just didn't meld.  It almost had a roasted/burnt coffee aftertaste.  I have been satisfied with the oat bran, and oats from this company in the past; but I'm a little hesitant to try any more of their granola.  You're probably better off making your own!

I had been craving a soda cracker/saltine for a long time, but because have a gluten sensitivity, I can't.  I saw these at the local health food store a couple of months ago (on sale I might add), and couldn't resist!  These are very much like their gluten counterparts (without the salt topping)!  If you've ever tried Glutino's GF pretzels, these taste similar.  They come in one large "board" (like graham crackers do), not in individual squares like "Zesta", etc.  (So, one board is about equal to 4 regular saltines).  They also come in 2 sets (about 6 or so in each), encased in plastic.  They're very sturdy too.  I put chilled nut butter on mine, and as long as I don't press to hard with my knife, and spread a little at a time, I have no problems with it breaking.  ..I haven't tried the Enger-G brand yet, but I'd like to see if the 2 brands are similar in taste.  I'm hoping that Amazon will start selling this ("Subscribe & Save" would be even better)!! *hint, hint*

This is the 2nd variety of rice that I've tried from this brand.  (FYI, the "Forbidden" (black/purple) rice is out of this world!!)  Being that this is organic, ecologically farmed, and fairly traded- the price seems extremely reasonable (especially with the "subscribe & save" discount)!  The reviews seemed promising, so I took the plunge!!  Thankfully they were all right on target; hands down, this is the BEST brown rice my family and I have ever tried! It's not tough, or chewy, and doesn't take very long to cook.  To be honest, when I first opened the bag, the scent almost smelled a little rancid (but maybe that's just the way rice bran smells??).  However, our fears were allayed with the first bite!  It's got a very pleasing taste, and not overpowering.  I've tried it in 4 different dishes/ways, and each time it's been a perfect addition!  (With Kung Pao chicken & veggies, in a "Nueva Cocina" chili mix, homemade lentil soup, and with cinnamon, sugar, and milk.)  I'm definitely looking forward to trying more of the "Lotus Foods" rice varieties; but I'm sure I'll be buying another bag of this before too long!!EDIT:  Since the above review, I purchased the "Madagascar Pink", sadly my family and I didn't like it as well as the "Mekong". It was a bit dry and bland.We also tried the "Jade Pearl", and liked it much better than the "MP".While it's definitely a rice suited for sushi makers, we purchased it to try with stir-fry's and such.  It's actually really tasty with Chicken "Korma".______After ordering the "Mekong" twice, I decided to switch to a brown Thai Jasmine (by "Village Harvest"). In short it's EXCELLENT, and a new favorite staple in my kitchen!

This is only the 2nd time I've ever tried chocolate covered espresso beans.  The first was some non organic unhealthy brand an acquaintance purchased at a store.  Obviously they didn't much impress me, because I never went out and bought any.  To be totally honest, I'm not even a coffee/caffeine lover!  And if I buy chocolate, I make sure it's really dark (in the high 60% to 80% range)- for its antioxidant properties!  Anyhow, being that these are certified organic, and fairly traded, I thought I'd buy a bag (Vitacost).  It arrived today; and all I can say is, it was love at first bite!!  Both the chocolate and espresso beans are the right acidity- not too bitter.  ..And just the right amount of sweetness!  It's hard, but I'm keeping myself in check, so that I can savor them for at least another day (and not be up all night from a caffeine overload) =oD  Hopefully these will come back in stock (at a reasonable price)- and SOON!!

They call these dazzle shorts because they have a bit of a sheen to the material that really stands out. LOL  The color of the orange and grey is nice looking... very muted other than the sheen.  No pockets.These shorts fall to knee level, maybe a bit lower. I did take off a star because in spite of them being one layer they are really ill shaped... just kind of a sloppy, baggy shape to them on my slim son.  Waist fits perfectly on him in his typical size he wears.  But the lower part is definitely a bit baggy.Good value/good pair of shorts, just not my favorite fit.

These are a good, basic STX short.  They are a bit roomier and not as well fitted as most of the STX shorts my sons have tried on.  However, the colors are super vibrant on this one and are super comfortable at the same time. It's double walled... so it has two layers of mesh which makes for a super comfortable short, but also a bit of a messy/non-fitted look to them.  I prefer the non mesh for this reason.Waist fits my slim size 12 son... but has plenty of room for an average waist as well.  No pockets. Fits to just below the knee.

Okay, I love this humidifier... but one warning. If you are wanting a warm mist it really doesn't have one... the warm is barely different than the cold.  It only heats the water up to 80 degrees for warm and it doesn't seem to really make a difference when it is coming out. My only other complaint is the ultrasonic. I know they say that it makes for a quiet humidifier (and it IS SUPER quiet), but they don't at all describe WHY this works or what it's doing. I had to look it up. Basically it vibrates at such a fast speed that it breaks up the water into fine bits to mist out.  The drawback to a supersonic is that it also sprays out any minerals that are in the water as DUST.  So you want to use super pure water in it as much as possible.  So just an FYI about how it works, and the reasons I took off a star.  I don't want to be negative about this humidifier though... IT'S A GREAT HUMIDIFIER:It holds A LOT of water. I had mine on full speed and warm water for 10 hours and it didn't even use half of the water. I see this lasting three nights. Which is REALLY nice, I was getting really annoyed with having to fill up my other one EVERY STINKIN' NIGHT!  This is probably the beat feature of this humidifier!It has a really nice looking night light if you want one; it makes the whole water tank glow blue.  It has three settings as far as how much mist it puts out. It has cold and hot setting too, but like I said above I don't really see much of a difference between the two.  It also has a handy little timer button... you can set it to go off after 4, 8 or 12 hours. Nice if you want it to go off when you wake up in the morning but won't remember to turn it off yourself.  It also has a refill reminder light for when it gets low.Keep in mind that if you are wanting this to help you sleep with white noise, you aren't choosing the right one... it's SUPER QUIET!!  LOLOverall I am super happy with my supersonic humidifier.  The best feature is that it lasts SO long!

These fit a little larger than most STX, a bit on the baggier side.  They fit my 12 year old son just right; but I prefer the other STX shorts he normally wears.  These have a double layer that adds a bit of bulk to them.  They are super comfortable however, and length is just below the knee.The mesh is see through only if you look through ONE side... so obviously it's just the bottom 1/2" that you can see through because the rest you can't see with the other side of the shorts on the other side!  It's very breathable, but a bit warmer with the double layer... so maybe a better fit for spring/winter/fall sports than summer.No pockets on these... just a good, comfy pair of shorts.

These are SUPER lightweight, very nice for the heat in the summer months.  Super breathable, a little stiff perhaps but still comfortable.  Construction and quality are very good, good stitching too.Fit goes to right below the knee, or more at knee level.  It's a perfect fit on my slim son; has enough wiggle room for an average sized waist as well. A bit slim fitting through the actual hip makes for a more tailored look... but still a nice enough long, loose cut that it is comfortable.Pockets are nice too... they have two good sized pockets (not huge like typical cargo shorts) on the sides; and it has a couple of little butt pockets that aren't super useful for much at all.Overall, my son really loves them and I can totally see him using them heavily in the summer months!

These are decent dress pants. My husband usually wears $70 dress pants so I wasn't sure how these were going to measure up.  They aren't bad but they definitely aren't anything super quality.The extender waist is awesome.  My husband, like many men his age, has a tendency to hold the weight in his waist. He's very slim and can only stand to lose several pounds, but it's always the waist that clings to him.  So to have the extra wiggle room is great. The extender works by having a strap you can pull tighter and then latch; and it has one on each side.  The drawback to that is he doesn't like the fact that it puts pressure on his gut area; which can cause him issues.  But it does work well as far as fit goes.Material is okay.  Honestly, it's 100% polyester and it didn't look great up close. Almost like a tablecloth. I was quite disappointed in that actually.Fit is okay too... it was a little long in the leg in spite of being his normal size.  And it's a bit baggy from front to back too.  Again, nothing hugely problematic, just little things that you slightly notice.Overall, it's a really good value and a good pair of low cost dress pants. But don't expect to be getting anything close to the quality of what you can get in a more expensive store.  That being said, for it's price range it's WORLDS above what you can get at Wal-mart and other cheap stores for THE SAME PRICE. So a really, really good choice if you are watching every penny and can't afford to spend a fortune on pants.

These go BARELY below the knee, more at knee level, on my 11 year old son.  They are REALLY thin in material, but not low quality, just a very lightweight short, perfect for summer.  They have two back pockets on the butt which are small and not very useful, but they have two cargo pockets on the sides of the leg which have a decent (not a ton) of room for a phone or other boy stuff.Waist fits nice on my slim son; he has some wiggle room. If your son is average or slim it will fit fine.  It has a very slim fit along the hips; more of a hip hugger, and then straight down from the leg.  It actually makes for a very nice looking short, very tailored looking.My son really loves these!

This fits my 7 year old son perfectly. He's slimmer around the waist, and it fits him fine; but if your son was a bit thicker it would have plenty of stretchiness to fit as well.It's a longer short, right below the knee, but it doesn't look "too" baggy.  Just a good, comfy short.  The mesh is a little see through just along the bottom inch or so; I tested it in front of a sunny window and the rest is totally fine. I was a bit worried about that. LOL  So it's REALLY breathable without being see through, which is perfect! My son loves these shorts though, and the price is super reasonable!

This is t-shirt material and not the typical STX material shirt.  It is a good basic t-shirt... fits perfectly from side to side (more fitted but not too much) and is a bit long, goes down to the lower hips on my 9 year old son.  He usually wears a size 8... this one fits, but I think it's a little long still. Not a problem, he is not picky, and it's not long enough to bug my fashion views.Material is super comfy for a t-shirt.  Not like a decades worn out t-shirt.... but just a super soft, on the thicker side material.  Softer than most t-shirts.

This shirt is great. It's super silky/smooth feeling, has nice bright colors, and fits perfectly.  It's very eye popping... not the most out of the STX shirts I've seen, but it has a nice balance between looks and comfort.It breathes really well even if your child is sweating a lot, and it has nice interlocking stitching. I love that it's made in Egypt and not in China.A good, basic shirt at a very reasonable price!

We take long road trips and this really comes in handy when you aren't sure of the speed limit, or when your foot has a tendency to become a dead weight... One reminder from this radar detector and you watch your speed!!We have used it on an all day trip across two states and it really does work perfectly. A couple quick minor false alarms but otherwise it was super accurate. I don't mind it being safe and going off more, and it remembers the false alarms and won't pay attention to them after that if they are static spots.It's truly plug and play. I didn't want to mess with it and it was perfect for that.  I know I can set it up with the app but I didn't want that detailed of control.  I simply put it in my charger and it went to work.It's much smaller than I thought only about 4" by 5", and super sharp looking with the copper highlights.VERY happy. Simple for your first detector, and detailed for those who want to fine tune it!

Other than the software disc being useless, this printer is top notch.  It hooked up to my Moto X phone in just seconds, and once I simply went into my printer settings on my computer it found it wirelessly and installed it in seconds.So how does it print?  Very nice!! I found it to be a tad yellow on some whiter photos but I can adjust it a little. The quality of pixels was amazing, even on plain cheap paper it looked like a nice picture!  It's quick too, in spite of working wirelessly. I live the two sided printing, that will save me money over my previous Canon printer in spite of the cartridges being almost 50% more. Hopefully that will be a wash and because it has an additional grey cartridge that will save too... I mostly print documents.If you are new to Canon you will love the efficient ink usage. They have separate colors so you don't toss a multicolor one like HP just because your yellow ran out. This has saved me a HUGE amount since I finally gave up the ink guzzler HP printers.This printer is super easy to print off fb, internet, cloud, etc... I have the Canon app on my phone and that makes it even easier.Oh, and one more nice upgrade is the lack of buttons on the printer, it is a touch screen like a smart phone. Really sharp, adds to the already sharp look.Scan and copy is a flat bed but works fine. Nothing fancy, just solid and easy to use. It holds separate trays for different size papers which is nice, and they slide seamlessly into the printer.  The printer takes up over a square foot of area but it helps that the front closes with no seams and will open automatically when it prints.VERY pleased with the upgrades from the previous versions!!

PRETTY gorgeous!  That about sums up this beautiful, flirty apron. It's VERY feminine and girly enough for my 6 year old; but not too girly that I don't mind wearing it either!  It's absolutely stunning... good quality down to the bow itself.  I have been in a lot of craft stores and DIY craft fairs and I have to say that this apron is one of the prettiest ones that I have ever seen, I was really blown away by it.SO MUCH NICER THAN THE PICTURES!!

I didn't think there was much to this cube until I started to play with it.  It's INGENIOUS!!  You can click individually on the instruments and slowly add in more and more instruments to the song.  The harp on it's own is just gorgeous... but if you add the flute to it then it's stunning, etc... you get the picture!  Really wonderful for my kids who are just now starting to learn the sounds of the different instruments in a VERY realistic way... they can try adding in different ones to see how it sounds together. You can also remove them by pressing them again.  If you want ALL of them, just press the orchestra button and it gets them all going.  REALLY nice.Even my baby loves it... he loves that the colors light up and pretty music plays when he bangs on it.DEFINITELY a hit for this classically educated family!

I am reviewing the Serve & store bowl. It's a perfect "large" dip sized bowl, very simple.  But it has a perfectly fitting plastic lid so that you can put any leftovers in the fridge. This is perfect for dips in particular, because you don't want to be using cling wrap over and over after a few dips of your chips or broccoli!Quality is nice, it's kind of medium... not exactly bone chinaish but more of a delicate serving... fancy enough to dress up and not too fancy that it won't fit on the casual table too.It's very Christmasy... which I love.  It has a nice cream background with lovely holly and berries on it.  VERY cute.  And it's super easy to wash.  Definitely a hit!!

Okay, this had a potential to be a neat toy. But it's OBNOXIOUS.  Horrible, really loud music that you can't turn down.  Once I removed the batteries it was SO much better.  It has a little swirly platform that is activated by pushing down on a tower... like a supersonic merry go round. :)  And it has a fun slide. It has a little platform that you can move up and down; and a stable as well.  That is the extent of the toy though... so it's not a hugely interactive toy. It's okay... but it really fails in the lack of sound control and the lack of extensive features.My girls are enjoying it, I just don't see this lasting for long... I've had other castles with similar features that ultimately get pushed to the side for more interesting toys.

I already use a liquid base from Lancome along with a color matched powder over it to control for oil.  So after applying my base I used this instead of my Lancome. I found it hard to get the right shade, to a certain degree; especially with my kabuki brush.  That being said, I then added a little bronzer to get the tone right on my face and it was all good.  The blush is a little TOO pale, in my opinion.  But I am impressed overall because I have a weird skin tone... I am super white/blonde but then with the Spanish in me I have some olive and yellow tones.  So it's always been hard to get my colors right in makeup (thus the expensive Lancome.)  This one actually worked on me... I was surprised.  The blush was nice for when I want to look more natural, but it definitely doesn't show much on me.  It is good on controlling my oily skin too, which is a huge plus for me.  Overall I am pretty happy... and I am glad I have a cheaper option that still works well for me.  I am not sure that I want to stray away from my perfectly matched Lancome... but it's 100% better than any "boxed" makeup I've EVER tried before, and I've tried a lot. Which is what led me to the matched makeup.  So it's nice to see one that will work at a fraction of the cost.

This toy is PERFECT with the exception of one thing: not enough blocks to put into it!  I did take a star off for that.  But other than that it's absolutely great... it has a variety of easy to insert shapes including a rattle ball; and they match the colors on the lid which really helps.  The lid snaps on but not too tight that a toddler can't open it. But what's really ingenious is that you can bring this on the beach or in the bathtub... it has a bunch of little holes on the bottom so it's good for water too.  Handles are perfect for the toddler as well. I think if you had extra shapes it would be the IDEAL shape sorter.

I personally can't stand the doll... but my daughters do really like it for the feeding and changing aspect, which they can do for hours on end.  It DOES work well, and they enjoy changing her outfit, her diaper, cutting up all the playdoh and food, etc...CONS:So why the 3 stars?  A few reasons...Because invariably the playdoh gets stuck and you have to clean it out... That is the first. It's not horrible, but it does happen.  I've had to be patient and show them in detail how to feed her, and now that it's gotten stuck a few times they are being more careful.  Still a bit annoying.Secondly, the doll is a bit creepy. LOL  She makes all types of obnoxious noises and her mouth moves and I admit it kind of scared one of my girls at first until her older siblings were playing with her. LOL  Some of the noises are, well, kind of gross. LOLThird, the hair is not good quality.  It just gets so super tangled and within a week looks like a rat's nest.  And the doll is not very conducive to sitting up... the head is heavy, etc... so she is best in a baby chair while feeding.  She's also not good for cuddling AT ALL. She's great for play, and that's it.  And they LOVE it for that.Other than that it's a good toy, and ultimately I don't mind too much... any extra playdoh can be vacuumed up.  It's MUCH less messy than most dolls that you feed.  So I give it 3-1/2 stars.  If you don't mind some of the cons then by all means it's a great choice.. especially for older girls who are a bit wiser about how they feed the baby. :)

This is a really cute toy, one of those ones that you don't really love yourself but that always seems to be a big hit in the house.  I'm not sure what it is, but anything train just gets used like crazy, and this one is no exception.  They latch on to each other relatively easily, sometimes my two year old needs a little help.  But they are interactive as well... they go over musical sounds, colors and animals, plus teach your child what each animal likes to eat and what noises they make.They could have been a bit more creative in that sense, so I took off a star just because I am not super enthused about it overall; especially since I have to keep putting the train back together myself, which is a bit annoying.But on the other hand my toddler is enthralled with it... and it's a reasonable price, so I am not going to complain. :)

Although I would prefer this to be fitted, for a flat pad it is excellent.  It's a bit more versatile since it's not fitted... not only have I used it on my son's bed (who is still learning to go through the night without wetting the bed!), but it can also be used on a larger mattress; or even as a pee mat for a puppy.  It is the right size to fully cover and protect a portable crib, but can be used in a standard crib as well (I have done both.)Washing is easy... I tried it out after my son wet it and it cleaned up super easily and I didn't have to fuss about it going in on hot settings in spite of what the tags say.  Overall I am happy... the only drawback is that not being fitted it can move around a bit. But it's not critical. It's soft, so no crunchy noises or anything; just a neutral, very thin pad that is perfect for an infant's bed.

Although I would prefer this to be fitted, for a flat pad it is excellent.  It's a bit more versatile since it's not fitted... not only have I used it on my son's bed (who is still learning to go through the night without wetting the bed!), but it can also be used on a larger mattress; or even as a pee mat for a puppy (I also used it for some rabbits that are not yet house trained).  It is the right size to fully cover and protect a twin mattress; and is a good enough size and easy enough to wash to also use it for protection in case my water breaks before the next baby.Washing is easy... I tried it out after my son wet it and it cleaned up super easily and I didn't have to fuss about it going in on hot settings in spite of what the tags say.  Overall I am happy... the only drawback is that not being fitted it can move around a bit. But it's not critical.

This is a good, low end net.  It's pretty low in price, so I will give it four stars... but it's definitely not the highest quality I have seen. I have another by SKLZ that is much better; but to be fair it's also much more expensive.  So for what you get, it's a very good value.Pros:It's a decent size, nice and wide and although it's not super tall, it works.Easy to put together, took me less than 10 minutes.Color is bright and easy to see when kickingNetting is great qualityHas typical "tent" stakes to stake it in... should be good enough for a fenced backyard with not a huge amount of wind.Cons:Frame is basically like the typical tent poles.. not super sturdy. A little worried it wont' stand up to our Midwest high winds.  Although it's easy to take down... so maybe if you put it up when you need it, it would be ideal.It's not deep at all. You cannot get inside of it, just guard from the outside.Sturdiness is questionableHas a "band" strap along the base (the black line) that is easy to step on while guarding; which puts stress on the net

Although limited by the electric cord rangewise (as long as your extension cord), otherwise this chainsaw is PERFECT and has some REALLY, really nice features.  Instructions are super useful; very readable in assembling it (minor easy assembly), very helpful in demonstrating safe technique and ways to cut trees in different positions, etc...Features: It has an auto oiling feature that REALLY is non-messy and you don't have to sit there and constantly pump oil onto the chain.  When you let go of the trigger, the chain INSTANTLY stops; so it's super safe and you have absolute control over it.  This somehow has a brake on it that immediately stops it.  It has an auto tensioner; so I don't have to go and constantly mess with special tools to get the tensioner right.  It's also super quiet... my wife was inside the house and didn't even realize I was not only running the chainsaw, but that it was chopping trees too.  It CUTS GREAT! It cut through my hard, dry wood very easily.  It has a cover that goes over the blade for safe storage. It's also lightweight compared to my gas chainsaw (which I will NEVER use again unless I am out of range of electric!!)I was super, super impressed by it... I normally don't like the electrical tools because they don't have the same power and functionality but this one was a very, very good chainsaw.

So it's not the MOST popular toy in the house... and it's not really suited for a 6 month old on his OWN... but this toy is very well priced and it's cute and fun so I give it a 4 stars.The head rotates around and the big eyes immediately attracted the attention of my 7 month old who chased it all over the wood floor (it doesn't work on carpet.)  The bad thing is that he can't operate it himself... you have to push down on the head to get it to "smush" down, which then operates the spring driven wheels. It shoots off gently... and it depends on how hard to push it down as to how far it goes. My 2 year old son LOVES pushing it and making it go.  And my 7 month old loves to chase it and knock it down. LOL  So it's a good hit in the house for us... if this is your first baby you may want to pass on it until baby is older unless you want to keep operating it yourself.

Okay, I LOVE this mat.  It's super interesting for baby, cozy and easy to transport, etc... and an okay size (could be a bit bigger.)  The antlers, one ear, tail and one leg all "crunch"... and baby loves the antlers in particular to gnaw on.So why the 3 stars?  Because it's expensive!  Super expensive for what you get, and compared to some of the baby mats that have play areas above it that also fold up and can be transported. So I don't think the value is there.  It's still super cute, so if you are wanting something a little less "intense" for baby, this would definitely be the way to go.  I do wish it was a bit more colorful... again, something for BABY to like. I personally love the pink, soft colors but the baby would have loved to see the eyes open on the deer, more color contrast, etc...  Still, it's cute.

This is such a great idea and it works for two things:#1: Expanding your Wi-Fi - It does a good job. Not as great as I wanted, but it does work.  I had a spot in my basement (my downstairs work computer) that kept losing my main Wi-Fi that was high speed; so I had to use a back up router that didn't work as fast to get internet.  This solved the problem; however it didn't have as good of a connection as I wanted. Still, it definitely upped my connection and is helping out MUCH better; enough that I can get rid of the second router now too, which is super nice!#2: Setting a timer on your "plug" - This is great for when you are out of town; you can plug a light into it and set up times for your light to go "on" and "off", making it seem like you are home when you are not.  A really, really great idea.  It's really unlimited in it's use... I have a wifi baby camera (used for home security from a distance, not for baby) that I don't really want on when I am there (um, yeah... I think I may have walked across the kitchen nude once!)... so I can set it to go on only during the day while I am gone.  A really great idea and it works seamlessly.  Even better, you can control all of these settings on the app you can download.  Again, a great idea.Overall I am super duper pleased with this. I plan on getting more to expand my wi-fi even more!

This is PLUSH. It's so ridiculously soft and cozy, my 7 month old attacked it and was squealing because it was so soft.  It's double sided and cozy on both sides... so it's super plush but not too "fluffy" that it's a danger in the suffocation department either.  It has a soft silky edge that babies really love as a contrast (baby loved to snuggle with the plush part and hold/touch the silk.)It comes in a very nice gift package with a pretty pink bow too.  It's not a "normal" baby blanket, it's unlike anything I've felt before.  REALLY, REALLY nice!

This is a great apron for both men/boys and women/girls.  My son (12) is actually the one I got it for since he has a tendency to wipe his hands on his shirt while cooking/helping in the kitchen.  He loves it... makes him feel like a professional chef. It also fits plus sized me... so it truly is one size fits all.  It has a simple round ring adjustment around the neck and the material is relatively thick and solid.  Construction is top notch too. Very robust.  It has a pocket on the front to hold a few little minor tools. Pretty simple; but works well. On my son, it goes to lower calf; on me it's just below the knees.

Finally, a seat made for the baby in mind instead of the parent!  My baby LOVES the bright colors and lots of animal faces with bright, big eyes... and the colorful puppets that attach to the bar (and you can make them talk and move too, which he loves even more!) Plus the seat is super cozy and has a typical angled position... but it ALSO can be adjusted to lay down flat for babies too... great particularly for the newborn.The bar is moveable too... it says it snaps in but it doesn't; however it's not super easy to come out so that's fine... it's sturdy enough and easy to remove. I love that it can bend closer to baby or further away based on how big/little baby is. Great idea.Sturdiness is great, and the padding/straps, etc... are SO cozy and soft. Plus gives baby some awesome little bumpers on each side for the littlest ones so they don't scootch around.  All those pads are removable for the older baby as well.Finally, the sounds/features... sound is a jazzy little tune, and it can be loud or medium leveled... no super quiet setting.  The vibration is a bit much, if you ask me... but I've never used it much anyway. Just be aware it's a bit more than usual.My ONLY complaint is that the "leaf" with the velcro isn't stitched on very well. I am finding just within a day of removing the puppets a couple times that it's breaking.  But you don't need the leaf to attach the puppets so I'm fine with it; they don't add anything to the bar itself.
AWESOME!!!  I was always losing these at the gym, and now I have tons of them.  I toss the ziploc bag of these in my gym bag and I will never be without them.

I wanted to try out some Trijicon Glock HD Night Sight on both my Glock 23 and 26.  I had Truglo Tritium/Fiber Optic Sights on both Glocks and this tool removed them nicely.  Both the Trijicon and the Truglo have the angled sites that this site is for.This is the #309GLK tool - I used on both 23 and 26 - and Youtube videos show you can use this for the large frame Glocks if you remove the silver shim.  This is for the angled sights - there is another tool if you need it for non angled.Tool is very easy to use, very detailed instructions, and lots of videos of people using this tool to replace sights.Comes with a combo tool to remove the front sight and also take apart the Glock.Use oil on the threads. Which is indicated on the tool and the instructions.That bottom star shape screw you use to tighten/loosen your slide from the tool - mine came as a round turn with checkering on it for a good grasp.Very good tool that will last you a lifetime changing Glock sights - if you have multiple Glocks or want to try different sights out - or you want to be able to adjust your rear sight while at the range.

Bought this to try out the Feather blades it came with before ordering a whole mess of them.This is my back up razor to my Merkur Heavy Duty Double Edge Razor #34C.  Also comes with a nice hard plastic case so you could use this as your travel razor if needed.I really like this one too, long than the Merkur 34C, light and comfortable.  I use it probably 2 x a week and the Merkur the rest of the time.This screws from underneath the head and opens up, drop blade in, and twist back the other way to close down on top of it.If you are looking to test out the feather blades and at the same time get a nice razor to go along with it, I would pick this up.

This thing ROCKS!I'm a sucker for cleaning products/tools for firearms.  If they make it,  I buy it and try it out.  Well the Real Avid AR-15 Scraper Tool just plain works and is very compact.  Very smart design, compact, sturdy, and helps you clean that Bolt Carrier Group up nicely.  You could use this at the range if you want to shoot more ammo but you notice a lot of fouling or you can use it once you are at home and just cleaning your AR after a day of slaying paper targets (paper is all I slay, if you slay piggies, prairie dogs, or terrorists I am sure it will clean that carbon also).I also own the AR-15 CAT M-4 tool and the AR-15 LUG SCRAPER TALON TOOL  - I have them as part of the CAT M-4 Field Kit with a riggers sheath.  If you have the CAT M-4 Field Kit riggers sheath this slips and fits perfectly into it along with the other 2 cleaning tools.It gets into more areas than the CAT M-4 tool due to its design. If you already have the CAT M-4 tool - I still suggest you pick the Real Avid Scrapper up - one check out the price - that is cheap!  Two it gets into more areas than the CAT M-4, BUT I still like the CAT M-4 so I use both when cleaning.Comes on a thick-ish cardboard package  - on the back are pictures/descriptions of the areas of the BCG it will clean - good to keep while you get use to using the tool - I still reference it. Also they have a video on their website.

Great knifeGreat priceCool sheath.Morakniv Knives are top quality.Great teaching knifeEasy to sharpen if you want to hone your skills on that (what I used it for)Handle is smooth, sanded with fine sandpaper and stained a darker color.

I have purchased Butler Creek Flip-Open Eyepieces and Objective Scope covers for about 10 different scopes.  Even if the scope comes with covers I replace them with Butler Creeks and keep the originals as back ups (never had a Butler Creek fail)I have always been impressed at how well these work for the price you pay.  These are a lot cheaper here on Amazon than a lot of other places.If you do not know which covers you need - go to the Butler Creek website>Scope Covers>Scope Cover Chart pdf.This chart can be printed off and your scope measured up to it, or they list a very large variety of popular scopes.

Great batteries at a great price.  I bought these for use with a Surefire flashlight and one other item. I love Camo Form Protective Fabric WrapI have probably tried every pattern, and all of them so far worked out amazingly.So this stuff is like the medical wrap the nurse wraps around your arm after you gave blood with a cotton ball underneath, or the vet puts on your dog where they put an IV in him when you take him home. Suppose to be easy to stick and easy to remove, so as not to hurt you or your pet.Same stuff, just longer, and in cool camo colors. I have rattle canned, gunkoted, and more different rifles. Such a pain, and sometimes I end up going back to what I had in the first place. With these camo fabric wraps I can slap multicam one day and Snow the next on the same rifle. It is reusable, cleanable and has more uses.  To clean all I did was rinse in cold water, wring out a little and let hang on a towel bar.Wrap it around the stock multiple times and you created a better cheek weld, wrap around your pistol grip on that rifle and will create a no slip surface to hold onto. Break up the pattern on your rifle, change the look of your rifle in a couple minutes. If you don't like it take it off and wrap something else. Binoculars, spotting scope, knife handles.

Great set of parts packaged very nicely.  I bought these as backups when I am building lowers and if I needed the parts in the future. This is an extremely nice light.  I am no Flashlight expert and I wanted a nice weapons light that didn't cost too much.  I have seen a lot of good reviews on this light.  I like that the tail cap twists a little bit and this disables the click to turn on the flashlight and you can save battery life this way.  Very bright and just want I need for a self defense in home weapon light. The crenelated Strike Bezel area is very sharp so if you had to use this as a line of defense I definitely would not want to get poked/jabbed with it.I purchased Magpul Industries Light Mount V-Block and Rings, Black and Magpul Industries M-LOK Offset Light/Optic Mount Fits M-LOK to attach this light to my rifle and worked out perfectly.

Amazing ring! 5 Stars all the way. Nice big sterling silver ring.  I am so happy with the purchase of this ring.Very bight, very huge! This is 3rd item purchased from this seller and have been impressed with everything sold.Inside stamped inscription - P Borda 925 ©2014

Used to measure firearms and firearm parts.When I first got it I tossed a couple items that I knew the stated weights on listed by the manufacture and this scale was dead on.Very simple to use, comes with batteries or you can use the plug in.I've decided not to keep the batteries in it while not using it (esp the Chinese batteries that it comes with) due to possible leaks, but you could keep this plugged in.Comes packed in a cardboard box with Styrofoam packaging that protect it very well. Nursing. Is there any other major that puts so much stress on an individual AFTER graduation?If you're a nursing student, BSN or ASN, you know the stress of nursing school, and the excitement of finally graduating. But graduation does not bring lasting peace for we all have one more giant obstacle to overcome: the NCLEX.My story is like most of yours: I was never really good with NCLEX style questions. My school used ATI to "determine" our predicted success for the NCLEX, and I always fell in the 50% to 60% range. I was very discouraged for some of my friends were in the 70% and 80% range. But this book has made me in to a barely passing candidate to a candidate who passed with 75 questions.Some say that this book is "too much material" and I agree; it's like nursing school in a book. But, I spent over $2000 on nursing school books, but this $60 dollar book is the best comprehensive nursing book on the market. Everything in this book is broken down in to nursing process. When it explains a disease process and the nursing care associated with it, it goes step-by-step through the nursing process. It also has pictures of diseases that it talks about, and since I am a visual learner (especially learning diseases, and procedures) the pictures helped a lot.This book has a lot of material, but it also highlights the key materials you need to know with a green, pyramid symbol. If you study only the things with the symbol, you will be successful. But if you study the whole book (like I did over month and a half by studying 2 to 4 chapters a day) you will be beyond successful.After every chapter, this book has practice questions, which further reinforces your knowledge, and has clear, concise rationale. These questions were pretty easy, but the goal is to reinforce the teaching of the chapter. But where this book shines is the online question bank. When you purchase a NEW book with an unused code, you get access to their question bank. The Q-Bank has over 5000 questions, and over 500 alternative format questions (select all that applies, drag and drop, etc). These questions are high quality, and comparable to Kaplan and ATI. I also bought and downloaded NCLEX Mastery app on my phone. So whenever I had downtime I pulled out my phone to answer questions. The NCLEX Mastery questions were difficult (much more difficult then the NCLEX) which helped a lot as well.Far as what I did personally to study, I used virtual ATI and this book. Honestly, I feel like I wasted $400 dollars on Virtual ATI. They say they pair you up with a "personal coach", but all that the coach does is tell you to remediate, and send you passwords for additional tests. VATI was a waste of time. I used this book to study, and VATI for questions only.NCLEX is a nerve wrecking, sometimes stressful adventure, yes an adventure. If you were never strong with NCLEX style questions, and do not feel confident, like I did, buy this book, and put forth 100% of your effort in to this book. Give yourself a week break (after graduation) and focus on completing 2 to 4 chapters, everyday. Utilize the Q-bank this book offers as well. This book is priced at $60, but for me, it was priceless when it came to my NCLEX success.If I can do it, you can, too. Study hard, dedicate yourself, and you'll be a successfully practicing nursing in no time.Best of wishes,Danny

I left my Asus charger on an Amtrak bus when I was traveling.I looked for an Asus charger, and they were going to cost me $30.Yeah, I wasn't going to pay $30 dollars for a charger.And then I came across this charger.This charger does the job, it is 90W charger, and a little switch in which you can control the voltage (different laptops take on different amount of voltage to effectively charge/run the battery. You can check the bottom of your computer, or your laptop specs to know which watt and voltage your computer needs, which is important to prevent damage).This also came with different adapters for different sized plugs for laptops. This will come in handy, even when I get a new laptop, I can use this as a backup charger.WARNING: This does not fit some HP laptops. I read in some reviews that it didn't fit HP laptops, and I tried the adapters on my girlfriend's HP laptop, and it did not fit, therefore it is not really "universal". I do not know if it is due to the year of the model, or just HP itself, but if you have an HP chances are this will not fit your laptop (hence 4 stars, instead of 5 stars).All in all, it's a good, cheap charger that will not break the bank. Glad to have found this charger on Amazon.

I have quit for a good year, but recently I've had an urge and completed three cans of Cope pouches in 2 weeks. After my sister saw my can, and talked to me about it, I know I had to quit. And one of my friend's dad dying of cancer recently really reinforced that I needed to quit. So let's get to it.Pros:-Looks: It really does look like the real stuff. If I put side by side this product with Cope straight cut, I wouldn't be able to tell the difference.-Feel: Even from the pinch, to your lips, and finally to the spitting, it feels and spits like real straight cut tobacco.-Taste: It tastes similar to regular straight cut, but not exactly the same. But I don't think anything comes close to tasting similar to it than this product.-Placebo: Every time I dipped Cope, my bowels would act up. Every time. When I put this stuff in my lips, my body reacted like it was the real stuff and began to brew some gas down there. Although the effect was not as prominent, the reaction from my body was still there due to the placebo.-Satisfies cravings: for me, it's not only the nicotine craving, but it's the physical act of pinching, putting in the lips, and spitting that triggers my cravings. Whenever I am studying, I crave dipping, but with these, whenever I crave, I put it in to satisfy my physical craving, and I'm fine. Really good product.Cons:-Artificial Colors, and preservatives: I was a little disappointed to see artificial colors and preservatives, it sure beats all the cancer causing substances in chewing tobacco.Conclusion:Very close snuff substitute without the tobacco or nicotine. Very satisfied with the product for it reduces my physical cravings of dipping. If you're trying to quit, give this a try.

As I am writing this, I put a pinch in my lips to test it out. I have quit smokeless tobacco, but recently I had the urge and bought two cans of Cope pouches. After a friend and my sister found out, I just wanted to quit once and for all, especially when one of my good friend's dad died of cancer.Anyways, going back to this product, one thing that stood out is that in the package, the seller does offer people 2 free cans for a good review. So if there is anything that we love most is FREE stuff. So I don't really know the legitimacy of some of these reviews. Now, let's go over the Pros and Cons of this products.Pros:-It's not tobacco, so even if you put a pinch of this in, it's million times better than putting in tobacco.-It smells great-It does give you some caffeine buzz, although I would much rather drink coffeeCons:-Consistency: it's like a sticky coffee grounds, glazed and  hardened with honey. It was not what I expected, it's pretty much a coffee ground candy.-It doesn't feel or spit like real chew: I have tried smokey herbal snuff, now that stuff looks, taste, feels, and spit like real dip. This, it just feels like coffee grounds stuck in your gum.-Price: honestly, if you buy high quality ground coffee, added some powdered creamer, honey, and got the consistency just right, you'll probably can make 10 cans of these, under 20 dollars. So I don't know if paying $5 dollars per can is worth it or not.Conclusion:It's not bad, per say, but it's nothing special. I like the little caffeine buzz I have going on right now, and it tastes good. And as a person that is drawn to dip because of the physical aspect of it (putting a pinch in, and spitting), putting this in definitely satisfies my physical draw to tobacco. However, I'm going to experiment with making my own, because paying 5 dollars per can, for me, is not justified.Also, people should fairly review products, not because the seller offers them two free cans for a positive review.

Seriously, did I buy a Bose? For under $40, I was expecting mediocre sounds, but this system is AMAZING. It comes with with 2 satellite speakers, a subwoofer, and a master volume controller. Though the picture is deceiving (usually satellite speakers are wireless, like pictured in the picture), these speakers have wire. However, the sound quality is amazing, and for the price you cannot beat. The first words that came out of my girlfriend's mouth as these speakers came on was: "wow, that is beautiful". 10/10, highly recommend.

Intro: This case is a solid case I chose to build my PC, it would have been a perfect, budget case, except for one flaw that I found.Pros:1) Price: for under $70 dollars, this is an awesome case.2) Configuration: both 3.5 and 2.5 inch drive bays for standard hard drive and solid state hard drive. Two USB 3.0 in the front is a plus.3) Easy to assemble: The optical drive bay was easy to use, which made things smooth. The case comes with railings for the hard drive, and has ample space for cord management and good airflow.4) Great airflow: multiple vents for good airflow, and up to 8 slots for case fans. One is already included (Front bottom).5) Solid construction: Feels sturdy and solid, and has an option for liquid cooling.Cons:1) This is the only con, and it's a weird one. I've noticed that when I placed my fans on the side vents, it would create a loud humming noise. I expect the fans to make some noise (blowing air), but this was more of a subtle, vibrating noise that was really loud. First, I thought it was the fan, but when I tested the fan, without mounting it on the case, it was fine. The culprit was the side vents. Whether it is due to the vibration of the fan causing the side vent to hum, or the airflow, I don't know. To remedy this, I had to put my side fans outside the vent it self, which, I didn't like at all.Conclusion: Solid case for the money, but I wish that the side panel was more sturdy.

This CPU is great, and for the money, you can't beat it. I chose this CPU which was recommended by jackfrags in his video (video about building a PC on a budget).There are a lot of discussion regarding Intel vs AMD, but the truth is, they all have their pros and cons. My budget was under a $1000 (for the whole PC), and this Processor hit the spot.Pros1) Price: Under a $1002) Great performance paired with Sapphire R9270x, 2gb. Tomb Raider on high setting with anti-aliasing, and motion blur turned off: avg FPS= 58. In Ultra setting, avg FPS= 45 to 50.3) Exceeds in everyday, mult-app performance.Cons1) CPU heat sink is adequate, but not great. If you are planning on overclocking, a good aftermarket CPU heatsink is a must. Otherwise you have the risk of overheating the CPU, causing damage.If you don't plan on overclocking, the heatsink that comes with it is fine, although it can be better.Conclusion: If you are on a budget, and want a CPU that has great performance which will bring out the most of your hard earned money, look no further.PS: For first time builders: this CPU goes in an AM3+ socket. Make sure your motherboard has a AM3+ socket.

I came to home brewing when I was bored and looked up hobbies I can take up, and slowly got more and more interested.I got this kit early this month, with the book How to Brew by John Palmer, which I highly recommend for anyone interested in home brewing. Though I cannot review on the quality of the beer (I bottled my first batch three days ago) I will write an honest review on the equipment, and ingredients that comes with this Mr. Beer Kit.IntroAs a beginner in home brewing, every home brewing term seemed alien to me, and seeing the 5 to 6 gallon carboy with contraptions like siphons, air locks, and hydrometers just confused. Therefore, I decided to get the most simplistic kit available, that's why I chose Mr. Beer. I will first start with the Pros.PROSMR. BEER Kit out of the Box , Perfect for Beginners  This is a perfect kit for absolute beginners on a budget. For 50 dollars, you get a fermenter, bottles, two hopped malt extract, yeast, and no-rinse cleansing solution. Almost everything you need is included, minus a large pot (enough to hold 4 cups of water), metal spoon, can opener, and a silicone spatula. The instruction manual is not clear, but Mr. BEER has a Youtube video explaining step-by-step on how to sanitize, brew, and pitch the yeast. Mr. BEER also gives you daily email (if you register) on subjects like sanitizing, science behind yeast and fermentation, and other useful information. Like I said it has 90% of what you need to get started.Ease of Use  Mr. BEER kit is easy to use. First you sanitize with the given sanitize solution. Then you boil 4 cups of water, add the hopped malt extract and stir until dissolved. Then you add 1 gallon of chilled water, add the wort, add another gallon of water, and then add the yeast. Finally, you close the lid and let it sit. of course there are more details involved, but it's pretty much as simple as it gets.No Gimmick, It Actually Brews  This is a legit, beer making kit. You can see everything happening in the fermenter: yeast fermenting, high krausen (peak of fermentation), layer of yeast in the bottom, and the clarification of the beer as fermentation completes. It's so fool-proof, it's guaranteed to make drinkable beer... note the drinkable part.Perfect for Increasing Knowledge  This kit is perfect for absolute beginners, who don't want to deal with a lot of complicated equipment, but as you brew, you will want to learn and start reading books and forums, like I did. As I gain more knowledge on the brewing process, watching videos and reading "How to Brew" by John Palmer, I see more and more future limitation when it comes to this Kit. This is where I start the ConsCONSLimited to MR. BEER Products  With this 8.5 Quart kit, you are limited to only using MR.BEER kit sold by MR. BEER. You can buy the standard 5 gallon recipe kit which makes 5 gallons, but you have to do the math and ratio out all the ingredients if you want to do so (who has time for that?). So unless you want to keep using hopped malt extract without using specialty grains, malt extracts, and add the hop yourself, this is obviously a kit that you'll "graduate" within time. But this kit is solely for Mr.BEER refills and nothing else.Quality of the Ingredients/ Yeast  As I learn more about specialty hop, adding hops at different times, and other brewing techniques required for home crafted beer, I find that just pouring a liquid extract to boiling water is very limited and restrictive. Also, the quality of the yeast is questionable, for it does not have a date, and who knows how long the yeast (refill) has been sitting on a shelf. According to Palmer, quality beer requires quality yeast, and with Mr. BEER, there is not telling the quality of the yeast that comes with it.Crude Ventilation/ Air Lock  This kit has "air notches": little holes on the mouth (top opening) of the keg which lets excess CO2 out, which, by theory can let oxygen in as well. Because how the lid is positioned, I do not believe a lot of oxygen gets in during the fermentation process, but the air notches are crude nonetheless.You Will Outgrow it Very Quickly  Though it is for beginners, you will outgrow it quickly. As I read more, and watch more videos, I am itching to get a standard kit (5 gallon carboy, siphon, airlocks, etc.) to "graduate" from this kit. It is perfect for beginners yes, but if I had to do it again, I would buy a standard starter kit (Northern Brewing, True Brew, etc) and start from there.ConclusionThis kit is awesome for beginners and those who want to start brewing without all the equipment. I will update this review on the quality of beer it makes.Note: I am following the 2-2-2 rule (2 weeks in the primary fermenter, 2 weeks of bottling, and 2 weeks of conditioning). Just FYI for those wondering the process I took.--------------------------------------------UPDATE 12/07/2014------------------------------------------------Beer taste: Wow, so I brewed the Aztec Cerveza and I am enjoying a glass right now, watching the 49ers v Raiders game. So this is the process I followed to brew this batch: 2 weeks in the fermenter, 2 weeks bottling/carbonating, and 2 weeks of conditioning in the fridge. However, I was curious and couldn't wait any longer. It's been 3 days of conditioning, and decided to drink it.This is an awesome tasting beer. More milder than other cerveza's out there, but awesome in every way. Good carbonation, good taste, and the best thing is that it is smooth. It has a hint of sour taste, but I think that is due to bottling a day or two early. But after this bottle, I will drink the rest of the bottles when the full two weeks of conditioning has been done.This is smooth, and very enjoyable beer. But be aware: home brewed beer has a certain taste to them. Internet forum describes it as "the homebrew musk". There is definitely that, but it adds to the richness of the flavor. I am very impressed.I bought one more keg: I bought one more keg. I thought about getting a 5 gallon, standard kit, but I am going to stick with Mr. Beer (I have changed my mind). It is simplistic, takes minimum equipment, I can brew multiple batches at one time, and the end result is outstanding.  Right now I have a pilsner and a stout brewing. Can't be more happy with Mr. Beer. For those people telling you that you can't brew good tasting beer with simplistic equipment like Mr. Beer, they are wrong. I wish you were here right now so I can have a glass with you. Cheers!Updated rating: 5/5

I needed new shoes for the Two Cities Full and Half (I did the half) that was held today (11/02/2014), and I received these on Thursday (10/30/2014). It fits more snug than usual, but I find that shoes "loosens" over time and use. These shoes were awesome, and did their job.I'm 5ft 9in, 190 lb (mostly upper body mass), and I'm in the army ROTC; so we go on 3-5 mile runs. I bought these shoes because a lot of flat feet runners wrote great reviews on these shoes. I was born with extremely flat feet, and I ordered these for that reason.I ran total of 4 miles in these shoes before I ran the half marathon, and I'm here to tell you that I am blister free, and my feet feels great; other than the expected soreness haha. They are comfortable, looks stylish, and very, very light. I highly recommend them to any flat feet runners.

So, after trying (it seems like) every pre-workout outhere (NO Explode, C4, Bullnox, Animal Pump, Six Star Brand, Cyto Max, etc.) I wanted a pre-workout with high quality ingredients, no artificial anything, and something that only has right amount of scientific-based ingredients. Well, I found it, it's pure pump.Purepump only has the things you need: caffeine (green tea extract), beta alanine, creatine, AKG, amino acids, and vitamins. It's not "proprietary blend" (aka BS) and the amount of each ingredient is disclosed.Pros:It works. If nature created a fruit called "pre-workout" the chemical composition would be similar to Pure Pump. I feel better taking this because it is as natural as you are going to get. Like I've said, I've tried them all, and Pure Pump works. The price is competitive, but hey you get what you paid for.ConsI wanted to give this a five star, I really did, but I couldn't because of one major con: the taste. Now I've taken nasty supplements before (Garden of Life Raw Food, grass drinks, etc) but the taste in this is just right horrible. It is because there are no artificial colors, flavoring, or artificial sugar (which I love it doesn't contain it), but man does it taste bad. It taste like expired, Chinese herbal medicine mixed with some crushed up beetles (it's downright nasty). You can get some natural sweeteners, or lime/lemon powder to help you, but the taste is overwhelming.ConclusionAs natural as it's going to get, it works, and price is competitive. If you want a preworkout without all the BS, but with high-quality ingredients, this is for you. I will only use Pure Pump from now on but man, the taste is gonna take some time to get used to. Highly recommend, but you have been warned about the taste.

This is a great watch. It does not come with overloaded features; it's simple, functional, and a clean looking watch. It's not as bulky as the g shock or other watches I had, and for the price, it's fantastic. If you are looking for a functioning with time, date, stopwatch and alarm, with a simple yet attractive design, look no further. If you are looking for a watch that cooks you breakfast, this watch isn't for you.

Far as stopwatches go, this is very functional. I need it for timing my self on the 2 mile run, and this is great.It has a large screen which is a plus, and something about clicking this thing is satisfying (the way the buttons feel).This is your basic stopwatch; functional and reliable.I took 1 star off because it didn't have memory to recall laps and splits, maybe this is asking too much for a stopwatch this price range, but I think this is a factor. All in all: reliable, functional, and get's the job done.

I got my Kindle 2 about a month ago, and I like it so far. I won't be the hysterical reviewer saying that "this product changed my LIFE" or anything like that, just an honest, helpful review. The kindle 2 is one thing: an e-book reader, and it gets the job done above my satisfaction. If you are looking for an internet browsing, MP3 compatible, and a device that does every pointless thing that wastes your time, get an I-Pad. As an E-Book reader, the Kindle 2 is tough to beat: with the 14 days battery life, free 3G download capability, and an easy-on-the eye screen, it is the best of any e-book reader. The design is slim and eloquent, it is efficient, and the prices of books are, on average, 4 dollars cheaper than print versions; which for avid readers, like myself, it is a huge money saved. It performs beyond my expectations, and worth every penny. Now, my constructive criticisms. The Kindle has a lot of room for improvement, and I believe Amazon is on the right track.1)The biggest criticism that I have is the lack of Titles, sure all the mainstream books are on the Kindle like: Twilight, Harry Potter, etc, but I outgrew that. Some of the books I want to read like, "All God's Little Creatures", are not available for the Kindle. In fact, if you are an avid reader, you will be disappointed when it comes to books available on the kindle.2)The second criticism I have, the keyboard: it's chunky, not spaced correctly (especially the M and N keys), and it is just there for downloading purposes without ergonomics in mind, can't we have both Amazon?3)Thirdly, the screen on the Kindle 2 can be bigger, just look at all the white plastic surrounding the screen.4) No interchangeable batteries. So if you run out, and you have nowhere to plug you can't read anymoreI am sure Amazon will fix these issues in the future, and I cannot wait what future Kindles will look like. This is only the second generation and Amazon made great improvements, I hope that they take all the criticisms as a blessing and blow us away with the Kindle 3.

I have been trying for several months now to find a deep conditioner that works and can be used every day. I've tried a bunch of different ones, but none of them have really made a lasting difference in my hair. I did find a generic version of a Paul Mitchell product that works great, but it's not meant for every day use.I bought this on a whim at Shopko. I don't remember what I paid, but I think it was under $5. To be honest, this product isn't anything spectacular. It's not awful, but it's nothing to get excited about either. This product does leave my hair soft and healthy, but it doesn't last very long. By mid-day, my hair feels and looks like straw again.However, the biggest issue I have with this product is the smell. I really wish I had smelled it before I purchased it. It claims to be citrus scented, so I thought I was okay. But I was wrong. The first time I used it, the smell turned my stomach. In fact, I was tempted to wash it out right away. But I left it on. This stuff doesn't smell anything even remotely close to citrus. The scent is very hard to describe. It has this weird, almost chemical smell to it. It's very strong and not at all pleasant.I think I might try a coconut oil or keratin treatment next. I will finish up the bottle, but I wouldn't recommend this product, and won't repurchase.

I have a couple small clusters of whiteheads that I've been trying to get rid of for the past few months. I tried 3 different salicylic acid treatments, that got rid of some of them. But some of them were closed comidones (whiteheads which have completely plugged and clogged the pore) I found a site online that said for regular whiteheads use salicylic acid, but for comidones, use benzoil peroxide. I used the salicylic acid every day for about 6 weeks on the comidones with no effect whatsover. But I was very nervous about trying the benzoil peroxide because I have extremely allergy prone skin. I was also concerned about peeling and irritation. But the salicylic acid wasn't really working, so I decided to try the benzoil peroxide. I bought this on a whim at Walmart. I don't remember how much I paid for it, but I think it was between $4 and $6.I did try a 2.5% benzoil peroxide treatment from Neutrogenia that I had first. But again, even though I gave it a good amount of time, it didn't really take care of the comidones. But I was also pleasantly surprised. It didn't irritate my skin or trigger any type of allergic reaction. The list of things my skin has reacted to is long, so that is a definitely plus for me.I have to admit, I was more than a little worried about trying the 10% benzoil peroxide treatment. But nothing else I'd tried had really worked. Amazingly, it didn't irritate my skin at all.I started using it every night before bed. I'd usually apply it two times before going to bed. Once a couple hours before bed, and then right before bed. It has made a HUGE difference. The size and number of the comidones have decreased dramatically. Every day they get smaller and smaller. After a couple more days, they will be gone completely. I haven't had any trouble with skin discoloration or itching or anything like that.I do, however, have one major complaint about this product. The packaging is terrible. The tube itself isn't bad, but the cap is really hard to open and close. You really have to pull to get the cap open. I've found it's easier to just unscrew the cap and squeeze it out that way. This product works great, so it wouldn't keep me from repurchasing it, but the cover design really could use some work. Other than that, this is a great product, and I will keep it on hand. Just in case I get more whiteheads. Great product.

I was recently in my local Christian bookstore. I always enjoy poking around the clearance section. I have found some real gems (and a few duds) there in the past. So when I saw this title I was intrigued. When I read the description, I was even more curious. When I saw that it would cost me less than $3, I was sold. This book is written by a pastor who decided to try an experiment. He recruited people from his church to attempt to live out the multitude of rules and prohibitions found in the Old Testament book of Leviticus for 1 month. Eventually, 19 people agreed to accompany him on this journey. The 19 participates were comprised of people from various walks of life and religious backgrounds.This book was an easy read. I have to admit, even though I am very familiar with Scripture, I have been intimidated by the book of Leviticus.
