If you are wondering if a career in medical coding is for you, do yourself a favor, and get a copy of this book. You won't be sorry

I was a little hesitate to try this product. I have extremely sensitive skin, especially on my face. I was even more concerned when I realized this product is NOT marked as hypoallegenic. I was running very low on my existing towellettes, so I decided to give this a try. As soon as I used wipe on my face, it felt like my face was on fire. There was a major burning sensation. I also felt like it really dried out my face. Needless to say, I won't be using this product again. If you don't have sensitive skin, this product might be great for you. But if you do, take my advice and skip this product.

This is a great product. It smells great and works wonderfully. The only complaint that I have is that I wish it was a solid. The semi-liquid of this product is very messy and hard to regulate. It's easy to use too much or too little. But all in all, this is a great product and I would recommend it.

I stumbled across this book in the free bestt sellers list on my Kindle a couple of days ago. The title immediately caught my attention. However, I have to admit that I was a bit skeptical. I thought this book would be geared towards a six figure income and presigious lines of work. But I was very pleasantly surprised. Mr. Churchill talks about how better skills and more income means something different to everyone. For Mr. Churchill, it means finding a job that gave him more freedom, more opportunity to be creative, more recognition, and better relationships with co-workers. For me, it would be a job with a 40 hour workweek and higher pay that would enable me to afford things like my own apartment, a car, and some extras.  For other people, it may mean 5K more a year or 50K a year. For some, it might mean starting your own business. Mr. Churchill discusses in detail how to figure out what skills you want to learn, how to identify (and fix) the problems in your current position and really makes you think. He teaches you how to ask the right questions and that gives you assistance in finding the answers. He gives you a step by step process for learning new skills on your own, online tutorials, finding a mentor, and even FREE online college courses. This is a book you will want to read with a highligher in hand. I would also recommend taking notes. There is a lot of great information in here. He gives the reader a ton of links and resources.I have been frustrated in my career for a long time now. I'm unhappy and barely earn enough to pay my expenses, much less many extras. But I'm very gun-shy about going back to school. I can't afford to take time off of work and really don't want to incur even more student loan debt. I have to admit, before reading this book, I had almost given up hope. I know my skills are out of date, but I didn't know any way to improve them except going back to school. Now, I have hope that there truly is another way that really is legit and makes sense to me. If you feel trapped in a dead-end job and feel like you are out of options, do yourself a favor and read this book. Even though this book is no longer free, it is very reasonably priced and well worth the money. This is book is one to read slowly, really think about, and then apply. Thank you Mr. Churchill for writing this book.

I have to admit, I was both nervous and excited about receiving this item. In fact, I was tempted to cancel this order and get something else. But I should have stuck with my insticts on this one. I received this item and tried one. I took a little bit and did manage (barely) to swallow it. I tried to eat the rest of the chew and just couldn't do it. I ended up spitting the rest of it. I very much doubt that I will be eating anymore of these chews. They are supposed to be chocolate fudge flavored, but in my opinion, they don't taste anything like chocolate. They have a really funky, almost bitter flavor to them.I was also more than a little freaked out by the choking warning on this back of the bag. It tells you to drink a 8oz serving of water or other liquid after eating this. If you don't, the chew could swell and cause you to choke. I was nervous to try this to begin with. I also have a very vivid imagination. Not a good combination. I would not recommend this product

I ordered this book several months ago, but never read it. I came across it recently and decided to read it. Honestly, I wasn't quite sure what to expect after reading the back cover. But I'm very glad I decided to give this book a chance. This is one of those books that will appeal to a wide variety of readers. There are elements of action, suspense, drama, romance, and history. There is also a strong Christian element to this novel. I thought it started out a bit slow, but once I got into it, I couldn't stop reading it. In a lot of ways, this book is very similiar to the novels "This Present Darkness" and Piercing the Darkness" by Frank Peretti. It also had echos of the Left Behind series by Tim LaHaye and Jerry Jenkins. But while this novel has similiarities to these other works, it is distinct and unique. The plot is exciting and full of twists and turns. Just when you think you have things all figured out, something completely unexpected happens. It left me guessing right up until the very end. The characters in this novel are complex and believable. There isn't a flat character to be found. I found it especially easy to sympathize and empathize with Jagger, one of the major characters. I could relate to a lot of his questions and struggles. But I was also able to sympathize with the Tribe members. Even though I found their logic twisted and their actions dispicable, I was still able to see them as lost, hurting, deceived souls in dire need of redemption. This book gave me a lot to think about. I know this is a novel I won't soon forget. I definitely plan on checking out other novels by this author. Highly recommended.

Lately, I've really been struggling with the idea of understanding where I fit in to the body of Christ. I've felt dissastified for a long time. I really want to serve, but I have no idea where to start or where I would be most effective. I have kind of a vague idea about what my spiritual gifts are, but not a clue on where to serve using those things. I've taken career tests, personality tests and read books, but still felt stuck. So when I first read about this book, I was excited.This book is written in a very readable, easy to understand fashion. Krista is not a pastor, a doctorate of theology, or a readily recognizable television personality or Christian author. But in my opinion, those are strengths not weaknesses. She writes from her own struggles and growth in this area. She has a lot of great insight and practical, useable ideas. I know that I will refer to my notes from this book often. This book will challenge you to think in new ways, to take a risk, and step out in faith. She also weaves in many stories from others who have successfully found and are living out their calling. I also really like that the author states that people who serve God in the marketplace (ie in a regular job) aren't second-class Christians. They can have just as much impact as people who are involved in things like church leadership or missions work. I think this element is missing in a lot of Christian books like this.However, in my opinion, this book does have one major flaw. First, I didn't think she spent enough time discussing the ins and outs of each spiritual gift. She does list them and talk about where they are found in Scripture, but she never really discusses them in detail. I also found it odd that she didn't include any kind of tests or assessments in this book. Now, I know these types of books can easily get bogged down with assessments. But this book needed at least a couple. At the very least, I thought she should have included a spiritual gifts assessment and possibly a passions and/or personality tests.Another complaint I had about this book is that she focuses a lot of attention on how to find your calling, but very little on actually living it out. I think she assumes the reader will be able to figure that out on their own. But when I got to the end of this book, I felt like there were a lot of loose ends. I wish she had pulled all the information together a little more. For example, I think that she should have taken all her great information about spiritual gifts and personality, passions, interests etc, and then listed where someone can use those gifts to serve in the church or in the marketplace. She does include some links to different types of assessments in the back of the book. I do usually thumb through the notes and references in a the back of books, but if you are someone who doesn't, it could be easy to miss, and you will probably end up really frustrated at the end of this book. But I think this information should have been more incorporated into the book, rather than just tacked on as almost an afterthought. The information that is here is excellent, helpful, and practical. For that reason I gave this book 4 stars. This book is definitely worth reading

Lately, I've been thinking about getting more involved with serving both in my church and just in general. I came across this book in the Kindle Store and decided to order it. There are some great ideas in here about practical, simple service projects. I also really liked the emphasis on being willing to do whatever, wherever. I think so often, people are only willing to do things that will attract attention to themselves. But even a cursory reading of the Gospels will make it crystal clear that is not Jesus' way.However, in my opinion, there is one major flaw about this book, and what ultimately made me decide to return it. On almost every page, Pastor Rizzo is talking about something he and his church did. Now, to be fair, this church has done a lot of great things. They were willing to serve the firefighters after 9/11 and to help out the victims of Hurricane Katrina. I don't doubt for a minute that Pastor Rizzo has anything but the best of intentions. I think he has a lot of great insight and experiences to share. I just think he went about it in the wrong way. Rather than focusing so much on his church, I think this book would have been much more effective if he had focused on the entire body of Christ. After all, this is stuff that all Christians should be doing, not just one particular church. I really wanted to like this book, but I just couldn't get past the constant references to one individual church. I agree with a previous reviewer who stated that it definitely has a tone of "look what we did" Which is really too bad, because I think this book discusses a vitally important topic, one that people need to be challenged in.I highly recommend "Barefoot Church" By Brandon Hatmaker and "The Dangerous Act of Loving Your Neighbor" by Mark Labberton.

I was intrigued by the Vine description for this novel. Since I love fiction set in exotic places, I thought this book would be worth my while. But in all honesty, I found it to be very dull and slow-moving. I felt like the plot crawled a long at a snail's pace. I kept reading in the hopes that it would get better, but I finished over half the book, and it never did capture my interest. I also found the characters very hard to relate to. Honestly, I didn't really care or emphathize with any of them. This book had a lot of potential, but in my opinion, it simply didn't deliver. I wouldn't recommend this book, and won't be reading any other works by this author.

I received this book for my Kindle as a Christmas gift from my brother and sister and law. I really want to see the movie version of "Life of Pi" but wanted to read the book first. I thought the book dragged just a little the first couple of chapters. But there are numerous facts about animals and their way of life sprinkled throughout this book. I would classify myself as an animal lover, so I found that enjoyable. Also, this book is beautifully written. The story is engaging. One thing I wasn't prepared for in this novel was the amount of gore and violence. At times, it felt like it went overboard.Pi finds himself stranded in the middle of the Pacific Ocean when the freighter he is sailing on sinks. None of humans, except Pi survive. He finds himself in a lifeboat (and a rather small one at that) with a hyena, a zebra, a orangatan named Orange Juice, and a massive, 450 pound male adult Bengal tiger named Richard Parker. The other animals don't make it very far into the journey. The zebra and orangatan are killed by the hyena and the tiger kills the hyena. All that remains is Pi and the most dangerous of his animal passengers, Richard Parker. Both are willing to do almost anything to survive. Pi knows that he must be ever viligant around Richard Parker. He knows all too well that showing any type of weakness or letting his guard down would mean death. There are many twists and turns in this book. The reader is kept guessing what is going to happen next. You can almost feel the wind in your face. You can sense Pi's growing desperation, hunger, and thirst. You feel his despair when it seems there is no hope of being rescued.The main reason why I didn't give this novel 5 stars is because of the religious aspect. Pi practices Islam, Hinduism, and Christianity. Not one after the other, all at the same time. He juggles the lifestyles and beliefs of all 3 religions at one time. He resists being told that he has to pick only one. There is definitely the underlying belief that all religions are valid and as long as you are sincere, it doesn't matter what you believe. It is a common theme in our politically correct society.  It does matter what you believe and sincerity is simply not enough. It is possible to be sincerely wrong. But even though I don't agree with the religious underpinnings of this story, it didn't keep me from loving this book. The rest of the story was so engaging and enjoyable, that I was able to overlook the religious ambiguity.I highly recommend this book. It is a quick, enjoyable read that is very well written.

When I first read the description of this book, and the back cover, I wasn't at all sure what to expect. I have read one of Frank Viola's books "Pagan Christianity" (which I also highly recommend. But to be honest, I didn't find the either description for this book particularly compelling. In fact, I was hesitant to read it at first. I had this book for about 2 weeks before I started reading it. I was also somewhat confused and intimidated by the term Theography. I didn't even really understand what that meant. But I am so glad that I decided to give this book a chance. Once I started reading it, I couldn't put it down. It drew me in from the very first page.I read the Bible from cover to cover, for the first time at age 18. I'm not in my mid 30s. So I would say that I am very familiar with the teachings, people, and stories of the Bible. I have studied the Bible for myself, but I have also read countless biblically-based books. I think this old saying "Familiarity breeds contempt" is especially true when it comes to the Bible.  If a person has a long history with the Bible, it can be tempting to think that there is nothing more to learn from or about the Bible. But I can't tell you the number of times that God has made His Word come alive to me in a completely new way.  I can read a verse I've read hundreds of times before, and gain a new insight or notice something I never noticed before. This is has happened more times than I can count over the course of my Christian life. The Bible is unlike any other book in existence. It is a living, breathing organism.  It is so much more than simply words on a page. But sometimes, it can be difficult to remember that.I admit, there are times when I have struggled to reconcile the God portrayed in the Old Testament with the life and teachings of Jesus in the New Testament.  At first glance, they can seem like polar opposites.This book does an excellent job of tying together the Old Testament and the New Testament into a seamless whole. It helps the reader see Scripture itself and the person of Jesus Christ in a way that is refreshing and new.In the Old Testament, there are 109 Messianic prophesies. All of which, down to the last detail, were fulfilled in the birth, life, crucifixion, and resurrection of Jesus Christ.  But the Old Testament also contains parallels and glimpses of Jesus Christ that have nothing to do with prophesy.  They are mere shadows in the Old Testament. They are much more detailed and clear in the New Testament.  There are numerous examples that I could cite, but in my opinion, one of the clearest are the Old Testament book of Leviticus and the New Testament book of Hebrews. At first glance, these books couldn't seem more different. Leviticus gives very specific and detailed instructions about how to worship God and how to live a holy life. There is extensive discussion about being ceremonially clean and unclean, and many different types of sin offerings and sacrifices.  Leviticus is part of the law. This also includes the law of Moses (more commonly known as the Ten Commandments).  But when placed alongside the book of Leviticus, it becomes obvious that Hebrews is a compare and contrast of the Old Covenant (Leviticus and the rest of the law) and the New Covenant (set forth by Jesus Christ).  Under the Old Covenant, the standard was absolute perfection.  Sinful  humanity, apart from Jesus Christ, has zero chance of meeting that standard.  However, Jesus, lived a completely perfect life. He never sinned, even in the smallest regard.  Therefore, He fulfilled the law. He paid the penalty that humanity owed, but could never pay.He also broke the curse of the law. Because of what Jesus did on the Cross, we are no longer subject to the law.The book of Galatians has much to teach us about the relationship between the law and faith in Jesus Christ.  Galatians 2:21 (New Living Translation) says  If keeping the law makes us right with God, then there was no need for Jesus to die.  Galatians 3 tells us why the law was given.  Galatians 3:19 says What then, was the purpose of the law? It was given alongside the promise to show people their sin.Another New Testament that has a lot to say about this issue is the book of Romans.  Romans 7:4-6, 8 tells us You died to the power of the law when you died with Christ.  So I discovered that the law's commands, which were supposed to bring life, brought spiritual death instead.Romans 10:4 is even more clear.  For Christ already accomplished the purpose for which the law was given.Finally, the book of James makes it crystal clear that trying to please God by keeping the law is an exercise in futility. James 2:10 (NIV) says Whoever keeps the whole law, yet stumbles at just one point is guilty of breaking it all.This book offers the reader a new lens through which to view Scripture. It helps you understand how the entire Bible, from Genesis to Revelation is about salvation through Jesus Christ.If you feel that your study of Scripture has become stagnant, do yourself a favor and read this book. I promise you won't be sorry you did.If reading this book has left you hungry for more, I highly recommend "Jesus Through Middle Eastern Eyes" By Ken Bailey and "The Message of the Old Testament: Promises Made" and  "The Message of the Old Testament: Promises Kept" both by Mark Dever.  These last two books develop even further the ideas and themes found in "Jesus: A Theography.

It is soooo cute, the fringe, the style the over all look is just first class.  The quality of the leather is top notch... what I didnt notice when ordering is you get not one but two handles... You can wear it over the shoulder or over the arm...I am so happy with this purse... It is over all the perfect size, not to big so you add to much stuff and start getting back aches, not so small you can't carry what you need.  I love that you have also two options to close it it has the draw string that I love but the magnetic clasp to get extra security.. Nice over all purse.I was lucky to get this purse at a discount in exchange for my honest and unbiased review but I can tell you as a purse snob it is well worth the money because of the over all look and quality it will last a long time..Hint Hint... If you made this same purse without the fringe would be awesome too....

I have a addiction and not afraid to admit it..I have a diffuser for every room of my house.  So I feel like I can honestly say what I do and don't think works for each one.  The ZAQ jellyfish is perfect for the bathroom.  It gives off a perfect amount of aroma for a nice relaxing bath, add the light and you get a relaxing glow.  I have nerve injury that gives me horrible headaches so bright lights are rough and so I was looking for a way to relax and detox from the day,  I found that I put some great quality lavender in this diffuser, start it flowing in a closed bathroom while my bath runs and when it's time to actually get in my bathroom becomes a spa like feel.  I am super happy with the time and size of this diffuser.. YOu get about 4 hours from one filling.  Perfect for the bathroom or any room for that matter ...Nice that you can use it light on or light off your choice.  I was lucky to get this to test in exchange for my honest and unbaised review and after testing it out I am extremely happy to give them my thumbs up.

SO if you love the feeling of rain on your body this is the shower head for your.. I love walking in the rain but hate getting my clothes all wet.. I have always loved it and this is the perfect shower for me.  I can't begin to tell you how good this shower head feels,  I was concerned at first because of the area the water has to get to and would it have enough pressure to rinse my hair etc.  All the things you want to consider when you are purchasing a shower head.  I am here to tell you this shower head mets or exceeds all my expectations.  NOT To mention it is a beauty.  A very good deal for the price.. You get so many options and it was super easy to install (or so says my hubby).I was very lucky to have received this in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.  I love it and am very happy to provide my opinion after getting it and testing it out.

Such a cool shot glass... I dont drink mixed drinks..I like shots and what a cool way to take them.... It is the perfect size to hold in your hand as you walk around the party and can be sipping your shot as you go...it is a great conversation starter,  it doesnt feel as delicate as it looks,  being blown glass makes it very unique.  I was lucky to get this as at a discount to test out in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

My son and his girlfriend are crazy outdoorsy kids... they are always doing something and looking for a way to protect their belongings from the elements.  Some days it is out on the boat in the ocean other days it is out on the honda mudding, then the days she takes her horse for a trail ride.  No matter what they have used this for they have reported the contents dry as needed.The nice part is you can use it either as a back pack or carry either way you have you choice.  The front pouch is super nice to have your phone  handy and dry... Great over all dry bag... I was lucky to get it to test and after the kids have thoroughy put it through the rounds, we are happy to give it a 5 star review... No water is getting by this bag...

I use this daily, every night and day to help keep my face moist during our humid days here in Florida.  It doen't take much to cover your face and leaves a light scent for just a few minutes.. Not overly oily or greasy, just right for my combination skin.  I am super happy with it.  I am usually the perosn who tries things out and then quits but have been using this for awhile because it has not caused any of the things that usually happens extra oil etc... I was lucky to get this to test in exchange for my honest and unbiased review and after using it for days happy to report what a good product it is.... Just the right amount of moisturizer for combo skin...

Having had the opportunity to test out several sets of headphones these are the best yet.  Seems they stay connected far better then most, and connected up super easy.  I have great sound quality that even impressed my husband who is a music snob... he is always adjusting my truck radio and such.. so for him to approve of the sound is impressive,  I was lucky to test these in exchange for my honest and unbiased review and have tested them thoroughly and am very happy to leave this review of my opinion.

I love this cup...My mother is a coffee drinker and loves Harry Potter... What a great gift for her...  who doesn't love their favorite book and a good cup of joe?  Well what is better then having that cup of joe in a mug derived from that favorite book?  Such a cute idea and motivational as well... It is a reminder to not let anyone get your down.  Great gift idea.... I was lucky to get this in exchange for my honest and unbiased review and very happy with the quality of it.  Three or four dish washes and no paint loss....

This is a little more than just your average lunch box... well really so much more.  You can put a meal for two in this thing.  I also love that it is insulated so my food can stay cool even if for some reason I forget to put it in the fridge at work.  I also have been taking it with me when I go grocery shopping to bring home my ice cream in..  It helps to keep it frozen more.. I don't live far from the store but honestly living in Florida and driving a truck that the groceries go in the bed this helps tremendously keeping my ice cream from becoming mush... I was lucky to get this to test in exchange for my honest and unbiased review and after testing it out I have happy to leave this review.

Who doesnt love breakfast? And when you can make it fun all the better.  I love that these are stainless steel so they are holding up well.  My daugther loves breakfast for dinner so much that she always ask for it on her birthday and so it is so nice that when I make her special breakfast I can make it fun and special.  I love the shapes and they are have gone through the dishwasher with no issues.  I was lucky to get these to test out in exchange for my honest and unbiased review and after thoroughly testing them out I am now having to hide them from my daughter.

Ask anyone I am a lime addict.  I love all things lime, I use a ton of it in anything I use it for, including my diet coke, If I cant get my diet coke with lime.  I am very happy using this, it seems I get a much better return on my fruit.  It is very strudy and easy to use.. I was lucky to receive this in exchange for an honest and unbiased review and so far I am loving it.

I have short haired dogs but wanted to see if I could get my lab's hair softer.  Seems the older she gets the more coarse her hair gets so I wanted to see if this would help, I gave her a bath with her normal dog shampoo and then conditioned her.  I also have 2 boston terriers who have dry skin issues... mostly because they are crazy and play rough all over the yard and in the mudd and dirt, so adding a conditioner to their bath routine was a big plus, I have noticed they are less itchy longer.  Not sure they are fond of it as they hate bath time but they do seem to be enjoying the not itching.  I was lucky to receive this in exchange for my honest and unbiased review and have thoroughly tested it on 4 dogs who all seem to be doing well with it....

What do you get your outdoorsman that has everything?  You get them the Paracord Survival Bracelet, then you get a two fold gift, something cool for them and some what piece of mind for you.  This is one of the most unique items I have ever found, I am truly not sure how they fit what they do into this bracelet and it is still not any bigger then the one I have made without all the extras... This is one amazing bracelet, a true must have for all of your outdoorsman family members.  I was very lucky to get to test this in exchange for my honest and unbiased review and am very happy to leave it after testing out this bracelet.

Braided 550 paracord.  You can use the whole cord straight up or you can use the guts solo or casing solo.  However you choose to use it, it will be durable and hold for a long while.  Same stuff they use in the military.  Somethings the military gets is crap, others is a lifesaver.  This is the latter.

People are crying that this safe is easy to open and easy pick and whatnot.  THIS IS A DIVERSION SAFE!!!  It works simply by not letting people know its a safe.  Put it on your shelf and DONT TELL ANYONE ABOUT IT!  Then you can leave it unlocked if you choose, however its much safer being locked.  (As safe as something small as a book and not bolted to the floor can be)  Just remember...  Loose lips sink ships...  Goes for safes too.

I review 100s of products for amazon (all ones I purchase myself unlike the vine reviewers) but this is the first one I dont want to review.  The underwear fit and are comfortable.  That's all you need to know.  Vote me up or down on this... I dont care, I'll pull down your underwear :)

I've been using the Razer Orbweaver for a few years.  Stepping down to this smaller version was a new experience.  Less keys to map, less functions, smaller hand print, less ergonomic options, but same gaming power/control.  The Orbweaver's rubber palm pad got so warm from my hand the glue came loose and the grip fell off.  This pad has a solid plastic palm pad.  Ive been using it for a few years now and it hasn't failed me yet where the 100$+ more version has.  Sometimes...  Less is more...  This is one of those times.

Steel toe rubber boots.  The best of both worlds.  I worked at a bakery and had to clean out industrial mixing bowls out back every night.  These boots saved my feet from getting literally hosed.  Not really much else to say about rubber work boots.  All depends on the application you use them whether theyd be right for you or not.
Best shirts ever.  What more can you say about a shirt?
Just like I had in the Army!  If you need more of a review than that, you need to join the Army.  Hooah!

Ordered 2 sets for use when playing WoW on my laptop.  Only problem I can see is that there's no way have external power to supply them unless you use the USB cord.  Not too loud and not tinny sounding.  Just a decent pair of small stereo speakers when your crap stock speakers just wont do.  They are only a couple inches tall and can pretty much fit anywhere.  I wont order more if these crap out.  I value my USB slots.  I'd prefer wall plug ones.

One straight edge blade, one serrated.  I would never hold it by the center closed fist with both blades open for fear when pulling your hand to you one releases and takes off a finger or two.  Luckily my little brother took this off my hands and he only uses one blade at a time.  He said a better idea would have not had blades at either end, but both blades at one end side by side.  I think that would be better too, but all in all this is a well made novelty knife designed to for looks over use.

Cheap dentist pick for cleaning up excess plaque around your teeth by yourself.  The mirror head is cheap plastic and snapped right off within the fist week of use.  The other picks are still with me.  The ergonomic rubber handles make gripping it easy.  Easy to use and easy to clean.  If you want a more sturdy set get a professional kit not this one.  This is just for touch ups or applying dental putty to fill minor cavities before you see your dentist to get them really filled.
All I really need is line and a hook but floats make seeing the fish hit much easier.  These are great for "seeing".  You should really "feel" when you fish though.
Best pajama pants ever....  period.

Great spring assisted knife.  The wood grain handle and the barber knife give it a classic look.  Get a whetstone and sharpen it right and you can shave with it.  I used this knife for scoring french bread tops when I was a baker.  Whatever you use it for, look good doing it.  :)
Tastes gross but in an emergency situation it will keep you up.  Go for the Orange flavored ones.

This is the water resistant version of the calculator watch.  Meaning it can be used with light swimming or showering.  It is a calculator you can strap to your wrist as well as a stop watch, calendar, and a clock with dual time functions.  What more could a nerd ask for?  I've been wearing this exact brand/style watch for over 2 decades now.  It's been with me when I was in the Army and through out the desert.  Its been with me though hiking and adventuring.  It's been through a lot.  If you have fat fingers (you know who you are) you can use a pen to press the buttons but Id just opt for a real calculator at that point.  Most times I dont need the calculator but its there if you need it.  Now if only they made one with a back light like this.  Battery life is 2+ years for me.  Longest battery run was 6 years but that was in my survival bag with a fresh Energizer CRT in it.

Product came with the clear plastic window warped.  It didnt let the needle read past 30psi since it was bubbled inward so I popped it out.  Come to find out the whole things shoddy.  It says not to go over 100psi and I never used it above 75.  The tip that clamps onto the tire stem is weak and the gold coupling on the tip started leaking a small bit of air when inflating after the first few uses.  Then the thumb button to release overflow air pressure from the tire started leaking too.  Lasted maybe a week and less than a dozen uses before it was completely shot.  Crap product, straight up.  Buy a decent one not this cheap thing.  You've been warned.  I try not to buy crap, I try to read reviews and make decisions, but this was utter crap.

Decent razors.  My wife uses them for her legs and gets a pretty decent use outta them.  She now uses the pink version which is a bit better she says. Lol, they look the same to me but Im a guy and I use a straight razor.  Im just going off her word.  I have posted reviews for all different razors for her and the pink venus embrace are the best she says.

I live in Colorado and I used this machine to make bubble hash for the past 2 years.  It has a little filter in the washing part you have to remove but other than that it's the perfect machine for knocking the trichromes off your plant matter and then processing it further.  The right side compartment is a centrifuge.  If I was to use it for clothes Id give it 6 stars if I could.  The centrifuge is so powerful that in the Max time limit (5mins) it can remove pretty much 99% of the moisture.  It may not be big, but it sure is powerful.

Bought this fridge for my little brother who bought a camper.  The fridge has been running quietly for about 2 years now keeping everything cold and fresh.  I also got the warranty from amazon for 24 months but I dont think this thing needs it.  So its up to you, buy the warranty, dont buy the warranty, but BUY THIS FRIDGE!  (I hope I just didnt jinx myself and at month 25 the thing craps out, lol)  I've purchased thousands of dollars of stuff from amazon and left 100s of reviews and this has to be the longest lasting and most used item I have yet.

I had a old TV that only had the Coax line.  I needed a way to plug in a Nintendo Wii system with the AV cables.  This little device helped me out.  The only problem was I needed a power strip because this device needs a power plug too.  (TV, Wii, and this Modulator.)  A great device and I am glad I bought it.

Great shower mat.  I used it for 6 months removing it once a week and cleaning the bottom suction cups.  After time the black mold color set in and I tried to soak it in bleach.  Then the mat was white and blue on top and black and blue on the bottom.  It was time for a new one.  :)  So I ordered another :)There's so many suction cups there's no way to slip with this thing in your tub.  The water still has small channels so it can flow under.  A great safety feature for you tub.

Quick tips for the Porter Cable CMB15 compressor I bought here on amazon too.  Not much to say, just the accessory tips you may need later on if you plan on using it with some tools for home repair etc.  like I did.  Better to have it and not need it, than not have it and need it.

I live in Colorado and if you dont use Nitrogen in your tires you wind up losing pressure most days.  It cost 1$ to use the air pumps infront of the gas stations most places here.  This compressor has paid for itself within the first year.  On cold mornings just plug it in inside and let it fill.  Then take it outside and air up the tires to max psi.  Then if you want (if it starts snowing) you have the option to deflate your tires yourself for more traction.  Fast filling, simple design, light weight, and easy to use.  I would recommend it to my 80 yr old grandma. (I air up her tires anyways but if I didnt Id recommend it to her)

Bought two of these.  The sheaths wear out fast and the leather softens so that it flops about your side.  You can wear these horizontally once the sheath leather has softened.  Full tang with a metal finger guard so you dont cut your hand open if it slips.  The woodgrain handle will give you splinters if it gets wet and you try to handle it.  All I did was re-sand it down at wax it so it wouldnt happen again.  Since they are hit and miss, I have them strapped to my survival bag now.  They will be great for survival situations but for practical use they are more miss.  I have however deboned a few chickens with these and I used them to cut my food a few times outdoors.  Not good for batoning as the metal is hard and will shatter upon impact.  Also I wouldnt trust it with a 4' drop onto concrete or anything hard for that matter.

This is the only razor my wife will use on her legs.  She's 6' tall and all legs so getting through one shave session without a knick or cut is amazing.  Sometimes she can even use these twice.  I can still use them on my face when shes done them since they're super sharp still.  It's just the curves of womens legs with the soft skin, vs the hard skin and straight angles of my face.  All in all a great razor.  (However I still prefer to use a straight razor on my face)

Jeez where do I start...  First problem was my laptop is a Dell.  Second is its about 5 years old so it was about time for the charger to die.  This is a great charger, but I feel it's time for a new laptop of you're looking here to buy a charger for your Inspiron 1720.  You can buy a pretty decent Asus these days for about 100$ and it would still be faster than this Dell.  lol.  But as for the charger it fits like the stock one and I can forsee another 5 years on this one if I choose to.
Needed some old school coax cables for an old school tv of mine.  This did the trick.  Took the "ghost" images right out.  All I needed was a new cable, not a new TV :)

No extra parts or assembly required.  Just simply unscrew the existing shower head and screw in this new one.  It has the built in shower head holder for the hand held sprayer built right in too.  Perfect for if you want to share a shower with a special someone.  Just get some screw in hooks and hang one on the opposite end of the shower and you can have water from both ends.  Both shower heads have 3 sprayer settings (shower, pulse(center) and full blast )and there is a switch on top to have main head, extended head, or both on.  If you get lower pressure than you're used to (since it is 2 shower heads) you can turn the knob half click and it will cut the pressure from the extender without shutting it off giving the main a ton of pressure :)  Hope this helps

Magazine has been getting thinner and thinner through the years.  The articles are well written but few and far between on piquing my interest.  Not a magazine subscription I will keep up in the future.
Bought this subscription for my wife.  She loves it.  I do too sometimes.

Makes your buds get really sticky.  Just need more than 8oz.  Use in all stages.  There are better products out there like hygrozyme and the molassess part 2 that the hygrozyme lives in.  But all in all a decent product.

Bought for a sweet baby warlock bear.  He summons his voidwalker almost nightly then we all have to give the void kisses then the baby bear Grimoire of Sacrifices his void and gains 25% more HP and a damage bonus for while he sleeps.
Holds all my yarn and accessories for when I travel.  Very nice and light.  Well made and sturdy.
Bought for a friend who has never owned/used a computer.  Best entry computer that has a big screen and enough memory and processor it will do whatever they need for a good while.
Bear cub is so sweet she hasn't lost a dart yet.  This pack is still unopened over 3 months later.  Great crossbow (see my reviews for the one) and great darts.

Accidentally dropped on the ground from waist height onto carpet after removing the dead bulb.  Shattered into a million dusty glassy pieces.  Other than that it lasted about 90 days before dying.  Average daily use was about 6 hours.  So died in 540hrs or 22.5 days constant.  I will buy my lightbulbs from a brick and mortar store from now on instead of getting old/used bulbs listed as new.Maybe you will get a new bulb, maybe you get a used one listed as new.  You can't know until it's too late and returns are over.  That's why it's 3 stars.  That and the way it just poofed into nothing after hitting carpet.

Bought for a bear cub.  She uses it for home defense.  She can turn on the TV from 10 feet away with the squeeze of a trigger.  No batteries required.  Just pump it back, push it forward again, then squeeze the trigger.  Shoots foam darts but still hits pretty hard.  Shot the wall at about 10 feet and the dart bounced back about 10 feet behind me.  Open range about 70' before it drops.  Pretty powerful for a kids toy.
Decent novelty for the Boop collector that has everything.  Only thing you need to get with it is a bill protector.  At this price though it should come with one...

Can you say act of terrorism?  Go ahead and think you can use these walking thru TSA.  Get caught with a metallic knife and you may be 1/2 OK.  Walk through forgetting or knowing you have this...  Say hello GITMO...  Oh wait, our Prez is releasing terrorists from Gitmo.  Nevermind...

Glows in blacklight.  Charges in blacklight.  Comes with small circle backing stickers.  Need to order more backing stickers though since it only come with 24 and they are the size of a loose leaf hole punch.  Undoubtedly 1 or 2 will not stick and 1 or 2 more will get stuck to you and not be sticky anymore.  Also the bigger leaves will be heavier and fall with the weak small sticker holding it up.  We have lost 2 behind the sofa from falling.

Which one?  The 3' tall BlueDot double jellyfish percolator with 9" ice trap?  Because that's what's under this poster!  The bowl piece holds 1/8 easy.  If you don't have iron lungs to hit this, you'll be in one.
For those who don't know, you can educate them with this poster.

Cheap alternative to LUSH USA.  I mean if you can even really compare anything to lush...  Smells aren't as fragrant.  The frosting on the top doesn't dissolve and isn't soap or anything.  My wife has a drawer with 100$'s of Lush bath oils, bombs, bubblebars, etc. and I wanted to see how these compared...  She used 2 cupcakes and gave the rest away.  Only reason she used a second was to make sure it wasn't just a faulty bath bomb.  If you're gonna shell out the cash, get lush and not these cheap knock offs.I guess she's spoiled.  And as a guy I don't really do baths.  If you never had lush these may be good for you but I can tell you this...  When she gets out of a lush bath, I want to lick her from head to toe she smells so good.  After these cupcake baths it was a kinda chemically/artifically taste I can't explain.  From both standpoints, male and female, I would just stick to lush.

Place I bought didn't have a closet door in one bedroom.  I used this as a door for almost 3 months.  Then when I got the doors, I put this up back over them.  I took a small 5" desk fan and have it blowing across the back of it making it ripple ever so slightly.  Almost looks like it's alive when viewed in black light.
Really funny.  I think I've had about 1/4 of the strains already.  Now to broaden my horizons.
Nice clean poster.
Kinda thin.  Not much to say.  Just gonna be hung on a wall in a stoner friend's house.  Looks cool in a black light.
Spongebob stickers purchased for a childs party.  Great item.

30w and 110dB later the cops were called for a noise complaint.  These little speakers really push.  If you put the bass dial 3/4 and turn up the speakers 1/2 way you will wake up everyone in the household.  If you crank the bass dial 90%, speaker volume 90%, and set the input device (phone, mp3 player, etc) volume to 90% (so you dont get hiss, crackles, and distortions) you can entertain the whole street if you open the garage door.  Someone say Block Party?  No Peavey's needed.Read my previous reviews.  I run my tech through a ringer.  If you want a cheap speaker set that will provide you awesome sound quality and still shake the pictures on your wall, this is it.On the dB meter these speakers pushed about 110.  So it's not a stretch to say every set should push over 100dB easy.  Just enough to make you  start going deaf if you listen top end in a closed room.  Or at least make your ears ring for a while.

Only trackball I use now.  Read the description, 5 buttons and a scroll wheel.  All you need.  I own 5.  I purchase these for friends when they complain about their corded mice.  If you don't have one, you're missing out.  Battery (1xAA) I use Eneloop Black Series Rechargable and the battery has lasted over a year with the mouse never turned off.  The no-name-brand that came in it originally lasted almost a year turning it off and on daily use.What?  Still thinking about another one you saw?  Think there's a better one out there?  I have reviewed 100's of items and I can tell you this is the best trackball for the average/moderate computer user.  If you are an engineer/developer then yes, you need the 3D trackball, but for a consumer, this is your mouse.

I've enjoyed Jody Hedlund's books since her very first and this one is no exception. Written very well and with accuracy as to historical events, Hedlund proves she very good at what she does. What I especially enjoy is that she bases her books on actual characters in history.The spiritual content of this one was very well done. I love it when characters decide that they must depend up on God alone to help them with their problems.

Carol Moncado's first book was so good that I decided I wanted to add her to my list of authors whose books I will always read. That decision has not changed.This one, Hand Me Down Princess, begins a new series and it was wonderful! Prince Malachi must marry a woman he has never spoken to, not ever seen, all because of a promise his father, the king, made to this woman's father many years ago.During this book, revelations about their families threaten to destroy their lives, intrigue abounds and love begins to grow little by little. All the while, the spiritual thread runs through that we are God's children, no matter what others think of us.There was an excerpt from the next book in the series and oh boy, I can't wait.*I was given a copy of this book by the author in exchange for an honest review. I was not encouraged to leave a positive one and my opinions are my own.

I have thoroughly enjoyed each of Carol Moncado's books!  Right from the very beginning, she was one to add to my list of authors whose books I always wanted to read.  This book is no exception.  I am a huge royal family fan and her royalty series is right up my alley!I can't wait to read the next!*I was provided a copy of this book by the author.  I was not pressured to leave a positive review and all my opinions are honest and my own.

This second book in the Valiant Hearts series is so good. I love, love, love a good medieval story and Dina Sleiman provides that wondefully.Allen of Ellsworth, formerly a part of the Farthingale Ghosts, has now departed for Edendale, believing that God has directed him there. What he finds is most unexpected and takes him totally by surprise.Lady Gwendolyn Barnes wants to be a knight like her brothers, but sadly, she is only a marriage pawn in this age. Her father is a tyrant, determined to wed her to a vicious man.Gwendolyn and Allen must trust fully in God's plan for their lives. (Jeremiah 29:11) For He does indeed have a plan.There's plenty of action, intrigue, sadness and joy in this book. One of my favorite quotes from the book is this: "Circumstances might look grim for a time, but God can turn matters for the good. He alone can sustain your soul through whatever adversity you might face." And as a Christian, I can say that this sentence is very true. God has, can and will continue to sustain us as we continue to place our trust in Him. (2 Corinthians 1:8-10)* I was provided with a copy of this book by the publisher. I was not encouraged to leave a positive review. All my opinions are my own and honest.

From Joanne Bischof's first book, I have been a huge fan. She is a wonderful writer, gifted with the ability to tell a tale that holds the reader enthralled from the first paragraph.Joanne ventures from historical to contemporary in this story, Riley and Becca's story. Both are teenagers, and before you think, 'I don't want to read a book about teenagers', please think again. This is one of the most tender, loving and precious stories you'll ever read.Riley is trying to get to Becca, whose family has had a crisis and has had to move very far away for a while. On his way to get to Becca, Riley encounters some difficulties. How Riley manages to get to Becca is an integral part of the story and one that changes Riley's life.Bischof manages with every book to engage the reader's emotions to a degree that they are so sad when her stories end. I want these people to be real! She has a wonderful ability and I'm so glad she began to write. I can't wait for what she has for me to read next.Sometimes, a broken down transmission is not such a bad thing, either. You'll have to read the book to understand that sentence.*I was given a copy of this book by the author. I was not encouraged to leave a positive review and my opinions are my own.

Laura Frantz became my all time favorite author with her very first book,The Frontiersman's Daughter.  She is the absolute queen of historical Christian fiction.  No doubt about that at all.  Her research is always spot on, each book prompting me to go back and check into the period and learn even more.  I love history and she does it proud.With each book, Laura Frantz manages somehow to draw her readers completely into the story and they just don't want to leave!  This reader didn't.  I only wish that life wouldn't intrude when I'm reading one of her books, but my dog and husband needed feeding! :)*I was provided with a copy of this book by the publisher and not encouraged to leave a positive review; all opinions are my own and honest.I felt at home as soon as I read her first sentence.  It's like sitting on the porch with an old friend, comfortable, at ease and not wanting the day to end.  Her words on paper are joyful to read, heart grabbing in their sincerity, uplifting in their spirituality.  The spiritual lesson here for me is: no matter how bleak things look, keep your faith in God for He will work things out for your good and His glory.The Revolutionary War has just ended and General Seamus Ogilvy has returned after 8 years away. His wife has been dead for years and his young daughter staying with her aunt. Seamus brings Lily Cate home and intends to raise her himself, burdened though he is.  Sophie Menzies lives at Three Chimneys, not far from Tall Acre, Seamus's home.  Lily Cate wanders over one day and captures Sophie's heart.  Sophie had assisted her midwife mother at Lily Cate's birth 5 years ago and has never forgotten Seamus.  He captured her heart and has held it for years.Sophie is about to lose her home because of unpaid taxes and also because her father was a Tory.  Seamus desperately needs a mother for Lily Cate, so he asks Sophie to marry him.  She agrees to marry Seamus and become to mistress of Tall Acre.  Great plan, right?  Well, things go awry, and Sophie and Seamus must learn to cope when times are hard.  Can their faith keep them?  Will they allow God to handle it? Even though it may not go the way they want?Laura Frantz is a total master at crafting historicals.  Completely masterful. With each book she writes I find myself looking up different things in history just to learn more.  She makes me want to know more about each period she writes about.  Her words flow onto the paper like rich chocolate and melting butter, so full of flavor that the reader is completely full of each word she writes.  The characters come to life as soon as they are introduced and each scene leaves you captivated, waiting breathlessly for the next one. She even describes locations and rooms in the houses in such a way that the reader feels as if they are walking the same lanes, wandering in the same woods and feels right at home in the houses.  Her prose is amazingly outstanding.  I just don't know how she does it!  I feel as if I'm sitting with her on my front porch, talking and drinking tea, as she tells me about her book.  I feel as if I'm privy to a part of her author's heart as I read her book.  I can tell she has just poured herself into her books.Laura Frantz's books always, always have pride of place on my shelves and will never be displaced.  I'm sad the book is over and now I must move on.  I want to stay there inside the book with Seamus, Sophie and Lily Cate and the other characters.

Oh, I do wish I could give this book 10 stars! I was so happy to at last begin the long awaited last book in The Song of Sears trilogy. I didn't think I would like Christian fantasy, but had thoroughly enjoyed Carla Laureano's contemporary novel, so I thought I'd give the fantasy a try. Wow, what I would have missed had I not read these books.When the second book came out, I reread the first in preparation for Beneath the Forsaken City, book two to Oath of The Brotherhood. It was amazing! I eagerly watched for The Sword and The Song. I loved these characters and longed to know what they would experience in this last installment.The island of Seare is at war. The Red Druid is gathering strength and power to stand against Conor, Eoghan, and the Firein Brotherhood. But there is a bit of strife between Conor and Eoghan, causing distance between them. Conor leaves to find the key to defeating the Red Druid, leaving Aine to worry about him falling prey to the druid and other dangers. How will they make it? There is danger everywhere and from every source, even within their own fortress. Nothing and no one is at it seems. Who can they trust?Carla Laureano has crafted a magnificent ending to this trilogy. Each character is more in depth, more moving and more real to the reader. They were before, but this go round, they are people you never want to let go, never want to finish the book and say goodbye, but hungry to finish to find out the ending.I won't give anything away, so there will be no spoilers here. I can't even begin to imagine how Carla has so much of this in her mind, to be able to write such a spectacular tale! I literally wept through the last half of one chapter, tears streaming down my face so fast and hard, I had to wipe them away to see the words on the page. When I finished the chapter, I just sobbed aloud. Literally. This book was absolutely outstanding! This series is one that will have pride of place on my bookshelves, destined to be read again and again. They deserve to be made into a miniseries, too. This would make great theatrical work.I really can't say enough good things about this book and the two before it. I am not gifted enough to describe how wonderful this series was. I wish it didn't have to end.*I was given a copy of this book by the publisher. I was not encouraged to give a favorable review, and all my opinions are my own and honest.

Well, Christina Coryell has written yet another good book! When I read her very first book, book one in the Camdyn series, I was astounded by her talent and knew this was an author I wanted to watch. Since then, I have read every book she's written, this one making 6, and have enjoyed them all.I have to admit, the Camdyn series is my favorite of all! Simply just perfect.This one is book two in the Girls of Wonder Lane series and features Harley Laine, whose real name will remain a surprise. Harley is a news reporter who is looking for that one great story that will land her a spot on the news desk.No more of the synopsis here, but please read this book. Christina is a very talented young woman whose books should be on your shelf. I eagerly anticipate the next one.*I was given a copy of this book by the author. I was not encouraged to give a positive review and my opinions are my own and honest.

I loved the first book in this series and the second was good; just not as good.  By this book, it wears a bit.  I thoroughly enjoyed it, but it went on a bit before anything happened. And these folks sure do think about sex a lot.  Philip and Tom are almost sappy and that's saying a lot for men of this time period.  But all in all, I did enjoy it and would read more of her work.
Misty Beller has written another of her westerns that her readers will love.  This one has lots of actionalso.  She is a young author to definitely watch.

I thoroughly enjoyed the first book in this series.  Loved it!~  I bought the next 2 as soon as I finished the first. This one was not quite as good.  For two reasons:  The heroine, Elizabeth, got on my nerves so bad! She was whiney, petulant and just plain obnoxious through more than half the book.  Tom put up with it and never once lost his temper with her.  I don't know about the middle ages, but what man would be so longsuffering with a woman acting that way?  He was all goodness to her, but still she was selfish and complaining.  I find it hard to believe a man could be so kind, but Tom did indeed love God and tried to live his best as a servant of Christ.I continued reading because it was a good book and held my interest and I'm glad I did, for it  picked up and things changed.  I absolutely LOVED the spiritual message and themes in this book.  Truly appreciated them.  And the ending?  Wow.  One scene near the end had me in tears.I'm off to read the third. Hope it's good. I wish this author would write more medievals because it's my favorite time period.  THese characters have kind of wormed their way into my heart

This is one of the most powerful books I have ever read! It truly deserves double the 5 stars allowed here.Set in Nazi Germany 1938-1944 and in America and Germany in 1972-1973, it an astounding story of God's grace and power to help His children forgive anything.Hannah Sterling, in 1972, has recently lost her mother and is about to lose her job unless she can control her bitterness. Given a leave by her principal, Hannah begins to pour over her mother's possessions, trying to find some answer to why her mother was always so cold and harsh with her and everyone else, why her mother and father fought all the time. What she finds leads her to Germany, to a grandfather she never knew she had. Hannah learns there are many, many secrets her mother kept from her, secrets that devastate her. This grandfather she found and hopes to forge a bond with is not the man she wants or needs him to be.Lisielotte Sommer, Hannah's mother, also tells her tale, set in the years 1938-1944 in the midst of the horror of the Holocaust. The reader learns much from this woman who endures more than we would have imagined.I won't give anything else away for fear of spoilers. Cathy Gohlke writes wonderful books, but this is her absolute personal best! I was entranced, absolutely captivated and had to tear myself away to do needful things like cook for my family! It was as if I couldn't rest until I finished this book.My book is marked and underlined in many,many places. This is not a book you put down after you finish and forget about it. NO! It is a book that lingers on in your heart because it is so rich and powerful. Powerful in that it teaches the reader a huge spiritual principle: the power of forgiveness. I believe many believers struggle with this and I believe they will be able to let go of that bitterness after reading this wonderful story.It was an absolutely amazing book and I will never forget it!*I was given a copy of this book by the author in exchange for my honest review, which I have given.
Good product but it needs to have cloth on both sides.  It sweats on your head as it cools.
This just didn't grab me.  So sorry but just couldn't get into it very welll.
Love Tamara Leigh's medieval books! This was great. I read Lady of Eve first and it should have been second, but still great!  Wish she'd write more medievals.

This is the 3rd book in Regina Scott's 'Frontier Bachelor' series and so far, in my opinion, the absolute best!James Wallin's family is depending on him to find a school teacher for their frontier town. Alexandrina Fosgrave seems to be exactly what they need. But, and it'a big one, will she accept?James Wallin is such a character, full of wit and always ready with a quick response to anything. He thoroughly charmed me and had me rooting for him. James carries a secret, though. Will he allow God to heal that dark hurt he carries?Alexandrina also carries a hurt inside. She has decided it's better to never love than to be hurt again, so she erects a barrier around her heart.The spiritual lesson here is that God loves us no matter how we may feel about ourselves or what has happened in our lives. And, we must forgive ourselves as well.*I was given a copy of this book by the author in exchange for an honest review. I was not encouraged to leave a positive review and my opinions are my own.

This was a very hard book at times to read. It deals with a serious issue about life that doesn't always end on a happy note.Sarah Jae Foster has a good one in A Little Bit Of Faith. I won't do the synopsis here because you can read it for yourself, nor will I include spoilers.This is a moving book. I really think it is worth your time to read.

I love medieval tales; It's my favorite genre, I think. I checked the reviews on this one and decided to take a chance. I'm sure glad I did. I loved it!The author has created very believable characters, the period history is spot on and there's wonderful spiritual content.  Very happy with this book, so much so that I immediately ordered the next 2 in the series, can't wait to read them!
Very nice story, but pretty short.  I enjoyed reading it.

I truly and thoroughly enjoyed Shelley Gray's western series and wished she would write more in that genre.  She writes mostly Amish fiction and I am not a fan, so when I saw this, I was absolutely delighted!  She goes back to the western series and tells Russell's story, who was a member of the Walton Gang.Russell comes home to find his mother dying and the girl he loved seeing a preacher now.  Well, things are not always what they seem.  I can't say more. I loved Russell's character. Gray's descriptions and sometimes comedic turn is absolutely fabulous! I seriously wish she'd write more westerns.  Loved this~

Tamera Alexander has been a favorite for many years. Her writing is full, descriptive and great!  We first met Savannah Darby in To Win Her Favor and I felt she deserved her own story even then. So I was particularly glad when Tamera told me she was indeed going to have a story!Savannah is called back to work at her family's repossessed home after the Civil War has ended. She desperately wishes she could live there again.  The new owner's fiance is changing everything, much to Savannah's dismay. She is there to look for what she was instructed to find in her father's last letter to her now dead mother.  She is the also the sole supporter of her much younger brother and sister.This is a wonderful story. As a rule, I don't like novellas, much preferring an entire full length novel, but this one was good.  Not many authors can pull off a novella and make it seem as full as Tamera Alexander. There are a few who do, but not many. This one is worth the time to read it.
LOVE this!  It is very well made and fantastic.
Very nice, but wish it were more sturdy.  But I could have gotten a sturdier one, but I carry this in my purse and did not want it to be too heavy.

I'm not a huge fan of novellas, much preferring a full length novel, but this collection featured Tamera Alexander, a writer I love and Dorothy Love, who I have also enjoyed for years.The short stories were well written and I did enjoy them, especially Shelley Gray's return to her western series to tell Russell's story.With Tamera Alexander's contribution, I was very glad to see Savannah Darby given her own story. I enjoyed her as a secondary character in To Win Her Favor.It's a very nice collection and one I enjoyed.  I enjoyed Tamera Alexander and Shelly Gray's stories better than the other two, both of which felt rushed and conclusions drawn too quickly.

I picked up Julie Klassen's first novel, 'The Lady of Milkweed Manor' years ago and was immediately captivated. I've read each book since and she has always been a favorite author. However, Lady Maybe is her best ever!! I was completely carried away by the mystery/mysteries of this book.Julie Klassen takes the reader on a journey that is exciting, suspenseful and very, very hard, if not impossible, to figure out. She often throws new information into the mix, causing me to gasp in shock many times throughout this book. I loved every minute of it. I can't wait to see what she has next for her readers.Truly, I believe it is her best book EVER!

Irene Hannon knows how to tell a story that is tender, full of believable characters and locales.  I love her Christian suspense titles and she is a deft hand at a Christian romance also.Hope Harbor is a tender, moving novel full of restoration, grace, second chances and forgiveness.  The characters, even the secondary ones, have a tale to tell and their their stories are so precious.Hannon has crafted Hope Harbor so well, I'd love to visit!  Loved these folks.  But be warned: you will need a tissue more than once here.  This is one of her best romance novels.

If you're looking for a great medieval read, look no further. Tamara Leigh is expert at writing this time period, which is my favorite!  I understand this is a 'cleaned' up version, but now is Christian fiction. And it works well.  I read this one ahead of the book that comes before it, but I am going back to read the first. Tamara's Age of Faith series is spectacular!  I loved each book in the 4 book series.

Misty Beller actually lives in my town!  What a surprise when I discovered this. A Christian Fiction writer in my own town.She writes books set in the old west.  This one actually begins in South Carolina!Beller is new to Christian fiction and she's a talented young author.  I don't think you will go wrong reading her books.

Just One Summer follows 4 girlfriends as they experience a summer in their lives. Each are facing a challenge of one kind or another this summer.I had never read any of the authors except Jenny B. Jones before, but I will be sure to read them in the future.This is NOT Christian fiction, but it IS a clean read. I am sure all CF fans will appreciate it. I absolutely adore Jenny B. Jones' writing! She is completely hilarious. I have all her books and one, Save the Date, I have read twice. She is very gifted.*I was gifted with a copy by the author. I was not encouraged to leave a positive review and my opinions are my own.
Kathleen Y'Barbo always writes well and I'll read what she writes every time.  The Will Turner series is my all time favorite!

Susan Anne Mason's debut novel is very well written and full of depth. The story of two sisters who want to live their own lives, but feel compelled to follow their father's will for their lives. Both Colleen and Brianna love men other than the men their father has decided they should marry. He is intent on them securing marriages that will strengthen their family name and save his faltering Irish Meadows.This is an author to pay attention to with future books. She has evidenced her ability to write a good tale with strong Christian values.*I was provided with a free copy of this book. I was not encouraged to give a good review and my opinions are honest and my own.

Well, I can say for sure that Susan May Warren books never,ever disappoint.The Wonder of You is the 5th book in the Christiansen Family novels and Amelia's story. Amelia is the youngest and everyone has always spoiled and protected her. Anyone who has read this series will remember at the close of the last book, Always On My Mind, Amelia returned home early from her European adventure, withdrawn. Then Roark St. John showed up and apologized to her, only to be driven away by her brothers and father.Well, Roark comes back to Deep Haven, convinced that Amelia is the one for him. If only Amelia would cooperate. Seth Turnquist also has loved Amelia forever and wants her to be his bride.Roark is heir to a vast fortune in the Constantine Hotels dynasty, but he is dealing with and haunted by tragedy, not sure what his life holds or what he is supposed to do. Roark has been from one country to another, never knowing how to stop running, But Amelia has given him a reason to stay put.Amelia is doing a bit of her own running, too. From God. Unsure of what decision she should make, but feeling something way down deep in her heart that won't quite let go, Amelia is confused and hurt by what she feels are lies Roark has told her.This was an amazing 5th book in this series. I love Deep Haven. I want to go visit. I want to stay a while in this tiny hamlet in the north woods of Minnesota. Susan May Warren has created characters and locales that not only enter the imagination of the reader, but take root and become very nearly a reality. I desperately sometimes want to be there and visit with all these people. Seriously. I really do. That's how good this writer is. When I have to put the book down to return to my regular life, I think about it and can't wait to pick it back up again.I also love how Susan lets us visit with and catch up with the characters from previous books. The secondary story line she gives to Max and Grace just blew me away and had me in tears, sobbing, even, at times. In fact, I wept more than a few times during this book. And the ending was sublime. Pure wonderful.Next up is the last book, Owen's story. Owen, the prodigal. I cannot wait to see how Susan reaches him for Christ.This book has a powerful spiritual message running throughout, as do all her books. I appreciate so much her ability to include this in her books and her bravery in taking a deep stand for Christ in her books. Some Christian authors do not. God loves us even when we don't love or believe in ourselves. He's waiting, arms stretched out, ready when we decide that His plan is best. What a wonderful life we have in Christ!*I was given this book as a gift from the author. A positive review was not expected, nor asked for. My opinions are honest and all my own.

I had never read several of the authors listed here, so when I was asked to be an influencer for this book, I accepted gratefully.  I have read many of Andrea Boeshaar's books and loved her story. I also especially enjoyed Erica Vetsch's story. I intend to read more of her books. It was a pleasure to read this book.*I was provided a copy of this book by one of the authors for an honest review. My opinions are my own and were not encouraged by anyone.
Wonderful music.
This is a great brush!!!! Soft yet worked super!
Did not help my tail bone pain at all.  Cushion did not stay puffed up.
Bought for hubby.  Too whiney for me.

MaryLu Tyndall can rock a pirate tale! It's great to be out on the high seas again with all her wonderful characters. AND she has brought some back from previous books so that we can have a nice visit with them, too.This is a time travel pirate tale and it is a great one, too! Morgan has just been diagnosed with liver cancer and is at a pirate festival when she becomes lost from her friends and suddenly finds herself on a REAL pirate's ship in 1694! Oh goodness! But Morgan doesn't get it; she seems to think this is all a big act funded by her absentee father to make her feel better. When she finally realizes that this is indeed 1694, she is totally bereft.Rowan is a pirate, trying to find that elusive treasure that will allow him to feel he finally measures up. Neither he nor Morgan have any use for God. However, as we all know, God has use for them!This was a rollicking good book and I have always loved how MaryLu Tyndall includes spiritual warfare in her books. She is not afraid to tell it like it is. I can't wait for more in this series.*This book was provided to me by the author in exchange for my honest review, which I have given.

I hate to be the odd man out here, but I just couldn't seem to connect with this book.  First of all, there were a few swear words here and I don't want to see that in a Christian fiction book.  I know they are what people might call 'minor' swear words, but they were unnecessary.  I believe that you can say anything anywhere without resorting to profanity.  That's my opinion and I'm fully aware that others will disagree, but I'm entitled to it.  We are cautioned in Scripture to not use coarse language. That's why I read Christian fiction.I just couldn't seem to grasp the characters. They did not seem very real to me. The story line just wasn't there for me.  Maybe because I've just finished several awesome books, but it just didn't 'grab' me.  I won't let this stop me from reading another book by this author, however. I will give him another try at a later date.  Maybe it was just not my cup of tea and another will be better for me.*I was given a copy of this book by the author in exchange for my honest review, which I have given.

Jen Turano is a master at writing Christian comedy. Seriously, she is. She has now written 6 books and I've read and own every single one and they have pride of place on my book shelves. This one, I'm happy to say, was no different. Spectacular! She is in very fine form indeed in her latest, 'In Good Company'. I was laughing by the second page and it never let up, only got better.Miss Millie Longfellow and Mr. Everett Mulberry, who we met in the previous book as secondary characters are the stars in this book. Millie is a nanny who always seems to be fired from every job she gets, no matter that she feels she is a wonderful nanny. Everett has just been willed 3 incorrigible children when his friends die in a carriage accident. Those children manage to run off every nanny he hires, too. However, he wants no part of Millie as his nanny.The employment agency which places nannies, at their absolute wit's end, decides that the best solution to both Everett and Millie's problems are that they should work together, Everett hiring Millie as his wards' nanny. Oh goodness.From there, the action just continues to escalate and hijinks abound. Millie is a most unconventional nanny and manages to get herself into odd situations.Before long, both Millie and Everett find themselves a bit drawn to each other, which is unfortunate, since Everett has been keeping company for quite some time with a very popular memeber of society. One who is beginning to get on his nerves.Jen Turano has been a favorite author of mine since I read her first novella, which was a prequel to her first 4 book series. I often find myself bursting out laughing frequently as I read her books. My husband just looks at me and looks away, he is so used to it.Jen has the ability to craft characters that are just so wonderful, the reader falls right in love with them and wants to sit down and have a meal with them! I absolutely love her characters and all the scrapes they get into. If you want a rollicking good time and a wonderful spiritual theme, you absolutely MUST read Jen Turano's books. I guarantee you will not be disappointed. They are a huge favorite of mine.*I was provided a copy of this book by the publisher in exchange for an honest review.  I was not encouraged to leave a positive review and my opinions are my own and honest.

Carla Laureano brings us book two in The MacDonald Family trilogy with London Tides. London Tides is Ian MacDonald's story.Grace Brennan, photojournalist travels the world's war zones documenting the helpless and forgotten. After the death of her friend and colleage, Grace is shaken and returns to London.Grace and Ian MacDonald had been engaged ten years earlier, but she left without a word, only leaving her engagement ring at his home. Ian gave up his championship rowing career and dreams of Olympic gold years ago for Grace....only to have her choose her career over him.Grace has never stopped loving Ian, but she's been too far and seen too much and carries way too much hurt. Has Ian forgiven her? Could it be that he can forgive her and they can go forward? Will the problems that they've faced tear them apart for good or can they make a go of this relationship?This was by far one of the most full and richest novels I've ever read. Carla Laureano has a way of creating characters so well that they actually feel real to the reader! Seriously. She pulls you in with her vivid descriptions and emotions that you very nearly feel the pain and heartbreak, the joy and tears of these people! Even secondary characters!She's not afraid to delve way down, plumbing the very depths of human emotion. Nor is she afraid to tackle heartbreak and fear in her characters. Rarely do I read a book that makes me 'feel' the pain and joy of characters as I did here. I was very impressed with her giftedness with the written word. The book was deep, rich, full and intensely moving. I wept with Ian and Grace, cheered them on and wished them the very best life has to offer two people.Carla's descriptions of everything, even the food (especially the food!), are so totally vivid, that the reader feels like they're sitting in this restaurant, walking that street, relaxing at the kitchen table with the characters. I didn't want to miss one single word, going back and rereading several passages many times. This is excellent writing, folks. You don't want to miss this book.I'm afraid I lack the ability to convey how very much I loved this book and how well written it is. It is an admirable and excellent sequel to Five Days in Skye, which I read twice! I seriously look forward to Serena MacDonald's story, which will be next in the series.The spiritual theme running throughout impressed me as well. God does indeed see our heartbreak, feels the tragedies we go through and carries our suffering. He gives us hope. He gave Ian and Grace wonderful hope.
