The first thing you notice is the amount of padding, these are clearly built for long gaming sessions or listening to music for extended periods, they are very comfortable.  The game sound is fantastic it really adds a lot to the whole experience.  The sound is also pretty good for just listening to music also considering they are tuned more for gaming and lack just the tiniest bit on the low end since they are not tuned for music.  The microphone is built in to the ear piece and because there is not a dedicated mouth piece the voice can have a little bit of a distant muffled aspect to it.  Decent budget level gaming headphones.

Just be aware I typically don't like to go into details in my reviews for fiction.  I try to go in to a book with as little information as possible, I don't read reviews or even the dust jacket synopsis.I have been a long time fan of Michael Shaara's works but it had been awhile since I read one of his books so when I saw this book I immediately recognized the last name but didn't know the connection.  Upon reading the book and learning that Jeff is Michael's son I can honestly say had I not known that I would think that this had been written by Michael.  Some of the best historical fiction, but with a lot of facts, that you will find on the market.

We have a similar Crayola version that didn't make much sense and was plagued by problems.  This Barbie version makes much more sense but is also plagued by some of the same problems.The consistency of the spray is inconsistent, while this may sometimes add an artistic element it is not ideal.  What is nice are the stencils and are practically a must because of the inconsistency of the spray.  Even when the spray comes out properly the colors themselves will have a washed out look but not as bad as pictured, they look better in person.  There are also additional kits with more designs which increases the re-playability of the toy.What hurts the re-playability is it requires 4 AA batteries.  It would have been nice if a Barbie and the batteries were included.  I like the creative element of the toy and for a child who is a Barbie fan a must have.

The box and wrappers both could be about half the size they are and still fit the bars, there is a lot of empty space, the bars are small relative to the size of the box and wrappers.  There is not any traditional cheesecake, the cheesecake flavor is incorporated in the cookie dough.  I like them but probably not enough to buy them because of how small the bars are.

This is the first step to that future but it will not be long before we will all be living those science fiction movies.  The biggest hurdle Echo faces is getting people used to the inevitable change in lifestyle for all of us.  I have no doubt that a contractor version is already in the works where as your house is built the contractor version is installed and we will have Echo access everywhere in the house.When I first got our Echo the implications of this technology hit me like a ton of bricks.  Ironically the technology involved itself has been available for over a decade, there is really nothing new here but it took the foresight of Amazon to put it all together.  As I started thinking about what we would be able to do with Echo I had to stop after about 10 or 15 minutes because the ideas just kept coming, it really was a revelation.Initially what you were able to do with Echo was rather limited, really mostly just music applications but Amazon has been steadily adding some functions but I think the majority of future functions will be available in apps where you pick and choose the ones you want.  I do think inevitably this app model will become obsolete as Echo will be able to do everything we want without picking and choosing select apps.Right now the best thing Echo does is accessing music, whether in your Amazon music library, through free prime music or genre radio stations and honestly is worth it by itself, especially if you are a Prime member.  The speaker for music is great and also works with Bluetooth.  The voice recognition was pretty good at the start and has improved.  A recent addition to functionality is the ability to reorder things previously ordered on Amazon.  Another great function is the shopping list which combined with the Echo app on your phone is quite a useful application and one we have used many times already.Your interaction with Echo is through "Alexa", she is a prim and proper lady that you can have a lot of fun with and not limited to just telling jokes.  She really is an information center, including dictionary, encyclopedia, weather, news and more.  Echo really is a platform and not just for applications, as we speak products have been produced and are being produced that will function with Echo.  It won't be long where you will be able to initiate macros, such as getting up in the morning and saying "Alexa good morning" which would initiate the morning macro, with things such as asking you if you would like hear the news, weather or starting the coffee maker and more, or just automatically going through these things and you would also be able to interrupt, you get the idea.I'm sure you are starting to see the implications yourself and the future uses are flooding your mind also. It wouldn't surprise me if they had some limited brain sensor functionality within 10 years where you could use your thought to make a choice.  Don't wait, get yours now and get used to this inevitable lifestyle change, the sooner the better.  When Echo first came out many complained that all it did was play music, I imagine it will not be long before we forget that Echo just happens to play music also.  Welcome to the future.

The majority of the cars in this set are reproductions of some previously rare and hard to find versions but this version of the Batmobile is a first time production and unique to this set.  Some of the other cars in this set were previously produced and sell on the secondary market for more than the price of this whole set by themselves.  This is a great option for those that don't want to spend the money on the first versions of the other cars.  The Batmobile is worth the price of the set by itself.  A must have for Hot Wheels collectors.

(sample supplied for review purposes)I like the matte black finish, not a fan of glossy parts on a mouse.  Was able to play around and figure out how to connect it to our HP Envy laptop without even looking at the instructions.  I like the small size it makes it easy to take along.  Had hoped it might work with our Kindle Fire HD but it does not.  Works great with our Windows 8 HP Envy laptop.  Recommended.

(sample supplied for review purposes)This is a very simple looking holder that does not look very impressive but don't judge this book by its cover.  This may look unimpressive but it is probably the best mount I have ever used.  It is hard to get around a pole or handle but that is what makes it so secure.  It is also hard to get the phone in but this also is why it is so secure.  This will easily hold over a 3 inch wide phone and you probably could even get a 4 inch wide phone in and can easily hold a 2 inch wide phone or less.  Get this mount, you will not regret it.  Very highly recommended.

(sample supplied for review purposes)I really like the case, it has a very cool high tech look.  The phone goes in very easily, you will want to put in one of the long sides first and the rest is really just popping it in.  It holds the phone very securely.  The stand works great for horizontal viewing. What a great value, the case would be worth the price by itself but it also comes with a great tempered glass screen protector.  Did I say I really liked this case?  I changed my mind, I really love this case.  I like it so much I'm thinking of buying other versions for for friends and family. Seriously this may be the best phone case I have ever used.  Very highly recommended.

The vibration and buzz can be a little intense at first and takes a little getting used to on the cleaning setting. The vibration and buzz is a little less intense on the sensitive setting.  It's possible the vibration and buzz may actually strengthen your teeth.  The cleaning is very good especially if used with a whitening toothpaste, works amazing and you will probably see results with the first brushing.  The brush works great on the front of the teeth but is a little difficult cleaning the inside of the teeth and is hard not to rattle your teeth when the hard parts of the brush touch your teeth.  It is very easy to charge and the charger has a small footprint and does not take up a lot of space.  The travel case and small charger make this very portable and great for traveling but considering the brush holds a charge for two weeks at twice a day brushing you might not even need to take the charger with you. A four pack of replacement brushes costs nearly thirty dollars Remington SFR401 Sonic Fresh Rechargeable Toothbrush Replacement Head, 4 Count, White but hopefully they might be discounted sometimes or maybe some second party replacements are made and less expensive. For me I don't see using this twice a day as recommended, probably just a couple times a week to get a good whitening and using a regular toothbrush the rest of the time.

(sample received for review purposes)I have a minor case of plantar fasciitis in one foot and these definitely relieve the pressure and I have zero pain.  Personally I wouldn't mind if the arch was a little higher, I have high arches but for most they are probably the right height.  They just don't relieve the pain they kind of feel good also.  Because they are 3/4 length they are ideal for running or walking exercise because they keep you on your toes.  Because of the 3/4 length you do have to hold them in place when you put your foot in the shoe but they do stay put once your foot is in.

...maybe a little of both.  I always worry a little about translations, more times than not there are problems and that is definitely what I felt here but figured since he was an international bestselling author I figured I would give it a shot.  The book had a little bit of a quirky tone and honestly thought it was a little boring, I think this may have been a product of the translation more than anything. One of the best translations I ever read was The Club Dumas, which I read when it came out and long before it was made into the movie The Ninth Gate.There were also a lot of similar Belgian names that were difficult to keep track of but having read enough books by Umberto Eco and others I don't let that stop me even though it sometimes involves going back and refreshing my memory.  Every country and people have their own little quirks and this also may be an acquired taste.

Absolutely love this table runner.  It makes my dining room table sparkle and will become a real feature during holiday season.  I washed it right away to see if it would hold up to washing and the answer is absolutely yes.  No fade in the color and relatively easy to iron.  I did dry it flat.  I've already been working on place settings for Christmas Eve dinner as the whole family will be here then.
This table topper washes beautifully and is easy to iron so that it looks as good as when you first unwrapped it.  You can put this over a white, gold or green tablecloth.  It really makes a sparkle.

This style Sketchers runs small.  I had to return the first pair, but I exchanged them for a pair one size larger and everything was fine.  Now that they fit, they are a very nice shoe that looks professional with my work outfits, but can also be paired with casual outfits.  Once I got a pair that fit and wore them, I liked them enough that I bought them in another color as well.

Perfect bag for an evening out.  It holds my phone plus a couple of credit cards and the gold chain means I can wear it and have my hands free - a nice thing if you go to a party where you aren't constantly sitting.  I can even slip a tube of lipstick in with my credit cards.  It comes in a variety of colors and I ended up buying a second one in a different color.  Great idea.
A chic way to carry your cell phone plus credit cards.  Going out for an evening?  This really makes your outfit

It works but it is pricy.  We use ours with our computer to enhance the sound --- both of us like to play music in the background as we work and this definitely does that.  Sound is better than any speaker system that we've tried with our computers.  However, it doesn't get a 5 star rating because of the cost.  I expect in the future, the cost will come down and the next generation of invisible speaker will improve so it will be worth five stars.

If you take a lot of pictures, this is for you.  Bevy will save, organize, and share all of your digital pics, along with those of your family and friends -- all you do is make an account for anyone who will use this device.  Then every time with an account takes a photo, it goes into an organized, instantly shared album.  This external hard drive and its free companion app connect multiple devices and users so you can find, manage, and share all of the pictures you take, wherever you take them.  It presents albums in a friendly Facebook like format where you can see the pics within each album, but you can also post in social media or e-mail.  The app is free.  Bevy can even display pictures on a TV screen. Because only people you choose see pictures, Bevy is more private than cloud storage. And with one terabyte of memory‚Äîabout 400,000 photos‚Äîyou‚Äôll free up space on tablets, computers, phones, and memory sticks.  I let Bevy automatically sort stored images by user, date, device, or location.However, if you already have digital albums on other services or drives, they can be moved over to Bevy with a click.  You can also show your pics on a TV screen in case you have a family gathering and want to review pics. It has a 2.16 GHz dual-core Celeron Processor, with 2GB RAM, 1TB Hard Drive, and a built-in SD Card Slot.  I use mine with my android smart phone, but it has mobile support for  iOS 8 and higher and Android 4.2 (Jelly Bean) and higher.

Bought these to keep my legs warmer when I'm at a sporting event watching my kids.  I wear them instead of socks with my sneakers, pull them up and put my jeans over them.  Even standing in the cool wind on a damp, humid day, my feet and legs feel warm.  This is such a blessing as last fall I was always shivering while I watched from the sidelines.  These wash great.

Love this light jacket.  Even on a windy, damp day, I stayed warm and toasty.  Under Armour calls it a ColdGearÆ Infrared lining that uses a soft, thermo-conductive inner coating to absorb and retain body heat and I don't know how it does it, but it really worked.  Was at a track meet watching from the sidelines and was very happy and comfortable in this great fleece zip up jacket.  Kept my hands warm in the front pockets

So my doctor wanted me to take my blood pressure and told me to buy one with a large cuff to make it more accurate and I did.  This thing is hard to use.  The cuff is very wide.  Both my husband and I use it and invariably the first time we try, it errors out.  Then you take it off, put it on, wait 2 minutes and it works fine.  Probably causing both of our blood pressures to go up because it refuses to work the first time.

This is a bright, beaded toy that was a gift to a one year old.  To my surprise every adult at the party immediately played with it.  Once the excitement was over, however, the baby sat in front of the dinosaur and carried on a conversation and then began moving the beads around.  After a while his brother, a 3 year old toddler terror who makes everyone laugh.  Mom then sat with both of them and started slowing moving one bead from one side to another and saying, "one."  Three weeks later, the toddler was moving the beads and saying, "one, two, three four ..." followed by a quizzical stare when he moved the fifth bead and of course all the adults in the room immediately chimed in and said, "five."  A fun. safe toy.
Added to my exercise play list.  I like a catchy beat to keep me going.

This is one of her early works, which I bought after I read her latest and it still had very good character development and lots of twists and turns.  Read it on a rainy Saturday and was sorry when the book ended.  I wish my favorite authors could write faster and I am adding Karen Rose to that list of favorites
Great dress.  Very comfortable.  Fit like a glove so true to size.  Got lots of compliments.  Packed in a suitcase and it looked great after I shook it out.

This series by Catherine Coulter and J.T. Ellison is growing and getting better with each book.  COE, a small environmental group, dedicated to making their point by bombing businesses, but not causing bodily harm suddenly jumps into killing people with bombs.  What caused the change?  What's next on their agenda.  Both FBI Special Agents Michaela Caine and Nicholas Drummond are soon involved.  They were only five minutes away when the carnage started, but are soon more than five minutes behind this crafty bunch.The plot development is logical even when it has unseen twists and turns and that's part of what makes it fun.  Additionally Coulter's long-time FBA character Savich and Sherlock are involved.  The end is unexpected, but satisfying.I hated to reach the end and immediately wondered how long before Coulter and Ellison would publish their next in this series.

Got this for my husband and he already loves it.  It repels water without sacrificing breathability as he discovered when he got caught in a shower at a chilly night football game.  The jacket is very warm and has what Under Armour calls ColdGear¬Æ Infrared technology that uses a soft, thermo-conductive inner coating to absorb & retain his body heat.  They put extra insulation exactly where you need it to stay warm and even though he is frequently cold, he said he remained warm throughout the game.  There are two chest pockets & hidden side entry zip pocket on left chest as well as pockets for his hands.

What a cool product and I have to admit I was skeptical when I read about it. There's nothing compared to a delicious grilled meal cooked over red hot charcoal and we like to grill out -- tailgates, picnic in the park. The heat from the charcoal‚Äôs embers cooks the interior and exterior of the meat, while searing in the natural juices and enhancing the mild smoky flavor of the meat and I don't know how it does it so well. The Homping Grill is a new-concept in charcoal grill that helps my family enjoy charcoal-grilling in a safe and convenient manner both at home and on the road. (and yes, my husband did, one summer, barbeque the back porch with our charcoal grill, but that's another story. However it was the reason for us to try this grill.) The Homping Grill provides the best attributes of convenience, heat and flavor in a light-weight, portable, nearly smokeless design and we love that we can easily take it with us or use it on the porch and not worry about another fire.The Homping Grill easily and quickly ignites in two different ways: you can use 8 to 10 instant light charcoal briquettes; or you can use a fire starting gel. Ignite the charcoal, turn on the fire control switch to increase airflow to the flames and you'll be cooking within two to three minutes and there is no black smoke.It comes with a carrying case and has three different plates for grilling or roasting. The built-in electric fan keeps the heat down. Supposedly you can use it inside, but we have yet to do that.

Great product.  Does its job in a gentle fashion and my face is always better if I use this brand and this product.  Yes, I do try others off and on, but always come back to this renewing cleanser.

Callahan and McLane are at it again, except this time they are also exploring their growing relationship.  Again it is a combination case with the FBI and police.  It began with a naked body hanging from a bridge, but when it is learned that it is the body of a Congressman the FBI is called in.  It's not long until a second naked body is found hanging, but this time from a bridge off the beaten track.  There is no obvious connection between the two bodies and there is fear that a serial killer is picking random victims and will be nearly impossible to catch.  From there it unfolds step by step, misstep by misstep as good leads as well as false leads show up.

Finally a comfy Bernie Mex loafer.  This mixture of leather and the stretch webbing that Bernie Mev is known for and these are stylish, attractive and just what I wanted.  I love these loafers and the new look with the combo materials.  They are super easy to slip into which I love.  Easy on.  Comfortable to talk in and they go with both work and casual clothes.  I'm thinking about buying a second pair to keep on the shelf for the day when the pair I'm wearing needs to be replaced.

This bootie is wonderful with my casual outfits.  The suede upper gives it a unique look.  Personally I order one size up when I purchase Bernie Me shoes, and then they are so comfortable.  I can wear them all day.  These are easy to walk in and already I've gotten compliments.  As fall gets cooler and I give up my sandals, these will become my go-to casual shoe.

Have a young one who wants to help bake cookies?  My grand-daughter thinks this pink non-sticking mat is the "very best because of the color."  The other nice thing is that it had circles.  She loves to mix, put the cookies on the sheet (of course eat the warm cookies and lick the bowl goes without saying).  With help she can now place the unbaked cookies in a good spot (thank you circles on the mat) and is thrilled when "her" cookies come out of the overn.
Just enough plot twists to make it difficult to put it down.  Good writing and characters that you want to know more about.  I'm definitely going to read the next in the series.
Loved this as soon as I got one.  It goes with many different outfits and always garners compliments.  Price is good

Perfect those the hot, lazy days of summer.  Wear this with sandals or with heels -- you can dress it up or down.  It came just as we were hit with unusually hot, humid September days and I got a number of compliments when I wore it.
Great product for babies and love that they can be delivered right to the house.

Great boot for those of us with a wider calf.  This boot has a full inside zipper which I really appreciate when I put it on and the shaft is 19" high so it is a good height to wear with dresses and skirts.  It has a very soft high-density memory foam insole with extra heel cushioning -- helps it be very comfortable.  I bought these as soon as I saw them.  They are in my closet waiting for cooler weather.  I much prefer boots when it is cold outside as I have quite a hike from where I park to where I work.

Perfect bootie for the fall.  I bought these to go with my jeans, but they are so well made and so stylish that I've gotten compliments when I've worn to work with dresses.  The memory foam insole makes them extraordinarily comfortable for walking and for wearing all day.  Although the heel is less than 2 inches high, the overall look appears to be much higher.  The back zipper makes it easy to get in and out.  When I first saw them I thought nice, but who wants to lace and unlace, then I read and discovered that there is a handy back zipper.  Great fall value.

So you bought and love your Fugoo Go Anywhere Speakers, but going anywhere has not really been possible.  Now it is.  This kit offer the attachments needed to really make your speakers go anywhere - including on a bike ride.  The Super Pack includes the Bike Mount, Strap Mount, Multi-Mount and Waterproof Bluetooth Remote in a value bundle.  My husband found the bike mount easy to attach.  Now he has music, but without the ear buds that would also block traffic sounds.  Well made and worth the money.

Nathanael Green's book titled FASCISM: AN ANTHOLOGY contained a collection of essay excerpts to "come to grips" with the political concept of Fascism. These excerpts dealt with disparate Fascist parties and movement and showed that Fascism had wide spread support in Europe and in the US. Some of the essays dealt with the international phenomena of Fascism while others focused on specific national Fascist nationalist movements and trends.George Mosse's essay made clear that by 1936, every European nation and the US had Fascist parties or movements some of which were splinter movements. Mosse should have been more specific re the international aspect of Fascism. Such examples could have included Mosley's British Union of Fascists, the Belgium Rexists, the French Action Francaise, the Romanian Iron Guard, and other Fascist groups outside of Italy and Germany.Ernst Nolte's excerpt was taken from his interesting book titled THE THREE FACES OF FASCISM. Nolte emphasized that the one phenomena that united the Fascists was fear of Big Communism. The Fascists were nothing if they were not anti-Communists. Fears ofBig Communism were very real in Central and Eastern Europe. Nolte remembered an attempted Communist revolution in Germany in 1919 which almost claimed the life of the future Pope Pius XII and was only crushed when German troops crushed this attempted revolution. Nolte cited Franz Borkenau (1900-1957) who, interestingly enough, wrote that the biggest purge of Communists occurred in the Soviet via Stalin & co. Except for Lenin's wife, everyone of Lenin's loyal supporters were purged and murdered mostly by the Show Trials in the 1930s. The German Reichstag Fire in 1934 caused a genuine fear of Big Communism, and the trial of van Der Lubbe, a Dutch Communist, proved that he committed the arson alone.As Dennis Mack Smith wrote in a following essay, Mussolini & co. used bogus fears of Big Communism in Italy. The Italians were mostly devout Catholics, and the Communist fear was indeed bogus as Smith noted. In fact, Mussolini, as A. Rossi cited, admitted that his rise to power was in part based on such bogus fears. As A.J.P. Taylor noted in his book THE ORIGINS OF THE SECOND WORLD WAR, the revolution that from which Mussolini saved the Italians was bogus and nonexistent.Often, apprehensively historians have equated Fascism with anti-Antisemitism. This is not true. The Belgium Rexists were not antisemitic and were not racists. Mussolini was not antisemitic and only catered to Hitler with some restrictions on Italian Jews. On the other hand, the alleged virulent anti-Fascist, Joseph Stalin, organized mass arrests and mass murder of Jews along the same lines that Hitler & co. were blamed.George Orwell wrote that historians and social scientists either clearly define Fascism or stop using Fascism as a political description or stop using the term. This reviewer's view is that Fascism was a response and NOT an ideology. The Fascists responded to the following:Disillusion to WW I (winners and losers)Failure to correct the problems of The Great DepressionThe perceived disintegration of social norms and stabilityFears of Big CommunismOne should note that without the rise of Big Communism, Fascism may not have emerged. As noted in this review, Fascism was not the same as conservatism. Franco disbanded his Falangists as soon as the Spanish Civil War was over (1936-1939). One could read Marx, Engles, Lenin, Trotsky, and company to get the roots of Communism. However, no one can trace any roots of Fascism Vain attempts have been made to claim that St. Thomas Aquinas (1225-1274) and Martin Luther (1483-1546) were precursors of Fascism. However no one can make any accurate claim of Fascist ideology.This collection of excerpts help eliminate emotional responses to Fascism. During the 1920s and early 1930s Fascism was a political approval word because of the paranoia over Big Communism. One defect of the book was that the historians mentioned in this anthology did not mention Fascist economic policy which was one reason for Fascist success in the midst of The Great Depression. Still this book is a useful tool to gain a better understanding of Fascism which apprehensively conventional historians refuse to  seriously consider.James E. EgolfOctober 25, 2015

David Starkey' book titled MAGNA CARTA: THE MEDIEVAL ROOTS OF MODERN POLITICS is a well written account Medieval English political and legal history. Starkey clarified the complex issues and identified the "players" who were involved during the reign of King John (1199-1216) who was eventually forced to put his seal on Magna Carta.The early sections of the book dealt with John's loss of Henry II's (1154-1189) Angevin Empire at the Battle of Bovines in 1214. This basically ended English hopes for any control in France until the Hundred Years War (1346-1453). So, as Starkey so clearly showed, King John focused on solidifying his control over the English nobility as well as the Welsh and the Irish. John had 28 Welsh hanged for alleged treason and tried to intimidate other English nobility via treachery, broken promises, and betrayal of loyal supporters.Such actions alienated the English nobles who FINALLY decided to act to protect their interests and their rights. As Starkey noted, the English nobility and Bishop Langton were not idealists but practical men whose "heads were not in the clouds but their feet were firmly planted on the ground." In other words, the English nobility were aware of what they wanted and knew how to get it. John did not understand his opposition and how practical and determined they were.When John agreed to the terms of Magna Carta, the romantic historians got their history wrong. Artists depicted John signing the Magna Carta, but John was illiterate. Also English documents were sealed and not signed. The myth that John signed the entire Magna Carta document was exploded. John only sealed the outlines of Magna Carta. The entire Magna Carta is about 4,000 words long, and scribes need time to complete the document which took considerable time given the fact that Magna Carta was written well before the invention of the printing press. Starkey mentioned that the English nobility formed an alliance with Henry III (1216-1272) who made a radical movement and a "weak" monarch a conservative tendency. Edward I agreed with the terms of Magna Carta which both enshrined the document and gave Edward credibility.When King John died in the midst political turmoil, his short will showed a congenial side to the nefarious monarch. John apologized to the families of people whom he harmed, apologized to those who survived John's persecutions, and he left considerable sums to help the poor and needy. This may fit that there is something good in the worst of us, or John's conscience bothered him.After John's death, English monarchs and nobility both pledged to uphold Magna Carta. While the English turned a radical document into a conservative political establishment, but the English were smart enough to make a  conservative political arrangement into a practical political system that worked for centuries. Starkey made a depressing assessment re the Magna Carta and history. As Starkey noted, British and American citizens do not know or care about Magna Carta, the US Constitution, and the Bill of Rights.One minor weakness of Starkey's book is that he could have mentioned the influence of the Catholic Church's Canon Law. The Catholic Canon Law jurists introduced par legum (due process) into legal practice. Starkey should have mentioned that the Catholic Church's Fourth Lateran Council introduced trial by jury which was not part of English Constitutional History until the reign of Edward I (1272-1307) which obviously was later than the Fourth Lateran Council.Starkey concluded the book with interesting photo plates and careful outlines of the paragraphs of Magna Carta. The outlines are easy to following and some have a "familiar ring" re the US Constitution and the Bill of Rights. One could argue that the US Constitution and Bill of Rights have the British Constitution written all over it. Starkey clearly made this connection. Those interested in English History will like this book which is well written and well organized.James E. EgolfOctober 20, 2015

Reza Aslan wrote an interesting book that provided readers with a practical history of the "origins" of Christianity. Aslan provided a clear explanation of the religious and political tensions within Judaism and the messianic fanaticism against the Romans. The cross currents of disputes among the Jewish priestly class and poor Jews was complicated by a nationalistic/religious opposition to the Romans whose authority was seen as an insult to the people and, as they viewed it, an insult to God.Readers may know of the different sects in Judea. The Sadducees, Pharisees, Essenes, and "Zealots," who should not be confused with the later Zealot Party. As Aslan informed his readers the temple priests were often bitterly resented by poorer Jews. These priests crushed many of the poor with taxes and lavish life styles. The priests' hypocrisy and exorbitant demands for fees and tithes were obvious, and the temple taxes were oppressive. As Aslan noted, this explained the a few assassinations of these priests.In the milieu of these tensions, messianic  leaders and their fanatical supporters emerged to challenge the religious and political status quo often with disastrous results. Aslan mentioned Hezekiah the Bandit Leader, Judas the Galilean, Simon son of Giora, Simon son of Kochba, plus others. These men led rebellions that were lethal to their followers. The Temple priests were resented due to their support for the Roman authorities. In fact, the Roman authorities relied on the Temple priests to help maintain "peace and quiet."Christ and his supporters are seen in the middle of these bitter disputes. Christ and his followers were largely ignored until, as Aslan wrote, they got closer to and entered Jerusalem. A good point was that seemingly innocuous comments were viewed with serious political overtones. Christ's remark abut rending unto Caesar what is Caesar's and render to God what is God's. The question of what belonged to God was seen as the land of Judea which was a direct threat to the Romans and Temple priests. Another threat to the Temple priests was Christ's exorcism or healing which undermined the expensive Temple purification rituals which included lavish fees and dues. Christ's healing was free which precluded all of the expensive ritual payments.Another thesis of the book was the status of John the Baptist. As the Gospel writers wrote about John the Baptist, his status was gradually reduced as the chronology of the Gospels were written. Aslan had interesting material on James the Just whose name appears as the author of the Book of James. Later rabbis argued that the Temple was destroyed because the Chief Priest Ananus had James executed in 62 AD.The earliest "Christians" centered their movement in Jerusalem which came into conflict with St. Paul and his missionary work among "Gentiles" or the Greek and Latin language people outside of Judea. These tensions are reflected in the New Testament Epistles. The "Gentiles" were the final winners when the Temple, the center of Judean worship, was destroyed in 70 AD. Thereafter, as Aslan noted, Christianity became an international religion which this reviewer noted is hinted in some of the Tanak or Old Testament Prophets.Obviously, the Greek and Latin world had various differences most of which were resolved at the Council of Nicea in 325 AD when Constantine (306-330 AD) wanted a resolution of these differences before such differences became serious political problems disrupting political unity which was emerging in the late Roman Empire. Aslan's conclusion was that Christianity today is not the same set of concepts during Ancient History.Reza Aslan wrote a readable account separting "theology" from history. He clarified the complex differences in Ancient Judea the effect these differences had in biblical literature and religious sectarian rivalry. Aslan included a good index and bibliography. As an aside, producing an index can be "soul destroying" work.James E. EgolfSeptember 30, 2015

Thomas Woods' book titled REAL DISSENT is a historically accurate antidote to the "conservatives" and the cowardly war party. Woods value is that he writes very well, and he knows actual history and bona fide sources. While some readers may place Woods as a "neocon," he is certainly is not. While this reviewer does not agree with all of Woods' views, Woods presentations are logical, and he is articulate.Woods wasted no time in attacking the neocons and the "liberals" strait jacket avenues of debate. The apprehensively conventional view that political debate should be confined to Romney, Clinton, and Obama agendas is shattered by Woods book. An amusing view of the neocons is that they whine about socialism and communism. Yet, these same neocons want a Soviet Leninist-Stalinist police state to undermine their badly distorted views of history. Woods cites "chapter and verse" the contradictory neocon views and confusion. Police state spying and attempts to stifle truth are exposed in Woods' book, and the "Establishment" is uncomfortable with Woods to say the least.Both Democrats and Republicans have expanded the war state. Without knowing who the "enemy" is at any given moment, all they can do is talk about bombing people regardless of innocent unarmed civilians including women and children. Between 1988-1991, US forces destroyed Iraq's water purification system which cost the lives of approximately five hundred thousand children because US authorities did not like Saddam Hussein. Then Secretary of State Madeleine Albright actually justified such tragedy.Woods could have made this more of an issue. Readers should know that between 1980-1988, Russian, West German, and US authorities armed Hussein and help him fight the Iranians in a long deadly war which no one won. The lies that Hussein had weapons of mass destruction were later undermined. In 1988, US forces helped the US Navy intervened on Hussein's behalf against the Iraqis. Yet three short years later, Hussein became the "bad guy." The Orwellian overtones are too obvious to ignore.Later in 2001, US forces ousted Hussein, and, as Woods noted, one neocon boasted that US forces should destroy anyone just to do it without any moral imperative. In other words, diplomacy should be based on evil impulse rather than rational policy.When US policy makers were warned about the different political factions in Western Asia, the ignorant government officials dismissed such warning and marginalized anyone who told the truth.Older conservatives such as Russel Kirk who were "the darlings of conservatism," are now condemned by the neocons. Woods noted that Kirk and older conservatives warned  that war destroyed civilized behavior which is now epidemic both overseas and in the US. Woods cited "The Founding Fathers" who were against standing armies, imperialism, and militarism. Now the neocons hate such great men because the views of "The Founding Fathers" undermine "Perpetual War for Perpetual Peace." In fact, some of the neocons are such "cry babies" that anyone who undermines their nonsense is removed from Face Book and other Internet connections.One example of the war party's deceit is John Yoo who tried to cite Alexander Hamilton's views in THE FEDERALIST PAPERS. Supposedly Hamilton said the US presidents had the same power as King George III. Yoo blundered in that he DID NOT finish the citation whereby Hamilton argued that presidents' war making powers were limited by the US Constitution and a declaration of war by Congress. Yoo had to retreat.The undersigned disagreed with Woods' economic views. Woods economic views were logical and expressed very well. However, his views would work in "a perfect world." The political greed and corruption is so entrenched that Woods' views would not work. On the other hand, Woods's economic arguments are well worth reading to understand what is wrong.In spite of minor disagreements, Woods' book titled REAL DISSENT is an "eye opener. This writer recommends any of Woods books which anyone of "residual common sense" can enjoy reading and comprehend. Hopefully Woods will write more thoughtful books and monographs if only for the record.James E. EgolfAugust 23, 2015

A previous reviewer remarked that George Seldes' (1890-1995) book titled THE GREAT QUOTATIONS  is the only book of quotations that is necessary, and the reviewer is right. Seldes' book is thorough, clear, and comprehensive. Seldes was one of the very rare journalists who was knowledgeable about history including Ancient History, Medieval History, Modern History (US and EUROPEAN HISTORY). Seldes was one of the few journalists who wrote where apprehensively conventional historians and journalists were too afraid to go.Charles Austin Beard once wrote that anyone who repeated The Bill of Rights would be branded as a "red," and dangerous. Members of the US Congress refused to go record in quoting the Bill of Rights and the written of Thomas Jefferson-so much for being un-American. In other words the written expression of the "Founding Fathers" was too dangerous for ignoramuses. What was worse for the cowardly was Seldes' examination of fabricated quotes,  Seldes also did a good job of locating original quotes and the fact the "apprehensively conventional" cowards altered the quotes to fit their political agenda. Seldes was well aware of how power destroys liberty, and, to paraphrase Bakunin (1814-1876), liberty destroys power. Or, As the state expands, liberty declines. As Seldes knew very well. most famous political leaders  have been liars, hypocrites, and cowards. As Pierre de Beaumarchais (1732-1799) wrote, "Be commonplace and creeping, and you be a success." Or, as Max Beerbohm (1872-1956) wrote "The  Nonconformist makes cowards of us all."Seldes cited scathing denunciations of war. For example, Erasmus (1466-1536 wrote that war is delightful to those who have had no experience. Seldes often wrote about cowardly war mongers, war wimps, and chicken hawks. Seldes cited a phrase that those who are the most patriotic for war are those who get the profits from war. Readers should read the book titled MERCHANTS OF DEATH.to get a good look at the hypocrisy. Even Henry Ford (1863-1947) remarked that," We must get our boys out of the trenches by Christmas." In other words, men can be rationale when they view war from a distance. As an aside, Nietzche (1844-1900) once wrote that bad music sound good when war is in the air.Seldes was well informed re labor movements and reform. He mentioned Mellon's remark that one cannot run a coal mine without machine guns. Another great quote was "A plowman on his legs is higher than a gentleman on his knees." Seldes knew very well that wealth can be a servant or a master. Or, men do not master wealth so much as wealth masters men-at the expense of the poor.poor. Seldes noticed that the habits and conditions of the destitute were often made by by the well housed, war, and well fed.As readers may know know, Seldes was critical of "organized religion," or organized hypocrisy. Women, the carriers of the race, have been treated contemptuous and degrading. Seldes cited numerous quotes of the cruelty imposed by religious fanatics. Harold E. Stassen once wrote,"whoever kindles the flames of intolerance in american is lighting a fire underneath his own home. Seldes showed considerable knowledge of the religious wars and the useless tragic bloodshed of these wars.Seldes' book titled THE GREAT QUOTATIONS is thorough and well written. He arranged the quotes alphabetically, and the undersigned thinks the organization of the book should have been my historical sequence. That however should not discourage reading this tome. Seldes did not let his "leftist" sympathies interfere with the honesty of book. As an aside, Seldes resulted in his deportation from the Soviet Union and Fascist Italy. Again, readers should know that Seldes was historically knowledgeable which is now rare among current journalists who know nothing more than five minutes again.James E. EgolfJuly 2, 2015

George Seldes (1890-1995) was a prolific writer and "gadfly." He did not flinch exposing hypocrisy and hate mongering. While some readers may consider Seldes as a "leftist," whatever that term means, Seldes was honest. Seldes' book titled WITCH HUNT has "a familiar ring" given the stupidity and hypocrisy among the wing nut political figures.Rarely do journalists and media gurus get anything right. Seldes wrote that the "experts" had no understanding of Russian History or the Bolshevik Revolution. Seldes reported that journalists tried to grab headlines by contradictory stories in Russia. Seldes commented on contradictory reports that Lenin had Trotsky arrested and the revolution was on the verge of collapse-"famous last words." What drew the ire of political leaders and corporate executives were the well researched reports of British and French CEOs  selling weapons and war material to the Germans during WW I. A solid book which gave "chapter and verse" of such transactions was titled MERCHANTS OF DEATH which French, British, and even US authorities tried to suppress.Seldes then explained conditions of post WW I Germany. Fears erupted of a Communist revolution which had a short life. German business executives were making huge profits and live well while the German people suffered from food shortages and illness because of the illegal blockade of Germany AFTER WW I was over. Basically, the red baiting had a temporary problem as political leaders wanted to punish the Germans and at the same time viewed the Germans as a bulwark against Big Communism. The hypocrites were so unaware that they did not see the glaring contradiction.While the British and French looted the Germans after WW I, the German industrialist Stinnes looted the Belgium people during WW I. Seldes made a pertinent remark that no one cared when the most defenseless were looted and forced into terrible living conditions regardless no which "side" they happened to reside. What was amusing was the fact that one of the loudest hypocrites against "The Red Menace" was doing a lucrative business with Soviets (Lenin, Stalin, & co). Of course any public mention was suppressed by press barons and political officials.While hate mongering got a lot of mileage, exposures of such nonsense did occur. Robert La Follette (1895-1953), who succeeded his father as US Senator, exposed the hate mongers and red baiters. The problem the press managers gave these hearing little or no pages, and only diligent  research gave the hearings any attention. The red baiters were confounded and them almost silent during these hearings. Basically Seldes emphasized that ad hominem slurs especially the term "red" threw all reason and knowledge into the "Orwellian Memory Hole."H. L. Mencken once wrote that "....the true patriot expects to be well paid..." The bribes paid to smaller circulation news editors made them "God's fools." However some of these bribes cause trouble for those involved J. B. Sherican who tried to smear those who favored public utilities over private utilities was so involved that he committed suicide. The government investigations into his nefarious activities were never reported in the press.Not only did red baiting attack political and economic dissenters, the red baiting affected social legal policy. A Mrs. Eaton lost custody of her two children because she attended lectures at the Rand School in New York City. She was questioned about her religious beliefs, scientific views, and her political reading. All that had to be mentioned was the Rand School was communist, which it was not, and based on she lost a custody. As an aside, due process forbids mention of a witness' religion, ancestry, or political affiliation.Two sections of the book are titled "Just Around the Corner" and "Small Town Fascism." These sections gave a detailed explanation of how small town news editors incited violence which was followed by local gangs of cowardly thugs. Laura Law of the state of Washington was murdered because she was a dissenter. Local prosecutors refused to prosecute premeditated murder, and police officials protected these cowards. As Seldes noted, calling someone a red was a good enough reason to murder that someone.Seldes further noticed that sensible people became hate mongers against Jews, communists, etc.-if the money was right. Conceding to bribes and wealth made otherwise decent people vulnerable to losing ALL of their self respect. Even those whose ancestors were victimized now became the inquisitors against other innocent victims. Al Capone engaged in red baiting forgetting that Italian immigrants faced discrimination and persecution. Father Coughlin became an inquisitor in spite of the hatred directed toward Irish Catholic during the 19th. and early 20th. centuries. Hypocrites forget history and have short memories.One might ask why such hate mongering is allowed. The answer is willful ignorance and the fact that too many people now see stupidity and violence as virtues. Seldes' book is a reminder how stupid some people are and that cowards and hypocrites are willing to destroy anyone so these cowards can get undeserved attention and bribes at any cost-to their victims. The undersigned recommends any of Seldes' books.James E. EgolfJune 7,2015

Max Nomad (1881-1973) wrote a comprehensive book titled POLITICAL HERETICS about political theory and misguided actions based on often faulty theory. Nomad surveyed he limited political thinking during the time of the Ancient Greeks and Romans and quickly transitions his book to the political thinking during Early and Late Modern History. Those studying "political science" would do well to read and digest this tome.In re the Ancient Romans, the Gracchi brothers who tried to make reforms were assassinated ten years apart. The fact that the Roman elites were threatened by suggested reforms between 133-102 BC led to popular dictators and eventually emperors who far exceeded the power of the Roman Senate. The political views of Plato (c.428-347) were based on elites or Aristocracy whom many Greeks accepted. as long as their political and economic benefits were satisfied.Nomad made a quick transition to modern European Historical political thought. Nomad's book was accurate re Jeremy Bentham (1748-1832) thought. As noted in the book Bentham made a transition from "Classical Liberalism" to Socialism which reflected the working conditions of "blue collar" workers. Another British political write was William Godwin (1756-1836) who scathingly condemned Britain's class society. Although was considered as a pariah and criminal. However, William Pitt the Younger (1759-1806) admitted Godwin was right in private conversation.Nomad had good sections on the French "radicals." During the violent turmoil of the French Revolution, the Reign of Terror, the Thermodorian  response, and the rise and fall of the French Empire, Nomad explained the conspiracies and intrigue the "revolutionaries" used against each other. No wonder historians used the expression, "The French Revolution swallowed its children." One of the casualties was Babeuf who led The Conspiracy of Equals was put to death after the rise of the Reign of Terror. The "practical" men of politics had to get rid  of Babeuf. Another French political "heretic" was Blanqui (105-1881) who repeatedly survived arrests and imprisonment. His organization titled League of the Just showed "lasting power" until late in the 19th. century. In re "political infighting, Lamartine (1790-1869) was at first pleased with working class help in deposing the French monarch Louis Philippe (1830-1848), but he was terrified by the workers when they made demands which resulted in the June Days Revolution (1848) which was crushed.While the French had a tradition of revolution, the Germans had their fair share of "Political Heretics." Aside from Marx (1818-1883), other Germans proposed suggestions for socialism. The big argument was the debate between those who proposed violent revolution and the "revisionists" who wanted gradual legal changes leading to socialism. Some of the German socialists included Kautsky (1854-1938), La Salle (1825-1864) and Edward Bernstein (1850-1932) who drove the fanatics crazy. The Revisionists were right when they argued that German workers were more concerned about better pay, better working conditions, and social security/health benefits. The fanatics and Revisionists were blunted by the "conservative" German Chancellor Bismarck (1815-1899) who "stole the socialist thunder."The British heretics had the same problem the German socialists had. The British Socialists, Communists, and etal., competed with the British trade union leaders. "The name of the game" was who could deliver what the British working class wanted. What Nomad could have focused upon was the rise of The British Union of Fascists under the leadership of Oswal Mosley (1896-1980) whose support was based on Britain's disillusionment over World War I and the Great Depression.Nomad did a credible job in discussing Anarchism which is a more "modern" political phenomenon in Western History. Nomad discussed Proudhon (1809-1865)who suggested a "People's Bank" and local political and economic arrangements. Nomad's treatment of Bakunin (1814-1876) was interesting. Bakunin's work which was popular in Russian, Spain, and Italy, included a concept of anarchist dictatorship. Kropotkin (1842-1921) had more "practical solutions such as federations of diverse skilled people who would be free of Russian Czars and serfdom. Kropotkin wrote, among other works, two books titled FIELDS, FACTORIES, AND WORK SHOPS and MEMOIRS OF A REVOLUTIONARY. These books provide careful thinking.The US had their own political heretics some of whom had to be imported. Emma Goldman (1869-1940), who was deported under trivial circumstances, wrote THE ABCS OF ANARCHISM, LIVING MY LIFE, and MY DISSOLUTION IN RUSSIA wrote well and informed readers of anarchism. Alexander Berkman (1870-1936), who wounded Henry Clay Frick (1849-1919) and spent fourteen years in prison, authored books re anarchism. Victor Berger (1860-1929) started the International Workers of the World.The better known heretics were Lenin (1870-1924) and Stalin (1879-1953) had to abuse language re Marx's definition of a classless society. What began as a phrase everything according to his abilities and everything according to his needs had to converted to everything according one's ability.The Soviet Union had a very strict class society except in name. As readers should note many millions of Russian were starved to support industrial workers and especially managers and technicians. "The Workers' Paradise" became a nightmare, and Lenin and Stalin in effect terrible mass murderers via lethal policies and a through police state.Nomad's book also updated the Chinese Communists and Mao Tse-tung (1893-1976) used political divisions and purges a la Lenin and Stalin. His "Let a Hundred Flowers Bloom" was a trap to expose dissidents and those who opposed Mao's Communist Party. Mao knew who to galvanize the Chinese via The Great Leap Forward which was an economic fiasco. Mao's Cultural Revolution in the late 1960s was actually a savage political  purge. While the Soviet and Chinese Communists had bitter disputes, their methods of trapping their internal dissidents were similar.Max Nomad's book POLITICAL HERETICS is a good book that gives "novices" a good background on political thought from Ancient History through much of the 20th. century. Nomad was surprisingly thorough, and he mentioned many political thinkers whom historians have neglected. Nomad wrote very well, and his book is readable. Those who know history and the "uninitiated" will benefit from Nomad's book title POLITICAL HERETICS.James E. EgolfMay 9, 2015

Mohammad Rehman's  book titled ANGELS ARE CRYING is a book that is long overdue. Rehman's book provided vivid contrast between what Mohammad the Prophet taught and wrote in the QURAN and the corruption of Islam since Mohammad's last sermon in 632. Rehman's corrects the misconceptions that many Muslims now believe, and he provided Westerners with a more accurate view of Islam.Contrary to modern Islamic rulers, Rehman wrote about the QURAN's insistence on charity. The book explains The Five Pillars of Islam which are a belief in God, donate to Charity/help the poor, pray five times a day facing Mecca, fast during the daylight hours during Ramadan, and, if possible, make one pilgrimage to Mecca  Contrary to current fanatic views toward women, Mohammed the Prophet insisted on respect for woman, and Mohammad dearly loved his wife Bibi. Mohammad considered his daughter Fatima the second most important woman in history next to the Virgin Mary.Those Westerners who preach hatred toward Muslims would do well to read this book. Mohammad and his early followers highly praised biblical people. Early Muslims accepted the Jewish Torah and much of the New Testament. Mohammad & co. highly praised Christ and the view of Christ's resurrection. Similar to Catholicism, Muslims accept the Perpetual Virginity of Saint  Marry. Mohammad referred to Jews and Christians as "People of the Book. Rehman was clear that Mohammad and early Muslims permitted and even welcome Jews and Christians into to city of Mecca which, by contrast, is only open to Muslims.When some Westerners complain about the Sharia laws, Rehman cited sections of the QURAN that are in contrast to these restrictive laws. As Rehman noted, the Shariat laws were compiled in 749 AD almost 117 years after the death of Mohammad. Rehma reminded readers that these laws both contradicted both actual meaning of the QUARAN and the spirit of early Islam. The QUARAN and early Islam accepted the view that Jews and Catholics along with devout Muslims had a place in the afterlife. As Rehman noted, Mohammad & co. were more concerned about deeds and actions than sectarian differences. The QURAN also severely condemned fanatical violence.Contrary to current misconceptions, original Islam encouraged compassion and forgiveness. Rehman mentioned that forgiveness was important and those who needed mercy had to be serious about reconciliation of wrong doing. Some critics of Islam complain about the fact that early Moslems could have four wives. However, this provision was due to out of a sense of justice rather than lust. Husbands were often lost to war, and woman were economically and socially vulnerable. Readers must remember that Old Testament figures had several wives and mistresses.Rehman also had interesting comments re "Great" men. While Alexander the Great, the Roman emperors, Genghis and Kublai Khan were considered great, Mohammad argued that mass slaughter is a terrible sin and crime. Rehman mentioned this to undermine the war/militant impulse of fanatics who consider themselves Muslims.Rehman also gave contemporary examples of the corruption of the QUARAN and early Islam. Islamic leaders from the Middle East, Western Asia, the Orient, and Africa has used corruption and violence to enhance personal wealth. Rehman cited "chapter and verse" of Islamic rulers hypocrisy and violence in violation of the QURAN. Islamic authorities condemn vices but foster gambling, excessive drinking, prostitution, child slavery, and unjust oppression. The lavish life style of these rulers is contrasted by the simple live and residence of Mohammad who urged simply living and charity. Western intervention in these areas and support for corrupt officials has made tense situations far worse. Hate mongers have fed into anti-Islamic bias simply which has incited both unaware Westerners and Islamic fanatics.Mohammed Rehman wrote a great book. This reviewer's only minor criticism is that the book should have an index. The writing is clear. The book is informative and well done. Muslims and non-Muslims would have a much better understanding of the QURAN and the actual meaning of Islam. Hopefully this book will have a wide readership.James E. EgolfApril 30,1015

Father Daniel Berrigan (1921-present) wrote a collection of poetry that was embellished by Adrianna Amari's photos. Howard Zinn's introcution to the book gives readers "a taste" of what is expected. Zinn commented to burning draft records and pouring blood on such records was not a tragedy, but using napalm and spilling innocent blood is tragic.The "message" of the selection of poems is that life and death are part of continuous process. Berrigan was clear that life and precious and that death is not end. Death can produce a meaningful legacy, and memories left after death can continue one's legacy-good or bad. Contrary to a commercial world and hate mongering, some people and incidents can inspire if people ever take the time to think what is actually important tather than "cheap grace. The "soul" is like the wind which cannot be seen but can be experience. Serious men and woman can appreciate "The Body of Christ" without a comprehensive understanding. Those "holier-than-thou" know-it-alls who think they have "all the answers," are trapped by the fact that a God who can be described scientifically and technologically  is in fact no God. Some concepts can be appreciated while remaining a mystery.Berrigan amusingly described someone who had no money, no fear, no lies but had a soul and a conscience as "Un-American" what ever that now means. Love and compassion are concepts that far exceed material possessions. Even lost loved ones can still exist via fond memories and their legacy. What is life without friends and loved ones. Such a life is full as material possessions can make life dull, lonely and absolutely meaningless. Men and women should celebrate the sublime relations which exceed the false hopes via advertising.One of the themes of Berrigan's poetry is time. Convictions, changes, renewal, and love take time. Maturity and becoming better people take time. Time can be an ally or an enemy depending on how people spend their lives .Berrigan's  message is the people can waste time or take advantage of time to become better people.Another poem in this collection dealt with the bloody 20th. and 21st. century. However the innocents who have died still leave a lesson about the uselessness of "Man's Inhumanity to Man." While the names and identifications of those innocent people who lied, their martyrdom can be remembered of people come to their senses. How people die is important. Many live meaningless lives while others whose self sacrifice and acts of mercy give their lives meaning while giving meaning to those who benefit or at least obse4rve.The last poem is a memorial to all the innocent who have died from W.W. II to the present. One might hope that such history may one day resonate and make people more loving, charitable, and thought. Berrigan provided so many examples in the last poem that contemporaries should invesitage who tragic these events were if only to learn from past evils.Berrigan's book is a direct assault on thoughtless conformity. The introduction and the poems focus on the appreciation of life and using memories to enhance our own lives. The lessons contained herein are important contrasted with dull monotony of stupid advertising and mindless cowardly political rhetoric. Since today is Food Friday, today may a good day to read Berrigan's work reflect on what he wrote.Good Friday, 2015James E. Egolf

Pricilla Robertson wrote a well researched book about the 1848 Revolutions which rocked Europe for a year but had far-reaching consequences. Her book diagnosed the problems and the class divisions and hatreds that were simmering since the French Revolution. Miss Robertson also developed the theme of nationalist and ethic hatreds that were probably unknown a hundred years earlier. The revolutions were omen of the tragic events of the 20th century.Miss Robertson's began with events in France. The French who ousted Charles (1824-1830) replaced him with Louis Philippe (1830-1848) whose popularity waned in lieu of economic depression. When French wealthy middle classes had a protest banquet in 1848, someone ordered the troops standing guard to fire into the crowd, and "all hell broke loose." Miss Robertson related that the euphoria of revolution when the middle class realized that they should fear the working classes. Larmartine (1790-1869) learned to fear the proletariat. The issue as Robertson noted was the creation of the National Workshops which were created to alleviate unemployment. Louis Blanc (1811-1882) who supported these programs was frustrated when the middle class and agricultural workers decided to refuse to pay taxes for what they saw as idle workmen in Paris. The result was the June Days Revolt in 1848 which was crushed  and paved the way for Napoleon III (1852-1870) to seize power.Other Europeans experience revolutions. The Prussians faced turmoil during the reign of Frederick William IV (1840-`1862)who faced "liberal" rebellion when wealthy Prussian middle class representatives created the Frankfort Assemble. Frederick refused to accept "a crown from the gutter" when offered a revised position as constitutional monarch. Similar to events in France, the French middle classes also faced rebellions from the working classes and called upon Frederick to use the Prussian army to crush working class riots. Frederick then used the army and disband the Frankfort Assembly and saved his political situation.Revolution and rebellion part of the political landscape in Eastern Europe. Metternich (1770-1859) who was such an important figure in the Austrian-Hungarian Empire and to flee for his life. Franz Joseph (1848-1916) inherited a volatile situation both in Austria and Hungary. His problems extended to Italy where Italian unification had been a dream at least since 1831 if not earlier. Robertson observed that the only thing that saved the Hapsburgs was the Austrian army. Even then the Austrian troops could stop the rebellions in Hungary led by Louis Kossuth 1802-1894). Given the "conservative" nature of Czar Nicholas II (1825-1855), he sent Russians troops into Hungary to finish the Hungarian rebellion.While none of the 1848 revolutions were successful, they did not result in some reforms especially in  Austria-Hungary. The evolutions also showed the cities and urbane areas were increasingly important both economically and politically. These revolutions revealed the potential for bitter class conflict. The "nationalities question" showed that different ethnic groups could rebel only to turn on each in at attempt at "ethnic cleansing. In other words, the 1848 revolutions were omens of what happened during the 20th century.Miss Robertson's book is well researched and well written. While the history of the 1848 revolutions is complex, Miss Robertson clarifies the issues and events to provide a clearer understanding of these revolutions. Even those readers who are not well read in history can easily comprehend the book and its implications.

Etienne Gilson (1884-1978) wrote a good summary about philosophy/theology, and Ultimate Being. Gilson presented problems posed by the Ancient Greeks and modern philosophers. While Gilson was a devout Catholic, he "gave credit where credit was due." He also effectively answered challenges to Catholic teaching. Jaroslav Pelikan (1923-2006) wrote a useful Forward to Gilson's book titled GOD AND PHILOSOPHY.Gilson started this book by explaining the insights of Ancient Greek philosophers. For example, Thales of Miletus (c.623-c.546 BC) argued that water had divine qualities and contained deities or that water was possibly a god. However, Thales never reached a clear point of origin. As Gilson noted, the Judeo-Christian view had an a priori view as "I AM WHO I AM" (Exodus 6:2). Plato (428-347 BC) viewed the celestial bodies as gods, but he also argued that the IDEA or ideas were above the gods. Aristotle (384-322 BC) made reference to a Supreme Being, but he held the gods "at arms length."Gilson treated modern philosophy with careful attention. He criticized Descartes (1506-1650) for trying to prove for what was obvious, namely physical reality. Descartes was too self absorbed to  allow other a priori causes. Gilson wrote St. Thomas Aquinas (1225-1274) had already answered Descartes questions of a starting point.Gilson further assessed the thinking of Kant (1720-1804) and Compte The views of Kant and Compte relied too much on physical science . Gilson thought that Ultimate Reality or God was avoided and the metaphysics were just as much a part of reality as physical science. In other words men and women were more than just "technocrats." Metaphysics and abstract thought helped people become human and humane and not members of an insect colony.Gilson wrote a good explanation of Neo-Scholastic thought vs. contending and often conflicting thinking. Yet, as noted above, Gilson gave credit when necessary, and his book is not only a good introduction to Catholic philosophy/theology, but his book is helpful to understand "other schools of thought."James E. EgolfMarch 3,2015.

George Seldes (1890-1995) was a knowledgeable, tough journalist. His book titled  TELL THE TRUTH AND RUN is a history of  honesty vs. "The Truth Telling Squads." Seldes was too honest for the "apprenhensively conventintal" which obviously led to confrontation  and, at times, dangerous situations. Seldes' book is readable and invites readers to continue reading.Seldes began his journalistic career as a reporter for Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania newspapers. His first experience with censorship dealt with is report of a traffic accident involving a driver of  a beer truck and a conveyance. When his report appeared in print, it was altered. The name of the beer company was omitted and facts were distorted. Seldes did an expose re police and "red light districts" only to be told  powerful real estate tycoons made money from these districts. The expose also included some police officers which was another reason for censoring and eliminating news reports.Another anecdote reported by Seldes was the Andrew Melon divorce trial which was held in secret. The Pennsylvania legislature passed a law to keep the proceedings secret, and Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania wire services including Western Union refused to send any reports. However, as Seldes noted, phone calls and mail could not be controlled and the events were reported to Philadelphia, Pennsylvania and Europe. Later the law re the Mellon's divorce was rescinded.Seldes' career expanded when he went to Europe toward the end of WW I.Seldes was critisized for telling the truth about a battle that never happened. Seldes got an interview with the German commander von Hindenberg (1837-1934) which was revealing. Von Hindenburg reported that the addition of US forces and infantry turned the tide against the Germans. This interview was censored and never reported at the time. In fact, the paronoid French authorities tried to have Seldes court-martialied and shot, but the effort failed. Seldes made a good arguement that had the interview been published, Hitler's rise to power may have been muted. Von Hindenburg was a German hero, and his word was respected. Had this interview been reported, Hitler's claim of the Germans being "stabbed in the back" by Communists, Socialists, and Jews would have been rebutted by the von Hindenburg interview.While Seldes was a "leftist' (whatever that means)he was not a Communist. In spite of Seldes political sympathies, his desire was for the truth. When Seldes went to Bolshevik Russia c. 1922, Seldes wrote honestly about the terrible conditions in "The Worker's Paradise." When Seldes tried to sneak his reports out of the Bolshevik Russia, he was forced to leave. Just before Seldes left Bolshevik Russia, he asked a former Czarist officer in Trotsky's Red Army why he was in the service of the Bolsheviks. The officer answered that he was Russian first. This comment reminded the undersigned of a comment of a White commander who opposed the Reds and was  questioned when fighting erupted between White troops and American forces during the Russian Civil War between the Whites and the Reds. The White commander was told by a US journalist that the Bolsheviks were bastards. The White commander agreed, but said the Bolshviks "were our bastards."Seldes reported two interesting anecdotes while he was in Bolshevik Russia. He attended a speech by Lenin (1870-1024). Lenin's photographs as a big man and great orator were mitigated by Seldes' description of Lenin as a small man and dull orator. One credit that Seldes gave Lenin is that Lenin was the only important poltical leader that Seldes met who had a sense of humor.The only speaker whom Seldes respected while in Russia was Karl Radak (1885-1939).Upon Seldes' removal from Bolshevik Russia, he went to report on Mussolini (1883-1945) and Fascist Italy. Seldes reported on Mussolini's armed Black Shirts and embarrassed some wealthy Americans who financed the Italian dictator. Seldes was so disliked while in Fascist Italy, that he was forced to leave. His experience was the basis of Seldes's book re Musslini titled SAWDUST CEASAR.Seldes was then assigned to Spain to report on the Civl War between Franco's forces and the Loyalists. Seldes' report was similar to George Orwell's (1903-1950)book titled HOMAGE TO CATALONIA. Similar to Orwell's account Seldes critisized Communist intervention in this strife. As Seldes wrote, the Orwell book titled HOMAGE TO CATALONIA was finished in 1938 but was almost unheard of until about 1952 or 1953.Seldes was also in Toto's Yugoslavia and interviewed Tito. Tito was clear that he stopped Stalin's Soviet agents from taking control of Yugoslavia, and Tito's police and troops stuffed Stalin's attempt to turn Yugoslavia into a Soviet colony. Tito was vilified in the Soviet press, and Seldes was later accused of being a Communist and a "red" for this honest interview.Seldes certainly did not lead a dull life. As mentioned above, was a self admitted leftist, but he was honest regardless of polticial affiliations. When Seldes was accused of "being one sided," the response was that Seldes reported the side that was omitted or distorted. Seldes' book is well written informative. Readers can learn much form this book.James E. EgolfFebruary 14,2015-Valentine's Day during which I let my wife know how much I dearly love her.

Thus far, the undersigiged has not been disappointed by Father Baron's books, and  this book is no exception. Father Baron's book titled EUCAHARIST is an intelligent and readable account of the Cathoic concept of the Eucharist. His book offers a good explanation of the Eucharist to both Catholics and non-Catholics. If some readers do not accept the Eucharistic concepts, they at least know the resoning for this Catholic Sacrament.The  book began with a story titled "Babette's Feast" the setting of which was in Norway among straight lace Lutherans ( this is not a slur against Lutherans) who thought that enjoyment of good food was somehow wrong. Babette spends all of her money she won in the French lottery to prepare a sumptuous feast which her friends attend. The moral of the story was that Babette sacrificed all she had to prepare a feast which her stern guests enjoyed and forget about past differences. Father Baron compared with this the Last Supper which he argued brought forgiveness and renewal to the human race.Father Baron then ventures into Old Testament stories re sacrifice. He used the example of Abraham ordered by God to sacrifice his son until a lamb appears to replace the human sacrifice. Hence, Christ is often referred to as The Lamb of God or the Ultimate Sacrifice. As Father Baron reminded readers The Last Supper was the Passover, and Baron draws imagery and comparisons which help explain the Catholic concept of the Eucharist.Father Baron's book dealt with the Gospel of John 6:53-63. In the discourse with His followers, Christ defines Himself as flesh and blood which must be consumed. Christ's does not retreat from his remarks which caused many followers to leave because the teaching was "too hard." Perhaps they should have waited for "the punch line" in John 6:63 whereby Christ said "It is the Spirit who gives life." Christ's comments are again reflected in the Last Supper narratives.Father Baron concludes his book with a comment by Flannery O'Connor (1924-1965)who was told that the Eucharist was "a powerful symbol." Flannery O'Conner said that if the Eucharist was just a symbol,"... the hell with it." In other words the Eucharist is essential and crucial to devout Catholics. Father Baron made another interesing comment re the wine and hosts. The soil, the sun and other aspects of the Cosmos go into the preparation of the wine and bread. Since these elements part of God's Creation, Christ's spiritual Real Presence is present. St. Thomas Aquinas (1225-1274)once wrote that the accidents of bread and wine appear as such, but the Essence of the bread and wine become of the essence of Christ.Father Baron could have enhanced this book by reporting on the intense arguement between Peter Abelard (1043-1142) and St. Bernard of Clairvaux (1090-1153). Both men accepted the Real Presence of Christ, but Benard thought that Abelard's dialetical examination of the Holy Trinity would trivialize the Sacred Mysteries. As an aside, both men recondiled, and Abelard died in full communion with the Catholic Church in a Cistertian monastery founded by Bernard.Father Baron does not engage in acrimony. He wrote an intelligent commentary about the Eucharist and the reasons for this Sacrament. Again, regardless of religious affiliation, readers can learn from this book.

H. W. Crocker III wrote a good survey of Catholic Church.  Croker's book is well written and well organized. Crocker also showed wit and the book is laced with humor which keeps readers' attention. The book is a good introduction to approximately 2000 years of Catholic History and should invite further investigation..The Prologue treated Constantine's military  victory over Maxentius at Milvian Bridge in 312 AD. Crocker's description of the battle scene was suprisingly well done. If Crocker is not a military historia, he still did an exceptional job. The victory insured freedom of religious liberty for both Catholics and "Pagans."Crocker's account of Roman control of Judea  c. 63 BC provided a historiical background to  Jewish background and political history from which early Catholicism emerged. Crocker explained the differences among Jewish groups such as the Sadducees, Pharisees, Essenes,etc. Readers should note that St. Paul was at one time a persecuting Pharissee.Crocker then examined the persecution of the Early Church. Persecutions were mostly sporadic, but the reigns of Decius (249-252)and Diocletian (284-305)consisted of attempts to erase the Early Church. When one reads that the Early Church was built on the blood of its martyrs, these persecutions confirm that phrase. The Early Church faced internal problems from the Gnostics, the Arians, and others. The Council of Nicea (325) resolved these differences in favor of St. Athanasius (293-373)who argued in favor of both Christ's human and divine nature (The Nicene Creed and the Apostles'Creed).Challenges to the early Catholic Church did not stop.
