I needed a dv camera to 6-pin cable and this and I was back up in running transferring videos.

I wasn't so sure about this product at first. I'm not a huge cologne wearer but I started with just a single spritz on the neck to see if it lasted, if I smelled it or if anybody else noticed it. None of those came to fruit so I upped the dosage to two and 1/2 or 3 and after doing this for a bit, I don't honestly care what anybody else thinks I smell like. I like what I smell like. Laoste L!VE has a nice even scent to it. It lasts a long time and it isn't obnoxious or overpowering. It's just a nice calm subtle smell to it. I've yet to have anybody comment on my cologne but I have noticed some squirrely eyes from some unsuspecting ladies wondering why they were so attracted to my awkward self.Bottom line though, I'm more attracted to myself and that's where it starts. Nice easy-going product to fit my easy-going nature.

For somebody who has sleep problems combined with work hours problems, I couldn't get into this bed fast enough to see if it changed my fortune. The mattress comes compressed in a box for easier shipping and when you take it out of its plastic wrapping it begins Decompressing; which is sort of cool watching it increase in size. The instructions are simple and easy; let the mattress decompress (which takes 24 to 72 hours) and then use it. I let it decompress for about a day and it was just fine. I removed my old mattress with the dips and craters and inserted this one.I've heard a lot of things about memory foam mattress; one being that they make you sweaty and they are hard.  One I haven't found to be true and the other is, but with a twist. I haven't found that this bed makes me sweaty in the least. In fact, it is actually cooling (hence the cooling gel). The bed however is hard, but once you lay down and find your spot, you will wake up in a 'you'-sized indention that is similar to if  you had slept in an organized and not messy pile of sand. This indention keeps you from tossing and turning and improves your sleep. There is no better proof that this works to keep somebody from tossing and turning than my 9-year old sleeping in it and not waking me up with a foot to my ribs or inexplicably laying at the foot of the bed.Since I started sleeping in the memory foam bed I am actually dreaming vividly again. I go to work at 3am every weekday morning and I usually go home after my work day and take a nap. I'm even dreaming then! This is a great bed and I thought it would take some time to get used to. Nope. Since day one I have been sleeping soundly and waking up in the exact same place I closed my eyes in. I can't wait to go back to bed.

In Gravwell, you play as a spacecraft sucked into a black hole trying to escape in a gravity-free zone, using only floating elements and debris to send you backward and forward, hopefully toward escape. It's the kind of game that you would see played on the television show "The Big Bang Thoery" with floating elements and calculations needed to succeed. Ultimately, the elements that you encounter don't necessary do what that particular element would do, it's all hypothetical and you are basically using the letters of those elements to determine who goes first on each turn.There's a lot of fun strategy in Gravwell. Playing it for the first time was difficult to get a grasp on and we read the instructions for a good long time before the gist of the game finally clicked and we had a big giant palm to the forehead, "Oh, I get it now!"  moment.  Reading the instructions and understanding the game actually took longer than the game to play... the first time. That won't happen again. The game takes about 30 minutes to play.You have 6 rounds of play to escape and the first one to succeed leaves the others suckers to die in the gravwell. Succeeding involves playing the right cards because you can't just 'drive' through a black hole, you have to coast and you have to coast properly. Some cards make you go toward the nearest ship (which could be BEHIND YOU), some cards make you go away from ships (but not once you get past the singularity), some cards are tractor beams which pull everything toward you by two spaces and everybody has 1 emergency stop card that they can use once per round to prevent one bad movement.  The trick is, you may have a plan before everybody moves that will catapult you toward freedom, but once people start playing their cards, the plan changes.This is a fun game that makes you groan outloud and celebrate outloud.  There are multiple ways to play as well (they are in the rule book) that can spruce up the fun. Once you get the basic game down, you can play 4 other radical ways or make up your own way of playing. I love games that can be altered and bended to suit the players. I also love games that involve strategy, misguided strategy and strategy that can be pulled out from under you like a rug.Good game.

These are round disk snacks that my dog was at first reluctant to enjoy. I have a small Chihuahua and these are maybe meant for a larger dog (most snacks are). They are also pretty hard (another setback for my dog). After watching her stare at it, lick it and leave it alone for a few minutes, I decided to break the snack up (which was easy) into small Chihuahua bites and she then enjoyed the heck out of them.  I'm not a dog, so I can't tell, but I would imagine if I were a dog I would be complaining about the hardness of these snacks. You'd have to have some pretty righteous teeth strength to chew these things.  If I bought a beef jerky at the gas station and it was this tough, I'd wing it out the car window.My dog did enjoy them though, once I broke them up into small bites.

"Munchkin Panic" is a fun and funny game that can be played by pretty much anybody. The age on the box says 10+ and I'd agree with that, but only because the rules are multi-faceted and a little complex for a young child. If you throw away your hard core rules following instincts though, the games rules can be tinkered with to suit whatever your situation.The game can be played as individual players or as teams defending your keep against the onslaught of many dangerous monsters like Lawyers, Maul rats, Insurance salesmen or 3,182 orcs (which are easier to defeat than the lawyers) and many others. As they move toward your castle you have to use your thought process and timing as to when to attack and how to keep the onslaught of bad guys from overtaking you.As I said earlier, this is a great game for adults who want to soup up the difficulty and beat the heck out of each other and a great game for young kids who maybe need some work thinking about processes and not necessarily living in the moment and planning for the future. This is why I love the game so much. I have a 9-year old and when playing with him, I can see the difficulty he has planning for his next move because he lives in the now. In this game though, you have to plan because you are equipped with a certain amount of knights, guards, archers etc. and they can only be used at certain times.Fun game for all ages.  Rules that can be toyed with to suit the situation.

If you‚Äôre like me, you were sort of indifferent about a sequel to the 2011 hit family film ‚ÄúDolphin Tale‚Äù about a dolphin who lost his tail in a crab trap. The films are based on the true life adventures of the Dolphin named ‚ÄòWinter‚Äô who resides at the Clearwater Marine Aquarium in Florida. The aquarium is a rehab and release facility and that becomes part of the story that makes up ‚ÄúDolphin Tale 2‚Äù.‚ÄúDolphin Tale 2‚Äù is a mix between authentic and informative and overblown self-importance. Winter is in desperate need of a dolphin-pairing and the stability of the Clearwater Marine Aquarium is at stake. The administrators of the aquarium, including Dr. Clay Haskett (Harry Connick, Jr.) are faced with moral dilemmas as to how to achieve that. That‚Äôs about it, but you would think the way some of the scenes play out that the end of the free world were at stake.To be fair, at the end of the film you will see some actual footage of the events portrayed in the film and you will be impressed at how accurate the staged scenes were to the real thing. To an adult viewer though, many of the scenes played out like overblown Hollywood self-importance and would have served better being downplayed. In nearly all the instances, the drama didn‚Äôt need to be manufactured by Hollywood magic; music, dialogue and tension. For someone who sees a lot of movies, like I do, the racked-up tension reeked of filmmakers trying to sensationalize.‚ÄúDolphin Tale 2‚Äù is a fine family film with charming characters and some poignant moments into the thin line between humans and animals. Morgan Freeman brings some nice wit and personality to the film as well. In fact, there is a lot to like about the movie as a whole. I enjoyed the personalities, the photography and the creator‚Äôs ability to give insight into the animals portrayed, but the films souped-up self-importance was unnecessary.

My son loved this book but it took him about 25 minutes to read the whole thing and he was done. The artwork is pretty quality but it's a pretty simple book. I like Ricky Ricotta because in the back of all their books they usually have a flip-page demonstration or how animation works demonstration. This one was just okay. The flip-paging didn't consist of much. In fact... it was just 2 pages each for I think 3 different animations.When it says Book 1 though, it means it. Ricky Ricotta, when the book begins, has yet to bring about his Mighty Robot and he is inspired to do so because of some bullys at school. So, with a ever-popular bullying theme, how can you go wrong.It's a good book. Not a great one. My son loved it though.

Roll for it is a fun game that takes the game Yahtzee's best qualities and adds a little bit of strategy to it. Of course, there is a strategy to Yahtzee as well, but ultimately you are only as lucky as your roll.  In "Roll for It" you are only as lucky as your role as well, but as you role, you have to wager whether to roll fewer dice in an attempt to get certain cards.You can play with 2-4 players and you each have the same amount of dice. You turn over 3 cards from the deck and they have point values awarded for rolling the dice on the card. You can get lucky and roll everything on the card in one toss... or maybe you will only get 2 or three of the dice on the card. So then you have to decide whether to take those dice out and put them next to the card, lessoning the power of your next role. All the while, your opponents are going for the same cards.It's a fun and simple game that my son and I played for a couple of hours the other day before he started getting emotional when he lost. We'll play again when he toughens up, cause I don't like to lose. I'd give it 5-stars but I'm pretty stingy and the game is nothing ground-breaking. It's just another one of those games that make you think... "I should have thought of that".  But you didn't.

After the 2005 release of ‚ÄúSin City‚Äù, Robert Rodriquez announced that there would be more from the fictional city immortalized by the graphic novels of Frank Miller.  After completing the screenplay in 2007, the film though went into hiatus until 2012 when filming began. ‚ÄúA Dame to Kill For‚Äù has had a long journey to the big screen and it‚Äôs up to us to determine if it was worth the wait.‚ÄúA Dame to Kill For‚Äù is a blending of four-short stories, ‚ÄúJust Another Saturday Night‚Äù, ‚ÄúA Dame to Kill For‚Äù, ‚ÄúThe Long Bad Night‚Äù and ‚ÄúNancy‚Äôs Last Dance‚Äù. All of these stories have one thing in common; revenge. Revenge is a bitter pill and mixed with the dirty, dark reputation of Sin City, there isn‚Äôt much of an upside to the emotions explored in the movie. Everybody talks with gravelly voices and everybody broods relentlessly; everybody.This is what you come to expect when you venture into Sin City though. You shouldn‚Äôt expect anything else. The name says it all. For that matter, ‚ÄúA Dame to Kill For‚Äù is a beautiful mix of graphic justice and deep, dark intentions from near everybody involved. On top of that, the cartoonish backdrop blend with real actors and environments comes across brilliantly in 3D and for that alone is worth a trip to the theater. Within minutes of the film beginning you are immersed in the visuals of Sin City and the stories it has to tell. As well, you will feel the heavy weight that Sin City bares.This though, may be part of the movies problem because as good of a job as the movie does to bring you there and drag you into its filth, once you‚Äôre done with the journey, you may be anxious to leave. You don‚Äôt venture to Sin City to find joy and happiness, but you also don‚Äôt go to the movies to feel weighted down by relentless drama, darkness and human filth. ‚ÄúA Dame to Kill For‚Äù is exactly what you expect and don‚Äôt expect anything else.

I love this binder. I completely scrapped my leather bigger, bulkier leather binder that was holding all my business documents and replaced it with this light-weight and flexible one. It is much more comfortable and less cumbersome to handle. It has an outside large zipper pocket, two inside large pockets for notebooks or documents, a 3-ring binder, a small velcro-pocket that would be ideal for a calculator or cell phone sized device and a smaller zipper pocket for pens and pencils. Since I got this, I have been carrying it everywhere. I look official and i'm not even. Great product.

It has been a little more than twenty-years since the `muppetish' "Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles III" and I'd have to admit that with the popularity and quality of the Nickelodeon cartoon, that a reboot was warranted. The pre-criticism has been rampant and nowadays that's fairly typical. Everybody has access to computers and phones and can voice their opinions like never before. More importantly, everybody can make a better movie than those that do.There is plenty to criticize about "TMNT 2014", but it may or may not have been a better movie than expected. Megan Fox was just fine as April O'Neill, the Turtles did have unique personalities and the fact that the turtles had noses wasn't a big deal in the least. On the other hand, although Michael Bay didn't direct the film (Johnathan Liebsman did), the markings of Producer Bay were all over the film, and that's not a good thing.As with 1998's Michael Bay brain-hurter "Armageddon", many of the sequences are edited into hundreds of three-second shots that are tough to watch. The opening animated sequence was such an assault on the senses that I had to look away from the screen during it. It was such a flurry of shots that I was so busy concentrating on the bombardment that I have zero idea what was even said during it. Much of the film is shot with a handy-cam style and in close, making some of the darker scenes pointless in 3D and some of the scenes actually really cool. It was a mixed bag.Another trademark of Michael Bay reared its ugly head with one ridiculous scene that didn't have to be so ridiculous, and I'm not even talking about the tower falling scene at the end of the film. A scene of cars and trucks crashing down a snowy hill was okay until it went on and on forever and just kept tumbling and tumbling further into overdone land. Not to mention, two human characters somehow survived the idiocy.I could go on and on with the criticisms; some of the scenes were staged ridiculously and Will Arnett's character, Vernon Fenwick, was way too heroic toward the end of the movie, which was a total over-step. Yet, notice I said nothing about Megan Fox and the Turtles were, well, the turtles. That being said, the movie was fun. You can sit there all day and criticize and knit-pick (and you certainly can) or you can forget your critical eye and have fun. If you do that, Turtles is good enough.

This is a pretty busy vacuum cleaner with settings, buttons, filters and modes. You have to sort of pay attention to what you're doing and make adjustments. In other words, if you're vacuuming hardwood floor, set the vacuum to floor. If you're vacuuming curtains, set it to curtains, etc. I vacuumed my living room floor once before realizing that I didn't have the vacuum set to the proper carpet setting. I adjusted it correctly and noticed a tremendous difference in the job that it did.There are many features to this vacuum that I REALLY like. I really like the HEPA filter that sits in the top of the motor. It has a tab on it that lets you know when it needs to be replaced. Sure, that's just another thing you have to get in order for your vacuum to do its job, but the benefits are great, especially if you have allergies and pets. Most vacuums allow much of these tiny danders and allergens to just escape back into the air; not this one.The vacuum is heavy for a vacuum cleaner, but as you run it, it has a forward pushing feature to it that almost resembles a lawn mower that rolls forward, limiting the amount of pushing you have to do. I love this because despite the weight of the vacuum, pushing it requires little to zero effort. Add the flexibility of the handle to his feature and I was whipping this vacuum cleaner all over the place with ease; hitting corners, angles, etc.Occassionally the flexibility of the handle would release when I wasn't trying to, which was a little annoying and troublesome, but that aside, this is a great vacuum cleaner that is easy to use and has powerful suction. Note: Don't vacuum near anything you would like to keep because it will devour it.

Some may say that "Guardians of the Galaxy" was the throw away movie for Marvel Studios. It comes from a lesser known series of comics and characters that have spanned sporadically throughout the Marvel universe since 1969. Even some Marvel faithful's were forced to admit that they were unfamiliar with the characters. Marvel Studios may have thought it was a throw away movie but Director James Gunn didn't think so. In fact, in my opinion, Marvel may have told James Gunn to just have fun with it because that's what it looks like, and he certainly did.On top of just plain being a complete blast of a movie to watch, "Guardians" may just be more poetic and meaningful than it ever planned on being. The characters Star-lord, Rocket Raccoon, Groot, Drax the Destroyer and Gamora, form an unlikely team of misfits. As the movie guides us through the details of how they become a team, they dance a fine line between hatred, love, respect and disrespect. This bond is the glue that holds the whole movie together and culminates with some well-placed emotion that reminds you how important it is for somebody to have your back and visa-versa.I was a little worried that "Guardians" would not be as snappy and catchy as the amazing trailer that began circulating earlier this year but my concern was quickly thwarted. The movie is from beginning to end, completely engaging and never once loses the snappiness that you come to expect. The characters are evenly layered and completely unique; which makes their coming together as a team all the more interesting.Director James Gunn had some fun with "Guardians" and in doing so, may have paid the ultimate homage to Marvel's creator, Stan Lee. Coming from Troma Pictures, he's used to having some creative liberties and he's proven that his liberties are usually good ones. What may have been a forgotten comic book series for Marvel has been revitalized and is one of the most entertaining movies to come along in years. It isn't without fault; the ending is a little confusing and disappointing, but everything that happens before that is more than worth the price of admission.

Renny Harlin's "Legend of Hercules" that was released earlier this year wasn't very good. Maybe that's why Brett Ratner's "Hercules" is coming out now, in the middle of the summer when there's a fresh new audience of people that no longer remember "Legend". The two movies, while about the same thing, are like night and day. "Legend" was more mythological and true to the legend of the strongman and "Hercules" is more grounded in reality; focusing upon how legends are created and exaggerated.I found this aspect of "Herclues" really rewarding because I like things grounded in reality. Even when things get ridiculous, I like when they play it off as ridiculous, rather than normalcy. Ratner took all the mythological aspects of Hercules and made them stories or possible exaggerations to be believed or not. On the surface, Hercules (Dwayne Johnson aka The Rock) is just a man with great size and strength, but his legend has spread and he is worshipped as something more than just a man."Hercules" did a lot of things right but that depends upon what you're looking for. If you're looking for something along the lines of "300" or "Clash of the Titans", look elsewhere. As I said, this is Hercules grounded in reality. There will be nothing portrayed here that is beyond possibility. Ratner makes sure that you have a strong emotional contact with Hercules and his band of warriors; again, something I really like.This was a role that Dwayne Johnson was seemingly born to play and it is probably one of his best movies to date. Surprisingly enough, along with the machismo, the movie is written with some pretty good comedy as well; which adds to the personal connection you feel with the characters. "Hercules" is a step up from "Legend of Hercules" due to its character development and story, but not a huge step up. It still lacks in importance and it still had a conclusion you could see a mile away. The outstanding 3D, fight sequences, character development and comedy saved the day though, making "Hercules" a passable summer movie that should have grand success on video.

For such a cool concept, "Watch Dogs" actually just borrows everything that it is from three games that have come before, "Assassins Creed", "GTA" and "Call of Duty". You have a grand environment that is open. There is a lot of driving and there is a multi-player/on-line aspect to it as well. I admittedly haven't played the whole game through yet, but my assessment so far is that the game is very very busy, repetitive and for a game that requries a lot of driving, has terrible driving mechanics.The graphics are quality but the gameplay has its issues. The two most prevalent things about the game, the hacking and the driving are the biggest problem and that doesn't bode well. Driving around is like driving on a sheet of ice, unless you have a large truck of some sort and then you can control it better; which makes no sense. The hacking become repetitious after you do it a few times. It doesn't get more interesting.Of course for a game about hacking they have to leave open a window for actual hackers to hack your game and everybody loves getting hacked don't they? Not a fan of this. In concept I'm sure it sounded fun to the creators who undoubtedly allowed this aspect to exist but in reality, it quite simply isn't.Could have been a great game, but it's just an okay one.

This is a good product if you just need something to keep notes in or something that you need noted for the time-being. I wouldn't consider this all that long lasting. As most everything is these days, Mead is most likely nickel and diming people by decreasing the grade or thickness of their paper. This is certainly not just a Mead tactic. I've noticed this with many other paper companies as well. I purchased a ream of paper the other day though that was plenty thick, so their not all cutting costs by issuing tissue paper thin product.The price is decent enough for what you get though. This would be a nice affordable product for somebody, as long as you aren't looking for something with more substantle weight to the pages.

I was struggling hard with some allergies when I found this product and I figured I'd give it a shot. At first I wasn't sure if it was working or not because it didn't have an immediate impact, but as all natural products do, it took time to work its 'magic'. Within about 5-days, the fatigue that I was feeling from the allergies in my sinus passages disappeared and I have no doubts that it is from "Queen's Magic". I switched to natural remedies three-years ago and it made a total transformation of me but I had yet to find something that controlled my allergies effectively.One of my first instincts was to question whether or not The Queen's Magic would spike my blood sugar. I recently found out that I am a diabetic, not a bad one, but I didn't want to take something that would make me worse. Upon doing some research, I found that Queen's Magic actually helps control blood sugar and many have theorized that it may or could be something that would eliminate the effects of diabetes entirely. That I've yet to see but I will be the first to let you know if it does.Bottom line though, with all natural remedies, you can't judge them right away. You have to give them time. Keep a chart. Make a comparision in how you feel after taking it for a decent amount of time. I can without question say that this worked for me. In the heart of allergy season, two weeks into taking these and I haven't even thought about my allergies for the last 5 or 6 days.To top it off... I e-mailed Eden Pond to ask them about the blood sugar thing and while they weren't allowed to give me a medical diagnosis, they responded quickly and I was able to have a really good conversation with them about the intent of their product and that just pushed my approval of the product over the top.

Pierre Boulle‚Äôs 1963 novel ‚ÄúLa Planete‚Äô des Singes‚Äù spawned many ‚ÄúPlanet of the Apes‚Äù movies that spans nearly 50-years, beginning with the classic Charlton Heston film in 1968. All of which have the same theme that appears to never get old; the fragility of humanity and the senselessness of war. This version, ‚ÄúDawn of the Planet of the Apes‚Äù is the follow up to 2011‚Äôs ‚ÄúRise of the Planet of the Apes‚Äù. I‚Äôm not too sure there‚Äôs much of a difference between the words ‚ÄòRise‚Äô and ‚ÄòDawn‚Äô, but that‚Äôs beside the point.I could nit-pick a few nickel and dime flaws in ‚ÄúDawn of the Planet of the Apes‚Äù, but the essence of the franchise and its meaning is alive and well. 2011‚Äôs ‚ÄúRise‚Äù was an okay movie with a small plot and a cool Caesar ape portrayed by Andy Serkis who is quickly becoming a legend of playing CGI characters; Gollum, King Kong and now Caesar. ‚ÄúDawn of the Planet of the Apes‚Äù is a huge step up from ‚ÄúRise‚Äù in nearly every way possible.If you thought Caesar was cool in ‚ÄúRise‚Äù, wait until you see ‚ÄúDawn‚Äù. In 1968, ‚ÄúPlanet of the Apes‚Äù set a standard for makeup and costuming by creating a community of apes that looked amazing. Now days, watching 1968‚Äôs ‚ÄúPlanet‚Äù, we are no longer amazed at guys and girls in monkey suits. The motion capture technology in ‚ÄúDawn‚Äù has set a new standard, just as ‚ÄúPlanet‚Äù did back then. Although as good as it is, effects alone do not make a movie.‚ÄúDawn‚Äù isn‚Äôt complicated. You‚Äôd think that it would be as the name portrays, but it really isn‚Äôt. Co-existence is apparently a tough thing to practice in the real world and in monkey/human movies. That is pretty much the nuts and bolts of the movie. It isn‚Äôt done on a grand scale, as the word ‚Äòplanet‚Äô implies, but in a small mountainous area. Ideals collide and symbolic struggles begin.‚ÄúDawn of the Planet of the Apes‚Äù is a really good movie and a big step up from its predecessor, but it certainly isn‚Äôt without some mild flaws. The biggest of those in my opinion, wasn‚Äôt the small scale of the film but in one final motivation right before the credits rolled that took everything you learned throughout the film about Caesar and tossed it out the window. Fortunately, they saved that until the very ending and it doesn‚Äôt ruin a really good time at the movies.

I won't judge this film based on the fact that it is a low-budget independent film with many handicaps in comparison to other larger budget movies. Clearly the creators had access to some really nice cameras, some acceptable film locations, the vault of cast off Lord of the Rings costumes and makeups and some pretty decent actors. The potential for something great and message sending to the billion dollar Lord of the Rings franchise and big studios was all there, it just wasn't realized.Fine, make a fantasy movie, but if you're going to use all the costumes and makeup from the Lord of the Rings vault at least alter them to make them unique. Fine, make a fantasy movie, but if you're going to use the Lord of the Rings costumes and makeups, how about trying to avoid things that reek of the Lord of the Rings.... like a crazy cave troll.... an elfish-female type character who speaks to other characters... with her mind... in nearly the exact same voice as Cate Blanchett from the Lord of the Rings.How about making a film with some personality instead of being so convoluted that I can only compare it to "Dune". They should have issued a manual with the movie just so you can keep everything straight or know what people are talking about when they say stuff like this:  "The shadow agent has the ashes of Amenkah (or something like that) and the blood of Gotha-Zool (?). He took the canteen I collected at the bleeding stone. When they are mixed together at the entrance of the underworld, they will raise a avatar of Gotha-zool lord of the dead. With him at their head, their legions swelling with the corpses they'll reanimate... etc. etc."All of the dialogue is like this. In fact, everything is over-acted and over-staged. Fight sequence are edited so loosely, you can actually see the actor for a split second waiting to hear 'action' before moving. The music plays through the film as if they want you to love this movie like the Lord of the Rings with such drama and importance, but you can't. They want you to care, but all you can do is watch mindnumbingly as they talk about things like you should know who and what they are talking about.Movies should let their audience play along. It doesn't have to be dummied down until it is stupid or simple.... but it doesn't have to be "DUNE" and it should NEVER, EVER, EVER, EVER make you think of another movie as you watch it at any time. Especially one as epic and memorable as the Lord of the RIngs. There are some good things about "Curse of the Dragon Slayer", but movies like this disappoint me. It's 2014 and this is something that Roger Corman would have made in the 1970s. That's fine if that was what the creators intended, but it is obviously NOT what they intended.  They intended to be a more adult version of "Lord of the Rings" and while they certainly succeeded, they also succeeded in making a bad movie despite having all the right tools to make a good one.

Based on the real-life accounts of former New York Cop Ralph Sarchie, "Deliver Us from Evil" makes you wonder if this craziness actually happened, or some retired cop figured he'd make some bucks off of hyping up something sort of similar that actually happened. I have no opinion on this, but I do have an opinion on the movie that delivered a mixed bag of intrigue, shocks, gore and monotony.From the early going the movie has you on the edge of your seat. The intrigue is well done and the two cops on the beat type storytelling is always a draw for me. Sarchie (Eric Bana) and his partner McHale are tying the events of multiple cases together to track down a bizarre and complicated criminal. The things they find are gruesome and the evidence they find string you the viewer along as a third-person very capably.Unfortunately the events leading up to the culmination are the most interesting part of the film. Not that the culmination wasn't interesting or fulfilling, but at one point, what was a relentlessly entertaining and intriguing movie dropped off into a form of monotony. It was like being in a racing car for about fifty minutes and then veering off into 40mph traffic for thirty minutes. The monotonous moments in the film should have been spread out over the length of the movie, but instead they chose to do it all at once and then deliver their grand finale.After viewing "Deliver us From Evil", I couldn't help thinking that we've been here before numerous times. With it being based upon real-life accounts, maybe that was unavoidable, but the "Se7en" meets "The Exorcist" premise hung there like a ghost and both of those were better films; much better films. Maybe even the finale would have been more interesting had we not already seen it dozens of times in other films. The only director to ever make an exorcism on film different than everybody else was Tim Burton in "Beetlejuice"."Deliver us from Evil" is a passable film with talented people in front of and behind the camera, but it just needed to find a way to transfuse that edge of the seat delivery from the beginning of the film into the second half.

This is a cool figurine that is about 15% bobblehead. I wouldn't necessarily consider this a childs play-toy, although it absolutely is. This is not the kind of toy you give to your kid so that they can recreate their own little movie in their head or move it around, etc. This has very limited mobility and as I said, is part bobblehead. Me personally, I put my bobbleheads on a shelf for observation. They aren't played with.This Rocket Raccoon has a cool gun that activates by hitting the button i.e. loader on the top. It rattles off a powerful (simulated) shot that causes the bobblehead and body to shake and rattle. It also has a few voices that can also be operated by a button on his leg.This is a cool toy that is more novelty than versatile but as a novelty it is top notch and a welcome addition to my movie room.

My dog went crazy for these. At first, she was a little apathetic, but eventually she was bouncing around like she does when I have popcorn. I have a small small dog and these are maybe meant for a bigger dog because they come in people-sized beef jerky pieces. Although, they are crisp and easily broken. I broke the treats up into mini-chihuahua sized treats and once she tasted one... she went nuts. Love these and I've never seen my dog respond to any treats this way. The only thing she truly gets excited about is popcorn and now I have something better to give her.

Michael Bay is like an old faithful horse packed with rocket launchers, laser-eyes and the ability to gallop through buildings, causing them to crumble to the ground. Also you may as well slap a Pepsi-Cola, Budweiser or John Deere logo on the rear end of that horse in order to truly cap off explaining Michael Bay. Michael Bay is the Nascar or WWE of Hollywood's movie directors. In fact, Michael Bay has even said, "I make movies for teenage boys. Oh dear, what a crime."Well, it may not be a `crime', but it may not be the best use of your gifts and opportunities. Despite the fact that critics have bombasted his films for years, Bay continues to rock the box office with big numbers. For the same reason why professional wrestling is still a huge money maker and "Walker, Texas Ranger" lasted nine seasons, you can expect more Bay-type movies. As long as people want their action movies simple-minded and relentlessly destructive, Bay will continue to get opportunities and others will not.As far as Bay Movies go, "Transformers: Age of Extinction" is one of his better movies. It certainly makes the second and third Transformers installments look like the drink coasters I thought they were. At a ridiculous 165-minutes, those who crave their chaos in unforgiving amounts will get exactly what they paid for. In fact, many of the action sequences had me in awe and appreciating good old fashion mindless fun. Even better, Bay even managed to attach a pretty good human element to his destruction epic.With that human element comes a fine line in believability when it comes to some sequences. It's a Bay movie though; who cares about believability? Well, I do. So, numerous instances where Cade Yeager (Mark Wahlberg) appeared to be more James Bond or Jason Bourne than farmland inventor were problematic. A teenage girl survives numerous falls and even is thrown down on a highway at high speed and rolls on the pavement, only to hop up without a scratch as if she were made of that Stretch Armstrong material. The worst of those were the instances where humans survived numerous falls without a scratch or were showered with the debris from dozens of buildings. That though, is typical Michael Bay.I'm certain there are better movie-makers and movies out there (Edge of Tomorrow), but unfortunately and apparently there is a huge market for Bay and that keeps us from seeing other people given the same bankroll to make their movie. "Transformers: Age of Extinction" is an epic action movie that will please those who love this type thing and it is good enough that it may even please some that don't. Yet, its typical Bay delivery will take away from its longevity. When the credits rolled, I no longer cared and that is the long legacy of such films.

My son was so excited to see this movie today on BLURAY 3D!!!. I was prepared to go buy it and surprise him with it when I picked him up. NOPE. Not paying $35 for any movie. I don't care how much trumped up junk you throw in it. To make matters worse, Amazon offers this for $34.96 (just 4-cents short of free-shipping... making it $39). There is NOTHING in this edition other than a lego figure that any other 3D RELEASE hasn't offered. When will movie studios get the hint that PEOPLE ARE POOR RIGHT NOW!! Oh, I forgot... their rich.  *sigh*... guess I'll $1 rent it.  So sorry Warner... no $$$$ from me.  Now my review of this FUN MOVIE:Every parent in the free world knows the mystique and endlessness of the Lego and every parent in the world knows the feeling of waking up in the middle of the night and feeling one of those Legos seemingly cut your foot to the bone. They also know the price tag of such Lego's and their child's disregard for formalities. That's what makes "The Lego Movie" such a great thing. While the 3D is dazzling and entertaining, the Lego's don't come out of the screen so that you can step on them and the price tag is no different than any other movie (unless you're talking about the 3D bluray ‡≤†_‡≤†)All that aside, "The Lego Movie" is a creative and imaginative movie for all ages. An ordinary lego named Emmet Brickowski wakes up in his world where 'Everything is Awesome' and soon finds his ordinary world exploded into a world of endless possibility. When Emmet finds a mysterious girl named Wildstyle tinkering around his construction site after hours, he becomes involved in her search for an object called 'the piece of resistance'; thus opening his eyes to incredible possibilities.Every moment of the movie is endlessly entertaining and we quickly realize that the possibilities keep us continuously on our toes and unsure of what may be next. The little in-destructive pieces just keep clicking together to form more and more environments and story-lines. The entire thing plays out like an epic play day for any child; even with ghosts on strings and boats and spaceships moving off screen with a 'brrrrrrrrrrr...'With all the pop culture references and movie references, "The Lego Movie" is a movie that everybody will enjoy. There are endless movie references and characters such as Batman, Superman, Han Solo, Chewie, Gandolf and so on. Not only that, you won't understand the ultimate meaning of the film until its finale. After watching a movie that played liked an assault on the synapse, it finished with a feeling of calm and promise.Sure, it may have been the longest commercial in the history of film-making, but despite stepping on those little things in the middle of the night and crying out in pain, or wondering why such a little tiny thing costs so much money, Lego's are an amazing source of imagination, patience and building mentality for children; just like the movie.

I have also tried the Nacho Cheddar version of Kernels Season's and I didn't find it to be overly salty, but the White Cheddar had too much of a salty taste to it.  I didn't like this one as much for some reason. Maybe I don't like the White Cheddar taste on my popcorn. The Nacho Cheddar was not bad at all, but as I was eating this popcorn with White Cheddar seasoning, I kept thinking that I'd rather be eating White Cheddar Cheezit's. THOSE... I like.I think my opinion of this product is a personal taste. I'm not knocking the product, I just prefer something different.

I travel frequently and as I type this I am On Oahu watching a giant storm pass by. This is important becasue there has been all sorts of lightning today across the island. This is one of my favorite devices to have in my travel bag for a few reasons.1. Its light weight and is a surge protector2. I can charge via the USB port3. Its small and gives me extra outlets to work from4. it worksBelkin typically makes great products and this is not exception

This is a good lightning cable. This is the 3 foot version and I like to use this short of a cable for travel. I this cable up to my Ipad air 2 and was able to charge with no problems from a RavPower 1600 with no problems. This also works with a standard apple usb chrager. The construction is great.If anything changes I will update my review

I have an asus t100 netbook / laptop that I use when I travel. When the device was built there was only 1 USB 3.0 port added. This lack of having support for multiple devices is not always easy. The best solution for this problem is to add a mini hub that is either powered or not powered. What I like about this hub is it can be used either way. This unit does come with the power supply and plug.I also have the mini version of this device and it is not powered.Now with any device the transfer rate can depend upon the device and what is being used. I was able to attach a Seagate hard drive to the hub and transfer at anywhere from 30 MBS to 40 MBS  for some large files. My larger i7 laptop was a bit faster.Overall this has been a good hub. the size is small, the transfers work, I get 4 more places to add devicesIf anything changes I will modify my review in the future.

Most jobs do not have life or death implications. Those who serve in the SEAL program are confronted with many challenges in a day an average CEO or business owner would have to face. The lessons taught in this book come from the years of honing leadership styles under pressure. Conflict is created on purpose to get the participants to react while training as lessons for the leads as well as those who go graduate the program and end up on teams.I have read quite a few books on leadership that deal with theory and ideas but are weak on the ability to explain how to implement. This book is great as anyone can adapt the concepts for just about any organization.This book is good for those who manage a few or manage many.There are ideas on:ownershipsmall teamsconflict and resolutiondecision makingstructureOverall this is a good book for businesses because the ideas are from the outside of most industries and not the same old worn out boring conversations.

This is a good indoor outdoor grill. I have been paying attention to my diet lately and this was the perfect option for grilling some food in a way that is easy. This grill does come in a box and some assembly is necessary but not very difficult at all. I wanted to make sure to use this grill for a few weeks before I wrote a review.Here is what I really like about this grill:This is easy to grill on and it heats up fairly quickIt can be used indoors and outdoorsThe size is fairly small and does not take up a bunch of roomFor the most part there is even heat for the entire heating surfaceClean up is easyTake down and storage is easyThere were not any items that I disliked about this grillIf anything changes in the future I will make changes to this review

This is a good lightweight hub. I have an Asus T100 transformer tablet / netbook and it came with only 1 USB port on the keyboard which would be awesome if I only needed 1 port. This 4 port hub was an awesome fix.As a side note this one doesn't have external power supply do its great for a few minimal transferring tasks or to hook up other devices. Trendnet does have a little bit larger powered version that is nice as well

I shoot a ton of video every week for my youtube channels. This weekend was not different. I went to Monterey Bay California for car week and was able to not just get videos but cool pictures of cars with this card in my Samsung Note 3 (smn900v).I also loaded this card into my panasonic x920 and put the settings as high as they would go... zero problems.This card took everything I threw at it and then some. I would have prefered to use a 128gb card but I cant really complain since this one was free.The card was accepted by my phone as soon as I put it in. There was no formatting needed.I shot a ton of videos all day in 1080 and didnt run out of room.When I took the card out and transfered the files they went to the laptop quickly. Transfer always depends on the device the card is in and the load on the laptop. This card bounced between 60 an 80 mbs with an iogear usb3.0 card reader on an asus i7 laptop using isb 3.0 ports.By the way if you have never been to car week in monterey you have to go. I lost count of all of the Ferraris and Lamborghinis plus all the muscle cars and other exotics.

I love my Sonicare tooth brush. I was commanded by my dentist to get a Sonicare toothbrush and at first I fought the idea. I realized they were trying to help me out so I could get a better job done brushing. I ended up ordering a Sonicare and even let the technician pick it out on my amazon app. This healthy white plus is a step above my original Sonicare. If you have never used one of these brushes you are in for a surprise of not just what they do but also how they feel when brushing your teeth. These brushes are amazing and do help with getting the job done.What is really cool is the near charge with this device. There are not metal contacts viable and the brush shuts off as soon as it hits the base if it on.Update 9-5-15 - This toothbrush has the wider head then what my first Sonicare came with, this is the head to get Philips Sonicare HX6062/64 Diamondclean Replacement Brush Heads, Standard even if you have an older sonicare. This difference right off the bat is night and day

Most people think they know how to collaborate with others, but do they really. The learning style has plenty to do with you connect with another person or not. Depending upon if you are Auditory (A), Visual (V) or even Kinesthetic (K) you may hear, see or feel things differently than the people you are working with and this may be part of the problem or the solution. If you have some knowledge into neuro linguistic programming NLP some of this you may already know.This book helps you understand the way you learn how it impacts others in their choices for what they will do in a given situation and there possible preferences.This book is broken up into 4 sections and gives 12 steps to figuring out how to collaborate with others to create more.Overall this is an easy read but a long book

If you have an android phone or tablet and would like more storage these are the perfect attachment to hook up a thumb drive or card reader to. I have some 256 GB thumb drives and these OTG cables will transfer or store just about anything I need. I travel frequently and tend to give one of these to someone on just about every trip. Its best to buy a few at a time as they don't cost very much.  The difference between USB 2.0 and USB 3.0 is the width of the connection that goes into the phone. The 3.0 is the wider version found on newer Samsung phones. You can use a 2.0 with a newer version phone but there is not enough room to plug a USB 3.0 into an older phone with the smaller connection.This is the better version to get if you have a thick case than the cable with the right hand turned connector.

I have quite a few scents in my collection with almost all of the Tom Ford private collection, a few from Creed, a few from Ramon Monegal and even Clive Christian C. In all total I have 130 different scents and I have to say this is one of the most unique there is. To begin with everyone I know who has bought this scent hates it for the first few minutes until it sets up properly and that will take about 10 - 20 minutes and then they love it. I cant even compare it to anything else I have smelled or is out there. To smell it out of the bottle on a paper card will not do any justice to the way this stuff smell and a little spray does go a long way.There are not many places that sell this scent, the Larger stores would be Neiman Marcus and Saks Fifth Avenue. I have also seen Clive Christian in a few boutique stores as well.If you do not want to smell like everyone else this is a great scent. I get asked all of the time what it is and have no problem telling people because I know most of them will never pay for it. The better bottle to buy is the 3.7 ounce. Yes its $450 here on amazon but this scent is intoxicating.The ingredients are listed as follows: Bergamot, spices, cardamom, ginger, and juniper berry, sambac oil,  cedarwood, moss, cinnamon, jasmine hedione, pimento oil, orris, amber, vetiver oil and vanilla

I love music and listen to just about every genre there is. What you also need to know is I love headphones and have just about every brand out there including: Sennheisser, Audio Technica, Dennon, AKG Beats Pro, Polk and so many more. I also have not just one pair but 2 pairs of the  1st Generation of the Klipsch Reference Ones and 2 pairs of the regular reference. These headphones are awesome for the price range and deliver the sounds needed if you love music. The first generation Reference Ones could pound your ears with Bass, these ones are a little more toned down and deliver a good thump when you need it.The fit and feel is way better than the first generation and they also feel more solid I wore these for the first time for a few hours. I like that these ones fold up and dont need a hard carry case. This set comes with a velvet type lined bag.Most headphones take about 20 hours to get burned in and I have about 15 on these. The more I listen with them on the more I like them.Overall these sound amazing and feel great while they are worn.I made  one phone call with the headphones on and they functioned well.

When I saw these nail trimmers I thought they looked cool and would be an awesome addition to my travel kit. They are everything they are advertised small, thin and a cool design. These trimmers slide into the main body to hide the lever.These clippers provide a nice clean cut and are easy to use.As a side note these trimmers / clippers are small and would be easy to lose track of. The case that is in the picture is a leather pouch to store the trimmers in.The one odd thing is these clippers come in a generic plastic package and you would think for $35 clippers they would come in something nicer instead of packaging for a $5 product.

As someone who shoots tons of pictures and videos I do like to know the colors on my screen are correct for a final output. I was surprised how far off my display was once I ran the program for this Spyder 5. I have an Asus laptop that is about 9 months old.The set up for this device is easy.1. Go to the Spyder website and download the program (took a few minutes at 25mbs)2. Install onto the computer3. Go through the activation process - input serial number, name, email address)4. Hold the device to the screen (this was about 4 minutes)5. See how far off the color was form before and afterthis whole process of initial set up took about 10 minutes form start to finish and was very straightforward. The program prompts each step and shows what to do with a seven minute video. I ran the video as I went though the process.This is a cool device for those who take and print pictures for clients, edit and shoot videos or even for someone who wants to make sure the colors being displayed are accurate.  This is easy to use and install. The program is set to automatically remind to run again every months as displays degrade over time. The video says after the first calibration the next run is half the amount of time. Each calibration can be saved.What is nice is the box can be save to hold the Spyder 5 and it is small enough it will not get in the way.

The back half of the house has a small problem of signal degradation. I have fiber at that house and typicality average 50 - 70 mbs depending on where I am sitting. The back half of the house gets 30mbs at best. Now I cant say the mbs is equal throughout the house now but I did get a significant boost of 10 - 15 mbs.This device is easy to set up and is ready to go in minutes

Almost everyone falls for the :I was planning on getting to that cycle". This common problem creates a challenge as nothing gets done as soon as it is supposed to. This book outlines the common challenges people face. While reading I am sure you will say "I have heard this before" but there is some information to reinforce how to get back on track and actually implement getting your work or goals done.There is a section on getting things done that rely on 4 pillars of 1. Creating, 2. Eliminating, 3. Accepting, 4.PreservingWhat I like about this book is that it is easy to read and there are constant reinforcements that we all tend to not complete what we need to.Self accountability is important and this book reinforces why asking yourself "Have I completed what I need to today". Having a checklist to work off does help on a daily and weekly basis.

I was on the fence if I should buy this holder or not as there are plenty out in the market for less than this one. First let me tell you what I use this for. I frequently travel and I shoot videos everywhere I go for either sales training or my travel blog. Being able to use a cell phone instead of a full size camera makes trips way easier.As of 8/2/15 I have purchased 2 more of these square Jellyfish tripod mounts and love them.Here is why you need this holder instead of one that is half the price. First off its built better. I have a samsung note 3 with on otter box on it. When turned sideways ( letter box) it measures 3 5/8 inches. The jaws on this holder will go from 3.25 inches to 6 as an inside the grove measurement. This is a little too large for my samsung s5 with an otter box to lay in the grips horizontally. I also tested this device with my Galaxy tab 8 and it fit with room to spare horizontally (letter box).Now I do have a few holders that I paid $6 - $8 for and there are 2 problems. 1st they are made ok not great and not bad. 2nd they feel like I have to cram my phone in hoping they will not break.Here is why its worth it to spend the $17 on this device: 1. Its made with thicker material than the ones half the price and is more stout. 2. This holder folds up to be about the size of a credit card in is right at 1.5 inches thick overall. 3. The main mount does rotate so the tablet or the phone can have the video aspect rotated on a selfie stick or similar device like a tripod or mount. 4. The grippers or feet fold up as well to make this as small as possible to pack.In all I wish I would have just started with this holder instead of the other 4 cheaper ones I bought recently.

I wanted to make sure I had more then enough batteries for a recent trip over to Hawaii. I already had 2 factory Gopro batteries and though what if I cant get to an outlest to charge them. I thought it would be better to have too many than not enough and for the price it was an easy decision. I have a few different devices that have Wasabi batteries in use including my Panasonic X920 video camera and have had zero problems with them in a $800 video camera.The build on these is almost exact to the factory ones except they do not last as long by a few minutes. It is nice to have an extra charger so a few batteries can be charged at the same time. It is also nice to have a charge that uses a 12v cigarette plug while driving.Overall I am impressed with how these and other Wasabi batteries have lasted and worked for me in several different devices.

I ordered 2 of these hard drives for my back up Synology 215j. I decided on the 4tb because I dont really need anything larger for what these will be used for.What you need to know is these drives need to be formatted before you use them or they will not show up on your computer (on windows right click on the windows sign and look for disk management - you can youtube how to do this). I know these drives were specifically built to deal with the heat and power consumption inside of a NAS.Mine were shipped in generic brown boxes, wrapped in anti-static plastic with a silica gel packet and secured through a holder on each end.Overall I like how these drives have opperated and would give you all of the speeds but unless you have the same exact setup as mine it really will not matter.

I travel frequently and sometimes I need to be on a plane for 5 hours or more. This unit is a life saver for sure and could be the perfect item to keep in an emergency kit. I can run a tablet and a cell phone for the entire flight and then get to recharge them both at the same time with power to spare. I used this to charge a Samsung Galaxy Tab 8 and a Samsung S5. On the flight home I charged my Samsung Note 3 and Galaxy Tab 8 at the same time and had zero problems.Now what you need to know is this unit is not lightweight for what you would think. It does need to be charged with a 2amp charger as a 1amp will take forever (f-o-r-e-v-e-r.) There is a light at the end you can turn on in case there is a situation where you would want a flashlight and it is a fairly bright light.This portable charger comes with a mesh style carrying case and has enough room to store (2) 3 foot charging cables and still have a little room.

Do you love Jolly Ranchers? No really do you LOVE Jolly Ranchers if so this is the bag of candy for you for sure. I like how you can order in one flavor. It would be so cool for other candies to do this. The behemoth bag of candy landed on my door and I have to share I love the flavor but after going through about a pound of this stuff it is almost too much. I should take this to the office and share but I will not as I have made a vow to eat the whole bag.The flavor is great I just have to explain to people I have blue teeth from candy and I am not an alien

The business world is colliding with technology and the changes that are made constantly. This chaos creates an opportunity for a business to take advantage of the changes that are being made. The gamble always is which platform or service to choose while taking the gamble. Business CEO's or managers must be able to see what is possibly coming up around the corner and either make the changes or prepare for them so they are not a surprise. Embracing technology is a better answer than ignoring it.This book was a cross between "the CEO who sees around corners by Jay Abraham and Carlos Dias and Bold by Peter Diamondis & Steven Kottler for me.

4 lbs of heaven in a bag... So if you didn't know peanut butter is the nectar of the gods and when mixed with chocolate it just so happens nirvana may be found. If you need a rush of sugar and need to be able to eat this type of candy this bag is for you.Reese's Peanut Butter cups are fairly consistent when it comes to their flavor and taste. A bag of these candies is within the norm of good taste and flavor. These individually wrapped candies are perfect for an office or anywhere 4 lbs of candies can be shared. My problem is if I leave them in the house I will eat them all for sure.

Whenever a book can make an easy explanation or put a process into steps it makes it easy to implement for those who read. This book does a great job of explaining ways to manage employees and treat them in a manner where they are respected and allow them to do what they need to.The business world has a way of looking at employees like replaceable things instead of the people who make the engine go. Some business models rely on keeping the feel of a business as if it a science experiment where noting but business can be talked about.Being able to relate to employees on a human level instead of a clinical level does help them to be more productive.

I live in California where everything is illegal so it is important to have a mount like this to avoid tickets. I like this mount as it has a good feel to the construction. I have a Samsung S5 and was able to stick the backing on fairly easy. I have to say even the sticky pads they sent were 3m and not just some knock off cheap sticky adhesive that doesn't last. The mechanisms lock fine and work well. If anything changes I will have to amend this review.

I used to wear gloves every day when I was a heating and air conditioning technician and I wish these ones were around as they are the real deal and heavy duty. Overall they fit well and have raised bumps to get a better grip on items so they wont slip when wet or when oil is on them. These gloves are strong and would stand up to many different situations in industrial work where gloves could be used.I used these gloves to change an alternator on a car and they didn't rip even with some abuse that would normally break some gloves I have used before.

I travel frequently and like to have some flexibility when it comes to using devices to watch videos, liten to music or edit documents. I opted for he USB 3.0 cables and they do not fit all android devices like the Micro USB cables will. These ones do work with my Samsung S5 and Note 3 but not my Galaxy Tab 8. I have had zero problems using any of my external drives or thumb drives when using this cable and any of my phones.I get fairly fast transfer rates but lets face it I am using these cables to hook up a hard drive or thumb drive to a cell phone for more storage. I am not expecting super fast rates just the ability to get to the content.

The patterns one could learn from this pack of cards is amazing to say the least. There are plenty of ways to use these patterns whether in sales, relationships and in general influence.I do have a pack of the original Zebu cards and a few of the patterns here are better and there are a few better patterns in the Zebu pack.Overall for how these cards can help you can learn how to influence others for about 30 bucks ... just buy the cards

I really like this charger for a few reasons: 1. There is no extension cord 2. The charger does what it says and charges multiple devices at one time  whether 2 amps or 1 amp 3. its smallI have had about a week to use this charger with my Samsung devices S5, Note 3 and Galaxy tab 8 and all were able to charge quickly.

As I read this book I kept thinking of my 84 year old grandfather. I kind of felt like he was sitting at the table talking to me about the way things used to be. These types of conversations are not a bad thing at all and most of the time they seem comforting.  As I read this book I kept reflecting upon my own life and where I stacked up in comparison towards humble or the center of attention seeker. What kept the book interesting was the part history lesson part character lesson based upon the life events of the person being written about.This book starts out talking about what is valuable in society and where the focus lies today and where it was after WWII. There are some stark differences between today and yesteryear. Some of these changes like technology that make life easier but back then it seems that people were more humble, had manners and everything wasn‚Äôt about them. Most of the people discussed in this book were brought up at the turn of the 1900‚Äôs.Here are the people written about in the book Frances Perkins, Dwight Eisenhower, Dorothy Day, George Marshal, A. Philip Randolph, Mary Anne Elliot, Augustine & Samuel Johnson,Here was the main theme of the book:The push for being the center of attention seems to have distorted the moral compass of society and their own sense of ‚Äúgood‚Äù. The events, trials and struggles we face in life tend to shape up for the good or the bad depending upon the choices we make when at the crossroads of difficult decisions. At some point we gain the fortitude to stick with one type of decision based upon what has been learned in previous adverse situations. Character is built on the tough decisions to be made plus life‚Äôs experiences.In the middle of the challenges it may be the sense of self resolve that keeps us from making the wrong decisions. The underpinning of religion does help people make decisions based upon the morals taught by the respective religions.The ability to be of service to those in need for non self-gratifying reasons does help build character.There are plenty of stories and examples spanning across time and places where people either decide to change or are pushed causing them to dig deep and decide what type of person they would become in the face of adversity, danger and questionable issues that could cause some sort of physical or moral harm. . It seems that as of today society has sacrificed much of character for justification of something else.I have to say I really liked this book and the saying of ‚Äúdo what is right even if nobody is looking‚Äù kept coming to mind. This book was written well and interesting enough for me to sit down and read it without getting up.

This is a nice humidifier. It is quiet, relatively compact and effectively adds moisture to the air. As the name indicates, this is a filtered humidifier which is the only downside I see to this particular humidifier because replacement filters are expensive and so the cost for this product over time continues.

This is a very patriotic headband. I like you can tie it to fit any size head (my 8 year old daughter has been wearing it around lately). It can be used for a fashion statement or when working out. Basically it is a little piece of fabric, so I am only giving it 4 stars because I cannot fully justify the high price tag.

Because this is a universal armband that is supposed to fit a variety of iPhones and Galaxy models, the fit of a phone in the holder differs. My iPhone 4 fits in with lots of room, and my husbands 5S fits in snugly. Both will be secure but just worth noting that you don't get a perfect fit with a universal armband. The velcro strap allows for the armband to fit a variety of arm sizes and it adheres securely. The armband can feel big on your arm at first when you workout but I quickly got used to it and found it helpful.
I really like using Hyland's products with my sick kids because of the natural ingredients used. This baby cough syrup is recommended for kids over 6 months and it seems to help my little one.
These are decent microfiber clothes. I like them because they are lint free. Because you can reuse them over and over I am hoping to save on the amount of paper towels we use.

This is a nice men's watch. The style and design are timeless (not overly trendy or dated). It is attractive and seems solidly made.I am not sure what to make of the pricing as it lists at almost $700 and then is discounted to about $100.

My daughter is more and more interested in doing hair. This doll is great for her to practice making pony tails and braids on. My daughter really likes the clip in highlights. While any hair accessories can be used, it would be nice if the set had more clips etc. Also since the dolls is designed to do her hair it would be nice if they upgraded to a nicer doll hair brush.

This package contains 21 drink mix packets with a "natural" pineapple flavor. You mix the packet with 12-15 oz of water and drink it. It is intended for daily use. While the drink is not terrible, it also takes me awhile to nurse it down. Instead of pineapple flavor, I think it would be better if they left it unflavored.

My 3 year old is all about being a helper, but it is hard to have let her join me in cleaning a lot of things. This set is great for her to come along and help because she gets her very own bucket of cleaning supplies. Kids this age love a squirt bottle (which this set comes with)... that alone keeps my daughter happy for extended periods of time. My only caution would be to make sure your child understands the difference between his/her play cleaning supplies and real ones... I would hate for a little one to accidentally get their hands on real cleaning supplies and use them like this play set.

My favorite thing about this medicine is that it is safe to give to kids as young as 2. We have a range of ages at our house and since so many cold medicines can only be used when children reach 6, this is a nice one to have on hand that all of my kids can take. This seemed to help with my little ones cold without having any adverse effects.

I usually use Pampers when my kids are this little but I decided to try these Huggies. They are different than Pampers. These Huggies are not quite as soft as Pampers, but they seem to fit better. We have had a few leaks but after 7 years of diapering 4 different children I have never been able to completely prevent leaks (especially in the under 1 kids).

If you have ever had to change a squirmy toddler or had a hard time putting on a new diaper while on the go, you might like these diapers. They are almost like a pull up (but not really intended for potty training) with tabs on the sides so the diaper can just be pulled on (without securing tabs on the sides like normal diapers). They are more expensive than regular diapers and not that helpful for us to use all of the time. But there are stages and times when these slip-ons would be preferred to regular diapers.

We really like these sippy cups. They are leak proof which is great for a toddler on the go. They are insulated which keeps drinks colder for longer. And they have the perfect flow technology which allows the parent to adjust the flow of the beverage depending on your child's age and ability.

These paper towels are great. They are the perfect in-between in quality - not so cheap that they fall apart but not so nice that it feels wasteful. My favorite part is the pick a size feature because most of the time I only need one sheet (equivalent to half of a standard paper towel size).
This pacifier holder has really come in handy to help us not lose more pacifiers. It is easy to use and has held up with daily use for almost a month so far.

As with most things, you pay for what you get. For less than 10 cents a cup, these are adequate but not amazing plastic cups. My biggest complaint is how thin the plastic is on most of the cup... even a light grip on the cup causes it to collapse inwards. The plastic around the rim seems thicker, but I am not sure why they designed the rest of the cup's plastic to be so thin.

After having been french press users for years, we decided to make the move to a more automated coffee maker. I researched different makers for quite a while, and this one rose to the top as a best buy despite its relatively low price. I was a bit skeptical, but we decided to give it a try over the more expensive makers ... and I'm glad that we did!As others note, make sure you run a number of just-water (or vinegar) cleaning cycles before you attempt to brew coffee. This maker gives off a bit of a plastic-y smell initially, but we found that it completely disappeared after those cleaning cycles.Normal cycles are a breeze, and the resulting coffee is quite nice. The detachable water cannister makes refilling the maker with water a cinch. The removable filter holder makes emptying old grounds and filling it with new grounds way simple. The carafe is excellent as well - coffee stays nice and toasty in there for quite a long time (just be sure that it's empty before you make more coffee!). And the maker is fast! It's just five minutes or so from start to finished coffee.We've found that we need to add a bit more coffee to get coffee that's as strong / tastes similar to our french press, but that's really the only difference. It's been a smooth transition to this maker, and I'm glad that we made the switch.

Great value - so many filters at a good price!And we've not just been pleased with the quantity - the quality of these filters is good too. As a coffee filter should, they let the coffeed-water through while retaining the grounds.Clean-up tends to get pretty well too. Occasionally the filter will tear along the top a bit as I lift it out to throw it away, but most of the time it stays whole and disposal is clean and easy.
This is a disposable razor handle that comes with 12 different cartridges. The razor isn't horrible but isn't amazing either. It feels like you pay for what you get in this circumstance.

I do not really understand the appeal of this product. Yes it tastes good, but they are expensive (almost $2 a sleeve) and very bad for you (each pack contains between 330-360 calories and 19-24 g of fat). The first two packs of the Hershey Chocolate and Almonds that I have opened had the 5 pieces of candy melted together too. With so many tasty and healthier on-the-go snacks available, I would not choose these. And if I wanted to indulge in a candy bar, it would be cheaper for me to buy one individually.

These are great storage bags. I got the blanket size and they are definitely nice and big. They are probably best suited (durability wise) to store thing that you want to keep dust free but only need a few times each year. The damask print is cute but subtle. The price seems great to me for 2.The only thing I would caution is that these are tall when filled (12") so if you are intending to store under a bed make sure you measure and have enough clearance before ordering.

Our neighborhood has a lot of bunnies and the little critters are constantly in our yard and garden. This product seems to have reduced bunny traffic a bit (I applied it on our fence line and around our main garden beds), but it hasn't eliminated it. Of course, it's been a fairly rainy season here so it's possible that I haven't re-applied frequently enough.I like this application process better than the sprays that I've used as I just took handfuls of the pellets from the bag and chucked it where I wanted it. The pellets left a little smell on my hands, but a good hand-washing took care of that.

I don't know table tennis rackets (or "racquets" for those of you who want us to know of your fine British / European sensibilities) well enough to compare this ping pong ball smacking device's features over and against those of other similar-valued devices or enough to say "bad value!!!11" (or "excellent value!"), but I know enough to say that I dig playing with this thing.The flared handle feels great in my hand; the head of the paddle is solid and weighted nicely; the head surface is tacky and helpfully grippy; and I don't expect to ever lose a match again. Ever.

Our neighborhood has a lot of bunnies and the little critters are constantly in our yard and garden. This product seems to have reduced bunny traffic a bit (I applied it on our fence line and around our main garden beds), but it hasn't eliminated it. Of course, it's been a fairly rainy season here so it's possible that I haven't re-applied frequently enough.The application process is fine. The stream out of the can is strong and steady, you just have to load the sprayer (by pulling it bad to create pressure) to create a spray of a few seconds.

These are nice, big trash bags. They are made to expand when filled but still stay strong. They are tough and tear resistant. We don't use big trash bags often but when I do, I want nice ones like these.The box says there is a Money Back Guarantee so I guess if you are really are disappointed with them, you can get your money back!

This pet bed is definitely large (make sure you look at measurements when you are ordering to ensure you get the right size for you dog). It is comfortable and the fabric is durable likely that it will hold up through lots of wear and washing.

This is a nice workbook for reviewing or extra practice. There isn't much teaching in the book so students will have to be familiar with these concepts or have a parent who is familiar. Answers are in the back of the book to check for accuracy.

This is a cute doll. Why 3 stars? First of all, the price. I was expecting something really exceptional for the price tag that came along with this doll and upon receiving it, there is nothing I can justify recommending anyone paying that high price ($40) for. Second, the sleeper is a bad fit for the doll and won't even fasten properly at the top. Third, the lavender smell... I actually like lavender but this smell is a bit off to me.All the negatives being stated above, it is a soft doll with a bean bag bottom. The magnetic pacifier is cute and the lamb has an elastic strap attached so the doll can hold it which is a fun feature. Overall I would say it is okay but not amazing.

This is a small size of AVAHA hand cream perfect for trial or travel. It has a pleasant scent and does a nice job moisturizing my hands. It is a thicker cream so you need a decent amount to get full coverage of your hands so this small size will not last for long but it is convenient for on the go.

This is a nice nail polish. It is described as gold but is definitely silver in color. It is metallic and shiny. I was impressed by the coverage of such a metallic color but would still recommend 2 coats for better coverage of your nails.

These are nice uniform pants. The size 6 fits my skinny 7 year old perfectly (she wears size 6 in most of her pants right now). I like the skinny fit. I wish it had an adjustable waist band as we do have trouble keeping pants up sometimes, but I guess a belt could be used. The fabric is soft and the pants are easy to wash. If you like clothes crisp, you will definitely have to iron these after washing.

Well, our kids (seven, five, and two-and-a-half) enjoy it. The games are very simply and only lightly educational, but that's been okay for these video game newbies. The system's start-up and game loading is pretty slow, but - again - not so much that it bothers the kids.We found the system to be pretty east to set-up, and we haven't encountered any bugs or notable issues in gameplay or operation. While the joystick-style controller is okay, the pointer-style isn't great (compared to, say, a Wii) as it's hard to get the controller to aim and select as the user intends. The camera-based games are okay ... but easy to dominate if the player gets close to the camera (my kids figured this out on their own!).

I was excited about the dual function of this hot brush and flat iron. It comes with three settings (off, low, and high) and with another switch you can unlock it to flat iron mode or lock it to hot brush mode.After testing it, I have to say I was disappointed in its performance. I was able to get the flat iron function to work without much problem. I did not have much luck with the hot brush function though... I just kept on getting it stuck in my hair or did not notice much of an effect.

This is a pack of 8 "high-performance" AA batteries. They are advertised as lasting 35% longer in digital cameras which I wasn't able to test since my digital camera doesn't use AA batteries.
