The idea of survival under constantly changing circumstances is an intriguing one. The dystopian society beautifully and insightfully described in this page-turner makes this book more than just escapist fiction. It's a witty, thoughtful, and fascinating journey into our own perceptions of history, human decisions, and their consequences. Highly recommended.

An exciting contemporary romance that starts in glitzy Las Vegas and moves to Texas as Erica explores her sensuality. She's torn between her husband and an ex-lover, and the triangle gets hotter as the book progresses. Fun and exciting!

I got this book as a bedtime story but after looking through it decided that there's an even better time/place to read it, and that's taking it to the zoo when we went there with my kids. We read the beginning (when Zoe and her family are getting ready to do) before we went to the zoo. Then, we read the rest of the book in the zoo while stopping by the various exhibits in our local zoo. The book has beautiful illustrations, great information about animals, and is both entertaining and informative. Reading it at the zoo made our whole trip more fun as it became a scavenger-hunt-like experience. Great book!

The story of Sharise Sills, a fictional character in Dennis Butler's novel Indigo Tears, is presented in this companion short-story as a first person narrative, a journal that Sharise started writing on the day of her capture.An ordinary afternoon and what seemed like a routine request for directions from a driver of a van on a busy street started Sharise's descent into what she refers to as Hell. For thirteen years, she was held in captivity, treated like a slave of the historical past that she was so well aware of, and abused physically and emotionally. But instead of giving up in what seems like a desperate situation, Sharise chooses to fight back. Her struggle is described in this audiobook exceptionally well, both by Dennis Butler's wonderful writing and by excellent narration of Stacy Towles. The ending does not disappoint.  Overall, a wonderful book!

Is there a chance for Brad Chance to find true love? From the tongue-in-cheek name of the main character to all the twists and turns of the clever plot, the book is a definite winner. The writing style is quick, witty, engaging and full of dark humor and satire that will leave you wanting for more, just like Brad Chance. Highly recommended!

Fantastic collection of first-person storie, personal accounts of slavery written with such raw emotion, pain, and passion that the readers feel as if they themselves have been thrust into the "deep, and dark, and foul...pit of abominations." I haven't seen anything else out there. Fantastic!
Mystery, travel, exotic destinations, love, passion, and a tightly woven plot make this book hard to put down. What a wonderful find!
Sizzling series. Gripping, exciting, and very well-written.
Jasmine is a great character, engaging and easy to relate to. This fun summer romance is engrossing as it is exciting. Jasmine's predicament sounds like one many of us can relate to. Recommended!

I'm not a heavy metal lyrics fan, but this book really spoke to me. As I'm standing at a fork in the road right now, the raw and real life experiences expressed poetically in these lyrics felt very relatable. It's a definitely a book I'm keeping.
Cinematic, suspenseful, and engaging, this book combines history, antiquity, and paranormal elements with great characters and an engaging style.

I love making soups and stews, but I often get busy and have to cook in advance. I tend to cook a large pot of one soup or stew, but that can get boring. What this book allows me to do is to make a few different soups/stews at once, in large quantities. Then, I keep a small amount of one soup/stew for our family to eat and freeze the rest. We can have different meals throughout the week without much effort. Some of my favorite recipes so far are Potato Soup with a Twist, Chicken Chili, and Sweet Potato Soup.

More than a just a dating book, this is a book about personal communication, the importance of good manners, being yourself, and being able to get to know other people by developing better listening skills, letting others talk in conversation, and other good skills applicable in situations that go far beyond dating. It also talks about how NOT to act around others, including a date. Great advice overall!

Would you consider the audio edition of Easy Guide to the Tarot to be better than the print version?It's best to have both because there's a lot of information to absorb, and the print/kindle version can be a good reference guide while the audiobook can be used for a general overview and as a refresher.What other book might you compare Easy Guide to the Tarot to and why?I haven't seen other audiobooks on Tarot cards. This one is quite unique.Any additional comments?The information is very interesting, and Adam Crafter's narration is perfect for an instructional book. Of course, don't expect to remember everything from the first listening. Having the print/kindle book to go along with the audiobook is a good idea.

Not too many romance stories involve amateur radio stations and looking for love over the radio, and that's one of the many things I loved about this book. In the world of social media, a romance that happens over the radio feels old-fashioned and nostalgic. The love triangle of Frannie, Dave, and Pete is exciting to read about. What a fun book!

What a great game! The rules are very simple, so it's easy to start playing it (or get people who have never played it to participate). At the same time, there's lots of strategy involved, so it will make you think. Love it!

Excellent military history/strategy collection. I got it mostly to read Remember the Alamo by Amelia E. Barr  and The Battle of Waterloo by Edward Shepherd Creasy but others look interesting as well. Very well done!

Great recipes! I truly believe that the right mix of spices is key to a good meal but I'm wary of buying seasonings in stores because so many of them have unhealthy ingredients, preservatives, and who knows what else. All the recipes in this book have natural ingredients that I can control. My favorites so far are spices for the apple pie, for pumpkin pie, ginger and garlic paste, and Greek seasoning.

I got this book for our summer travels and expected it to help us enjoy and appreciate nature more. The book definitely does that with all the activities and all the tidbits of information (such as the different smells of pine trees that vary from vanilla to butterscotch).But what it also does -- and that was an unexpected and pleasant surprise -- is that this book focuses on the idea of mindfulness and awareness. I loved the example with the ticking wristwatch that can be heard from (relatively) far away if we focus on it.Adam Crafter is a perfect narrator for the audiobook version of this book. His narration pace is conducive to thought, reflection, and developing mindfulness that this book is intended to promote.

What a fun series! I love mysteries with a good plot and excellent story-telling but so many of them today are filled with unneeded violence, gore, and blood, and I don't like that. This cozy mystery is wonderful: it's a page-turner written very very well. I love the humor, dark as it may be.

Beautifully-written collection of short poems that will allow you to reflect on mortality, life, and the passage of time. These thoughts might be "tiny" in the number of words in each poem, but they are filled with wisdom and insight. Very interesting!

A great guide to common Latin phrases and expressions that we encounter in literature and everyday life. Reading this book gave me a better appreciation for the English language and the myriad of connections between English and Latin. If you're looking for a grammar guide, this is not the book for you. But if you want to learn common Latin phrases and proper ways to use it, this is a great resource.

Great duo! I've always been curious about the phrase "mind the gap." Apparently, it's applicable in far more situations than a train ride. Paying attention to the present is essential to happy and happy living, but many of us can't seem to master ways to do it. We focus on the past or on the future instead of on the moment and...fall through the cracks. These two books give easy to follow, simple suggestions about ways to stop/minimize the mental noise, become more productive and more effective. Great books!

One of my colleagues raises her own chickens and often shares the eggs with us. They taste so good! Much much better than the ones you can buy in a store, and they are healthier because she controls what she puts in the food that she gives to the chickens. I've been intrigued with the idea of having chickens in my own backyard for a while, and that's why I got this book. While my colleague shared some of her experiences with me here and there, this book provides a much more logical and systematic approach to raising chickens. Great ideas!

What a beautiful book! The message of believing in yourself, acceptance and finding your place in the world is perfect for kids. The illustrations are adorable, and the story is told in an engaging way easy enough for kids to understand. The classroom references make the story even easier to relate to for kids. It's perfect for kindergartners starting school this fall.

Engaging and exciting. I loved the way this story transcends traditional genres. It's romance, it's a coming-of-age story, it's both sweet and erotic, and it's hard to put down. Amerie's character is easy to relate to no matter what your age is.

Great guide! It's thorough and well-written. I usually don't think of Denmark as a place of sand dunes and sunny beaches, but the author of this guide reminded me of that aspect of Denmark.  I'd love to see the coast and the beaches next to Dueodde. I appreciate all the detailed information about different regions, different islands, the climate, etc. Even though summer is the most popular time to visit, Christmas sounds like a fun time in this northern country, too. Great maps in this book!

What a perfect purchase! We love yogurt but buying it all the time can get a bit expensive. Also, good yogurt can be hard to find. This little machine makes seven individual containers of yogurt overnight. It tastes great, it's easy to make,  it has only natural ingredients, and it costs less that store-bought stuff. Love it!

Sometimes, my family and I can't decide whether we want to vacation in a city, in the wilderness, hike, or sight-see and learn about history. Sweden can be the perfect place. Norrland offers plenty of wilderness to explore, with mountains, rivers, and great hiking. And it's not far at all from other areas of Sweden, from the bustling city life of Stockholm to intriguing ancient history of Uppsala. This book provides a wonderful introduction to all the possibilities that Sweden has to offer. It's definitely on our list of potential vacation spots.

A friend of mine has been talking about the wonders of wheat grass juice all summer, so I decided to read more about it. The first three chapters of the book explain the problems of our everyday life that cause us to feel tired, unwell, sick, etc., and create the need for herbal remedies, such as wheat grass juice. The following chapters discuss the benefits of wheat grass juice from a scientific point of view (but written for a general audience, easy to read), ways to grow wheat grass, how to get juice from it, how much to drink, and how wheat grass juice can help with a varieaty of health conditions. The discussion of wheat grass as an important source of chlorophyll was very interesting to me.

Great book! The focus is on the high level of Objective-C (which is what I was looking for). The explanations are clear,with good screenshots, and detailed discussions of each line of code provided in the book. The book provides a good overview of basic concepts for complete beginners in programming but also has in-depth explanations of concepts specific to Objective-C. Excellent guide. The structure of the book, with tables, bullet points, and illustrations, makes it easy to use and learn from.

I got these for my husband to use with a new pair of work boots that just don't have good arch support and were a tad bit roomy.I could tell just by the look on his face when he stepped into the boots after he added these insoles that they were a winner!He gets random heel pain from prolonged standing so he reported that, after working all day in his boots with these  insoles, he had NO pain AND no more pain in his instep!I had a feeling he would love these since I own a pair of these and LOVE them.  These really are a top quality support insole without the big price tag!  They make a huge difference for shoes that aren't comfortable AND arch support.Was able to purchase these at a promo price to test and give my honest opinion and review :)TWO THUMBS UP on these!!!!

I had no clue I suffered from tinnitus until my husband started complaining about his ears ringing a few years ago and we did some reading about it!  I thought this high pitched constant sound in my head was normal and just grew to live with it.We tried a similar product for my husband a couple of months ago with marginal results though it has helped him some in the month he's been using it.Then, I had an opportunity to try Tinnitivix through a promotional offer to see how it worked and review....this time for ME!I've been taking this faithfully for about a week and a half twice a day and I'm pretty amazed...I'd say that the ringing has reduced so far by about 30% and I'm really encouraged to keep using this to see if I can eliminate it totally!I'm not sure which ingredient is working or if its the combination of what is in this, but I'm pretty surprised it helping so much!I take several supplements anyway so frankly I wasn't expecting this to really do much but I'm glad I was wrong about that.I will update this review after a month or so to let you know if it has eliminated the issue entirely but so far I'm pretty happy to have at least SOME of the annoying noise gone.I really didn't realize how bad it was until it started going away!  I feel bad for anyone with a worse issue than mine as I've now discovered some people are about driven nuts by the sound :(So the bottom line is, if you have this issue, you have nothing to lose to try this and see if it helps...I'm REALLY glad I found this stuff and am hoping it continues to improve the condition :)Hope this was helpful :)

I have been hearing about this supplement and wanted to try it to see if it would help maintain my 25 lb weight loss over the past year. I'm not able to exersize right now due to back and knee issues so I'm trying different supplements to assist in continuing the health changes I'm making.I struggle with chronic pain which tends to drain me of energy so I was hoping this would help.I started with another brand which is half the strength to start with to see if it would agree with my stomach. Once I found I didn't have any adverse reactions, I switched over to the Lumen 500mg to continue my experiment.Taking one twice a day before meals as recommended for the past several weeks I've had no issues with upset stomach or jitters.While I have not lost any additional weight, I also haven't gained any and I've been eating some things I should not ;)My energy level has improved and it feels like I'm processing food quicker and don't get the cravings for no no's like I used to!I've not noticed anything dramatic but I will continue with this until I finish the bottle.Overall, I'm happy with the results so far and will likely continue with this for a few months to get a better idea of how it's working :)I received this product at a discount to evaluate and give my honest opinion :)

This may be one of those items you don't think you need until to have them!  Yes, they work great to tie down things with handles that you don't want scratched, but there are more uses for these :)We do a lot of camping/backpacking and sleep in hammocks so we are always looking for strong, light weight tree straps to suspend the hammocks.I got these through a special promotion at a discount to test out and give my honest opinion and feedback-otherwise I probably would not have bought them, BUT....We started testing these out for various uses around the farm and also for hanging our hammocks and found they are really useful!For hammocks, sometimes you need a little extra length on the straps to hang depending on the design of the hammock.  These straps proved to be a perfect solution without  much weight!  Also, if you are hanging a  hammock on small trees, these can be used with just a simple slip through one end and a carabeener!These are a great solution for when you need to secure gates, enclosures and even attaching tie downs in the back of a truck for hauling hay!I'm sure we will find more uses the longer we use them but for now, I'm really glad we got these and they have proved to be pretty handy!

The big surprise on these bargain scrubs is the quality and fit!  I've purchased the low priced scrubs before from other companies and they always fun REALLY small with a funky, inconsistent fit - NOT THESEFirst, the fabric is actually nice with well constructed seams.  The only issue I had was, thinking they were going to run super small, I ordered a size up - XL and I actually wear a size 12 so a Large would be perfect with these so I had to return them :(There's ample length on the pants so someone taller than me (I'm 5'2) will find they work great.Overall I'm quite impressed with these well priced scrubs!  Just pay attention to the size chart :)I received these at a promo price to try out and give my honest opinion and feedback.

First, I'd like to say that I really love this company and what they are doing!  They are a family business that makes head wear for cancer patients and based on every interaction I've had with them, they clearly care about their customers :)I ordered this sleep cap for my husband for our backpacking adventures to keep his head warm since we sleep in hammocks and do Fall and Winter camping.The sizing is ample on this so even those with a larger head will have a good fit on this cap.The weight is just right to provide warmth without bulk.All of their products arrive well packaged and the caps are wrapped in tissue with a sticker which demonstrates a standard of excellence in how they choose to do business which I greatly appreciate :)  I enjoy supporting business like this who are doing it right!I purchased this at a discount to try out and give my honest opinion and feedback.Bottom line - good products at a good price from a great company! :)

I have and use 3 different brands of these knee sleeves now and I'm still amazed how well they work for such a light weight product!This Copper Fitness brand is a great fit with the sleeve length being a bit longer than the others I have which I like.The size Large I ordered fits perfect though the size chart indicates that, by my knee measurements, I should wear a Medium.I think, for me, the medium would be a little too tight since I wear this all day for support and don't like them too tight.This stays put all day without rolling down and helps SO much with chronic knee pain from a  bone on bone issue with both of my knees and I'm trying to put of knee replacement as long as possible!For the quality, the price on this brand is very fair :)I received a promo discount on this item to test out and provide my honest opinion and feedback :)You have nothing to lose to try these sleeves for even mild knee pain and support - they really do work!

It's too bad this didn't fit as I really liked the style of this jacket :(  However, it runs about 2 sizes too small!  I ordered according to the size chart - I'm a 12 - and the jacket looks to be more of a children's size!I had to return it and the company was great about it, but I'm really disappointed that they just don't have a size that will fit for me to exchange it.The inside fleece hoodie is cute and a different touch for a bomber jacket and it appears the quality is good for the price you pay.Sadly, their sizing runs REALLY small :(I purchased this at a promo price to try and give my honest opinion and feedback...Hopefully, the company reads these reviews and makes an adjustment to their size chart :)

My husband has suffered from Tinnitus for years so he was the test subject for this product!  After reading about this product, we figured it was well worth a try to see if it would help.After taking it for almost a full month, so far he reports the only change is that the ringing in his right ear is now louder which, we are both assuming that means it seems to be helping by DECREASING the ringing in his LEFT ear!Perhaps, as with any natural supplement, the longer you use it the more noticeable the results, so he will continue to use it to see if he continues to improve :)We figure even if it decreases the maddening, non stop noise by even HALF its well worth it!  Will update with results.We were given a discount on this product to test it and give an honest opinion and feedback

I've used pumice stones for years and have found recently its getting hard to find THIS type.  What makes these the best, in my opinion, is the two sided design and texture.  Most of the pumice stones I've found recently are the hard type very much like the ones used to clean toilet bowls :(  Those do NOT work and can  actually tear the skin.This 4 pack is not only a great buy but the quality really is the best for what they are intended for.  The  texture is a bit softer so it really does a great job exfoliating without damaging the skin.I stumbled on these through a promotion so I was able to purchase them at a discount to test out and give my honest opinion :)So glad I found a source for these again!

I actually purchased these, not as money belts, but for the purpose of having a small, low profile waist pack for hiking!  These are the perfect size to be able to fit a cell phone, driver's license and car key with some room left over for a lip balm and a couple of other small items.While we WILL use these on a upcoming trip as money belts, for what we wanted these for right now, they work great!The material is light but sturdy and the quality of the construction is good.For those who don't want a full blown fanny back and need to have your hands free for hiking and still need to protect your cell phone, this is a great option.I even wore this shopping under a sweater the other day when I didn't want to take my purse because I needed both hands free and it worked great!For the price, the quality and function is great AND you get TWO!I purchased this set at a discount to test out and give my honest opinion and feedback.So, YES!  I certainly recommend these :)Hope this was helpful info!

I've purchased a few of these leggings from this company now and have been REALLY happy with them!  I first discovered these through a promotion and was able to buy them at a discount to try out and give my honest opinion and feedback.I wear leggings all year around since they are SO comfortable but when the cold weather hits, they really aren't thick enough to keep your legs warm.At first glance, you would never know these are fleece lined!  They look like regular tights but the inside is a wonderful, velvet soft fleece that is SO warm but still light weight and not at all bulky!I'm 5'2" and 160 lbs and these fit perfectly with a little extra length to tuck into boots.You can't tell from the photo, but these have a texture to them - like a cable knit sweater - which is subtle but adds just enough interest to make them a little more stylish than your average, boring leggings!I'm getting a few more colors in these since they are really a good value and good quality :)Without hesitation, I recommend these!!!

This is the third shredded memory foam pillow with bamboo cover that I've purchased recently and I'm really sold on how well these work.  The shredded foam does a much better job of conforming to your body than formed foam as there is more give but still lots of support!For anyone with back, hip or knee issues that needs to sleep with a pillow between their knees or have support up against the back for side sleepers, this pillow is fantastic!First, it is LARGE!  Like, wow, I was shocked how large once I unwrapped it and it decompressed!  It's almost the length of our Cal King bed but not so wide to where you can't work it around your body to get comfortable - unlike a standard King sized pillow which is what I was using.My only negative on this particular pillow is the cover...The first bamboo covered pillow (king size) is from another brand and the cover on that one is SSSOOO soft!  I've never felt anything like it!  I was so happy with it, I bought another in Queen size for my husband since he kept stealing mine!  It was yet another brand from the first one and the pillow was fine, but the cover was nothing like the first - still soft but not as soft as the King size :(Then, I discovered THIS one through a promotion to test out and review and was excited to buy this since I had been looking for a body pillow in shredded memory foam with the bamboo cover!Unfortunately, though the pillow itself is great, again the cover is nothing like the first one I bought that is so amazingly soft :(So my experience with these type of pillows is the quality of the covers varies greatly from company to company.  Don't get me wrong, this is an amazing pillow and, if I hadn't experienced the first one I bought with the super soft cover, I probably would never have noticed!So....overall, this is a wonderful pillow and, yes, the cover is still nice and soft - much nicer than cotton - but it's not the holy grail of pillow covers like my first one.I still would highly recommend this pillow for those looking for a super comfortable body pillow :)

Having excessively dry and sensitive skin, I'm always looking for products like this with few ingredients, natural and organic and that will moisturize my super dry skin.In the past, to get enough moisture in my skin - especially my hands - I had to resort to petrolium based products.I ran across this product through a promotion that allowed me to purchase it at a discount to test and review :)Wow!This is certainly a thick product and is, in fact, a balm - not a creme or lotion.  I mention this so you know this is the very thick product.in spite of the weight of this balm, it absorbs quickly into my skin!My hands get SO dry from working outdoors all day and I have to be careful what I use because I'm sensitive to so many ingredients.This truly is the most soothing, moisturizing product I've found to date which leaves my skin calm and full of moisture!I can only imagine how well this would work on infants and their tender skin :)Calendula is very soothing to irritated skin and this also contains lavender.  It absorbs well and doesn't leave the skin greasy :)I would recommend this to anyone with an infant with ouchy skin AND to adults!!!!Lovely product :)

We had been looking to get one of these for a while for using as a light weight wash basin for when we backpack.  With backpacking, the weight of your gear really matters!This is a well made, decent design, right size for the price.  8L is plenty big enough to wash clothes or cooking utensils but still small and light enough to not be too bulky for the pack.On the photos I've added, I put a standard sized can inside so you can get an idea of size.It does well with standing upright when filled with water and did not leak.The only complaint I had was the valve for filling the rim with air is a little hard to operate and could use some tweaking.Other than that, it's working well so far and was just what we were looking for!I was able to purchase this at a promotional price to test out and review :)Hope this was helpful info!

We have purchased quite a few backpacks over the past few years for various uses since we do a lot of hiking and backpacking.The reason we chose this one is we were looking for a smaller, lightweight pack to keep on the car for an emergency pack.  Since we are in the woods nearly every weekend, having an additional pack full of emergency supplies in the car in addition to the packs we carry was something we needed to do for a while.Through a special promotion, I was able to buy this pack at a discount in order to test it out and review...Really, I wasn't expecting this to be GREAT because of the price but we have been nicely surprised at the quality and function of this little bag!We got the 20L and it is the PERFECT size to fit everything we needed to put in there for an emergence in case we get stranded in the woods.This easily fits a sleeping bag, first aid kit, MRE's, extra water, poncho, emergency tent, flares, etc. and it fits easily in the tire well of my RAV4.There is no chest strap like with many of the bags we already own, but that is a very simple fix with a strap we already had around.Overall, this is a sturdy, well made, well priced bag!  If you are looking for a bag for your car or for day hiking, this is a really good choice :)Hope this was helpful!

Being a hard core coffee drinker..like...STRONG coffee...my teeth started getting darker :(  The problem is I have VERY sensitive teeth and gums and was not able to use the whitening system I got from my dentist since it caused way too much pain to my teeth (AND was very expensive)I ran across this set on a special promotion and was able to buy it at a discount to test and review...First time I used it, I held my breath while putting the trays in and waited for the burn!hhhhmmmm...no burning pain!I suspect it's because the formula is not as strong as the kind I got from my dentist which was GREAT, actually, since I needed a milder solution that would still work...After just a few days, I already noticed my teeth were quite a bit whiter!Some helpful tips on using this kit:Use a SMALL amount!  You do NOT want to totally fill up the tray since it's a waste PLUS you want to keep as much off your gums as you canAlso, if you already have a custom tray set you bought through your dentist like I did, USE THAT!  The trays that came with this set are fine, but I didn't use them since the set from my dentist is custom fit to my teeth.DO use the included remineralization treatment along with this to avoid further sensitivity!So, overall, for the price, this is a great product that works and lasts quite a long time if you are careful how you use it! :)Happy whitening!!!

Ok, so...I'm a little long in the tooth to be going to Rave parties!  It wasn't until AFTER I bought these I found out why they are so popular!!!  LOL!Actually, I got these for camping and backpacking!We need a few of these to put in our emergency supplies but also for our camping and backpacking gear as they make great emergency lights!You can also use these to tie on a weighted fishing line for night fishing and they work GREAT.We also tucked a few in drawers in various locations in the house in case the power goes out to have some light to find flashlights by :)The other thing I'm using these for is to attach to our small dog's collar for night time potty runs so we can see her when we are camping!  Just tucked one into the loops on her collar and we can see her from quite a ways awayFor the price, this is a bargain for 200 of them!May take us a while to use these, but I'm happy to have gotten them :)I bought these at a promo price to test out and review :)Love these and, if I decide to crash my grandkid's dance party...well...I'm hip then ;)

This 2 pack infusion bottle set is a great buy!  I purchased these as a gift for a newlywed couple who are into health and fitness and they LOVED them!  The simple, sturdy design is the perfect size to fit in most cup holders in cars which many of these type of bottles are just too big!I especially like the bottom infusion part which makes it easier to refill than the type that screw onto the top of the inside of the bottle.We threw in a couple of "S" type carabeeners in the box since I know this couple likes to hike - that would be a nice addition to an already great product if the company is reading these reviews ;)The other thing I liked about this set is they are not too heavy.  Very sturdy, but not heavy like some of these bottles can be.The pop top is great for keeping things from spilling without having to unscrew the top.This is an all around great bottle that really makes a super gift - one for the office - one for home :)I was able to purchase this set at a promotional price to test and review and I certainly give this one two thumbs up!!!Hope this was helpful info :)Happy sipping!

I would not have dreamed something like this (kinda looks funny on!) would actually WORK!  Color me surprised! :OSo, sitting at a computer for long periods really causes problems with my neck.  I have an inversion table that I use all the time but it just does not do as much for my neck as I would like.When I ran across a promotion for this product and had a chance to buy this at a discount to test out and review, I figured it was worth a shot!So, the way it works is you put this around your neck and pump up the little blood pressure like pump until it inflates enough to start giving your neck a comfortable stretch!They recommend when you first start using this to only leave it inflated for a few minutes to start so, the first test drive only lasted about 4 minutes.  However, in just those few minutes, i could right away feel the pressure lift off of my neck and my headache subside!  AMAZING!I also have one of those cervical stretch pillows you lay on the floor and drape your neck over the back but it doesn't come close to helping as much as THIS gizmo!I'm now using this a few times a day and right before bed and it has helped SO much.  I'm pretty surprised since I didn't honestly expect much from this.  Imagine how many pounds of pressure the weight of your head puts on your spine - especially your neck - and how being able to decompress the neck - even a little - helps to relieve that pressure!I'm totally sold on this and have actually loaned it out to a couple of gals my husband works with who have terrible neck problems and they both are ordering their own now!  Thankfully, I got it back from them ;)You have nothing to lose to try this.  It may not help, but there's a bigger chance that it will!  Send it back if you don't like it, but at least give it a try!Hope this was helpful!

I bought these for my husband for a pair to carry in the boat for fishing so I didn't want to spend a ton of money but wanted a decent pair of sport glasses for him.These actually aren't bad for the price!  I even wore them the last time we fished and found them to be comfortable and we both like the wrap around style for extra sun protection but also helps prevent wind from getting in the sides - VERY helpful for those who wear contacts and don't want dry eyes!They come in a nice microfiber case and fold to store in the bag.The only thing some may not like is there is a bit of distortion in the lens but hey, these are NOT $100 sunglasses!  They are just good, comfortable wrap around glasses for use outdoors when you want a pair that will actually stay on your head!We purchased these at a discount to test out and give our honest opinion and feedback :)Overall, we are happy with these!Hope this was helpful :)

I'm not sure why some have said this is a badly made chair!  I found it to be just what we were looking for in a lightweight, outdoor chair with a back!Just to be clear though, I'm short - 5'2" and so this fits me perfectly!  My husband, who's 6' sat in it and it was a little too close to the ground for him but said he would still use it if no other chair was available in the woods! LOL!The chair folds up easily to carry and all of the components seem to be well made for the price point of this product.  What I feel isn't made well is the bag it comes in for carrying the chair.  It's thin and already fraying so we ditched that bag and found one we had around that is made better and use that to carry the chair in.  Not a problem for us since we always have extra carrying bags around but could be a deal breaker for some folks.The other thing that was a little negative is, when I first took this out of the box, the strong chemical smell almost knocked me over!I just left it out on the patio for a few days to air out and it is fine now but for someone who wants to use this right away, you may find this issue unpleasant.I found this to be a perfect solution for us because I wanted a small, lightweight chair WITH A BACK that we could take with us on our day trips to the woods and didn't want to always pack our big, zero gravity chair!This one is small but sturdy and it actually pretty comfortable because of the back.  No arm rests but then you are talking about a much larger thing to have to pack around.Overall, I like this little chair a lot and have found we use it quite a bit now for our day trips :)  I think for the price and the quality you can't go wrong on this one.  It would be nice if they worked on the quality of the carrying bag :)We received a promotional discount on this to test out and give our honest opinion and feedback :)Hope this was helpful!

This is not only a really well made, functional bottle but beautiful as well!  I own several water bottles and none are as nice as this one :)This comes with 2 straws for attaching to the extra top which allows the bottle to be used in a sipping fashion as well as the regular screw top.The attached carabeener is lightweight but sturdy enough to hang from a backpack.I like the 32 oz size as its enough water for a full day hike without being too heavy.  We bought two of these.  This beautiful red one and also a silver one and both have performed perfectly - no leaks and are holding up well to continual use.We could not be happier with these!I would not have even found this brand had it not been for a promotion which allowed me to buy these at a discount in order to test out and give my honest opinion and feedback!Without a doubt, I recommend this bottle and any of the Swig Savvy products! :)Hope this was helpful info!

I use hot/cold packs daily for back and shoulder pain so I have several different types and brands I've collected over the past couple of years!What I love about this one is the STRAP!When you need to get up and move around, you don't have to worry about trying to stick this down the back of your shirt and having it fall out!This has become my "go to" ice pack for that very reason...I can wear it, it stays in place and it's comfortable!The size is just right for icing the small of the back but also works great for icing a shoulder as the strap can fit across your body and it holds the pack in place!I tend to use this more for icing rather than heat therapy but one thing to keep in mind about these gel type packs... DO NOT overheat them in the microwave or they will burst!So glad I found this one through a special promotion to be able to test out and review!For sure a big thumbs up on this design!!!!Hope this was helpful :)

Finding nice looking, functional kitchen ware is tough...especially pieces that you want to use for serving at the table.This stainless steel ladle is BEAUTIFUL!  The weight and balance of this piece is PERFECT for both cooking and for serving.The mirror finish on the stainless steel is STUNNING...it really is a work of art!  I also purchased the skimmer spoon from this company and am really happy with it as well.The depth of the spoon part is just right for portion size and length of the handle is easy to work with.Honestly, I can't say enough about this product!For the price and quality, this is a bargain!This is a serving piece you won't be embarrassed to have at the table :)I ran across this company through a promotion and was able to buy this at a discount to test out and give my honest opinion and feedback.You WILL NOT be disappointed with this ladle!Hope this was helpful!

This is not just an ordinary skimmer spoon!  It's really a work of art!!!You really have to  see this in person to appreciate the quality and feel...  The weight and balance of the spoon is perfect and the mirror finish on the stainless steel is stunning!It's hard to find reasonably priced, nice looking serve ware so coming across this beauty was nice!  Not only will this work well in the kitchen for cooking but is WONDERFUL as a serving piece that you won't be embarrassed to have at the table!I ran across this on a special promotion so was able to test it out and give my honest opinion and feedback :)You won't be disappointed in this spoon!Hope this was helpful :)

I'm trying to downsize everything in our house because I just don't like crowding and clutter - especially in the kitchen!  These looked interesting and was hoping to ditch my big, bulky measuring cups :)These are just what I was looking for!  The collapsible design makes them easy to store in a drawer as they nest inside of each other :)So  far, I've tried them using liquid and solid food and they work well for both!I think these would make a great wedding gift for couples just starting out building their kitchen supplies - especially if they live in a small place without a lot of storage.I'm glad I got to try these at a promotional price to test our and review! :)This set is a good buy and good quality addition to everyone's kitchen :)Hope this was helpful!

I wanted to try this scrub specifically for my hands!  I work outside ever day and my hands get SO rough and dry and no amount of thick hand creme can help sometimes.  Without exfoliating, moisture cannot easily penetrate the skin.As a disclaimer, I have VERY sensitive skin and VERY dry skin, so my situation is not typical when it comes to skin care products!  I only mention that because, what irritates MY skin may not bother most folks.What I have to do several times a week is, in the shower I use a pumice stone on the palms of my hand to help with callous buildup.  Again, I'm working outdoors all the time so my hands get rough :(I think it's because of the pumice stone use that this body scrub burned my skin!  Of course, it IS salt so if you have any areas on your body where you have a cut or your skin is raw, it likely will burn :)So after rubbing well into my hands and rinsing, I noticed my skin was softer :)  My personal preference would be to have a little bit more of something in it to make it a little more abrasive as the salt dissolved very quickly.Overall, I like it!  I can deal with the burning because that's just my skin and it goes away.  Helped make my hands softer so I liked that!So, I would recommend giving this a try!I was able to purchase this at a promotional price to test out and give my honest opinion and feedback :)Hope this helped :)

To be very fair here to this company, I do not have "normal" skin!  My skin is VERY dry and extra sensitive so I have a difficult time finding products that both work AND don't burn my wimpy skin!I was sent this product through a promotion to test and give my honest opinion and feedback, so please keep in mind that MY experience with this product may not be average :)After using Hyaluronic Acid for a few years now and really find that it helps with my super dry skin.  This eye cream contains HA along with a whole host of other ingredients so I was thinking, "Hey...the more the merrier!"After using this for the past couple of weeks or so, my skin has just "adjusted" to the formulation and, like the first time I used it, it burns like crazy!I'm not sure which of the ingredients is the culprit but something is not agreeing with my skin :(As far as results....Nothing dramatic to report...if I can stand the burning I may continue to use it but I notice I do have to apply this twice in order to moisturize my skin enough but, again, I have super dry skin.I did go through and read other reviews who have mentioned some "fake" reviews and, if that is the case, that gets a thumbs down from me as I value integrity!  If a product truly is that good, companies don't need shore up the reviews with fakes :(Honestly, I don't know that I would buy this again unless the burning suddenly stops and I see visible line reduction and reduced puffiness!I will update this review if things improve :)Hope this helped :)

First, let me say I'm sort of...well, ok..I'm a hard core PILLOW COLLECTOR! Because of issues with my neck and back, I've been on the hunt for "THE" pillow that will work for me for years. So, I have amassed a collection of 11 pillows - everything from the buckwheat, memory foam with gel, down and even the newest My Pillow. Nothing has really worked well and I end up switching out pillows several times a night trying to get comfortable.What I've been searching for is a pillow that isn't bulky, low profile and that can be "formed" around my shoulder as I'm a side sleeper. So many of the pillows I've tried while thin enough, simply don't hold their shape and end up going flat after an hour or so. The thicker, fluffier pillows end up being too bulky which holds my head too far up off the pillow causing neck pain....UGH!If you are one of those people who can sleep on any pillow, God bless you! You have no idea how fortunate you are!I was offered an opportunity to try this pillow through a promotional offer to test out and give my honest opinion and feedback and, after reading about it, was excited to give it a try. What was one more pillow?! I'm more than willing to be a guinea pig, especially when it comes to a product I'm on the hunt for anyway.Once I got the pillow unwrapped in its very tight wrapping, I watched it decompress into a normal looking, queen sized pillow but that's where the "normal" part ended and wonderfulness began!!!I wish I could properly describe how amazingly soft this pillow is! The cover of the pillow alone is worth the price of admission! There is a very different feel to this fabric that, until you touch it, just looks like normal cotton but feels incredible! It's the first pillow I've ever had that I DIDN'T want to put a pillowcase on!! The great thing is that the cover can be removed and washed so I elected to use it without a pillowcase just because it feels SO amazing.Since it was mid day when this arrived and I had not slept well the night before, I decided it was a perfect opportunity to test drive it by taking a quick nap :)Though this is not a thick pillow, I noticed that there is plenty of support without being too bulky. There is just enough "give" to the filling to be able to sort of mold it around the shoulder and neck area and it holds it shape!I really only intended to take a quick 20 minute nap, but ended up falling SOUND asleep and didn't budge from my original position for 2 1/2 hours!!!This may not sound exciting to you, but for someone who wakes frequently with neck pain, it was right up there with a miracle!!!Upon close inspection of this pillow, the quality of construction is pretty amazing - not always the case with pillows even the very expensive ones.Since I thought may it was just a fluke that I slept a solid 2 1/2 hours without waking to make pillow adjustments, I tried it again that night and had the best night's sleep I've had in literally years.So, in conclusion, I can say without bias that this truly is the BEST pillow I've EVER used and will be buying a couple more!!! The crazy thing is, this is not an expensive pillow to start with - $22 for a good quality, queen sized pillow is VERY reasonable when you compare it to many out there on the market that make the claim that they are the worlds softest, most comfortable, etc....All I can say is TRY IT! You have nothing to lose since it has a money back guarantee.If you have ANY trouble with sleeping because of pillow issues you will not be disappointed with this product.

With colder weather here, I had been looking for leggings that were a little thicker since my legs freeze in leggings - even with a long sweater!I didn't realize they even made fleece lined leggings until I stumbled on these through a promotion!  I was afraid they would be too thick as it's hard to tell from the photo.Actually, these are quite a nice surprise!  They look and feel like regular leggings until you put them on!  There is a light weight, fleece lining on the inside that adds just the right amount of warmth without bulk!!!The sizing fit perfect with a little extra length on me (but I'm 5'2) which is fine since I tuck them into boots.LOVE these and I'm going back to buy other colors!Through the promotion, I received a discount to try these and give my honest opinion and, YES I recommend these!Good quality - good price - warm legs :)Hope this was helpful :)

With so many devices requiring USB charging and many of these devices also requiring you use your own charger, its nice to have a few of these around!  We actually only had one or two for all of our stuff and found we were constantly looking for them.These Spark Wireless plug ins are a great economical solution and you will find you use every one of the 5 that come in this set!What I did was put one in various locations around the house and one in my purse for travel since they are small and light weight :)This gave me the idea to get these as stocking stuffers since I'm sure I'm not the only one who finds having several of these very helpful!Sounds silly but I probably would not have thought to buy this 5 piece set had I not come across a promotion to be able to buy these at a discount to try out and give my honest opinion!That being said, I can certainly recommend these and suggest for the price, the quality and value is very fair!Hope this was helpful info :)

We have close to a dozen different types of hammocks that we use for a variety of things - backpacking, camping, backyard use, etc. - and almost an equal number of tree straps.  Just so you know we have a bit of suspension experience :)This is a rare example of "TRUTH IN ADVERTISING" - Meaning Cherokee Outfitters claim regarding these being "HEAVY DUTY" and extra long is an UNDERSTATEMENT!!!When we first opened the package and looked at these, I thought for a second we were sent a set of seat belts by mistake!The quality of these tree straps is above and beyond and are more than adequate for suspending the heaviest loads....um..sorry..no offense intended in calling any fellow hammock dwellers heavy loads!The material literally looks and feels just like seat belts and, in fact, if you were camping and got your vehicle stuck in the mud and needed to pull it out, you could use these straps and not worry about breaking them!The length is indeed extra long, allowing for use with even the largest of trees...well..excluding giant California redwoods of course...The metal rings and carabeeners are extra strong and heavy duty as wellSo...for backyard hammock use and camping, these are awesome.  The only situation we would not suggest using these for would be ultralight backpacking simply because of the weight - for those mindful of gear weight, you'd want to use a whoopie sling or ultra strong paracord.We would not have known about these had we not been given the opportunity to try these through a promotion to test drive and share our honest opinion and without hesitation give these TWO BIG THUMBS UP!!! :)

I'm not sure what the issue is with other folks with this holster but I find it to be really nice quality and it works great for my needs!  The holster is sturdy, good quality leather.  The construction is above average for a reasonably priced holster like this.I have a leather top fold case on my iPhone 6 plus that is not really bulky so I found that, with that case on my phone, it fits in this holster snugly.Some have mentioned that there wasn't a belt loop or clip on the back but there IS indeed both!  You can either slide your belt through the "loops" on the back or use the clip to hook it to your pants or belt.Personally, I'm using this holster to clip to my backpack for hiking and also for hooking to my waist band for keeping my phone protected while working in the barn.So far, it's been the perfect solution for what I needed and I'm really happy with the quality and function :)I'm not sure why others are having issues with this unless they received the wrong case.  I purchased this at a  promotional price to try out and give my honest opinion and feedback :)

For the price, I had certain expectations of how the quality would be on this robe.  I'm kind of a robe COLLECTOR!  LOL!  I have over a dozen and I like them to fit a certain way and the fabric needs to be plush.  I always buy men's robes because they are usually longer and more roomy - not that I'm a large woman (5'2" size 12) but I like plenty of robe and women's robes never are "blankety" enough for me!I bought this in the M/L size and it's PERFECT!  Ya, my husband could fit in this but he has his own!  Of course, the sleeves are too long, but I just roll them up and it's not a problem.I've paid much more than this for robes and really, the quality is very nice on this robe for the price!  It's not as thick as many of my others, but I didn't expect it to be.I've laundered it and it washes up really well.  As with any of these plush robes, DON'T dry them in a hot dryer!  They lose their softness!  I always run my robes on Medium in the dryer for only about 20 minutes then hang it to dry the rest of the way.  It really preserves the fabric.I was able to purchase this at a discount in order to try it out and give my honest opinion and feedback and YES I can certainly recommend this robe!Hope this was helpful :)

As a hairstylist, I'm always on the lookout for new and great products to try!  This hair mask was offered through a promotion where I had an opportunity to test it and give my honest opinion and feedback :)First, I love the packaging!  The jar comes in a nice box with clear instructions for use :)It takes very little product to do the job...Just a small amount worked fine for my shoulder length, rather thick hair.  I was initially concerned that it would simply coat the hair without penetrating and actually conditioning the hair but not the case here!The product works into the hair really nicely and detangles really well.The real wonderfulness happens when you dry and style your hair and see the shine and silkiness emerge!  The hair feels SO good, even just air drying leaves the hair soft and silky but drying with a round brush really leaves the hair extra smooth :)My ONLY dislike about this product is the really strong, floral fragrance which, to me, is a bit overwhelming.  I think they could cut the fragrance by half and still have a nice smell.  The other thing is the bright, blue color.  Personally, I prefer not to apply artificial color to my body and, again, I think they could do without it in this great product.Overall, I would buy this again and recommend it with the heads up about the strong fragrance...many people are very sensitive to smells and would miss out on the benefits of the product because of this :)Hope this was helpful!

What a great invention!  Of course, in some cultures, these have been around for years but it's new to me!  I thought this would be a helpful thing to have around when the grandkids come to save my back!The fabric is SO soft with just enough stretch to have a little give without losing support for the child you are holding.  Once you get the wrapping figured out, this is really the BEST way to carry a baby :)The only down side is anyone who tends to run a little warm ( like some of us gramma LOL) this can get a little too warm.  Between the warmth of the child and the extra fabric wrapped around you, it may be a little much in the summer.I love the idea of these as a gift for a new mom :)I had the opportunity to try this at a promotional price to give my honest opinion and feedback :)  This is something I would certainly recommend!Enjoy!

My skin is not anything like the "average" person's skin!  It's so dry it is actually painful if I don't apply enough moisturizer :(I had been reading about Phytoceramides for a while and finally got a chance to try it. I have SUPER sensitive skin and just can't get enough moisture externally so I thought this may help.After only a  couple of weeks of taking this I can say that  it sure seems my skin is less dry. It actually feels more "plump" if that makes sense.I already take grape seed extract which is also good for skin but this seems to have given my skin an extra boost toward helping to retain moisture and even out the texture. I firmly believe that your skin is only as good as the fuel and nutrients your body gets so this is a great addition to what I was already doing!I like that this brand is gluten free too.The price is reasonable for the quality of the product and this is something I will be sticking with. I will update the review if I see anything dramatic - like suddenly I get carded when I buy wine or something ;)I received a promotional price on this product to test out and give my honest opinion and feedback :)

So you understand the fit on these, here's my size/shape - I'm 5'2, 160lbs, size 12 in pants and usually size Large in tops as I'm larger busted.As others have mentioned, the sizing on these runs small - especially the pants BUT if you are built like me, these may be perfect!Personally, the length on the pants is perfect for wearing with clogs or tennis shoes but may be too short for someone with long legs.  I'm smaller on the bottom and legs so having the pants fit about a size smaller than average worked fine but if you have a booty, larger thighs and stomach, these may be too small.The top fits more like a standard size but still on the small size for an XL but, again, this worked great for my shape.The fabric is a bit on the stiff, scratchy side but softened up after washingThe workmanship is "ok" and I noticed the seams and stitching are a little wonky in some placesPersonally, these worked great for the purpose I need them for which is midwife duties in the barn when my goats are having their babies!  They have several pockets in both the pants and top for items I need to have handy, the fabric is durable and the design and fit work well for bending, kneeling and sometimes crawling around on the ground helping the goats :)I actually found this brand through a special promotion when I was able to buy these at a discount price to try out and give my honest opinion and feedback so for my needs, this was a win win :)The bottom line with these is this:If you can get the sizing issue figured out, they work. Keep in mind the price point!  These are very reasonable and would be good for maybe someone who needs an economical set of scrubs for occasional use or a temporary work situation or and doesn't want to spend a ton of $.  They make great outdoor work clothes that you can not worry about ruining :)These are worth a try if you pay attention to the size chart.Hope this was helpful info :)

This is an essential oil that everyone needs to have in their "tool kit!"I keep finding more and more uses for Peppermint oil including:**Add to body wash for an immediate cooling effect in the summer**Use in smoothies**Add to activated charcoal to brush your teeth**Mixture of peppermint oil and water in a spray bottle to keep spiders away**Use a mixture of peppermint, cedarwood and pine oils in a carrier oil soaked on a cloth to wipe down a dog who's been sprayed by a skunk (after bathing)**Add a few drops in a diffuser to promote alertness**Add a couple drops on a damp, cool washcloth and apply to eyes to soothe allergiesThese are just some of the things I've used this oil for! This is the reason I was so thrilled to find this larger sized bottle at such a good price.The quality of Pure Body Naturals oil is great and their customer support and service is outstanding. They were kind enough to offer this to me at a promotional price and asked for my honest opinion and feedback :)Hope this was helpful info for those shopping the many choices in oils out there :) This company is a winnerEnjoy

I have EXTREMELY dry and VERY sensitive skin - like, off the charts sensitive - so I have to be really careful what I use as my skin is easily irritated.  For the past couple of years I've used an eyecream I really like but the price is three times what this product costs so I have been looking for a more cost effective replacement that will actually work.I've been testing out this eye cream for a couple of weeks now with daily use.  What I've found is it take just a small amount but, because of my excessively dry skin, I have to apply more than one coat in order to get the amount of moisture my skin needs.  Probably not the case for most people but I just have unusual skin :(The great thing is it does not burn my skin or make it red!  That's pretty huge for me!The other thing I like about this product is that it doesn't clog my pores like some eye creams I've used nor does it leave a white residue on my skin which is another plus.As far as dealing withe dark circles, bags and puffiness, I have not seen any dramatic results yet but that may change with continued use and I will update this review as more time passes.So the verdict for me so far is I like it!  Do I look 25 again?  Nope.  Does it provide enough hydration?  Yes, with 2 applications but, again, that may just be my skin.I feel like the price is reasonable for the quality of the product so no complaints there :)Radha was kind enough to let me try this for free to test it out and give my honest opinion and feedback - Thanks for that :)Overall, I would recommend this as a good quality alternative to overpriced eye creams that works well - especially for those with sensitive skin :)Hope this was helpful info!Enjoy

Two reasons I wanted to try this product:1.  I'm trying to stop using the OTC sleep aids I've used for years and HATE the smell and taste of Valerian Root!2.  My husband really hates taking pills because they make him gag. He needs help sleeping once in a while.I've taken Melatonin before in pill form and didn't have much luck with it helping me get to sleep.  In fairness, it could have been due my extended use of OTC sleep aids.I really love the idea of chewable suppliments for adults and wonder why it took so long for companies to produce "grown up" chewables!These actually taste really good!  Some of the gummies leave a weird taste in your mouth but, thankfully, these don't!I started taking these a couple of weeks ago every night in place of the OTC sleep aid I had been using.  The first couple of nights, I had trouble falling asleep but I think it had to do with my body adjusting to the lack of chemicals!After continued use for almost 2 weeks I'm happy to report that chewing up 2 of these about an hour before bed REALLY helps me fall asleep and STAY asleep AND I don't have that annoying brain fog in the morning like I get with what I used to take - BIG bonus!The price for these is very reasonable when compared to the chemical sleep aid alternative so this is something I will continue to take as a more natural solution to night time sleeplessness.  I'm really happy I got these and highly recommend this!!!I was able to purchase these at a discounted price to try out and give my honest opinion and feedback :)  I will be a repeat customer of this product!Hope this was helpful!Enjoy your ZZZZ's :)

My 81 year old mom has dexterity issues with her hands and finds the pump type hand soap dispensers a little painful to use.  After searching for a solution for her, I came across this sensor activated model.  These can be pretty expensive so I was attracted by the price.  We were given an opportunity to try this out through a promotion at a discount to test and give an honest opinion and feedback :)After looking it over carefully, it appears to be pretty well built though not as heavy duty as some of the higher prices models.  After putting in the batteries, loading it with hand soap and test driving it, here's what I found...While it's not stainless steel, it is a fairly well made plastic with a metal looking appearance.  Finger prints do show but it's easy to clean.The opening where you load the soap is bigger than other models that I've looked as which makes it easier to fill.I like that it can be mounted on the wall or used on the counter top because you have the option of freeing up space.The amount of soap dispensed with each use can be adjusted with a button on topWhile not silent when in use, it's pretty quiet and not annoyingThe operation is pretty straight forward...just wave your hand in front of the sensor and the soap comes out, however, I think the reflection off the shiny surface can cause the sensor to trigger on it's own so I advise using the base to keep the reflection down!  You will have soap coming out on it's own otherwise.I did notice a few times that the sensor doesn't trigger on the first pass of movement and had to try to trigger it a few times so there's that..So after I tested it and determined that it does indeed work and that it's something an elder person and easily operate I gave it to my mother and she is thrilled with it!  She actually asked for another for Christmas to put in her bathroom :)Overall, I think for the price it's a good product that serves a good purpose - especially for those who like or need hands free operation.Hope this was helpful info :)Enjoy

You dudes with short hair just don't know how easy you have it sometimes!  Having to work around a pony tail when it comes to finding outdoor gear can be a bit of a challenge!I've been searching for a balaclava that would be both effective at keeping out the cold and comfortable.  I've tried a couple in the past but, with long hair, you end up either stuffing all your loose hair down the back which feels annoying after a while, or putting your hair in a ponytail and then having to deal with the bulk!  UGH!I was really excited to try this balaclava when I saw it offered through a promotion and got a chance to test it out and give my honest opinion and feedback!Just the fact that it is MADE for us pony tail clad users was nice and if it actually keeps you warm would be a huge plus!Well, I can fully attest to the fact that it is both functional AND comfortable!!!  Yessssssss!I love the lightweight but warm fabric.  It's a perfect combination of warmth without the bulk.  Having tried a fleece type before, I found the fleece to be too bulky and not practical as it would block side vision.What I also like about this one - apart from the obvious wonderfulness of having an opening for your pony tail - is that the way it's cut at the opening around your face makes it WAY more comfortable.  Sometimes the face opening is too small and you are constantly pulling the material away from your eyes.This one has plenty of room around the forehead and eyes while still providing excellent protection from the cold AND you can wear glasses.I always wear a baseball hat anyway and this one not only allows me to pull my ponytail through the opening in the balaclava but also my hat so my hat stays put even in windy situations.Though the fabric is light weight, it holds in the body heat just fine and it's soft against your skin.  The length of the fabric going down the neck area is plenty long enough for complete coverage on your neck and can tuck inside the shirt .For such a simple item, this one is done the right way and is a VERY valuable piece of gear!!!LOVE this and would not hesitate to recommend it :)Hope this was helpful info :)Enjoy!

I was SO hoping this would work!  Since it's advertised to work with the iPhone 6 plus, I was anxious to try it - hoping to ditch the cable set up we currently have.Sadly, after getting it set up and trying it, it just didn't work!  It would start to charge for a few seconds then stop.  After unplugging it and plugging it back in several times and getting the same result I just gave up, boxed it back up, and opted to return it for a refund :(Because the iphone doesn't have the build in technology for wireless charging, it's necessary to plug in the "transmitter" to your phone, keep it in the case, and set it on the charging disc - a process I didn't really find I liked anyway.  Even tho the transmitter part is thin, it still caused my case to not fit properly and I'm not about to have to take the case off each time I want to charge the phone.It was an interesting concept but poorly executed with this product which it too bad :(I noticed after I purchased this that others have had the same issues.  Hopefully the company can made some changes to where this will be a successful product :)I received the product at a discount to test and give my honest opinion and feedback.

First, let me say I'm sort of...well, ok..I'm a hard core PILLOW COLLECTOR!  Because of issues with my neck and back, I've been on the hunt for "THE" pillow that will work for me for years.  So, I have amassed a collection of 11 pillows - everything from the buckwheat, memory foam with gel, down and even the newest My Pillow.  Nothing has really worked well and I end up switching out pillows several times a night trying to get comfortable.What I've been searching for is a pillow that isn't bulky, low profile and that can be "formed" around my shoulder as I'm a side sleeper. So many of the pillows I've tried while thin enough, simply don't hold their shape and end up going flat after an hour or so.  The thicker, fluffier pillows end up being too bulky which holds my head too far up off the pillow causing neck pain....UGH!If you are one of those people who can sleep on any pillow, God bless you! What was one more pillow?!  I'm more than willing to be a guinea pig, especially when it comes to a product I'm on the hunt for anyway.When this arrived, it was packaged in a clear, plastic carrying case with a handle which I thought was odd since I don't think it would really ever be used again.  The pillow was compressed completely flat and stuffed very tightly into this bag so getting it out of the carrying case was tough!When I tried to get the pillow out, the case totally ripped apart which was fine because I wasn't planning on ever using it again but thought a different packaging method would be far better!Once I got the pillow unwrapped, I watched it decompress into a normal looking, king sized pillow but that's where the "normal" part ended and wonderfulness began!!!I wish I could properly describe how amazingly soft this pillow is!  The cover of the pillow alone is worth the price of admission!  There is a very different feel to this fabric that, until you touch it, just looks like normal cotton but feels incredible!
