I'm using it in a guest bath, so there will not be a mess of shampoo and bath care products showing. If you are ordering this, do take the fact it us see through into consideration. I am very pleased with the grey and am sorry I did not get the purple when it was offered previously. This shower curtain definitely looks much higher quality than it appears nonlinear.

These Hefty bags are really great for jobs that require a large, strong bad. I use them for changing the cat litter and they hold up really well, even when full of the heavy litter. No holes or even what would look like stretching of the bag. The drawstring is a plus, too. I even dragged the bag across the ground and it still held up. Definitely going to purchase these when I run out.

These Kitchen cloths are really absorbent. They dried my dishes fast and  don't leave a bunch of fibers all over my dishes like some do. They didn't feel very soft at first, but after washing they are much better. I hand wash a lot,so good towels for drying are important to me.One thing to note: I reviewed the grey stripes, but only 2 really look grey. The others have a greenish hue to them. Not a big deal unless you are planning to leave them out and want to match certain colors in your kitchen. That was the only reason I gave 4 stars instead of 5.

I can honestly say that this is close to being the best vacuum I have ever owned. It is very lightweight and easy to move around the house. I was able to get around corners and under my coffee table.  It picks up dust and dirt with ease, and then there are the attachments.The attachments all fit right on the vacuum, which makes keeping it easy to change off when needed. You switch from regular to attachment mode with the click of a switch. The pet hair attachment is great for cleaning my cat's bed of all the excess hair . This is designed specifically for pet owners, it seems to live up to that standard. Bagless, it's easy to open and empty, plus a washable filter saves money. I am very pleased with it overall and even like the fuschia color.

I used this hair color in the Rich Chocolate Brown on my mom's hair because it is very close to the color she has been having done in a salon. The color was easy to apply and was enough to cover all of her medium length hair completely. A nice aspect of this hair color is that it has a neutral smell and not too strong like some permanent colors. I was concerned that it would fade like some demi-permanent colors (which is an issue she has in the salon) but it has lasted almost a month now. Not a but of grey has come through and the color is quite pretty.Application, as I said , was easy and it felt very smooth going through her hair. I didn't have trouble getting all through and she even commented that her hair felt incredible soft after washing out. It looks fantastic ,too! I believe she is going to use this product from now on because it is a better color than she gets in the salon and having me apply it for her is much less expensive, too! I may try it in a red on myself.

First, I will say that this product is not to used solely as a "slimming product" and it does say so on the box. As a skin care professional, I am well aware that often products can REDUCE the appearance of cellulite over time, but really only diet and exercise can help reduce it. That being said, here is how I feel about the product .This is nothing more than a TEMPORARY self -tanning spray. I recommend applying it an area where it will not get on anything, or put old towels down, first. When I first applied the spray, it looked very dark orange and my first reaction was "oh, no. I'm going to look like an Oompa Loompa." The directions suggest rubbing in the product and after I did that, it was better, but still left me with a very fake looking color. I am very fair skinned and the few times I get any sun on my, it does not look like this. I just feel the color was too noticeably artificial.The basic fact is this product is what it is: an artificial tanner meant to give a "glow" to the skin. If you apply it carefully, it will not look too terrible,but you must make sure you are evenly applying it, or it will leave some areas noticeably pale. Use caution on parts of the body such as knees, feet and hands because that is where it will appear darker. Also, a good idea is to wear gloves when applying or wash hands IMMEDIATELY after to avoid staining of the palms. I didn't like the fact that the whole point of this was that it is an SPRAY and therefore you really shouldn't even have to use your hands to apply. It does dry quite fast and has a touch of shimmer, which I liked. Another good aspect is that it is not thick like an self tanning cream and it does NOT have an awful odor. It really didn't have much at all.What I really did not like was that after all my efforts, after one shower, the color was GONE. So now I had to apply it after every shower. I think I will save this product for special occasions when I want to appear to have a slight tan, such as my sister's wedding . Also, it would look better if  you already have a base tan because it will enhance it,Overall, not something I would buy.

TheraBreath is a unique take on mouth rinses. It's made with natural ingredients like chamomile and aloe, so it's very soothing and gentle. It has a little cap on top for easy measuring the right amount. I have had dental work done and still get gum irritation after eating certain foods, so I was looking for a mouth rinse that would be less harsh than most on the market and this works pretty well for my needs.There is one thing I dislike, which is the flavor. While it has a touch of a minty taste, it has xylitol, which is a sugar alcohol used in many diabetic foods, and it leaves an aftertaste in my mouth. I just rinse with water afterwards and that usually helps.I like that it is alcohol free, taking away the burning  feeling I sometimes get from some mouth rinses.Overall, this is a good product for people with mouth sensitivity. Great for when I have my teeth cleaned because my mouth is always irritated and sore afterwards.

I'm loving this weekly "rehab" treatment for hair. Since I've been using it, my hair is softher, shiner and rinse cleaner. A great improvement overall. I use it once a week as directed, leaving it on while I shave my legs. Then I rinse it out as the last thing. It even makes blow drying faster and leaves less frizz.

What can I say about this adorable shoe stapler? It is from Swingline, so I knew it would work well. As a shoe lover, I think it looks cute on my desk and gets a lot of attention when people realize what it is. My only issue is that it was a little getting used to the grip because of the shape, but it's definitely fully functional and takes standard size staples. A great gift for a shoe lover!

After My favorite razor become "extinct" and I could no longer find replacement blades, I didn't know what kind of razor to try next. I had been using the same one for over 20 years. I tried many options, but was still never completely satisfied.Bic Soleil Bella is the first disposable razor I have tried that gave me a truly close shave with no missed hairs and no nics or cuts! I was even able to go a few days without shaving my legs!This incredible find has 4 flexible blades and a pivoting head, which makes it easy to get close, even in hard to shave areas. There are 2 strips of coconut oil , which makes for a smooth shave.A package contains 3 disposable razors and is available a decent price. I think (no, I know) I finally found the last razor I will try again.

I admit black bean chips didn't sound appetizing to me, so I wasn't sure if I was going to like these Beanitos chips.I was pleasantly surprised that are actually really good! Crispy, full of flavor and also good for you! These had just the right amount of sea salt. They are high in fiber, full of protein and gluten free!I only had a small bag, but I am definitely going to buy more. I think I like them more than tortilla chips and I don't feel guilty eating them. I think they will be great with salsa, but are just as good straight out of the bag.You'd never know they were made from black beans.Thanks to Influenster, I received a sample of Beanitos chips for free in exchange for my honest opinions.

This is an amazing little gadget! I have similar products advertised and in stores and was very interested in checking it out, so when I was offered an opportunity to review one for amazon vine at no cost, I jumped! I am on my feet all day at work and living in Florida, spend a lot of my free time barefoot. These are 2 very good reasons I wanted (and needed) this. Well, I was not disappointed! I want to say I was simply amazed at how FAST it worked. I saw instant results. Now,my fet were not really all that bad, but I did have some rough patches and very dry, cracked heels. Guess what? I DO  NOT ANYMORE!This comes with 2 heads. One for really rough, coarse skin (blue) and another for softening and polishing (purple). I used the blue first all over my heels and on the pads of my feet. Wow. I just can't say enough how fast this works. I do recommend 2 things. First, I would place down a towel or cloth to "catch" all the dry skin that will flake off. It's a bit messy. Second, I would suggest using a foot cream- one specifically for feet, not a regular hand or body lotion- and use it right after. It will help with the softening.Do not worry that this is something that will cause irritaion or any real discomfort with use. I know some of the advertised foot products look like they might be painful or make your feet sore after. Not The Silk'n.  It barely felt like I was doing anything and my feet were super soft and smooth after. Now I am ready for summer sandles and flip flops without worrying about my feet looking old and dry.Along with the 2 heads, it also comes with the 2 AA batteries needed and a cleaning brush. I do wish it came with a storage case, but I am using an old makeup case I have.

There are a few things I like about this product. 1. The relaxing and soothing scentt of lavender has always had a calming effect on me. 2. It can be used hot or cold, which is nice because sometimes warming it up makes it even more effective because it intensifies the aroma . Unfortunately, there are also some things I DO NOT like about this. 1. I felt it was a bit "heavy" and that makes it a bit awkward. It tends to fall off my face and THAT doesn't help me relax at all. 2. I don't care for the material it's made of. A cotton type material would have been more comfortable in my opinion, but it's not too bad.If you do not like lavender or any strong scent, I urge you to pass on this. It can be very strong coming out of the package and even just laying on my coffee tabel after use, I could smell it across the room. I personally, am a fan of lavender, do I like it.As for using it for migraines, I didn't feel it helped that much. My migraines are pretty bad, so it might just be me.This comes from a well known brand and is also eco-friendly, which makes me feel good about using it.Overall, it's nice to place it over my eyes and relax or take a nap. It does work well, but it's just not something I would be raving to everyone about.  Hence, the 3 stars.

Normally, when I make any kind of stir-fry dish, I make my own sauce, but when I had the opportunity to try this skillet sauce from McCormick, I decided it give it a shot.As the package suggests, I chose to make chicken . I used about a 1 lb. of chicken cut into cubes, mixed with peppers, onions, mushrooms, as well as water chestnuts and baby corn.I cooked the chicken and vegetables as directed, fully cooking the chicken and until the vegetables were tender, but still crisp, I added the sauce. It says to let it come to a boil, it I can't say it really did because the sauce coated the ingredients perfectly, so there wasn't a lot of "extra" to boil. I did let it cook until the veggies were just a bit more tender, but I don't like my stir-fry to be mushy, so it wasn't much longer. .As for the taste, it was delicious! I didn't have to add any additional spices to it. I served it over brown rice and there was enough for two, leaving me leftovers as well.I will definitely purchase more of this sesame chicken skillet sauce. I look forward to trying it with pepper steak next time.It's a great way to cook a one-pan meal with very little effort and mess

Bold. Sensual. Warm. Exotic. Those are just a few words I would choose to describe this fragrance by Calvin Klein. I have to be very careful with perfumes because of my migraines, but for some reason I can wear anything by Calvin Klein ,which is great because they are my favorites.I had been wanting to experience Euphoria every since I started seeing the scented ads in magazines and now through the Amazon Vine Program I am able to try it in exchange for an honest review.I can smell the notes of pomagrante, amber and black orchid , which are in a lot of the fragrances I enjoy. It's not a flowery fragrance. It's very exotic and sexy.The 1 oz.bottle has a unique shape and a spritzer for application, which I like better than one that you have to dab on with your fingers,Already loving this scent, I can tell it will be one I'll be wearing for a long time to come

All of the classic Hersey candies are here in the usual miniature size. Original, Special Dark, Krackle and Mr Goodbar. This is a huge 4 lbs of candy and is great for so many occasions. Halloween , parties and even just for snacking. I only hope I can eat in moderation!

These makeup "papers" are a great idea and definitely convenient. I really like the darker blush because it's more flattering on my skin than the lighter pinkish one. The highlighter is a bit too shimmery for everyday, but I used it on my lids for evening. They are very convenient to carry for touch-ups throughout the day and don't make a mess. I found them quite easy to use. Either by swiping across the cheek or blotting. I found it was better to apply the blush AFTER my all over powder because when I used it before, it seems to not be as noticeable. They definitely are better than regular powder blush and paraben free, which is always a good thing!
Love this! I ended up buying another with a similar quote to put on my wall near this. Great buy. Love the "vintage" look!
I loved this quote and was glad to find it on a canvas print in a nice size. I loved it so much, I ended up buying another similar quote from the same seller

Ava Trumble lives in a haunted house. At least that is what everyone in Kerrick, Maine think. Strange occurances happen, and most of the town is afraid to enter or stay there for very long. Ava isn't afraid, though. When her aunt leaves the mansion to Ava in her will, Ava plans to turn it into a bed and breakfast. Those dreams are put on hold as she learns before the home can truly become hers, she must solve the mystery of what happened Sarah Kerrick, who disappeared over 200 years ago from the manion and whose body was never found.Feeling determined, Sarah calls upon Phantoms, a group of paranormal researchers that have a popular TV series to come investigate and help her claim the home she has lived in for years.Jackson Granger is the lead investigator of Phantoms, and as it turns out, has ties of his own to Trumble Mansion. When Jackson and Ava meet, there is attraction, but tension. As Jackson and his crew investigate the mysteries surrounding Sarah's disappearance, he finds himself drawn the her and having feelings  he has never felt for any woman before. The feelings become mutual for Ava, but she knows Jackson's time with her is temporary. Still, she cannot help the feelings developing when he is near.Falling fast for each other, amidst ghostly activity, they both have to wonder if what they feel is real-or if they are pawns of some restless spirits haunting the mansion.I have read many books catagorized as paranormal romance, but this is one of the few to contain an actual romantic storyline. I instantly liked the lead characters of Ava (the feisty, headstrong redhead) and Jackson (the rugged, handsome Brit). The chemistry was so well written, I could feel the heat jumping out of my kindle.Kelly Moran obviously did a lot of research when it came to the field of "ghost hunting". She knew the proper terminology and names of equipment used, which to me was important since I have been a fan of the type of TV show depicted for years.I really enjoyed the mystery of Sarah's disappearance and found it a good storyline that kept my interest as much as the unfolding romanace between Ava and Jackson. This book wasn't scary, but suspenseful and had the right blend of mystery and romance. I found it played out very well.I also enjoyed learning about the secondary characters, some of which I am happy to know will have stories of their own in the next two books in this trilogy.Kelly Moran has been one of my favorite authors of romance for years and with Ghost Of A Promise , she continues to remain so.

This Electrolux vacuum is extremely lightweight and easy to maneuver around. I like the way I can zip through my house and get a really good carpet cleaning. Some key points are the adjustable pole, light on bottom (for seeing under my bed) and some great (and useful) attachments.Although I was happy to find a bagless vacuum, I found it a bit difficult to remove and open at first, but I'm getting used to it.The retractable cord is a great feature, because you can pull out as much as you need and with the push of a button, it retracts back into the vacuum.My only issues with it are that it is not a real heavy duty vacuum, made with a light plastic(which of course is the reason it moves easily around) but for my small house, it does what I need it to do.

Vidal Sassoon has brought back the original condtioner with the classic cherry almond scent I remember from years ago. This condition is not too heavy and rinses clean with no residue left behind. It makes my hair easy to manage and with less flyaways. I love the classic scent of cherry almond.
Great pillows. I have a "quote" theme in my living room and these pillows are a fun addition to it. I bought 2.

This carpet sweeper comes in quite handy for in between vacuuming and works well on both my carpeted areas and tiled floors. I love that it's quite compact and fits in my laundry room for easy access. It even picks up excess from my litter box. I remember when I was a child and my mom had a similar carpet sweeper. This is a great little item that makes cleaner a little bit easier.

I do not have the specific BIssell these were intended for, but I have a Bissell /Swiffer floor steamer that I thought they would work for. They are a bit snug, but they work. They do a great job of cleaning my tile, which is throughout my home. It's nice to have to one for regular cleaning and one that is better at the harder to clean areas because of the texture on the pad. Microban treated pads are good because they keep the pads fresher and when you need to, you can wash them in the machine. It's great because I have money from not having to buy the diposable pads for the Swiffer. Cleaning the floors is a chore I really dislike,but these pads make it much easier.

These Olay make-up remover cloths are a great way to ge rid of all your make up quickly and easily. I can remove a face full of makeup (including mascara) with one large cloth. They have just the right amount of moisture and the resealable bag makes it easy to keep them on me when I travel. I do still like to use my regular cleanser afterwards, though. While these are great for removing makeup, they aren't going to give me any skin care benefits that my cleanser does. My only other "issue" is that they are scented and I don't like using anything with fragrance on my face. Other than that, they are a great product for the job they are intended for.

These scissors are really fantastic! I am always having a hard time cutting open thick plastic packaging with regular scissors and usually end up breaking them, so I don't like to spend a lot of mone on them. These Premium scissors from Stanley are a much better quality than I have used before and can really hold up well. They can cut through thick plastic with ease and have a handy little ruler on the blade. I recommend these if you need a good pair of utility scissors.

I am always looking for cat food that is healthier for my cat, but worried that she will not like a change in her food. Purina Beyond seemed like a good choice to try because she typically likes their other varieties and Ocean Whitefish flavor is one of her favorites.The only concern I had was that she prefers "meaty" canned food, with chunks and gravy over pate' style.I gave her about half a can to try and at first she looked at it and sniffed it. Then she tasted it and surprised me by eating quite a bit of it. Though, she didn't finish it all, she didn't scoff at it and walk away , like she has done with other foods.I tried it out a second day and also gave some to my mother's cat, who loves pate'. They both ate a little bit this time, but neither ate as much as they do with their regular food.  Purina Beyond, Grain Free is definitely something I would be happy giving my cat on a regular basis, but I think she would prefer a variety that wasn't pate'.

Not much to say here except that this is so much better that just putting down shelf paper. It looks nicer, has a bit of a stretch to it and is easy to apply. You just cut to fit you cabinet floor and press down. It stays putr and I even had a bit extra that I used on a closet shelf. It certainly makes the area under my kitchen sink look nice and keeps it very clean. It's non adhesive, so It can be removed to clean, but I haven't needed to do that. I am impressed enough that after trying it for free in exchange for this unbiased review , I am probably going to buy more for under my bathroom sinks.

LAY'S Air Pops are all the great flavor of original Lay's potato chips, but air-popped. They are very crunchy and light and just like all Lay's chips, very addictive! I could have consumed the whole bag in one sitting. These make a great snack and I would love to see them in more flavors.

I thought the Divine Duos cat food would be something my cat would really like. It's a good combination of a pate' topped with diced food and lots of gravy. Typically, my cat loves wet food with gravy, so I was sure it would be a hit with her. Unfortunately, that's about the only thing she liked. She licked up all the gravy and ate a little of the diced food, but left all the pate'.Of course, being able to ASK her, what she thought, that is about all I can say.For me, the appearance of the food looked good and it would be something I would buy if my cat liked it.

This was my first experience using a French Press Coffee maker, so I don't have anything to compare it to. That being said, this OXO Press makes a really good cup of coffee!I typically brew coffee with my Keurig coffee maker for several reasons. One of them is that living by myself, I don't need to make m ore than one cup at a time and another is that it makes good coffee.I have been told by others , including my brother, how great coffee is when made with a French Press Coffee maker, so having the opportunity to review one for amazon vine, I decided to take advantage and give it a try.First, for those who don't know (I didn't) you need to buy coarsely ground coffee for it to work properly. I went to a local gourmet food store and picked up some of an old favorite flavor.The French Press is pretty easy to use. A round tablespoon is needed for each 4 ounce cup of coffee. You add the coffee, then hot (not boiled) water and the filter press. The press down and voila'! You have delicious coffee. I have to say, I really did enjoy the coffee, though on my first try, I admit I did have a few grounds floating around. I blame this on my inexperience. After more attempts, I was able to not just get a good cup of coffee, but a GREAT cup of coffee.I like the sleek silver and black design of the press , itself, as it matches nicely in my kitchen.So this French Press Coffee maker will not replace my Keurig for everyday coffee, but I will be using it for special occasions, or when I am in the mood to treat myself to something special.

I absolutely love this sign! I love stars and tend to buy lots of things with them on it. My living room is decorated with quotes on everything from wall hangings to throw pillows and this is the perfect compliment. Even the color goes great with my decor'.

When I was browsing items for my new home, I came across this by "accident" and loved the saying. I think it's very fitting for me, as I am quite the "potty mouth". I ordered it immediately and it shipped very quickly and was packaged well. The only thing I can say other than that is I thought the glass was purple, but it's only purple at the base and that causes it to have a "tinted" effect. Very inexpensive and great as a gift as well.

I know it seems that there wouldn't be much to say about placemats, and there really isn't, but it's not really how much is said, but what is said.So here is what I do have to say. The placemats themselves are a nice size of 15 inches round. I like the woven material and it's easy to wipe clean.As for the shape, I have always used rectangular placemats, but I these are so attractive and fit well on my smaller, square table. I also have black and white square dinner plates, which combined with these in black, make for a very nice place setting.The price is good for the set of 4 and I do know there are a good amount of color options available.

This is a great little (focus on little) storage for your coffee pods or k-cups. The drawers each hold 9 k-cups, which is good if you have a box of 18. The top has 3 very small compartments and one large one. This is great for holding individual sugar packs. Contrary to the picture, it does NOT have round circle slots in the drawers, which I found to be a good thing. This storage container is good to keep a small selection of coffee pods on the counter, but here's a tip- It also would make an excellent storage container for make-up or organizing hair accessories. Personally, I may use it for just that because I have way more than 18 kcups and it looks more suited for a bathroom counter than a kitchen one. Still, whatever you use it for, it's a great little storage item!

when I ordered these, I cloth they were dish towels, but they are much smaller. Like the size of a wash cloth. Not what I was needing, but still good quality and I like the black and white windowpane design.
this is a great clear shower liner that is very lightweight. The only thing that would make it better would is if it had metal grommets around the holes. when there isn't they tend to tear.

This is cute, but the bowls are too small for my cat. If I used this as a daily feeder for water and dry food, I would be filling it every hour. Maybe if you have 2 small cats that dine side by side or a cat tat doesn't drink or eat a lot, it could be good, but my cat is always drinking water (which is important for their health) and eats about 2 bowls  full of dry food a day!

Cody Wilde made a promise to his dying father‚Äîhe would always avoid trouble‚Äîa difficult promise to keep in a rural Texas town where he‚Äôs bullied by the sheriff‚Äôs son. Cassie Strong found it hard to understand why people always picked on Cody, who had only shown her sweetness and kindness. In fact, she was the only person to see the nice side of him. When tragedy strikes her life, Cody is there for her, and their friendship becomes something more.As they enter adulthood, Cody tries to avoid becoming too attached to Cassie, but can‚Äôt continue to deny his feelings. When his childhood enemy reenters their lives, he resolves to keep Cassie safe, but when Cassie is raped, Cody is faced with a problem‚Äîhe can protect Cassie only by violating the oath he made to his father.The three Strong & Wilde series by L. A. Castillo follows Cody and Cassie from their teen years until the crisis of adulthood that forces them to make some life-changing decisions. Strong action, stronger emotions, and a harsh, demanding setting makes this a blistering read that is part romance, part thriller, and all fascinating. Strong characters facing mountainous challenges will keep you flipping pages, gnashing your teeth, and sitting on the edge of your seat.I received a free copy of this three-book set in exchange for my review.

M‚Äôrain is on the threshold of womanhood, but she is restless and longs to know more than just the desert world in which her village is located. One day, while out food gathering, she wanders far, and after taking shelter in a cave, is taken captive by a band of women who are under the thrall of a mad man who claims to have magic powers. With the help of the enigmatic lizard, Glick, M‚Äôrain escapes and makes her way through the labyrinth of tunnels and into a land like known she‚Äôs ever known. Glick informs her that she is the chosen one, a Traveler, who can transit the labyrinth and serve as the link between the two people. But first, she must free those held by the mad man.Labyrinth Quest by Yvonne Hertzberger is fantasy fiction at its best. The author creates a believable world, inhabited by believable creatures. Her characters feel real, and I found myself cheering for M‚Äôrain and her newfound love, P‚Äôpuck, as they jockeyed back and forth concerning their feelings for each other. Hertzberger can put a lot of meaning in a few words, and the images conjured up by her prose were fantastic.This is a story that begs for a sequel‚Äîperhaps the story of M‚Äôrain and P‚Äôpuck‚Äôs heirs. Loved it.

Having installed screen shields on other devices, I was a bit daunted at first with the installation instructions for the ArmorSuit shield. It turned out, though, that it wasn't all that complicated, and not that it's on, I'm more than satisfied with the results. A great product, and you can't beat the price, especially when you compare it to other similar products on the market.

Nadia Bolz-Weber is an unconventional pastor. Having lived a rough life, including problems with drugs, Bolz-Weber‚Äôs ministry focuses on the so-called sinners. Her belief is that God works most through sinners, and reminds Christians that Jesus spent more time with those on the underside of society, the money lender, prostitutes, etc., than with the pious upper class.Accidental Saints: Finding God in all the Wrong People by Nadia Bolz-Weber/Key Takeaways, Analysis & Review by Eureka Books is a fantastic summary of Bolz-Weber‚Äôs book, showing her own ups and downs as she learned what it really meant to be a Christian.From this summary I think this is a great book to read, regardless of your religion.

If you ever watched the TV show, ‚ÄòParks and Recreation,‚Äô you‚Äôll be familiar with the off-beat humor of comedian Aziz Ansari. In Modern Romance, co-authored with social scientist Eric Klinenberg, Ansari takes a humorous look at how modern technology impacts on love and relationships. In a world where a person can begin a romance with a right swipe of a finger, and break up via text message, Ansari believes we‚Äôve been given too many choices and have lost sight of what is really needed to have a sound relationship.Modern Romance by Azia Ansari and Eric Klinenberg/Key Takeaways, Analysis & Review by Instaread gives an in depth summary of the book, allowing a reader to get the gist of a book in 15 minutes or so before committing to buying it. Always a treat to get an advance and unbiased look at new books.

Those with strong religious beliefs will probably not like reading anything renowned scientist and atheist Richard Dawkins writes. But, the second offering of his memoirs, Brief Candle in the Dark: My Life in Science, is worth reading regardless of your religion. Dawkins goes into some detail in this book about his scientific and religious beliefs (or disbeliefs), but the key thing is his take on those who have in some way influenced him through the years. If there is a weakness in the theories Dawkins espouses, it‚Äôs that if evolution is as determinative as he believes, how can there still be so many people who refuse to believe in it. I say that tongue in cheek, because there have always been, and will always be, people who cannot accept any fact that contradicts cherished beliefs.Brief Candle in the Dark is a book about science written for laymen; it uses a thematic/literary style in order to maintain interest, rather than a straight chronological style, and esoteric/complicated scientific terms are used sparingly.I got the audiobook version of Instaread‚Äôs Brief Candle in the Dark: My Life in Science by Richard Dawkins/Summary & Review, and was as usual impressed. Being able to get an in depth summary of a book in a mere 15 minutes is a treat for those of us with busy schedules. It enables one to get a good idea of a book without having to read the whole book‚Äîor pay for it‚Äîand then one is able to make a more rational and informed decision on which books to buy.

While aerobic exercise is important, it's also important to do resistance and strength exercises. During my time in the army, one of the exercises that benefited me most was the pushup. But, pushups can be difficult and hard on the hands. These pushup bars can be quite useful in keeping the hands in the correct position, and in addition, because they have the hands off the floor they put more resistance on the shoulder and back muscles. The grips are great for maintaining position and the nonslip pads make them useful on any surface. Assembling them was a snap (pun intended) with the flanges holding them in place tightly. Luckily, putting them together was pretty intuitive, as there were no instructions included--which would be helpful for people who're not adept at assembling things. This, though, is a minor point. This device has really kicked my morning exercise routine up a notch.

New Orleans lawyer Tubby Dubonnet is a simple man with fancy tastes. When a new client, caught with a load of marijuana, gives Tubby a gym bag full of cash for safekeeping, nothing is simple anymore. His client dies unexpectedly of lead poisoning (the projectile kind) and Tubby‚Äôs left literally holding the bag. If the cops catch him with it he could go to jail, but that‚Äôs not the worst of his problems‚Äîthere are others who are willing to kill him for it.Crooked Man by Tony Dunbar is the first book in the Tubby Dubonnet series. Full of local color, action, and plenty of laughs, this is a mystery with a cast of over the top characters that are totally entertaining.Dunbar is a maestro at whipping you through the action like a bullwhip, hanging you over the ledge, and then dropping you into the middle of Tubby‚Äôs muddle. When you finally crawl out, you‚Äôre ready to go back and do it all over again. Three cheers for Tubby.

Ailin, on her way to have her heart eaten as part of a lavish banquet, is saved by Fenton, who is held captive by the pirates transporting her because he can speak to and control the dreaded kraken.When their two lives collide, Fenton has to make a decision, summon the beast to free Ailin, or free himself.Heart of the Kraken by A. W. Exley is a chilling story of Fenton‚Äôs search for his soul, full of action and excitement, and deep emotions as well. Fantasy fiction for the connoisseur of fine storytelling. I received a free copy of this book in exchange for my review.

British army lieutenant Hugh Pyke and Susquehannock warrior Wolf Tongue are brought together in another hazardous mission when they‚Äôre called upon to protect the settlement of Millers Town from Indian raiders. Upon arriving in Millers Town they discover that not only does it contain no militia, or even men with military experience, but that the town harbors secrets that endanger both men‚Äôs lives.Pyke nonetheless sets about building some kind of defense with what the town has to offer, while at the same time having to watch his back against those in town who would gladly kill to protect their secrets. On the eve of the attack Wolf Tongue has to rescue the kidnapped daughter of the Indian chief leading the attackers.Through the Narrows, book two in the Tomahawk and Saber series by Nathaniel Green and Evan Ronan is rich in historical details about pre-independence America and contains characters that are larger than life. For a peek at what life must have been like for our forefathers, this is historical fiction at its best.I received a free copy of this book in exchange for my review.

Maritime engineer Tom Dugan is a part-time informant for the CIA, but when he‚Äôs implicated in a hijacking and then asked to spy on his long-time friend and client, shipping company owner Alex Kairouz, he‚Äôs plunged deeper into the murky world of secret intelligence than he‚Äôd ever imagined possible.Multiple attacks, including a tanker found adrift near Singapore with its crew murdered, and a deadly attack in the Panama Canal, deepen the mystery; leaving Dugan to believe that an even deadlier attack is still imminent.Dugan teams up with British Intelligence, a determined Panamanian cop, and a Russian special operations team to head off a disaster that could kill tens of thousands and plunge the world into war.Deadly Straits by R. E. McDermott is an ace thriller, covering the globe from the pirate infested waters near Singapore, to the Panama Canal, to the beautiful Bosporus Straits, and is laced with a thrill a minute and details of ships and shipping that could only come from someone who has had long experience on the briny. Layered with political intrigue, this is a book for the diehard thriller fan.

Mankind has been studying the universe‚Äîboth the macro universe of the galaxies and stars and the micro universe of subatomic particles‚Äîsince ancient times, and it is still a mystery. Stephen Hawking, one of the greatest minds of the 20th and 21st centuries, in his book A Brief History of Time attempts to shed some light on the nature of both universes. While the book is written in plain language, what seems to come through is there remain more questions than answers. But, Hawking at least points the way to further research into efforts to develop a unified theory, or an explanation of ‚Äòeverything.‚ÄôEven though it‚Äôs in nontechnical language, this is a book that‚Äôs likely to appeal mostly to those interested in science, which is a shame, because what Hawking has to say is important. If you don‚Äôt read the book itself, I would at least suggest reading A Brief History of Time: by Stephen Hawking/Key Takeaways, Analysis & Review by Instaread. This handy little book, that can be read in 15 minutes, will give you the essence of Hawking‚Äôs book, and it just might entice you to dive into the full work.

Many people suffering from mental or emotional illness don‚Äôt receive proper treatment because of the stigma surrounding such maladies. A Common Struggle by Patrick J. Kennedy, youngest child of the late Senator Ted Kennedy, and Stephen Fried, attempts to remove the stigma by sharing with the reader the troubles Kennedy had struggling with his own addiction problems and mental disorder, even while pursuing a career in politics.Instaread‚Äôs Summary & Analysis of Patrick J. Kennedy & Stephen Fried‚Äôs Common Struggle gives an excellent overview of the book, with a summary, introduction to the important people mentioned in the book, and an analysis of the themes and authors‚Äô style.

Robert B. Reich‚Äôs Saving Capitalism is a comprehensive look at how economics and politics combine in the US to produce economic inequality. Reich debunks the myths that the uber-rich perpetuate about the free market, as well as many other misperceptions about economic issues. His main thesis is that it‚Äôs not about free market versus big government as a host of conservative politicians and their wealthy backers would have you believe, but about creating a market economy that further enriches the top 1% versus one that is designed to benefit the majority of citizens.Reich manages to remain mostly apolitical in his book, focusing on the things that people of all political persuasions can do to improve their lives and benefit the country at large‚Äîsomething all too many of our current crop of politicians fail to do.Saving Capitalism: For the Many, Not the Few by Robert B. Reich/Key Takeaways, Analysis & Review by Instaread is another great introduction to a book that many lay readers might be reluctant to purchase. The overview and analysis of the book‚Äôs key takeaways removes much of the mystique, and just might entice people to want to read it. I know it did for me.

A prequel to the Primal series, Primal Inception by Jack Silkstone tells the story of how the partnership of CIA operatives Ice and Vance began. In Kosovo in 1999, the two operatives begin to question whether they‚Äôre fighting for the right side when their so-called allies, the Albanian rebels resort to mafia-like tactics that aim at enriching themselves rather than freeing their people. Scarred after witnessing an act of genocide, Ice decides to run his own investigation into the war crimes the Albanians are committing. After a short assignment in Africa, Vance returns to help his friend fight an unsanctioned battle against people their government and the UN support.Top flight action and suspense mark this story. It‚Äôll get your pulse racing.

In Spilt Milk: A Collection of Short Stories by D.K. Cassidy each story briefly distills life‚Äôs essence‚Äîchoices are made, sometimes unfortunate ones which change the characters‚Äô lives.The characters are unforgettable, such as Cinderella‚Äôs stepmother undergoing a therapy session, and they all change, some for the worse. This is a collection of droll, horrific, but thought provoking stories that every reader will enjoy.

As a young girl, Skye Cree was brutally assaulted by Ronny Wayne Whitfield. But, Skye is a survivor, and with her Nez Perce spirit guide, the wolf Kiya, she is, as a young women, determined to use her ability to protect others. Traumatized by the childhood incident, Skye avoids intimate contact with men until she saves Josh Anders, CEO of a game company, from muggers, and sparks fly between them. For the first time in her adult life, Skye is in love. But that love is threatened when she learns that Whitfield is out of jail, and young girls are going missing.The Bones of Others by Vickie McKeehan tells the story of Skye and Josh as they vow to track Whitfield down and bring him to justice. As they peer deeper into the missing person cases, though, they discover that it‚Äôs more than just a single predator attacking young women, they find an international trafficking operation involving dozens. McKeehan does a fantastic job of keeping a reader guessing until the end‚Äîwill Skye and Josh prevail, or will they too become victims? Though this story contains elements of the supernatural, it is told as a mystery thriller, complete with enough action to appeal to the most rabid fight junkie. At the same time, the author handles Skye‚Äôs awakening feelings for Josh with astonishing tenderness.Once you start reading this book, you won‚Äôt be able to put it down. I look forward to further adventures of these two extremely likeable characters.

When Dr. Richard Buckley returned to him home in Dunderrig after service in France in WWI, he was disillusioned with war and only wanted to be with his family. Returning with him was Solange Allingham, the widow of his best friend. Unfortunately, Buckley‚Äôs wife, Edith, bitter at him for serving in the British Army, sworn enemies of the nationalist Irish, becomes even more withdrawn after the birth of twins, James and Juliet, leaving them to Solange‚Äôs care. Eventually, Edith leaves him and goes to Dublin where she eventually marries a German national, despite never having officially divorcing.The twins grow up under Solange‚Äôs care, considering her more their mother than the woman who gave birth to them. As the world enters the horror unleashed by the rise of Hitler in Germany, the twins grow into adulthood and their lives take divergent paths‚Äîpaths that threaten the unity of the Buckley family.So Much Owed by Jean Grainger is a stirring tale of the horrors of war and its impact on one family during a time of cataclysmic change. It reveals the depths of human emotion; love, betrayal, loyalty, and bravery in a way that most novels only touch on sketchily. The author takes a reader into the hearts and minds of the characters in such a way you come away feeling as if you know them as well as your next door neighbor‚Äîor best friend. This is s book that will bring tears to your eyes while at the same time leave you with a warm feeling in your heart.

The small town of Hidden Falls is preparing a great celebration. Ted Quinn, who has been a teacher at the local high school for 30 years, is being honored for all that he‚Äôs done for the town and its people. Quinn has touched nearly everyone‚Äôs life, from the mayor, Sylvia Alexander, to the town cop. Almost everyone, even those with secrets they‚Äôd like to keep hidden, pitches in to honor Quinn, and on the night of the big event, when the curtain opens and the spotlight shines, Quinn is missing.The Disappearance by Olivia Newport is part one of a five part series. Character development is outstanding, and the author pulls the reader fully into the action. The series concept, though, where the book ends on a complete cliffhanger, is not my cup of tea. When I like a series, I‚Äôll read subsequent books without the ruse of leaving things hanging, forcing me to read the next book to find out what‚Äôs happening.This is a great book for TV series fans, people who tune in week after week to find out ‚ÄòWho shot JR?‚Äô. Unfortunately, as someone who doesn‚Äôt watch much TV, I‚Äôm not a fan of this type fiction. The author writes extremely well, and except for the annoying ending, developed an interesting theme, so I‚Äôll grant kudos for that.

PI Gen Delacourt is hired by the owner of an exclusive club to find out why her club has so many missing wine bottles. Her investigation leads to another exclusive club where she finds the patrons are victims of a scam being run by the club‚Äôs beautiful owner, Amanda Grant. Then, to add to her complications, she‚Äôs hired by Amanda to find out who is sending her threatening notes. Gen‚Äôs life takes an unexpected turn when Shiloh James, a childhood friend of her boyfriend, SFPD detective Mack Hackett, becomes romantically involved with the owners of both clubs.Swindle Town by Molly Greene, the fifth book in the Gen Delacourt mystery series, is a different kind of mystery. While there‚Äôs plenty of action, unlike other mysteries, there aren‚Äôt dozens of corpses piling up page after page; just a finely-crafted story with enough twists and false leads to keep you wondering who the bad guy or gal is until Gen wraps it up and ties it with a beautiful bow near the end.Greene handles her characters well, so well that you love some and feel sorry for others‚Äîthe hallmark of fine fiction.

As an avid sci-fi fan for more than 50 years, I approach most new science fiction books with a healthy dose of skepticism. It‚Äôs difficult to find new works that truly break ground in the genre. The Beam: Season One by Sean Platt and Johnny B. Truant comes pretty darn close in my humble opinion.In a future when humanity is totally connected, he who controls the Web has control over everything. The world‚Äôs political borders have disappeared, leaving only two political parties in control‚Äîand control is what they‚Äôre all about. This is a cutting edge story of a group of people caught up in this soulless political machine, where every whim is catered to, but deviance is fatal.Well written, with enough explanation of the technology to make it just about believable. The important element here is the way the characters react to their environment and each other. Techno-geeks might not find that of much interest, but it makes for good reading.I received a free copy of this book in exchange for my review.

In the second book in the Reed Ferguson mystery series, Reed takes on a new client. Reel Estate Rip-Off by Renee Pawlish is another witty and funny adventure of the noir fiction, old movie-loving detective who, along with the wacky Goofball Brothers, and his computer geek friend, Cal, finds a string leading to a byzantine real estate scam that could end not only his career, but his life.Pawlish writes with a dry wit and a deft touch, evoking the era of Mickey Spillane and other greats of the pulp era. Anything else I say about the book would spoil it for readers‚Äîother than, this one is a keeper.I received a free copy of this book in exchange for my review, and I wasn‚Äôt disappointed.

Agents Phaedra and Aegus, agents of New Crete‚Äôs Intelligent Data Enforcement Agency (IDEA) are tasked to find five missing AI students. Their investigation leads them to a mysterious hacker known as The Cretan. With The Cretan‚Äôs help, they learn of a rogue AI program called the Daedalus Project that threatens the freedom of society.The Daedalus Code by Colin F. Barnes is a short novella that tracks Phaedra and Aegus as they bore deep into the AI networks of New Crete, putting their trust in an unproven lawbreaker, The Cretan, and their lives and careers on the line.An imaginative story that is filled with action and future technology that science fiction fans will thoroughly enjoy.I received a free copy of this book in exchange for my review.

Eve has a problem. Her parents are witches who want power, and are willing to do anything to achieve it. Her refusal to use her own powers infuriates them, threatening her life. She, however, vows to never use her powers, until, at her birthday party she meets Boaz, a powerful vampire who takes her under his wing. Boaz teaches her to embrace her supernatural side, but she learns that this can be dangerous.I received a free copy of The Devil‚Äôs Fool by Rachel McClellan in exchange for my review. This thriller kept me on the edge of my seat as I followed Eve‚Äôs metamorphosis into the very thing she‚Äôd sworn never to become‚Äîa true devil.An intriguing journey into the depths of the human mind, and a thought-provoking validation of the corruptive influence of power. It could stand another round of proofreading to clean up a profusion of typos and word errors, but is still an interesting read.

In the charming little Kids Book: Let‚Äôs Go to the Park, written by Mae Segeti and Nic Monty, three children go to the park with their parents. This is part of the Family Fun bedtime stories for kids series, a series of family stories for children age 2 ‚Äì 8. While some of the words are probably a bit advanced for younger children, my own experience with my grandchildren, ages 2 and 4, have shown me that they quickly get it, often with just a bit of explanation. The illustrations are quite cute, and the adventures, especially the part where a dog grabs the Frisbee they‚Äôre playing with and runs away with it, will entertain youngsters.

Thirteen-year-old Noah Winter has been diving with his parents since he was ten. During a dive on the wreck of the San Isabel, a passenger liner, he finds a strange piece of porcelain. His parents found an old spy glass which is the key to the location of the De La Rosa emerald, which the descendant of the original owner has hired them to find. A ruthless competitor, however, is determined to beat the Winters to the missing jewel, and is willing to go to any lengths to do it.The Emerald Quest by Renee Pawlish is a young adult action adventure novel that follows Noah as he tries to stay one step ahead of the villains, while at the same time save his parents who have been kidnapped. Even though this book was written for young adult readers, it will appeal to older action fans as well. Young Noah is not a cardboard teen action junkie, but a true-to-life character who is skillfully portrayed. The action scenes, though a bit fanciful in places, keep the pulse racing as you read.The author seems to know her way around boats and diving. All in all, an outstanding adventure read.I received a free copy of this book in exchange for my review.

LAPD Detective Kate Sexton and her canine partner, Bernie, are assigned to investigate the murder of Olympic gold medalist Jezzie Rose, a case that had been mishandled by the detectives previously assigned to it. Things become complicated when Kate learns things that lead her to believe the prime suspect, the dead girl‚Äôs boyfriend, might not be the killer, and then the chief of police allows the media to become involved in her investigation.Hollywood Dirty, book four in the Hollywood Alphabet series, by M.Z. Kelly, is a rip-roaring funny story of a woman whose love life is in tatters, and who is also obsessed with finding the man who killed her father, while at the same time having to cope with a houseful of roommates who come across like escapees from a looney bin. At the same time, it has all the elements of a top-flight mystery; clues aplenty, more suspects than you could comfortably fit into a lineup, and action scenes that will satisfy readers who like a little blood in their mystery stories.Kelly nailed the Hollywood scene square on the head, and has set the bar high for others in the genre.

Jessica Moore, despite appearances, is not your usual country girl. She has the ability to read the feelings of other living beings and direct them. One day, while on a flight, she connects with a stranger and the plane she‚Äôs traveling on crashes on an alien world. Jessica learns her true identity, and a strange one it it‚Äîshe‚Äôs an alien whose ancestors were powerful and dangerous. But, Jessica wants nothing to do with any of it. She just wants to go home.Watcher‚Äôs Web by Patty Jansen is a fast-paced adventure story that takes place in alien places populated by beings that are inhuman in their humanity. A book that any fan of Edgar Rice Burroughs will enjoy. I received a free copy of this book in exchange for my review.

Zombies are beginning to roam an island in the North Atlantic. Bad enough they‚Äôre taking livestock, but someone‚Äôs started organizing them, building an army to eliminate humans from the Earth. The only force that can stop them is a group of amateur ninjas. The problem is, the police aren‚Äôt exactly convinced the ninjas are for real either.If you like zombie fiction, you‚Äôll probably like this book. I found it a bit too predictable, though, and some of the action a bit farfetched. The characters are at least likeable.

Johanna Brouwer wants to take over her father‚Äôs shipping business. She wants a place where she doesn‚Äôt have to hide her magic. The problem is, her father wants her to marry the prince‚Äîwho is a half-wit‚Äîand improve the Brouwer family fortunes. Fate intervenes, though, when her home city is invaded by bandits who are supported by demons, and the king and queen are killed, leaving the half-wit, Prince Roald, the only living heir to the throne.In Innocence Lost: A story from the kingdom of Saarland by Patty Jansen the reader is treated to Johanna‚Äôs story as she, the half-wit prince, her maid servant, and her closest friend (who has been bewitched), flee the invaded city and try to survive long enough to restore the crown and save her homeland.Johanna‚Äôs worries about getting married pale in comparison to the trials she must face, the sole sane member of her motley crew. Jansen‚Äôs a master at creating a believable world and authentic characters. If you like your characters sassy and independent, Johanna fits the bill. A thoroughly enjoyable story, except for the ending which leaves too many questions unanswered.

Trent Oster is a small-time bookmaker and debt collector in Huntington Beach, California. He‚Äôs also a wannabe writer. When he‚Äôs offered the chance to write the biography of Preston Walker, the alleged mastermind of some of the most controversial murders in America, he jumps at the chance.The Bookmaker by Chris Fraser takes history as we know it and turns it on its head. The characters are complex and the plot has more twists than a ball of yarn after a cat‚Äôs played with it. It‚Äôs fiction, just keep telling yourself that as you read, but there‚Äôs just a tinge‚Äîa hint‚Äîof veracity to this convoluted tale of one man‚Äôs quest for revenge; enough to make you wonder whether or not the conspiracy stories just might be true.Fraser‚Äôs a master at taking known facts, dressing them up in a cloak of fantasy, and sucking you into his tale, and with a touch of humor to ease the tension.

Qui Tai, the Wolf-slayer, is the ruthless concubine of Petrov, the Devil, who is the leader of a band of werewolves who control crime in Ponong. When Qui Tai‚Äôs ex-lover is murdered, only her sworn enemy, the disgraced Thampurian Kyam Zul knows the identity of the killer. But Kyam will only reveal the name if Qui Tai promises to help him.The Devil‚Äôs Concubine by Jill Braden is a hard novel to categorize. Set in a mythical world containing werewolves, shape shifters, and all manner of beasts, it could be seen as a fantasy. But, there are also elements of science fiction, and a large dollop of just plain thriller. Braden has done an excellent job of creating a believable fantasy world, and her characters are easy to develop feelings for‚Äîlove or hate. The murky relationship between Qui Tai and Kyam is perhaps the best part of this story of a character who must deal with her internal demons while trying to save her people. There‚Äôs enough here to please fans of the fantasy genre, with enough action thrown in to keep adventure junkies reading.While it ends with almost all of the loose ends tied up, the question of Qui Tai‚Äôs feelings for Kyam, and what becomes of him was left hanging, which was a bit disappointing, but not enough that it kept me from thoroughly enjoying the story that unfolded.

The brush has to be washed thoroughly after use or the bristles get kind of gnarly, but once you get the hang of it, it's not too bad. I really like the smell of the soap. Having to learn how to work up the right amount of lather was tough at first, but like everything, patience is its own reward. Reminds me of the barbershops from my childhood.

Takes some practice to learn to use this correctly, but once you do, it's a snap. the hook allows me to hang it on the bathroom door near the sink, so it's always handy when I need it. Kind of retro, but neat.

I remember my uncle using a straight razor when I was a kid. With the price of razor blades going through the roof, I decided to give it a try. It was that, or stop shaving, and my wife vetoed that idea. Took a bit of getting used to, but now I can do it almost as fast as I used to be able to do with the safety razor, and I don't have to worry about disposing of dull blades; just strop this baby and I'm ready for the next session. Looks nice too.

This was the perfect addition to my home office/studio. It allows me to paint while sitting down. Being able to paint at a desk instead of having to stand, means I can paint longer without becoming fatigued. As I get older, this is a consideration for me. Folds into a nice easy to carry package, and I really like the storage drawers.

The 8 x 10 size canvas panel is excellent for still lifes. I also do paintings of insects, small birds, and butterflies, and this is a great size for that. Worth every penny I paid for them - and I didn't have to pay all that much.
This is a real bargain. The right size for portraits, small landscapes, or still life paintings, and you can't beat the price.

This oil paint set has everything you need to get started. The canvas panels are a bit small, but good for those first pictures if you're a beginner, or for smaller subjects if you're more experienced. I like the case which makes it possible to take it into the field for on location painting.

Very useful for underpainting, allowing you to achieve luminosity in your artwork. The liquid white is a real plus, because when you paint into it while it's still wet it changes the value of the color you're using, which is really great for landscapes. Nice that brush cleaner is included with this pack.

On the eve of her 18th birthday, a talking rabbit hops into Alice Goodenough‚Äôs life. He tells her that the bad characters from the Grimm Brothers‚Äô fairy tales are real, and they‚Äôre bringing evil into the world unless they‚Äôre found and destroyed.In Prince Charming Must Die by Isabella Fontaine and Ken Brosky we‚Äôre treated to Alice and the rabbit‚Äôs search for the bad guys, with the main bad guy being Prince Charming. Prince Charming‚Äôs identity comes as a shock to Alice, and she has to choose‚Äîlove or the fate of the world.Funny in places and scary as the dickens in others, this is a charming tale that you will thoroughly enjoy.

Find the Cutes book 1: Playtime, written by Celestial Noot and illustrated and edited by Vincent Noot, is an activity book for children along the lines of ‚ÄòWhere‚Äôs Waldo?‚Äô It has an interesting story and Mad Magazine style illustrations that in a larger format offers hours of diversion for young readers.While I think this would be a great book in large format paperback, or for larger tablet readers, on Kindle-sized readers, the pictures and text were too small to be easily read.Other than that, though, this is a great diversion for your young ones on a rainy day, and with its family-focused message offers excellent life lessons.

It‚Äôs been 800 years since the Great War that devastated the world, and left the slowly recovering population in a handful of isolated, self-sufficient people. In order to survive in this barren environment, Aapelli has developed a series of iron-clad rules. His rules, however, come into question when he rescues an abandoned Liberty, who soon shakes up his extremely organized existence.In Finding Liberty by Regina Puckett, we get the story of how Liberty came to be. The author tells a compelling story of how two people come to know and love each other, and how Liberty learns to cope with great loss as she discovers that she can no longer be daddy‚Äôs little girl.Written with humor and compassion, this is a book that young adults will like, but has lessons for old greybeards as well. I read this one after the sequel, and found things that helped me understand the second book better.

Even though they‚Äôre intended for young readers, I‚Äôve found myself enthralled by Werner Stejskal‚Äôs Oliver and Jumpy stories. Oliver and Jumpy, Stories 28-30 continue the tradition of the enchanting adventures of Oliver, the elegant cat, and his friend, Jumpy the Kangaroo. In this series, readers learn how Oliver and Jumpy first met. In story 28, Letter in a Bottle, Joey, Jumpy‚Äôs son, wants to free a prisoner who has sent an SOS in a bottle. In No. 29, we learn how Oliver first met Jumpy and began their adventures, and in the final story, Enchanted Forest, Oliver and his friends fight a witch in a magic castle.The stories, along with the illustrations, are great for reading to youngsters, or for first readers to learn words on their own. My grandchildren continue to be captivated by Oliver‚Äôs escapades.

I received a free copy of The Christmas Cats Fear for the Deer, written by Constance Corcoran Wilson and illustrated by Gary McCluskey in exchange for my review.The Christmas cats worry about a herd of deer that are grazing in an area where they can do damage to crops and are in danger from hunters. Told in verse, with colorful paintings, the book shows how the cats find a unique way to help keep the deer safe, avoid damage to the crops, and come up with an alternative delivery vehicle for Christmas.Some of the verses, especially those that show hunting in a less than negative light, might be a bit intense for some children, and the rhyming is a bit rough in some verses, it will entertain many. Looking past the portrayal of hunters, though, it does show that problems can be solved if one thinks beyond the usual solutions, and the activity pages at the end are nice for helping younger readers learn problem solving.

Bob Mayes is a fast draw artist who entertains tourists. He lives in a one-horse town, but he‚Äôs satisfied with his life, using his ‚Äògift‚Äô of speed and accuracy with a gun for good. Then, a shadowy organization known as the Faction, which has a mission of depopulating the world shows up in his town, Bob finds that his ‚Äògift,‚Äô and working with an organization called the Group Army Soldiers (GAS) might the only thing keeping the Faction from world domination.A fast-paced paranormal thriller, Fast Draw by D. W. Collins follows Bob from a small western town to the jungles of South America and back again as he and GAS go on the hunt for soldiers of the Faction. Good character-driven story that sometimes overdoes it with the action scenes‚Äîone can read the details of what bullets do to the human body only so many times before it no longer shocks.Other than this bit of overreliance on graphic descriptions of all the ways people can die, it‚Äôs a story that‚Äôs easy to get caught up in. Bob is a totally likeable character‚Äîa paranormal version of the white-hat marshal of the old west who comes to town to take care of the outlaws.I received a free copy of this book in exchange for my unbiased review. I give it 3.5 stars, rounded up to 4.

A sequel to the 2006 bestseller, Me Before You, Jojo Moyes‚Äô After You is the story of how Louisa Clark handles the death of Will Traynor, a 35-year-old quadriplegic who chose suicide as a way out of his suffering. Devastated by Will‚Äôs death, Louisa is adrift until she finds someone else who depends on her, giving her the will to continue living. An essential character in the first book of the series, Will is relegated to a tangential role in this sequel, which detracts somewhat from the story because of the dramatic impact he had on everyone he came into contact with.Summary & Analysis of Jojo Moyes‚Äô After You by Instaread is an excellent 15-minute read that gives readers a full explanation of the novel, including the main characters, their relationships, and the key recurring themes of Moyes‚Äô book.

TV‚Äôs Dr. Phil McGraw‚Äôs book The 20/20 Diet is a guide to dieting for people who haven‚Äôt been successful taking weight off and keeping it off. It offers solutions to the seven most common reasons diets fail by combining longstanding strategies with the results of recent research. An easy-to-follow diet plan in three phases over a 30-day period, it offers no quick fixes; instead, it stresses that good weight management is based on developing proper habits and achieving balance in eating and exercise.  Though McGraw is not a diet specialist, and the book is written in layman‚Äôs terms, he uses his own experience with weight control problems to illustrate how to achieve success. For those who have seen ‚ÄòDr Phil‚Äô on TV, the tone of the book, humorous in places, scathing in others, will be familiar.A Review of Dr. Phil McGraw‚Äôs The 20/20 Diet by Eureka Books is an excellent summary of the book, and makes it sound like one that is well worth reading.

A 15-minute Summary & Analysis of Andy Weir‚Äôs The Martian by Instareads is an excellent review of the novel that tells the story of the abandonment and subsequent rescue of astronaut Mark Watney from the planet Mars.Watney, believed killed in a freak Martian dust storm, was left behind by the rest of his crew. Later, it is discovered that he survived and has found a way to communicate with NASA. The story is both a science fiction thriller and a profound tale of human perseverance in the face of adversity. The author tells the story by way of Watney‚Äôs log, which he keeps as a record in case he dies on Mars. It contrasts bureaucrats who assess risks and keep an eye on the bottom line with those who are willing to risk all in order to save a comrade.If you‚Äôve seen the movie you owe it to yourself to read the book that inspired it. If  you‚Äôre in doubt about it, read this great summary and I can promise you, you‚Äôll change  your mind.

When two students, Kantak Johnson and Harvey Jamison, discover how to make a truly stealth aircraft, they become the target of two hostile blocs, both willing to go to any lengths to control this new technology.As events unfold, Johnson, an Alaska native, must use his skills as a pilot to defend his country and his people from an invasion force.The Sky Between Two Worlds: Part 1 ‚Äì Apocalypse Denied by Glen E. Books is a thriller that you‚Äôll find hard to put down. Exciting action scenes written with a degree of authenticity that makes you ready to believe the technology is real. Books also takes you inside the characters‚Äô minds in a way that makes the plot totally believable. Part techno-thriller, part science fiction, it‚Äôs a must-read book for action-thriller fans. Some of the historical background could have been better melded into the dialogue or doled out in smaller chunks, but since it‚Äôs the first in a series, I‚Äôm prepared to cut the author some slack.

Bought this for streaming gaming sessions on twitch and Youtube Gaming.  The green screen works perfectly to mask out the surrounding area and only show the subject as an overlay on the gaming screen.
I love it. Great cable great price works well haven't had a problem. The cost is low enough I bought spares so I have cables on hand.

I love having the ability to convert my 70-200 to a 98-280 on a sunny day.  Used this just the other day at my sons football game and was able to get shots with the players filling the frame instead of needing to crop in post production.  Takes very little space in my bag but is there when I need it.

Went back and watched this recently with a friend who has not scene this movie yet.  I very much enjoyed watching it again.  There are some very classic moments like the laser grid in this movie.I consider this to be the best adaptation of a game to a movie ever.  I always hope that another game will make the jump to screen effectively, but this is the only one that I feel has met that mark.  Still it is a game to movie, so is not for everyone.

I will never understand why Microsoft made the choice to eliminate the standard headphone jack in the xbox one controllers, in favor of a proprietary connector.  Granted they have since seen the error and released an adapter and a new controller that has a standard jack.  However, I already own four controllers and do not want to replace them in order to get one that has a jack.As for the alternatives, they have issues.  When in game/party chat you can tell if someone is using a headset connected to one of these other options as it will either produce echo or a ring within the party that everyone but the user producing it can hear.Finally, I could live with the proprietary connection, if the product provided was a quality product.  This product is poorly made with the thinnest possible wire, which breaks easily.  I am now on my third headset and have done nothing with them that was abnormal.  Infact I did purchase one of the adapters, which comes with a dongle to connect a standard 2.5mm headset, that dongle made with the same wire as the headset also failed.  leaving me without a headset again.  I suspect that dongle was responsible for much of the in party noise.Many would argue that I should get turtle beach headset.  Those users are not enjoying the true sound capabilities of games mastered in 5.1 and 7.1.  Even "Surround" headphones cannot compare with a true surround system.  A 2.5cm speaker cannot compete with a 15" 1000watt subwoofer for producing base.  And even a few micro drivers baked into a head set cannot truly emmulate surround sound.  I use a 7.1 setup with Pioneer Elite Amp and Klipsch Reference speakers.  Why would I want to give that up to listen through a pair of headphones that mess with the audio balance in favor of amplifying footsteps instead of providing a well rounded audio experience?  Haters gonna hate, but they don't know what they are missing.So here I am stuck giving MS money for a poorly built product with no recourse.

I purchased this for my wifes birthday and she loves it.  She loves Beauty and the Beast so this was a treat for her.  The piece is very cute, though I would not say that it is fine.  Some of the pieces appear roughly carved.  Lumier is put together with what looks like cheap craft wire.  The pieces have some detail but I would not call it fine detail, I would not say that it is something I would see something new each time I saw it.That said it was not very expensive, and my wife did thoroughly enjoy it.
